data.v: ततो ज्वलनसंकाशैः शितैर्वानरयूथपाः । ताडिताः शक्रजिद्बाणैः प्रफुल्ला इव किंशुकाः ।।
data.es: Struck by Indrajith's arrows, the (bodies of) Vanara troops were glowing like Kimsuka trees (red in colour) bearing flowers.
data.anv: ततः then, ज्वलनसङ्काशैः glowing like, शरैः arrows, शक्रजिद्भाणैः by Indrajith's arrows, ताडिताः struck, वानरयूथपाः Vanara troops, प्रफुल्लाः bearing flowers, किंशुकाःइव like Kimsuka trees.
data.md: The monkey-leaders struck with Śakrajit's shafts. resembling flames, appeared like laughing Kinsukas.

data.v: अन्योन्यमभिसर्पन्तो निनदन्तश्च विस्वरम् । राक्षसेन्द्रास्त्रनिर्भिन्ना निपेतुर्वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: Hit by the Rakshasa king, the bulls among Vanaras gliding towards one another roared in discordant tones and fell down.
data.anv: राक्षसेन्द्राभिनिर्भिन्नाः hit by the king of Rakshasas one over the other, ते they, वानरर्षभाः bulls among Vanaras, अन्योन्यम् one another, अभिसर्पन्तः gliding towards, विस्वरम् discordant tones, निनदन्तश्च roared, निपेतुः fell down.
data.md: They foremost of Vānaras, pierced by the missiles of the lord of Raksasas gliding towards one another and crying bitterly fell down on earth.

data.v: उदीक्षमाणा गगनं केचिन्नेत्रेषु ताडिताः । शरैर्विविशुरन्योन्यं पेतुश्च जगतीतले ।।
data.es: Some Vanaras looking up to the sky eyes pierced with arrows held one another and fell on the ground.
data.anv: गगनम् sky, उदीक्षमाणाः looking up, केचित् some, शरैः arrows, नेत्रेषु in the eyes, ताडिताः pierced, अन्योन्यम् one another, विविशुः holding, जगतीतले on the ground, पेतुश्च fell.
data.md: Some looking at the sky were struck at their eyes. They gradually began to hide themselves in each other and drop to the earth.

data.v: हनूमन्तं च सुग्रीवमङ्गदं गन्धमादनम् । जाम्बवन्तं सुषेणं च वेगदर्शिनमेव च ।।
मैन्दं च द्विविदं नीलं गवाक्षं गजगोमुखौ । केसरिं हरिलोमानं विद्युद्दंष्ट्रं च वानरम् ।।
सूर्याननं ज्योतिमुखं तथा दधिमुखं हरिम् । पावकाक्षं नलं चैव कुमुदं चैव वानरम् ।।
प्रासैः शूलैः शितैर्बाणैरिन्द्रजिन्मन्त्रसंहितैः । विव्याध हरिशार्दूलान्सर्वांस्तान्राक्षसोत्तमः ।।
स वै गदाभिर्हरियूथमुख्या;न्निर्भिद्य बाणैस्तपनीयपुङ्खैः । ववर्ष रामं शरवृष्टिजालैः; सलक्ष्मणं भास्कररश्मिकल्पैः ।।
data.es: Having hurt the Vanara leaders with maces and arrows shining like gold, he rained volley of arrows shining like sun rays on Lakshmana and Rama.
data.anv: सः he, गदाभिः maces, तपनीयवङ्खैः arrows shining with golden colour, बाणैः arrows, हरियूथमुख्यान् leaders of Vanara troops, निर्भिद्य wounded, सलक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, रामम् Rama, भास्कररमशिकल्पैः shining like Sun 's rays, शरवृष्टिजालैः volley of arrows, ववर्ष rained.
data.md: Having pierced those foremost monkeys with golden-hued maces, he showered on Rāma and Lakşmaņa arrows resembling the rays of the sun.

data.v: स बाणवर्षैरभिवर्ष्यमाणो; धारानिपातानिव तान्विचिन्त्य । समीक्षमाणः परमाद्भुतश्री; रामस्तदा लक्ष्मणमित्युवाच ।।
data.es: Most wonderful and prosperous Rama, looking at the rain of arrows continuing to shower, not minding it as if they are rain of water drops, spoke this to Lakshmana.
data.anv: परमाद्भुतश्रीः most wonderful and prosperous, सःरामः that Rama, बाणवर्षैः rain of arrows, अभिवर्ष्यमाणः while continuing to rain, तान् them, धारानिपातानिन like rain of water drops, अच्नित्य not minding, समीक्षमाणः was looking at, ततः that, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshman, इति this, उवाच spoke.
data.md: And showered with those vollies of arrows, Rāma, without heeding that discharge resembling a very downpour, reflecting, spoke to Laksmana.

data.v: असौ पुनर्लक्ष्मण राक्षसेन्द्रो; ब्रह्मास्त्रमाश्रित्य सुरेन्द्रशत्रुः । निपातयित्वा हरिसैन्यमुग्र;मस्माञ्शरैरर्दयति प्रसक्तम् ।।
data.es: "Lakshmana! Rakshasa king, an enemy of Indra afflicted the Vanaras with the Brahmastram secured by him. Using that power, he is tormenting us with sharp arrows."
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, असौ that, सुरेन्द्रशत्रुः enemy of Indra, ब्रह्मास्त्रम् Brahmastram, आश्रित्य secured, हरिसैन्यम् Vanara army, निपातयित्वा having pained, अस्मान् by that, शितैः sharp, शरैः arrows, प्रसक्तम् using that power, अर्दयति tormenting.
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, this lord of Rākşasas, this foe of the lord of celestials, having obtained the Brāhma weapon, after having brought down the monkey-hosts, are assailing us with sharpened shafts.

data.v: स्वयम्भुवा दत्तवरो महात्मा; खमास्थितोऽन्तर्हितभीमकायः । कथं नु शक्यो युधि नष्टदेहो; निहन्तुमद्येन्द्रजिदुद्यतास्त्रः ।।
data.es: "How can it be possible now to destroy that great Indrajith who is conferred with boons of invincibility by the creator Brahma, who is steadfast and is concealed in dreadful form with weapons uplifted?"
data.anv: स्वयम्भूवा creator, दत्तवरः who is conferred with boon of invincibility, महात्मान great, समाहितः steadfast, अन्तर्हितभीमकायः concealed in dreadful form, युधि in combat, नष्टदेहः body not visible, उद्यतास्त्रः with weapons uplifted, इन्द्रजित् Indrajith, अद्य now, निहन्तुम् to destroy, कथम् how can it be, शक्यः possible.
data.md: That high-souled heedful one, having been given a boon by the self-sprung, has rendered his dreadful body invisible. How can we slay him, who is fighting with upraised weapons, but who has hid his body.

data.v: मन्ये स्वयम्भूर्भगवानचिन्त्यो; यस्यैतदस्त्रं प्रभवश्च योऽस्य । बाणावपातांस्त्वमिहाद्य धीम;न्मया सहाव्यग्रमनाः सहस्व ।।
data.es: "This weapon of him (Indrajith) is that of the glorious creator and is presided by Him. By that reason he is inconceivable. O! Wise Lakshmana, remain calm and undisturbed at this hail of arrows."
data.anv: एतत् this, अस्त्रम् weapon, यस्य his, यः that which, अस्य whose, प्रभवः glorious, भगवान् god, स्वयम्भुः creator, अच्नित्यः inconceivable, मन्ये remain calm, धीमन् wise, त्वम् you, इह here, अद्य now, अव्यग्रमनाः undisturbed, बाणावपातम् hail of arrows, मयासह with me, सहस्व tolerate.
data.md: The reverend self-sprung, I deem, is incomprehensible. And this is his weapon, embodying his energy. Therefore, O intelligent one, do you today along with me calmly bear this.

data.v: प्रच्छादयत्येष हि राक्षसेन्द्रः; सर्वा दिशः सायकवृष्टिजालैः । एतच्च सर्वं पतिताग्र्यवीरं; न भ्राजते वानरराजसैन्यम् ।।
data.es: "This Rakshasa king is covered thickly with volley of arrows on all sides. Able warriors of Vanaras are falling and not happy."
data.anv: सर्वाधिकः all sides, एषः in that way, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, सायकवृष्टिजालैः with volley of arrows, प्रच्छादयतु covering thickly, पतिताग्य्रशूरम् able warriors falling, एतत् this, सर्वम् all, वानरराजसैन्यम् Vanara king's army, च भ्राजते not shining.
data.md: Let this foremost of them all, this lord of Rāks asas-cover all sides with the showers of his shafts. And in consequence of this, the army of the monkey-king with its greatest heroes fallen, does not appear to advantage.

data.v: आवां तु दृष्ट्वा पतितौ विसंज्ञौ; निवृत्तयुद्धौ हतरोषहर्षौ । ध्रुवं प्रवेक्ष्यत्यमरारिवासं; असौ समादाय रणाग्रलक्ष्मीम् ।।
data.es: "This Indrajith is desisting from comb at on seeing us. As the Vanaras have lost pride and happiness and fallen into unconscious state, he would surely think that he has attained prosperity after victory in war and surely enter Lanka, the abode of enemies of god."
data.anv: असौ to us, निवृत्तयुद्धौ desisted from combat, गतरोषहर्षे lost pride and happiness, विसंज्ञौ lost consciousness, पतितौ fallen, आवाम् both of us, दृष्टवा seeing, रणाग्य्रलक्ष्मीम् attained prosperity after war, समादाय come, ध्रुवम् surely, अमरारिवासम् abode of enemies of gods, प्रवेक्ष्यति will enter.
data.md: Seeing us also fallen, senseless, and desisting from fight with our joy and anger gone off from us, for certain will the enemy of the immortals, taking the Fortune of fight seek his home.

data.v: ततस्तु ताविन्द्रजिदस्त्रजालै;र्बभूवतुस्तत्र तदा विशस्तौ । स चापि तौ तत्र विषादयित्वा; ननाद हर्षाद्युधि राक्षसेन्द्रः ।।
data.es: Seeing the two princes severed and fallen down struck by the net of arrows of Indrajith, he roared happily in the battle.
data.anv: ततः then, तौ the two, इन्द्रजितः Indrajith, अस्त्रजालैः net of arrows, तत्रthere, तथा that way, विशस्तौ fallen down, बभूवतुः severed, सः he, राक्षसेन्द्रश्चापि even the Rakshasa king, तत्र there, तौ the two, विदर्शयित्वा seeing them, युधि battle, हर्षात् happy, ननाद roared.
data.md: Assailed by Indrajit with networks of arrows, they were then sore distressed in the field. And having struck them with sadness, Indrajit from joy shouted in the encounter.

data.v: स तत्तदा वानरराजसैन्यं; रामं च संख्ये सहलक्ष्मणेन । विषादयित्वा सहसा विवेश; पुरीं दशग्रीवभुजाभिगुप्ताम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Vanara army withdrew from the battle along with Rama and Lakshmana. Indrajith for his part moved to the abode protected by Ravana's arms, while being praised. He at once entered the city happily and related everything to the father.।। इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्धकाण्डेत्रिसप्ततितमस्सर्गः ।।This is the Seventy third sarga of Yuddha Kanda of the first epic the holy Ramayana composed by Sage Valmiki.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सः he, तदा then, वानरसैन्यम् Vanara army, लक्ष्मणेनसह accompanied by Lakshmana, रामं च and Rama, सङ्ख्ये from the battle, एवम् in that way, विषादयित्वा withdrew, यातुधानैः moved to abode, संस्तूयमानः while being praised, दशग्रीवभुजाभिगुप्ताम् protected by Ravana's arms, पुरीम् city, सहसा at once, विवेश entered, हृष्टितः happily, सर्वम् all, पित्रे to father, अभ्वुवाद related.
data.md: Having thus worsted in battle that monkey army and Rāma along with Lakşmaņa, he-speedily entered the city ruled by the hand of the Ten-necked one. And extolled by the Yatudhānas, he, filled with delight, related everything to his sire.

data.v: तयोस्तदा सादितयो रणाग्रे; मुमोह सैन्यं हरियूथपानाम् । सुग्रीवनीलाङ्गदजाम्बवन्तो; न चापि किंचित्प्रतिपेदिरे ते ।।
data.es: The two brothers (Rama and Lakshmana) become unconscious in the forefront of the battle the monkey leaders lose senses. Sugriva, Neela, Angada and Jambavantha did not know What to do.
data.anv: रणाग्रे in the forefront of the battle, तदा then, तयोः both, सादितयोः unconscious, हरिपुङ्गवानाम् monkey leaders, सैन्यम् army, मुमोह lost senses, ते they, सुग्रीवनीलाङ्गदजाम्बवन्तोऽपि Sugriva, Neela, Angada and Jambavantha, किञ्चित् indeed, न प्रतिपेदिरे not known what to do.
data.md: They were rendered inert in the field; and the army of the monkey-leaders was stupefied, with Sugrīva and Nīla and Angada and Jāmbavān, and they did not show any signs of activity.

data.v: ततो विषण्णं समवेक्ष्य सैन्यं; विभीषणो बुद्धिमतां वरिष्ठः । उवाच शाखामृगराजवीरा;नाश्वासयन्नप्रतिमैर्वचोभिः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, foremost among the wise, Vibheeshana observing the despondency of the monkey leaders spoke to them reassuring in incomparable words.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, बुद्धिमताम् wise, वरिष्ठः foremost, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, विषण्णम् despondent, सैन्यम् army, समवेक्ष्य observing, अप्रतिमैः incomparable, वचोभिः words, शाखामृगराजवीरान् the monkey leaders, आश्वासयन् reassuring, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Thereupon, seeing them dispirited, that foremost of intelligent persons, Vibhisana, cheering them up with his peerless speech, said.

data.v: मा भैष्ट नास्त्यत्र विषादकालो; यदार्यपुत्राववशौ विषण्णौ । स्वयम्भुवो वाक्यमथोद्वहन्तौ; यत्सादिताविन्द्रजिदस्त्रजालैः ।।
data.es: "O Noble men! Do not fear. Rama and Lakshmana are afflicted by Indrajith's volley of arrows and have lost senses. They are despondent to honour the statement of the creator not otherwise."
data.anv: आर्यपुत्रौ noble men, स्वयम्भुवः creator, वाक्यम् statement, उद्वहन्तौ to honour, अथ now, इन्द्रजित् Indrajith, अस्त्रजालैः network of arrows, यत् that which, सादितौ helpless, यत् that, अवशौ lost senses, विषण्णौ despondent, माभैष्ट you need not fear,  तत्रthere, विषादकालः sorrowful, नास्ति not.
data.md: You heroes of the king of monkeys, do not give way to fear. This is not the time to indulge in grief at this place; for the sons of that noble one,' inactive and depressed, and seeming to be wounded with the showers of Indrajit's shafts, are in reality in this plight, for showing reverence to the words of the self-sprung one. 1. Dasaratha. 2.Mantra.

data.v: तस्मै तु दत्तं परमास्त्रमेत;त्स्वयम्भुवा ब्राह्मममोघवेगम् । तन्मानयन्तौ यदि राजपुत्रौ; निपातितौ कोऽत्र विषादकालः ।।
data.es: To him (Indrajith), the creator has conferred this weapon of Brahma endowed with terrific speed. To respect the missile both the princes have fallen. Why do you grieve?
data.anv: तस्मै to him, एतत् this, अमोघवेगम् terrific speed, ब्राह्मंपरमास्त्रम् Brahma's weapon, स्वयम्भुवा creator, दत्तम् conferred, तत् that, मानयन्तौ to respect, राजपुत्रौ the princes, युधि in battle, निपातितौ fallen, अत्र there, विषादकालः to grieve for, कः why.
data.md: On him the self-sprung has conferred the mighty Brahmă weapon of unfailing power; and the king's sons are doing honour to it by lying down on the field of battle. Why then do you grieve now?

data.v: ब्राह्ममस्त्रं तदा धीमान्मानयित्वा तु मारुतिः । विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा हनूमांस्तमथाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, hearing Vibheeshana's words, wise Hanuman spoke this with respect to the missile of Brahma.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, धीमान् wise, मारुतिः Maruthi, हनूमान् Hanuman, ब्राह्मम् Brahma, अस्त्रम् missile, मानयित्वा to respect, विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana's words, श्रुत्वा hearing, अथ this, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing the words of Vibhisana and honouring the Brahma weapon, Hanumăn spoke as follows.

data.v: एतस्मिन्निहते सैन्ये वानराणां तरस्विनाम् । यो यो धारयते प्राणांस्तं तमाश्वासयावहे ।।
data.es: "Whoever is strong among Vanaras, have been struck and are alive breathing among the Vanaras. Let us restore their confidence."
data.anv: एतन्निहते who has been struck, तरस्विनाम् who are strong, वानराणाम् Vanaras, अस्मिन् those, सैन्ये army, यःयः who so ever, प्राणान् are with life, धारयते breathing, तंतम् all of them, आश्वासयाम restore confidence.
data.md: The host of the quick-paced monkeys has been slain by this weapon. Let us go and console them who are still living.

data.v: तावुभौ युगपद्वीरौ हनूमद्राक्षसोत्तमौ । उल्काहस्तौ तदा रात्रौ रणशीर्षे विचेरतुः ।।
data.es: The two heroes, Hanuman and Vibheeshana, and the foremost of Rakshasas with torch in hand searched for the left over Vanaras in the battlefield.
data.anv: वीरौ heroes, तौ those, उभौ two, हनूमद्राक्षसोत्तमौ Hanuman and foremost of Rakshasas (Vibheeshana), तदा then, रात्रौ night, उल्काहस्तौ torch in hand, रणशीर्षे left in the battlefield, विचेरतुः searched.
data.md: Those two great heroes— Hanumān and that foremost of the Rakşasas, with fire-brands in their hands, began to range to and fro in the battle field.

data.v: छिन्नलाङ्गूलहस्तोरुपादाङ्गुलि शिरो धरैः । स्रवद्भिः क्षतजं गात्रैः प्रस्रवद्भिः समन्ततः ।।
data.es: Two of them saw the ground covered with Vanaras of mountainlike forms, who had fallen with tails cut off, some with broken thighs, broken legs and fingers, necks severed, letting off blood, discharging urine and glowing weapons lying on the ground.

data.md: They beheld there the earth strewn on all sides with monkeys lying down like so many hills and various shining weapons. And some of these monkeys were deprived of their tails, some of their hands, some of their thighs, some of their legs, some of their fingers, and some of their heads. And blood was gushing out from the persons of some, and others were urinating out of fear.

data.v: सप्तषष्टिर्हताः कोट्यो वानराणां तरस्विनाम् । अह्नः पञ्चमशेषेण वल्लभेन स्वयम्भुवः ।।
data.es: By the creator's missile Indrajith struck down sixtyseven crores of strong Vanaras between the fifth and last part of the day.
data.anv: स्वयम्भुवः creator's, वल्लभेन by Indrajith, अह्नः struck down, पञ्चमशेषेण fifth and last period of the day, तरस्विनाम् strong, वानराणाम् Vanaras, सप्तषष्टिः sixtyseven, कोट्यः crores, हताः killed.
data.md: Vibhișana and Hanuman saw in the field seven and sixty kotis of fleet-footing monkeys slain (in battle) at the fifth part of the day by the darling of the self-sprung.

data.v: सागरौघनिभं भीमं दृष्ट्वा बाणार्दितं बलम् । मार्गते जाम्बवन्तं स्म हनूमान्सविभीषणः ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana and Hanuman seeing the ocean of Vanara army and the glowing arrows on them, looked for Jambavantha.
data.anv: सविभीषणः Vibheeshana, हनूमान् Hanuman, सागरौघनिभम् ? resembling ocean, बाणार्दितम् glowing arrows, बलम् army, दृष्टवा seeing, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavantha, मार्गते looked for.
data.md: And surveying that host worsted, dreadful like the surges of the sea, Hanumăn and Vibhīşaņa began to search for Jāmbavān.

data.v: स्वभावजरया युक्तं वृद्धं शरशतैश्चितम् । प्रजापतिसुतं वीरं शाम्यन्तमिव पावकम् ।।
data.es: Paulastya (Vibheeshana of Paulastya clan), seeing the son of Prajapathi (Jambavan), who by nature was wise and aged, afflicted by hundreds of arrows, like a cooling fire sacrifice, went close by and spoke these words.
data.anv: पौलस्त्यः Paulastaya, स्वभावजरया by nature, युक्तम् wise, वृद्धम् aged, शरशतैः hundreds of arrows, चितम् pained, शाम्यन्तम् cooling, पावकम् इव like fire, वीरम् heroic, प्रजापतिसुतम् son of Prajapathi, दृष्टवा seeing, तमुपसङ्ग्रम्य going close, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा तमुपसंगम्य पौलस्त्यो वाक्यमब्रवीत् । कच्चिदार्यशरैस्तीर्ष्णैर्न प्राणा ध्वंसितास्तव ।।
data.md: Finding that heroic son of Prajāpati, afflicted with natural decrepitude, aged, and resembling smouldering fire, wounded with hundreds of shafts, Pulastya's son said, “O noble one, has not your life been destroyed with those sharp shafts?"

data.v: विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा जाम्बवानृक्षपुंगवः । कृच्छ्रादभ्युद्गिरन्वाक्यमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama of mighty prowess having heard everything from Vibheeshana, examining in his mind, spoke.
data.anv: रामः Rama, दृढपराक्रमः one of mighty prowess, विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana's words, श्रुत्वा: hearing, सर्वम् everything, मनसा: in mind, अन्वीक्ष्य: examining, इदम् these, वचनम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Hearing Vibhisana's words, Jambevan, best of bears, evoking utterance with extreme effort, said.

data.v: नैरृतेन्द्रमहावीर्यस्वरेण त्वाभिलक्षये । पीड्यमानः शितैर्बाणैर्न त्वां पश्यामि चक्षुषा ।।
data.es: "Great hero, Vibheeshana! I recognise you by your voice. Pierced with sharp arrows I am not able to see you."
data.anv: महावीर्य great hero, नैरृतेन्द्र ruler of Rakshasas, स्वरेण by voice, त्वा your, अभिलक्ष्ये, शितैः sharp, बाणैः arrows, पीड्यमान pierced, त्वाम् you, चक्षुषा eyes, नपश्यामि not see.
data.md: O foremost of Naiſtas, endowed with exceeding prowess, I know you by your voice. Having my person pierced with sharp shafts, I cannot see you with my eyes.

data.v: अञ्जना सुप्रजा येन मातरिश्वा च नैरृत । हनूमान्वानरश्रेष्ठः प्राणान्धारयते क्वचित् ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana (Rakshasa)! Indeed, Hanuman, the foremost of Vanaras, by whose birth, Anjana and Supraja are blessed as parents, are they alive?
data.anv: नैरृत Rakshasa, येन by whom, अञ्जना Anjana, सुप्रजाः Supraja, मातरिश्वाच blessed as parents, वानरश्रेष्ठः of Rakshasa, हनुमान् Hanuman, क्वचित् indeed, प्राणान् life, धारयते alive.
data.md: Does he through whom Añjanä as well as Mātariśvan* are blessed with fair offspring, does that prince of monkeys-Hanumān, live? *The wind-god.

data.v: श्रुत्वा जाम्बवतो वाक्यमुवाचेदं विभीषणः । आर्यपुत्रावतिक्रम्य कस्मात्पृच्छसि मारुतिम् ।।
data.es: After hearing Jambavantha, Vibheeshana said "Noble son, why are you enquiring about Hanuman?"
data.anv: जाम्बवतः Jambavatha, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said, आर्यपुत्रौ noble son, अतिक्रम्य leaving, मारुतिम् Hanuman, कस्मात् why, पृच्छसि enquiring.
data.md: Hearing Jambavan's speech, Vibhisana said, “Why, passing by the son of the high and mighty,* did you enquire after the wind-god's offsprmg? *Vide Hamlet.

data.v: नैव राजनि सुग्रीवे नाङ्गदे नापि राघवे । आर्य संदर्शितः स्नेहो यथा वायुसुते परः ।।
data.es: "Noble one! You are showing affection to Hanuman but not to King Sugriva, or Angada or even Raghava?"
data.anv: आर्य noble, वायुसुते son of wind god, यथा that way, परः others, स्नेहः affection, सन्दर्शितः showing, राजा king, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, नैव not, आङ्गदे Angada, , राघवेऽपि even Raghava
data.md: O noble one, you did not show that overflowing affection either for king Sugrīva or Angada and Raghava that you show for the son of the wind-god.

data.v: विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा जाम्बवान्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । शृणु नैरृतशार्दूल यस्मात्पृच्छामि मारुतिम् ।।
data.es: After hearing Jambavantha, Vibheeshana said "Noble son, why are you enquiring about Hanuman?"
data.anv: जाम्बवतः Jambavatha, वाक्यम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, इदम् these, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said, आर्यपुत्रौ noble son, अतिक्रम्य leaving, मारुतिम् Hanuman, कस्मात् why, पृच्छसि enquiring.
data.md: Hearing Vibhisana's words, Jambavan said, "Hear, O foremost of Raksasas, why I enquire after the wind-god's son.

data.v: तस्मिञ्जीवति वीरे तु हतमप्यहतं बलम् । हनूमत्युज्झितप्राणे जीवन्तोऽपि वयं हताः ।।
data.es: If this hero Hanuman is alive, even if the army is destroyed and if we are alive, it is like dead only.
data.anv: तस्मिन्वीरे if this hero, जीवितliving, हतमपि destroyed, बलम् army, अहतम् intact, हनूमति Hanuman, उज्झितप्राणे is still alive, वयम् we, जीवन्तःअपि living also, हृताः like dead only.
data.md: While this hero is alive, this force, albeit destroyed, live; but if Hanumān is reft of life, although living, we are destroyed.

data.v: ध्रियते मारुतिस्तात मारुतप्रतिमो यदि । वैश्वानरसमो वीर्ये जीविताशा ततो भवेत् ।।
data.es: "Dear! If Hanuman who is equal to wind god, resembles Vyshvanara (God of fire) is breathing, then we can hope to live (for life)."
data.anv: तात dear, मारुतप्रतिमः equal to wind god, वीर्ये in valiance, वैश्वानरसमः equal to Vysvanara's, मारुतिः Maruthi, धरतेयदि is breathing, ततः then, जीविताशा hope for life, भवेत् will be.
data.md: O child, if the wind-god's offspring, resembling his sire himself or (the deity of) fire in prowess, is alive, there is hope for our lives.

data.v: ततो वृद्धमुपागम्य नियमेनाभ्यवादयत् । गृह्य जाम्बवतः पादौ हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Hanuman the son of the wind god coming close to the aged Jambavan clasped his feet in accordance with tradition and greeted him.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, मारुतात्मजः son of wind god, हनूमान् Hanuman, वृद्धम् aged, उपागम्य coming close, नियमेना in accordance with tradition, जाम्बवतः Jambavantha, पादौ feet, गृह्य clasped, अभ्यवादयत् greeted.
data.md: Then approaching that aged one, Hanumanson to the wind-god-saluted him humbly, holding Jāmbavān's feet.

data.v: श्रुत्वा हनुमतो वाक्यं तथापि व्यथितेन्द्रियः । पुनर्जातमिवात्मानं स मेने ऋक्षपुंगवः ।।
data.es: Then again, Jambavan whose senses were affected, on hearing the statement of Hanuman, the foremost of Vanaras, felt as though he was born again.
data.anv: तदा then, अपि again, व्यथितेन्द्रियः whose senses were affected, प्लवगोत्तमः foremost of Vanaras, हनुमतः Hanuman, वाक्यम् statement, श्रुत्वा hearing, आत्मानम् himself, पुनः again, पुन once again born, मन्यते felt।।
data.md: Hearing Hanuman's voice, that foremost of monkeys with his senses sorely smarting, deemed himself as having regained his life.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा हनूमन्तं स जाम्बवान् । आगच्छ हरिशार्दूलवानरांस्त्रातुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Then brilliant Jambavan spoke to Hanuman, the tiger among Vanaras, on reaching him. "You ought to protect the Vanaras."
data.anv: ततः then, महातेजा brilliant, सः he, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, हनूमन्तम् to Hanuman, अब्रवीत् spoke, हरिशार्दूल tiger of Vanaras, आगच्छ reaching, वानरान् Vanaras, त्रातुम् protect, अर्हसि you ought.
data.md: Then that exceedingly energetic Jåmbavān addressed Hanumān, saying, “Come, O powerful monkey, It behove you to rescue the monkeys."

data.v: नान्यो विक्रमपर्याप्तस्त्वमेषां परमः सखा । त्वत्पराक्रमकालोऽयं नान्यं पश्यामि कञ्चन ।।
data.es: "You are fully endowed with prowess and great friend of monkeys in that way. It is time for you to show your talent. Indeed, I do not see anyone else."
data.anv: त्वम् you, एषाम् in that way, वक्रमपर्याप्तः fully endowed with prowess, परमः great, सखा friend, अन्यः others, न no, अयम् we, त्वत्पराक्रमकालः time to show your talent, अन्यम् others, कथञ्चन none indeed, न पश्यामि I do not see any.
data.md: There is none else. Endowed with profuse prowess, you are the greatest friend of these. This is the hour when you should display you might. Any other see I not.

data.v: ऋक्षवानरवीराणामनीकानि प्रहर्षय । विशल्यौ कुरु चाप्येतौ सादितौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: For the Bears and Vanaras, create excessive happiness. For Rama and Lakshmana who are unconscious, make them comfortable.
data.anv: ऋक्ष्वानरवीराणाम् for the Bears and Vanaras, अनीकानि excessive, प्रहर्षय happiness, सादितौ unconscious, एतौ for them, रामलक्ष्मणौ च and for Rama and Lakshmana, विशल्यौ comfortable, कुरु make them.
data.md: Do you cheer up this host consisting of bears and monkeys; and do you also heal the wounds of these two tormented by them.

data.v: गत्वा परममध्वानमुपर्युपरि सागरम् । हिमवन्तं नगश्रेष्ठं हनूमन्गन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "Hanuman, you ought to go very far over the sea to the Himalayas, the highest mountain."
data.anv: हनूमान् Hanuman, सागरम् उपर्युपरि over the sea, परमम् very, अध्वानम् far, गत्वा going, नगश्रेष्ठम् highest mountain, हिमवन्तम् Himalayas, गन्तुम् going, अर्हसि ought to.
data.md: Bounding sheer over the main, you, O Hanumān, should repair to the Himavānforemost of mountains.

data.v: ततः काञ्चनमत्युग्रमृषभं पर्वतोत्तमम् । कैलासशिखरं चापि द्रक्ष्यस्यरिनिषूदन ।।
data.es: "O Destroyer of enemies! there on top you will see the foremost of the mountain Rshaba and on the peak of Kailasa."
data.anv: अरिनिषूदन destroyer enemies, ततः there, काञ्चनम् golden, अत्युग्रम् top of, पर्वतोत्तमम् foremost of the mountains, ऋषभम् Rshaba, कैलासशिखरं च on the peak of Kailasa, द्रक्ष्यसि will see।।
data.md: There you will see that best of mountiansthe golden Rşabha of terrific aspect, and, O smiter of foes, the peak also of Kailāśa.

data.v: तयोः शिखरयोर्मध्ये प्रदीप्तमतुलप्रभम् । सर्वौषधियुतं वीर द्रक्ष्यस्यौषधिपर्वतम् ।।
data.es: "Heroic Hanuman! In the middle of those two mountains, you will see a highly splendid mountain covered with all kinds of medicinal herbs."
data.anv: वीरhero, तयोः those two, शिखयोः peaks, मध्ये middle, प्रदीप्तम् glowing, अतुलप्रभम् very splendid, सर्यौषधियुतम् all kinds of medicinal herbs, ओषधिपर्वतम् mountain covered with medicinal herbs, द्रक्ष्यसि will see.
data.md: Lying in the lap of these two, you, O hero, O powerful monkey, will see the mountain of medicines, fraught with healing herbs of all kinds.

data.v: तस्य वानरशार्दूलचतस्रो मूर्ध्नि संभवाः । द्रक्ष्यस्योषधयो दीप्ता दीपयन्त्यो दिशो दश ।।
data.es: "O Tiger among monkeys! You will see on the summit four medicinal herbs growing there illuminating the ten directions."
data.anv: वनरशार्दूल tiger of monkeys, तस्य your, मूर्ध्नि on the summit, सम्भवाः growing there, दीप्ताः illuminating, चतस्रः four, ओषधयः medicinal hebs, दशो ten, दीपय्नत्यो flaming, द्रक्ष्यसि will see.
data.md: On its summit you will find four medicinal herbs flaming and illumining the ten cardinal quarters-viz., Mſtasanjivani,' Višalyakarani, Suvarnakarani, and the mighty medicine, Sandhănī. 1. Lit. reviving the dead. 2. Lit. healing wounds inflicted by darts. 3. Lit. transmuting any thing to gold.

data.v: मृतसंजीवनीं चैव विशल्यकरणीमपि । सौवर्णकरणीं चैव संधानीं च महौषधीम् ।।
data.es: "Mrtasanjivani, Visalyakarani, Suvarnakarani, Sandhani, all these herbs are grown there."
data.anv: मृतसञ्जीवनींचैव Mrtasanjivani (restoring life of the dead), विशल्यकरणीम् अपि Visalyakarani (capable of healing wounds inflicted by weapons), सुवर्णकरणींचैव Suvarna karani (restoring original complexion after injury), सन्धानम् Sandhani (capable of joining broken bones), करणीम् herbs, तथा that way.

data.v: ताः सर्वा हनुमन्गृह्य क्षिप्रमागन्तुमर्हसि । आश्वासय हरीन्प्राणैर्योज्य गन्धवहात्मजः ।।
data.es: "Hanuman, taking the four herbs you, the son of wind god ought to return immediately with the speed of wind, to unite the life of the monkeys and reassure."
data.anv: हनुमन् Hanuman, ताः you, सर्वाः all, गृह्य taking, क्षिप्रम् immediately, आगन्तुम् return, अर्हसि ought to, गन्धवहात्मज son of wind god, हरीन् monkeys, प्राणैः life, योज्य uniting, आश्वसय reassuring.
data.md: O Hanumān, providing yourself with these, you should come here without delay. Do you, O offspring of the wind-god* bringing back lives to these monkeys, cheer them up. *Gandhavahātanaya-lit., son to the bearer of smell-a designation of the wind in Sanskrit.

data.v: श्रुत्वा जाम्बवतो वाक्यं हनूमान्हरिपुंगवः । आपूर्यत बलोद्धर्षैस्तोयवेगैरिवार्णवः ।।
data.es: "Hearing the instruction of Jambavantha, the son of the wind god, infused with wind speed as the ocean, heaves with the force of wind increasing his strength fully."
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः son of wind god, हनुमन् Hanuman, जाम्बवतः Jambvatha, वाक्यम् instruction, श्रुत्वा on hearing, अर्णवः ocean,, स्तोयवेगैःइव like infused with wind speed, बलोद्धर्षैः increased his strength, आपूर्यत completely.
data.md: Thereat hearing the words of Jāmbavān Hanumān, son of wind-god filled himself with energy, even as the Ocean heave with the force of the winds (blowing on its breast).

data.v: स पर्वततटाग्रस्थः पीडयन्पर्वतोत्तरम् । हनूमान्दृश्यते वीरो द्वितीय इव पर्वतः ।।
data.es: Standing on the summit of the foremost of the mountains, hero Hanuman pressing his feet seemed like a second mountain
data.anv: पर्वतताटाग्रस्थः standing on top of the mountain, पर्वतोत्तमम् foremost of the mountains, पीडयन् pressing, वीरः hero, सःहनूमान् that Hanuman, द्वितीय second, पर्वतःइव like mountain, दृश्यते appeared.
data.md: Ascending the summit of that mountain,* and hurting it with his tread, that hero-Hanumanappeared like a second mountain. *Trikuta.

data.v: हरिपादविनिर्भिन्नो निषसाद स पर्वतः । न शशाक तदात्मानं सोढुं भृशनिपीडितः ।।
data.es: Trodden by the feet of Hanuman that mountain pressed forcibly by himself could not bear his strength.
data.anv: हरिपादविनिर्भग्नः trodden by the feet of Hanuman, सःपर्वतः that mountain, भृशपीडितः sank down, तदा then, आत्मानम् himself, वोढुम् forcibly pressed, न शशाक not bear, निषसाद his strength.
data.md: Crushed under the tread of that monkey, the mountain was dispirited; and sore distressed, it could hardly contain itself.

data.v: तस्य पेतुर्नगा भूमौ हरिवेगाच्च जज्वलुः । शृङ्गाणि च व्यकीर्यन्त पीडितस्य हनूमता ।।
data.es: Oppressed by the speed of Hanuman, the mountain fell to the ground and by the impetuosity of his speed the mountain got shattered.
data.anv: हनूनता Hanuman, पीडितस्य pressurised, तस्य by his, नगाः mountain, हरिवेगात् by the speed Hanuman, भूमौ ground, पेतुः fallen, जज्वलुः च started fire, शृङ्गाणि च by the impetuosity of his speed, व्यशीर्यन्त shattered.
data.md: The trees on it began to topple to the earth; and on account of the vehemence of the monkey, they flamed up. And smitten by Hanumān, its peaks were scattered around. And monkeys could no longer dwell on that fore. Most of mountains, which being hard pressed (by Hanumān), was trembling all over, with its slopes covered with broken trees and rocks.

data.v: तस्मिन्संपीड्यमाने तु भग्नद्रुमशिलातले । न शेकुर्वानराः स्थातुं घूर्णमाने नगोत्तमे ।।
data.es: As the foremost of the mountain got oppressed it crushed the trees and rocks on it and Vanaras were unable to stand on it.
data.anv: सम्पीड्यमाने began to get oppressed, भग्नद्रुमशिलातले trees and rocks broken, तस्मिन् नगोत्तमे that foremost of mountain, घूर्णमाने crushed, वानराः Vanaras, स्थातुम् to stand, न शेकुः not possible.
data.md: The trees on it began to topple to the earth; and on account of the vehemence of the monkey, they flamed up. And smitten by Hanumān, its peaks were scattered around. And monkeys could no longer dwell on that fore. Most of mountains, which being hard pressed (by Hanumān), was trembling all over, with its slopes covered with broken trees and rocks.

data.v: स घूर्णितमहाद्वारा प्रभग्नगृहगोपुरा । लङ्का त्रासाकुला रात्रौ प्रनृत्तेवाभवत्तदा ।।
data.es: Then the mighty gates of Lanka shaking, homes shattered, stricken with fear that night it seemed Lanka was dancing.
data.anv: तदा then, घूर्णितमहाद्वारा mighty gates shaken, प्रभग्नगृहगोपुरा shattered the homes and gates, त्रासाकुला stricken with fear, लङ्का Lanka, रात्रौ night, प्रवृत्तेव dancing and shaking, अभवत् seemed.
data.md: With her giant gateways shaking, and the doors of her edifices broken, that night Lankā, over-whelmed with fright, seemed to be dancing.

data.v: पृथिवीधरसंकाशो निपीड्य धरणीधरम् । पृथिवीं क्षोभयामास सार्णवां मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: Son of the wind god, who was like a mountain supported by earth, pressing hard caused the earth with its ocean to shake.
data.anv: पृथिवीधरसङ्काशः like a mountain, मारुतात्मजः wind god's son, धरणीधरम् supported by earth, निपीड्य pressing, सार्णवाम् ocean, पृथिवीम् earth, क्षोभयामास made to shake.
data.md: The offspring of the wind-god, resembling a mountain itself, bringing that mountain to sore straits, agitated the entire earth with her oceans.

data.v: पद्भ्यां तु शैलमापीड्य वडवामुखवन्मुखम् । विवृत्योग्रं ननादोच्चैस्त्रासयन्निव राक्षसान् ।।
data.es: Pressing the mountain hard by his feet, opening his largemouth wide, he roared like Rakshasas to make Rakshasas fearful.
data.anv: शैलम् mountain, पद्भ्याम् by feet, आविध्य pressing, बडबामुखवत् opening his largemouth, उग्रम् angry, मुखम् face, विवृत्य opening, इवराक्षसान् like Rakshasas, त्रासयन् fearful, उच्चैः loudly, ननाद roared.
data.md: And hurting the mountain with his tread, he, opening wide his mouth resembling that of a mare, sent up loud shouts, terrifying the nightrangers.

data.v: तस्य नानद्यमानस्य श्रुत्वा निनदमद्भुतम् । लङ्कास्था राक्षसाः सर्वे न शेकुः स्पन्दितुं भयात् ।।
data.es: All the Rakshasas in Lanka hearing the loud roar of Hanuman were afraid and could not stir from there.
data.anv: नानाद्यमानस्य by the roaring, तस्य its, उत्तमम् loud, निनदम् sound, श्रुत्वा hearing, लङ्कास्थाः Lanka's, राक्षसाः Rakshasa, सर्वे all, भयात् in fear, स्पन्दितुम् stir, न शेकुः not possible.
data.md: Hearing those tremendous roars as he kept emitting cries, the powerful Rākṣasas were quite stupified.

data.v: नमस्कृत्वाथ रामाय मारुतिर्भीमविक्रमः । राघवार्थे परं कर्म समैहत परंतपः ।।
data.es: Maruti, scorcher of enemies, endowed with terrific valour offered prayers to Sri Rama and made up his mind to embark on the stupendous task for Raghava.
data.anv: भीमविक्रमः of terrific valour, परन्तपः scorcher of enemies, मारुतिः Maruthi, रामाय Rama's, नमस्कृत्वा offering his prayer, राघवार्थे for Raghava, परम् stupendous, कर्म task, समीहत made up his mind.
data.md: Bowing down to the Ocean, that subduer of enemies, the Wind-god's son, endowed with dreadful prowess, began to ponder over the mighty mission with which he had been entrusted in the interests of Rāghava.

data.v: स पुच्छमुद्यम्य भुजंगकल्पं; विनम्य पृष्ठं श्रवणे निकुञ्च्य । विवृत्य वक्त्रं वडवामुखाभ;मापुप्लुवे व्योम्नि स चण्डवेगः ।।
data.es: Raising his tail which resembled a serpent, bending his back, and ears, opening his mouth wide expounded Hanuman sprang up at terrific speed.
data.anv: सः he, भुजङ्गकल्पम् resembling a serpent, पुच्छम् bending his back, उद्यम्य raising, पृष्ठम् tail, विनम्य bent down, श्रवणे ears, निकुञ्च्य bending, बडबामुखाभम् opening widely, वक्त्रम् mouth, विवृत्य expounded, निचण्डवेगः terrible speed, व्योम्नि sky, आपुफ्लुवे sprang up.
data.md: Then upraising his tail resembling a serpent, bending his back, contracting his ears, and opening his mouth looking like that of a mare, that one possessed of terrific impetuosity, bounded into the sky.

data.v: स वृक्षषण्डांस्तरसा जहार; शैलाञ्शिलाः प्राकृतवानरांश्च । बाहूरुवेगोद्धतसंप्रणुन्ना;स्ते क्षीणवेगाः सलिले निपेतुः ।।
data.es: By the speed of his arms and thighs clusters of branches of trees, mountains, rocks, and common monkeys were attracted, and with reduction of speed along the way the rocks fell.
data.anv: स: he, तरसा speed, वृक्षखण्डान् clusters of trees, शैलान् mountains, शिलाः rocks, प्राकृतवानरांश्च common monkeys, जहार attracted, बाहूरुवेगोद्धतसम्प्रणुन्नाः by the speed of his arms and thighs, ते they, क्षीणवेगाः speed reduced, सलिले rocks, निपेतुः fell.
data.md: With the vehemence of his rush, he carried away in his wake whole tracts of trees, and rocks, and crags, and inferior monkeys;* and after having been carried away some distance by the vehemence of his arms and thighs, they, at length losing their velocity, fell into the waters (of the Ocean.) *Residing in the Trikuta mountain.

data.v: स तौ प्रसार्योरगभोगकल्पौ; भुजौ भुजंगारिनिकाशवीर्यः । जगाम मेरुं नगराजमग्र्यं; दिशः प्रकर्षन्निव वायुसूनुः ।।
data.es: Stretching his arms which resembled coils of serpents, whose valour equalled Garuda, enemy of serpents, as if attracting all the directions went to the summit of the foremost mountain which equalled Meru mountain.
data.anv: भुजङ्गारिनिकाशवीर्यः whose valour equalled Garuda enemy of serpents, सःवायुसूनुः that son of wind god, उरगभोगकल्पौ resembling coils of serpents, भुजौ arms, प्रसार्य stretching, दिशः directions, प्रकर्षन्निव as if attracting, अग्य्रम् summit, मेरुम् Meru, नगराजम् king of mountains, जगाम went.
data.md: Stretching his arms resembling serpents, the son of the Wind-god endowed with the prowess of Garuda* coursed on towards the monarch of mountains, as if making all the quarters tremble. *The text has, the foe of serpents—an appellation of Garuda

data.v: स सागरं घूर्णितवीचिमालं; तदा भृशं भ्रामितसर्वसत्त्वम् । समीक्षमाणः सहसा जगाम; चक्रं यथा विष्णुकराग्रमुक्तम् ।।
data.es: Observing the ocean whose waves were made to revolve round (by his speed), exceedingly, whose creatures were made to whirl round violently (by the wind force generated by his speed), he went forth like the wheel loosened from Vishnu's hand.
data.anv: सः he, घूर्णितवीचिमालम् whose waves were made to revolve, तथा that way, अभृशम् exceedingly, भ्रामितसर्वसत्त्वम् whose creatures were made to whirl round, सागरम् ocean, समीक्षमाणः observing, सहसा violently, विष्णुकराग्रमुक्तम् loosened from Vishnu's hand, चक्रंयथा like the wheel of Vishnu, जगाम went.
data.md: Seeing the sea with its hosts of billows rolling furiously and with the confederacies of aquatic animals bewildered by the angry waters, he coursed on rapidly, like the discus discharged by the hand of Vişnu.

data.v: स पर्वतान्वृक्षगणान्सरांसि; नदीस्तटाकानि पुरोत्तमानि । स्फीताञ्जनांस्तानपि संप्रपश्य;ञ्जगाम वेगात्पितृतुल्यवेगः ।।
data.es: Watching the mountains, trees, birds, rivers, tanks, the best of cities, all of them and prosperous people, he went at his father's speed.
data.anv: पितृतुल्यवेगः like his father in speed, सः he, पर्वतान् mountains, वृक्षगवान् trees, सरांसि birds, नदीः rivers, तटाकानि tanks, पुरोत्तमानि best of cities, तान् them, स्फीतान् prosperous, जनान्तान् अपि people, सम्प्रवीक्ष्य watching, वेगात् speedily, जगाम went.
data.md: Surveying hills and birds and pools and rivers and tanks and splendid cities and flourishing provinces, that one equal to his sire himself in celerity, held his way.

data.v: आदित्यपथमाश्रित्य जगाम स गतश्रमः । स ददर्श हरिश्रेष्ठो हिमवन्तं नगोत्तमम् ।।
नानाप्रस्रवणोपेतं बहुकंदरनिर्झरम् । श्वेताभ्रचयसंकाशैः शिखरैश्चारुदर्शनैः ।।
data.es: He reached the foremost of mountains, which was adorned with different kinds of springs, many caves and cascades and graced with trees. The peaks were like masses of white autumn clouds graced with splendour and beautiful to look at.
data.anv: नानाप्रस्रवणोपेतम् adorned with different springs, बहुकंदरनिर्घरम् many caves and cascares, श्वेताभ्रचयसङ्काशैः like masses of white clouds, चारुदर्शनैः beautiful to look at, शिखरैः peak, विविधैः several, वृक्षैः trees, शोभितम् graced with splendour, पर्वतोत्तमम् foremost of mountains, अगमत् reached.

data.v: स तं समासाद्य महानगेन्द्र;मतिप्रवृद्धोत्तमघोरशृङ्गम् । ददर्श पुण्यानि महाश्रमाणि; सुरर्षिसंघोत्तमसेवितानि ।।
data.es: Reaching there he saw the tall and terrifying peaks of the Lord of mountains frequented by Devatas and sages, meritorious hermitages.
data.anv: सः he, अतिप्रवृद्धोत्तमघोरशृङ्गम् tall and terrifying peaks, तंमहानगेन्द्रम् that Lord of mountains, समासाद्य reaching, सुररिसंघोत्तमसेवितानि frequented by Devatas and sages पुण्यानि meritorious, महाश्रमाणि hermitages, ददर्श saw.
data.md: Arriving at that lord of mighty mountains, furnished with excellent towering golden summits, he saw the great sacred asylums (of the ascetics), inhabited by the flower of celestial saints.

data.v: स ब्रह्मकोशं रजतालयं च; शक्रालयं रुद्रशरप्रमोक्षम् । हयाननं ब्रह्मशिरश्च दीप्तं; ददर्श वैवस्वत किंकरांश्च ।।
data.es: He saw the seat of Brahma, the abode of Rajathanabha, the abode of Indra, the location from which Rudra discharged an arrow (at Tripura), the abode of Lord Hayagriva, and glowing abode of the deity presiding over Brahmastra and Vyvasvatah's attendants.
data.anv: सः he, भ्रह्मकोशम् seat of Brahma, रजतालयं च the abode of Rajathanabha, शक्रालयम् abode of Indra, रुद्रशरप्रमोक्षम् the location from which Rudra discharged an arrow (at Tripura), हयाननं Lord Hayagriva, दीप्तम् glowing, ब्रह्मशिरः च abode of the deity presiding over Brahmastra, वैवस्वतकिङ्करांश्च Vyvasvatah's attendants, ददर्श witnessed.
data.md: He beheld Brahmakosa (a) Rajatalaya (b) Śakrālaya (c) Rudraśarapramokṣa (d) Hayānana (e) and the flaming Brahmasiras (f) and the servants of Vaivasvata (g). (a) The place of Hiranyagarbha (b) The place of Rajatanăbha— silver-neededanother from of Hiranyagarbha (c) The abode of Sakra. (d) The place where from Rudra discharged his arrow on the occasion of the destruction of Tripurā (e) Theplace of the horse-necked. (f) The place of the deity presiding ever the Brahma-weapon. (g) An appellation of Yama.

data.v: वज्रालयं वैश्वरणालयं च; सूर्यप्रभं सूर्यनिबन्धनं च । ब्रह्मासनं शंकरकार्मुकं च; ददर्श नाभिं च वसुंधरायाः ।।
data.es: He saw Vajralayam (where Brahma gave Indra the thunderbolt), the abode of Kubera shining like the Sun, the spot where the Sun was bound, Brahma's abode and the abode of the bow of Lord Siva, and the earth navel.
data.anv: वज्रालयम् Vajralayaam (where Brahma gave Indra thunderbolt), सूर्यप्रभम् shining like the Sun, वैश्रवणालयं च the abode of Kubera, सूर्यनिबन्धनं च the spot where Sun was bound, ब्रह्मासनम् Brahma's abode, शङ्करकार्मुकं च the abode of the bow belonging to Lord Siva, वसुन्धरायाः the earth's, नाभिं च navel, ददर्श saw.

data.v: कैलासमग्र्यं हिमवच्छिलां च; तथर्षभं काञ्चनशैलमग्र्यम् । स दीप्तसर्वौषधिसंप्रदीप्तं; ददर्श सर्वौषधिपर्वतेन्द्रम् ।।
data.es: He saw Kailas, the rocks of Himalayas, that way on the Rshaba the foremost Lord Siva, the golden mountain, and the great mountain on which grew, glowing medicinal herbs.
data.anv: उग्रम् elevated Siva, कैलासम् Kailas, हिमवच्छिलां च rocks of Himavat, तथा that way, ऋषभम् Rshaba, अग्य्रम् foremost काञ्चनशैलम् golden mountain, सन्दीप्तसर्वौषधिसम्प्रदीप्तम् glowing medicinal herbs illumining, सर्वौषधिपर्वतेन्द्रम् great mountain on which all medicinal herbs were, ददर्श saw.

data.v: स तं समीक्ष्यानलरश्मिदीप्तं; विसिष्मिये वासवदूतसूनुः । आप्लुत्य तं चौषधिपर्वतेन्द्रं; तत्रौषधीनां विचयं चकार ।।
data.es: Observing the herbs blazing like fire, he was astonished at the herbs on the mountain and went round thinking of the names of herbs (asked by Jambavan).
data.anv: सः he, अनलरश्मिदीप्तम् blazing like fire, तम् those, समीक्ष्य observed, विसिष्मिये astonished, ओषधिपर्वतेन्द्रम् mountain filled with herbs, आवृत्य going round, तत्र there, ओषधीनाम् names of herbs, विचयम् thinking, चकार went.
data.md: Beholding that flaming mass of fire, the offspring of Vasava's* emissary wondered. And bounding up to the lord of medicinal mountains, he fell to searching for the drugs. * The emissary of Vāsavain his cloud-from is the wind driving the cloud; and the passage refers to Hanuman,

data.v: स योजनसहस्राणि समतीत्य महाकपिः । दिव्यौषधिधरं शैलं व्यचरन्मारुतात्मजः ।।
data.es: The great monkey, son of the wind god, having traversed a thousand yojanas began to range the wonderful herbs and went about searching.
data.anv: महाकपिः great monkey, सःमारुतात्मजः that son of wind god, योजनसहस्राणि a thousand yojanas, समतीत्य having travelled, दिव्यौषधिधरम् began to range the wonderful herbs, शैलम् mountain, व्यचरत् went about searching.
data.md: That mighty monkey-the Wind-god's son-leaving behind a thousand Yojanas, began to range the mountain containing the divine remedies in its entrails.

data.v: महौषध्यस्तु ताः सर्वास्तस्मिन्पर्वतसत्तमे । विज्ञायार्थिनमायान्तं ततो जग्मुरदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: Perceiving a seeker coming for them, the herbs all over the wonderful mountain disappeared.
data.anv: ततः then, तस्मिन् in that, पर्वतसत्तमे wonderful mountain, सर्वाः all over, महौषध्यः among the herbs, अर्थिनम् seeker, आयान्तम् coming, विज्ञाय perceiving, ततः those, अदर्शनम् disappeared, जग्मुः disappeared.
data.md: Those potent medicines, in that foremost of mountains, knowing (before-hand) that one was coming seeking for them, rendered themselves invisible.

data.v: स ता महात्मा हनुमानपश्यं;श्चुकोप कोपाच्च भृशं ननाद । अमृष्यमाणोऽग्निनिकाशचक्षु;र्महीधरेन्द्रं तमुवाच वाक्यम् ।।
data.es: The great soul Hanuman was not able to see, those herbs, became angry and his eyes were burning like fire in anger. He jumped up and roared and said to the lordly mountain.
data.anv: महात्मा great soul, सःहनुमान् that Hanuman, ताः those, अपश्यन् not able to see, चुकोप became angry, कोपात् in anger, भृशम् jumping up, ननाद च roared, अनगिनिकाशचक्षुः eyes burning like like, अमृष्यमाणः , तम् , महीधरेन्द्रम् to the lordly mountain, वाक्यम् words, उवाच said.

data.v: किमेतदेवं सुविनिश्चितं ते; यद्राघवे नासि कृतानुकम्पः । पश्याद्य मद्बाहुबलाभिभूतो; विकीर्णमात्मानमथो नगेन्द्र ।।
data.es: "O King of mountains! You are not showing compassion to Raghava. Is it your determination to be like this? Overcome by my shoulder strength I shall crush you now. You may see."
data.anv: नगेन्द्र king of mountains, राघवे to Raghava, कृतानुकम्पः compassionate, न असिइतियत् not showing this way, एतत् all this, एवम् in that way, ते you, सुविनिश्चितंकिम् your determination, अथो is it, अद्य now, मद्बाहुबलाभिभूतः overcome by my shoulder strength, आत्मानम्? myself, विकीर्णम् crush, पश्य you may see.
data.md: What is ihis that you have decided on, that you show no compassion for Rāghava? But, O lord of mountains, today witness yourself, overpowered by my arms and torn in pieces!

data.v: स तस्य शृङ्गं सनगं सनागं; सकाञ्चनं धातुसहस्रजुष्टम् । विकीर्णकूटं चलिताग्रसानुं; प्रगृह्य वेगात्सहसोन्ममाथ ।।
data.es: Seizing hold of the peaks vehemently, its trees, elephants, gold mines withthousands of minerals he crushed the projections and set fire and burnt and uprooted swiftly.
data.anv: सः he, तस्य its, सनगम् trees, सनागम् elephants, सकाञ्चनम् with gold mines, धातुसहस्रजुष्टम् thousands of minerals, विकीर्णकूटम् crushed projections, ज्वलिताग्रसानुम् set fire and burn the peaks, शृङ्गम् peak, प्रगृह्य seizing, साहसा vehemently, वेगात् swiftly, उन्ममाथ uprooted.
data.md: And (anon) on a sudden, he violently rooted up its summit with trees and elephants and gold, and furnished with thousand varieties of ore, having its tops torn and its slopes aflame.

data.v: स तं समुत्पाट्य खमुत्पपात; वित्रास्य लोकान्ससुरान्सुरेन्द्रान् । संस्तूयमानः खचरैरनेकै;र्जगाम वेगाद्गरुडोग्रवीर्यः ।।
data.es: Striking terror among Devatas and demons and leaders inhabiting the world, uprooting the mountain he hurried at Garuda's speed into the sky praised by aerial creatures.
data.anv: सः he, तम् them, समुत्पाट्य striking terror, ससुरासुरेन्द्रान् leaders, Devatas and demons, लोकान् world, वित्रास्य inhabiting, खम् sky, उत्पापात uprooting, अनेकैः many, खचरैः aerial creatures, संस्तूयमानः praised, गरुडोग्रवेगः at terrible speed of Garuda, वेगात् hurried, जगाम went.

data.v: स भास्कराध्वानमनुप्रपन्न;स्तद्भास्कराभं शिखरं प्रगृह्य । बभौ तदा भास्करसंनिकाशो; रवेः समीपे प्रतिभास्कराभः ।।
data.es: Resembling the Sun closely, radiant like the Sun he was taking the top of the mountain, betaking himself in the vicinity of the Sun he was like another Sun.
data.anv: भास्करसन्निकाशः resembling Sun, सः he, भास्कराभम् radiant like Sun, तंशिखरम् that top, प्रगृह्य taking, भास्कराध्वानम् in the vicinity of Sun, अनुप्रपन्नः betaking himself, तदा then, रवेः Sun, समीपे close, प्रतिभास्कराभः another sun like, बभौ seemed.

data.v: स तेन शैलेन भृशं रराज; शैलोपमो गन्धवहात्मजस्तु । सहस्रधारेण सपावकेन; चक्रेण खे विष्णुरिवोद्धृतेन ।।
data.es: He, the son of the wind god sitting upon the crag, was delightful like Vishnu with a flaming wheel shining.
data.anv: शैलापमः that crag, सः he, गन्धवहात्मजः son of wind god, तेनशैलेन with that crag, खे sky, अर्पितेन setting upon, सहस्रधारेण with thousand edges, सपावकेन with flaming fire, चक्रेण wheel, विष्णुरिव like Vishnu, भृशम् delightful, रराजshining.
data.md: With that mountain, the offspring of the bearer of perfumes appeared surpassingly grand, like very Vişņu equipped with the flaming discus having a thousand edges.

data.v: तं वानराः प्रेक्ष्य तदा विनेदुः; स तानपि प्रेक्ष्य मुदा ननाद । तेषां समुद्घुष्टरवं निशम्य; लङ्कालया भीमतरं विनेदुः ।।
data.es: Observing him high the Vanaras became joyful, and he also saw them. Hearing their loud noise becoming aware of the Rakshasas of Lanka also roared in terrible fear.
data.anv: उच्चैः high, वानराः Vanaras, तं they, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, विनेदुः joyful, सःपि he also, तान् them, प्रेक्ष्य seeing, ननाद roared, तेषाम् their समुध्घुष्टरवम् raising loud noise, निशम्य Rakshasas becoming aware, लङ्कालयाः of Lanka, भीमतरम् terrible fear, विनेदुः roar.
data.md: Seeing him, the monkeys shouted, and he also, seeing them, shouted in delight. And hearing their tremendous cheers, those residing in Lankā shouted still more dreadfully.

data.v: ततो महात्मा निपपात तस्मि;ञ्शैलोत्तमे वानरसैन्यमध्ये । हर्युत्तमेभ्यः शिरसाभिवाद्य; विभीषणं तत्र च सस्वजे सः ।।
data.es: The great Hanuman along with the mountain descended in the midst of the Vanara army, and greeted the army head bent down and embraced Vibheeshana standing there.
data.anv: ततः then, महात्मा great, तस्मिन् with that, शैलोत्तमे foremost mountain, वानरसैन्यमध्ये in the midst of Vanara army, निपपात descended, सः he, हर्युत्तमेभ्यः best of Vanaras, शिरसा head bent down, अभिवाद्य greeting, तत्र there, विभीषणम् ? Vibheeshana, सस्वजे च embraced.
data.md: Then the high-souled one dropped on that best of mountains in the midst of the monkey-forces; and, bowing down to the principal monkeys there, he embraced Vibhisana.

data.v: तावप्युभौ मानुषराजपुत्रौ; तं गन्धमाघ्राय महौषधीनाम् । बभूवतुस्तत्र तदा विशल्या;वुत्तस्थुरन्ये च हरिप्रवीराः ।।
data.es: The two sons of the ruler of men inhaling the fragrance of the herbs became free from wounds. Other Vanara heroes also got restored.
data.anv: तौ the two, मानुषराजपुत्रौ sons of ruler of men, उभौ both, महौषधीनाम् of the great herbs, तंगन्धम् that fragrance, आघ्राय inhaling, तदा then, विशल्यौ free from wounds, बभूवतुः restored, अन्ये others, हरिप्रहीराश्च Vanara heroes, उत्तस्थुः got up.

data.v: ततो हरिर्गन्धवहात्मजस्तु; तमोषधीशैलमुदग्रवीर्यः । निनाय वेगाद्धिमवन्तमेव; पुनश्च रामेण समाजगाम ।।
data.md: Then that monkey, the offspring of the bearer of fragrance, endowed with terrific speed, took that medicinal mountain (back) to Himavān and again presented himself before Rāma.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजाः सुग्रीवो वानराधिपः । अर्थ्यं विजापयंश्चापि हनूमन्तं महाबलम् ।।
data.es: Sugriva, the king of Vanaras called Hanuman to make him know the task ahead and said these words.
data.anv: ततः then, वानराधिपः Vanara king, महातेजाः intelligent, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, विज्ञापयन् च अपि the task ahead, हनूमन्तम् Hanumantha, अर्थ्यम् make known, इदम् these, वचः words, अब्रवीत् said.
data.md: Then the exceedingly energetic lord of monkeys, Sugrīva, said to Hanumān these words fraught with import,

data.v: यतो हतः कुम्भकर्णः कुमाराश्च निषूदिताः । नेदानीमुपनिर्हारं रावणो दातुमर्हति ।।
data.es: " As Kumbhakarna is killed and his sons are destroyed, Ravana may not putup defence again. I think."
data.anv: यतः since, कुम्भकर्णः Kumbhakarna, हतः killed, कुमाराश्च son, निषूदिताः destroyed, रावणः Ravana, इदानीम् no longer, उपनिर्हारम् put up defence, दातुम् again, न अर्हति I think.
data.md: Inasmuch as Kumbhakarma has been slain as also the princes,' Rāvana can no longer defend the city.

data.v: ये ये महाबलाः सन्ति लघवश्च प्लवंगमाः । लङ्कामभ्युत्पतन्त्वाशु गृह्योल्काः प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: "Of the bulls among vanaras, endowed with prowess, whoever is quick, able and foremost, let them go to Lanka, the abode of Ravana."
data.anv: महाबलाः endowed with prowess, लघवश्च and quick, प्लवगर्षभाः bulls among Vanaras, येये whoever, प्लवङ्गमाः Vanaras, सन्ति able, हरिसङ्काशाः foremost, हरयः monkeys, उल्काः torch, गृह्य taking, रावणालयम् Ravana's abode, प्रदग्धुम् invade, अशु go, लङ्काम् Lanka, अभिपतन्तु let them.
data.md: Now let those principal monkeys that are endowed with great strength and that are furnished with fleetness, taking fire-brands (in their hands) rapidly rush towards Lankā.

data.v: ततोऽस्तं गत आदित्ये रौद्रे तस्मिन्निशामुखे । लङ्कामभिमुखाः सोल्का जग्मुस्ते प्लवगर्षभाः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the bulls among Vanaras turned their faces towards Lanka and went holding torches in hand, after the Sun set as the frightening night started.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, आदित्ये Sun, अस्तंगते having set, रौद्रे frightening, तस्मिन् their, निशामुखे faces turned, ते they, प्लवगर्षभाः Vanara bulls, सोल्काः holding torches, लङ्काम् अभिमुखाः facing Lanka, जग्मुः went.
data.md: Then when the Sun had set and at the terrific front of Night, those foremost of monkeys marched towards Larikā, equipped with firebrands.

data.v: उल्काहस्तैर्हरिगणैः सर्वतः समभिद्रुताः । आरक्षस्था विरूपाक्षाः सहसा विप्रदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.es: Vanara troops went all over with torches and chased by them, the Rakshasas at the gates ran instantly.
data.anv: उल्काहस्सैः torches in hand, हरिगणैः Vanara troops, सर्वतः all over, समभिद्रुताः chased, आरक्षस्थाः at the gates, विरूपाक्षाः Rakshasas, सहसा instantly, विप्रदुद्रुवुः ran.
data.md: Charged at all points by nur bers of monkeys armed with fire-brands, those firece-eyed (Rākş asas) that guarded the gates.* suddenly fled away. *Araksasthā-according to some means gates. According to others, a gulma or division of an army.

data.v: गोपुराट्ट प्रतोलीषु चर्यासु विविधासु च । प्रासादेषु च संहृष्टाः ससृजुस्ते हुताशनम् ।।
data.es: Rejoiced Vanaras set fire to the towering gates, attics, different streets as well as mansions to send away Rakshasas.
data.anv: सम्हृष्टाः rejoiced, ते they, गोपुराट्टप्रतोलीषु towering gates and attics, विविधासु different, चर्यासु streets, प्रासादेषु च mansions, हुताशनम् set fire, ससृजुः to send away.
data.md: Thereat (the monkeys) delighted set fire to gates and upper apartments and spacious highways and various by-ways and edifices.

data.v: तेषां गृहसहस्राणि ददाह हुतभुक्तदा । आवासान्राक्षसानां च सर्वेषां गृहमेधिनाम् ।।
data.es: Then thousands of their houses were burnt by fire (consumer of offerings), and mountain like mansions collapsed to the ground.
data.anv: तदा then, हुतभुक् fire, तेषाम् their, गृहसहस्राणि thousands of houses, ददाह burnt, पर्वताकाराः of mountain like form, प्रासादाः mansions, धरणीतले on the ground, पतन्ति collapsed.

data.v: हेमचित्रतनुत्राणां स्रग्दामाम्बरधारिणाम् । सीधुपानचलाक्षाणां मदविह्वलगामिनाम् ।।
कान्तालम्बितवस्त्राणां शत्रुसंजातमन्युनाम् । गदाशूलासि हस्तानां खादतां पिबतामपि ।।
शयनेषु महार्हेषु प्रसुप्तानां प्रियैः सह । त्रस्तानां गच्छतां तूर्णं पुत्रानादाय सर्वतः ।।
तेषां गृहसहस्राणि तदा लङ्कानिवासिनाम् । अदहत्पावकस्तत्र जज्वाल च पुनः पुनः ।।
सारवन्ति महार्हाणि गम्भीरगुणवन्ति च । हेमचन्द्रार्धचन्द्राणि चन्द्रशालोन्नतानि च ।।
रत्नचित्रगवाक्षाणि साधिष्ठानानि सर्वशः । मणिविद्रुमचित्राणि स्पृशन्तीव च भास्करम् ।।
क्रौञ्चबर्हिणवीणानां भूषणानां च निस्वनैः । नादितान्यचलाभानि वेश्मान्यग्निर्ददाह सः ।।
ज्वलनेन परीतानि तोरणानि चकाशिरे । विद्युद्भिरिव नद्धानि मेघजालानि घर्मगे ।।
data.es: The archways covered with a touch of fire shone like lightning in summer, girt round like clusters of clouds.
data.anv: ज्वलनेन by the touch of fire, परीतानि covered, तोरणानि archways, घर्मगे in summer, विद्युद्भिः lightning, नद्धानि girt round, मेघजालानीव like clusters of clouds, चकाशिरे shone.

data.v: विमानेषु प्रसुप्ताश्च दह्यमाना वराङ्गनाः । त्यक्ताभरणसंयोगा हाहेत्युच्चैर्विचुक्रुशः ।।
data.es: The lovely women sleeping in burnt mansion tops screamed loudly in desperation saying 'Alas! Oh Oh!' and removing their ornaments.
data.anv: विमानेषु in the mansion tops, प्रसुप्ताः sleeping, दह्वमानाः burnt, वराङ्गनाः lovely women, त्यक्ताभरणसर्वाङ्गाः removing the ornaments, हाहाइति alas! Oh Oh!! like this, उच्चैः screamed, विचुक्रुशुः loudly in despair.
data.md: And superb damsels asleep in lofty edifices, being burnt, cast away their ornaments and shrieked bitterly saying "Alas! Woe is me". * Vimäna, according to Rämānuja, is a sevenstoried edifice.

data.v: तत्र चाग्निपरीतानि निपेतुर्भवनान्यपि । वज्रिवज्रहतानीव शिखराणि महागिरेः ।।

data.v: तमिन्द्रकेतुप्रतिमं वृक्षं मन्दरसंनिभम् । समुत्सृजन्तं वेगेन पश्यतां सर्वरक्षसाम् ।।
data.es: All the Rakshasas seeing the tall tree, which was like Mandara mountain, resembling Indra's banner hurriedly was about to let loose.
data.anv: सर्वरक्षसाम् all Rakshasas, पश्यताम् seeing, इन्द्रकेतुप्रतिमम् resembling Indra's banner, मन्दरसन्निभम् like the Mandara mountain, तंवृक्षम् that tree, वेगेन hurriedly, समुत्सृजन्तम् impatiently.

data.v: स चिच्छेद शितैर्बाणैः सप्तभिः कायभेदनैः । अङ्गदो विव्यथेऽभीक्ष्णं ससाद च मुमोह च ।।
data.es: Kumbha shattered Angada with seven sharp arrows capable of tearing the body. Angada, pained by that screamed and lost his senses.
data.anv: सः he, कायभेदनैः tearing the body, शितैः sharp, सप्तभिः seven, बाणैः arrows, चिच्छेद shattered, सः , अङ्गदः that Angada, अभीक्ष्णम् immediately, विव्यथे pained, ससादच screaming, मुमोह च lost senses.
data.md: Thereat he* severed it with seven sharp shafts capable of piercing the body. And Angada experienced a sharp pang and fell down deprived of his senses. *Kumbha.

data.v: अङ्गदं व्यथितं दृष्ट्वा सीदन्तमिव सागरे । दुरासदं हरिश्रेष्ठा राघवाय न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.es: Seeing the foremost Vanara, Angada who was difficult to encounter fell and like sinking into the ocean of despondency, the foremost Vanaras submitted to Rama.
data.anv: व्यथितं tormented, सीदन्तम् sinking into despondency, सागरम् इव like into an ocean, दुरासदम् difficult to encounter, अङ्गदम् Angada, दृष्टवा seeing, हरिश्रेष्ठाः foremost of monkeys, रामाय to Rama, न्यवेदयन् submitted.
data.md: Seeing the invincible Angada down like ebbing sea, the foremost monkeys informed Raghava of it.

data.v: रामस्तु व्यथितं श्रुत्वा वालिपुत्रं महाहवे । व्यादिदेश हरिश्रेष्ठाञ्जाम्बवत्प्रमुखांस्ततः ।।
data.es: On hearing that Angada was tormented in the battlefield and pained he ordered Jambavan and the best of monkey leaders to help him.
data.anv: ततः then, रामः Rama, रणाजरे in the battlefield, वालिपुत्रम् Vali's son, व्यथितम् pained, श्रुत्वा hearing, जाम्बवत्प्रमुखान् Jambavan and other leaders, हरिश्रेष्ठान् best of monkeys, व्यादेश ordered.
data.md: Rama, hearing that Vali's son had come to grief in terrific fight, directed the principal monkeys, headed by Jambavan.

data.v: ते तु वानरशार्दूलाः श्रुत्वा रामस्य शासनम् । अभिपेतुः सुसंक्रुद्धाः कुम्भमुद्यतकार्मुकम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Rama's command, the enraged Vanara tigers took up bows to attack Kumbha.
data.anv: ते those, वानरशार्दूलाः Vanara tigers, रामस्य Rama's, शासनम् command, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुसङ्कृद्धाः very angry, उद्यतकार्मुकम् took up his bow, कुम्भम् Kumbha, अभिपेतुः to attack.
data.md: And hearing Rama's command, the monkeys, fired with wrath, charged Kumbha, staying with his bow upraised.

data.v: ततो द्रुमशिलाहस्ताः कोपसंरक्तलोचनाः । रिरक्षिषन्तोऽभ्यपतन्नङ्गदं वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: Bulls among Vanaras then took trees, and rocks in hand, with their eyes red in anger started for the protection of Angada.
data.anv: ततः then, वानरर्षभाः bull among Vanaras, द्रुमशिलाहस्ताः trees, rocks taking in hand, कोपसंरक्तलोचनाः eyes red in anger, अङ्गदम् Angada, रिरक्षिषन्तः for the protection, अभ्यपतन् started.
data.md: Those powerful monkeys, with their eyes crimsoned with choler and bearing rocks and trees in their hands, were engaged in defending Angada.

data.v: जाम्बवांश्च सुषेणश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः । कुम्भकर्णात्मजं वीरं क्रुद्धाः समभिदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.es: "Let Rksharaja the mighty strong Jambavan and Sushena even Vegadarsi protect the rear side (of the army)".
data.anv: ऋक्षराजः Rksharaja, महासत्त्वः mighty strong, जाम्बवांश्च even Jambavan, सुषेणश्च and Sushena, वेगदर्शि Vegadarsi, वानरश्च ते those vanaras, त्रयः three, कुक्षिम् rear side, रक्षन्तु protect
data.md: Jāmbavān and Suşeņa and the monkey, Vegadarsi, wrought with wrath, darted against that hero-son to Kumbhakarma.

data.v: समीक्ष्यातततस्तांस्तु वानरेन्द्रान्महाबलान् । आववार शरौघेण नगेनेव जलाशयम् ।।
data.es: Perceiving that great army of Vanara leaders are advancing, Kumbha obstructed them with a volley of arrows just like a mountain obstructing the path of torrent.
data.anv: आपततः advancing, महाबलान् great army, तान् them, वानरेन्द्रान् Vanara leaders, समीक्ष्य perceiving, जलाशयम् torrent, नगेनेव like a mountain, शरौघेण with volley of arrows, आववार obstructed.
data.md: Seeing them spring forward; he covered up those exceedingly mighty lords of monkey, with showers of shafts, even as a crag obstruct the course of a current.

data.v: तस्य बाणचयं प्राप्य न शोकेरतिवर्तितुम् । वानरेन्द्रा महात्मानो वेलामिव महोदधिः ।।
data.es: The Vanara leaders could not bear the range of arrows of Kumbhaka, just as a tide can't overstep the shore of an ocean.
data.anv: महात्मानः great self, वानरेंद्राः Vanara leader, तस्य his, बाणपथम् range of arrows, प्राप्य reaching, महोदधिः great ocean, वेलाम् इव like tide, अतिवर्तितुम् overstep, न शेकुः become unsuccessful.
data.md: Even the great deep cannot see his own shores, those high-souled lord of monkeys, coming within the range of his arrows, could not even see.

data.v: तांस्तु दृष्ट्वा हरिगणाञ्शरवृष्टिभिरर्दितान् । अङ्गदं पृष्ठतः कृत्वा भ्रातृजं प्लवगेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Seeing the Vanara army pained by the rain of arrows, Sugriva, the Lord of Vanaras having Angada in his rear, swiftly rushed and assailed Kumbhakarna's son just like a lion roaming in the mountains attacks elephants.
data.anv: शरवृष्टिभि rain of arrows, अर्दितान् pained, तान् them, हरिगणान् Vanara army, दृष्टवा seeing, प्लवगेश्वरः Lord of Vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, भ्रातृजम् brother's son, अङ्गदम् Angada, पृष्ठतःकृत्वा in the rear, रणे in combat, वेगवान् endowed with speed, केसरी lion, शैलसानुचरम् roaming in the mountains, नागमिव like elephant, वेगेन swiftly, कुम्भमाहवे Kumbhakarna's son, अभिदुद्राव assailed.
data.md: Seeing those monkeys sore distressed by the shafts, the king of the monkeys, Sugrīva, in that conflict taking his brother's son on his back, rushed against the son of Kumbhakarna, even as a powerful lion rush at an elephant ranging on the slopes of a mountain.

data.v: अभिदुद्राव वेगेन सुग्रीवः कुम्भमाहवे । शैलसानु चरं नागं वेगवानिव केसरी ।।
data.es: Seeing the Vanara army pained by the rain of arrows, Sugriva, the Lord of Vanaras having Angada in his rear, swiftly rushed and assailed Kumbhakarna's son just like a lion roaming in the mountains attacks elephants.
data.anv: शरवृष्टिभि rain of arrows, अर्दितान् pained, तान् them, हरिगणान् Vanara army, दृष्टवा seeing, प्लवगेश्वरः Lord of Vanaras, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, भ्रातृजम् brother's son, अङ्गदम् Angada, पृष्ठतःकृत्वा in the rear, रणे in combat, वेगवान् endowed with speed, केसरी lion, शैलसानुचरम् roaming in the mountains, नागमिव like elephant, वेगेन swiftly, कुम्भमाहवे Kumbhakarna's son, अभिदुद्राव assailed.

data.v: उत्पाट्य च महाशैलानश्वकर्णान्धवान्बहून् । अन्यांश्च विविधान्वृक्षांश्चिक्षेप च महाबलः ।।
data.es: In the battle Neela hurled Aswakarana, Sala and Mango trees in good bloom and several other trees at Ravana.
data.anv: सःनीलः that Neela, संयुगे in battle, अश्वकर्णान्धान् Aswakarana, शालान् Sala, सुपुष्पितान् in bloom, चूतानपि and Mango trees, अन्यान् and other, विविधान् several, वृक्षान् trees, चिक्षेप hurled.
data.md: That mighty monkey, uprooting many an asvakarna and other mighty trees of various kinds, discharged them (at the foe).

data.v: तां छादयन्तीमाकाशं वृक्षवृष्टिं दुरासदाम् । कुम्भकर्णात्मजः श्रीमांश्चिच्छेद निशितैः शरैः ।।
data.es: Frenzied Kumbhakarna's son was torn under the shower of trees that covered space with sharp arrows which was difficult to approach.
data.anv: शीघ्रं frenzied, कुम्भकर्णात्मजः Kumbhakarna's son, आकाशम् space, छादयन्तीम् covering, दुरासदाम् difficult to approach, ताम् them, वृक्षवृष्टिम् shower of trees, निशितैः sharp, शरैः arrows, चिच्छेद torn asunder.
data.md: By means of his sharp arrows the graceful son of Kumbhakarņa cut off that down-pour of trees covering the welkin; and incapable of being resisted. And being beffled those trees looked like sataghnis.

data.v: अभिलक्ष्येण तीव्रेण कुम्भेन निशितैः शरैः । आचितास्ते द्रुमा रेजुर्यथा घोराः शतघ्नयः ।।
data.es: The sharp arrows aimed at the target by Kumbha covered the trees and they shone like dreadful Sataghnis.
data.anv: अभिलक्षेण aimed at the target, तीव्रेण violently, कुम्भेन by Kumbha, निशितैः sharp, शरैः arrows, अचितास्तेद्रुमा covered with trees, ते those, घोराः dreadful, शतघ्नयःयथा like Sataghnis, रेजुः shone.

data.v: द्रुमवर्षं तु तच्छिन्नं दृष्ट्वा कुम्भेन वीर्यवान् । वानराधिपतिः श्रीमान्महासत्त्वो न विव्यथे ।।
data.es: Valiant hero, the prosperous and noble Sugriva, the chief of Vanaras did not get distressed when tormented with rain of trees.
data.anv: वीर्यवान् valiant hero, श्रीमान् prosperous, महासत्वः very noble, वानराधिपतिः Vanara chief, कुम्भेन at Kumbha, सञ्छिन्नम् tormented, तत् that, द्रुमवर्षम् rain of trees, दृष्टवा seeing, न विव्यथे not distressed.
data.md: Seeing that shower of trees riven by Kumbha, the graceful lord of the monkeys endowed with exceeding strength and prowess, did not feel any mortification.

data.v: निर्भिद्यमानः सहसा सहमानश्च ताञ्शरान् । कुम्भस्य धनुराक्षिप्य बभञ्जेन्द्रधनुःप्रभम् ।।
data.es: He snatched the bow of Kumbha forcibly which was like Indra's rainbow, pulled it and broke, while tolerating the pain of the arrows.
data.anv: निर्भिद्यमानः snatching, सः he, तान् them, शरान् arrows, सहमानः tolerating the pain, कुम्भस्य Kumbha's, इन्द्रधनुष्प्रभम् like Indra's rainbow, धनुः bow, सहसा forcibly, आक्षिप्य pulling, बभञ्च broke.

data.v: अवप्लुत्य ततः शीघ्रं कृत्वा कर्म सुदुष्करम् । अब्रवीत्कुपितः कुम्भं भग्नशृङ्गमिव द्विपम् ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva leapt into the chariot, which was a difficult deed to perform, saw Kumbha who was like an elephant and whose tusks were broken and spoke.
data.anv: ततः then, शीघ्रम् speedily, अवफ्लुत leaping, सुदुष्करम् very difficult, कर्म deed, कृत्वा having done, कुपितः angry, भग्नशृङ्गम् peak broken, द्विपम् इव flame like, कुम्भम् elephant, अब्रवीत् spoke.
data.md: Suddenly attacked, he bearing those arrows, seized Kumbha's bow resembling in resplendence the very bow of Indra. And swiftly bounding up and performing that feat difficult of being achieved, he, exceedingly enraged, addressed Kumbha resembling an elephant shorn of his tusks, saying.

data.v: निकुम्भाग्रज वीर्यं ते बाणवेगं तदद्भुतम् । संनतिश्च प्रभावश्च तव वा रावणस्य वा ।।
data.es: "Oh, elder brother of Nikumbha! Your valour, speed of your arrows, compliance, and glory is wonderful like that of Ravana's."
data.anv: निकुम्भाग्रज elder brother of Nikumbha, ते your, वीर्यम् valour, बाणवेगवत् by the speed of your arrow, अद्भुतम् wonderful, सन्नतिश्च compliance, प्रभावश्च glory, तववा of yours, रावणस्यवा or Ravana's.

data.v: प्रह्रादबलिवृत्रघ्नकुबेरवरुणोपम । एकस्त्वमनुजातोऽसि पितरं बलवत्तरः ।।
data.es: "You are equal to Prahlada, Bali, Indra, Kubera and Varuna in might. You alone have taken over like your father."
data.anv: प्रह्लादबलिवृत्रघ्नकुबेरवरुणोपम Prahlada, Bali, Indra, Kubera, Varuna, त्वम् you, एकः alone, बलवत्ततम् equal in might, पितरम् father's, अनुजातः like father, असि are.

data.v: त्वामेवैकं महाबाहुं शूलहस्तमरिंदमम् । त्रिदशा नातिवर्तन्ते जितेन्द्रियमिवाधयः ।।
data.es: "Oh! mightyarmed, Kumbha! wielding pike in hand, you are a tamer of enemies, you alone are the one that gods are not able to overcome, a pre eminent one who has gained over senses, highly intelligent, exhibiting your prowess and deeds before me."
data.anv: महाबाहुम् mighty armed, शूलहस्तम् wielding pike in hand, अरिन्दमम् tamer of enemies, त्वाम् you, एकमेव you alone, त्रिदशाः gods, जितेन्द्रियम् one who has overcome senses, आधयः pre eminent, नातिवर्तन्ते not able to overcome, महाबुद्धे highly intelligent, विक्रमस्व prowess, मम me, कर्माणि deeds, तः those, पश्यत: exhibit.

data.v: वरदानात्पितृव्यस्ते सहते देवदानवान् । कुम्भकर्णस्तु वीर्येण सहते च सुरासुरान् ।।
data.es: "Your uncle Ravana is able to withstand the Devas and Danavas by virtue of the boons and Kumbhakarna was able to with stand gods and demons by virtue of his courage."
data.anv: ते your, पितृव्यः uncle, वरदानात् by the boons, देवदानवान् Devas and Danavas, सहते with stand, कुम्भकर्णस्तु Kumbhakarna also, वीर्येण courage, सुरासुरान् gods and demons, सहते with stand.
data.md: It is only by virtue of the boon he has received, that your uncle can bear the deities and the Dānavas. But Kumbhakarņa cop with the immortals and Asuras by means of his native might. And in the bow equal to Indrajit himself and in power equal to Rāvana, you now in might and energy are the foremost of Räkşasas.

data.v: धनुषीन्द्रजितस्तुल्यः प्रतापे रावणस्य च । त्वमद्य रक्षसां लोके श्रेष्ठोऽसि बलवीर्यतः ।।
data.md: It is only by virtue of the boon he has received, that your uncle can bear the deities and the Dānavas. But Kumbhakarņa cop with the immortals and Asuras by means of his native might. And in the bow equal to Indrajit himself and in power equal to Rāvana, you now in might and energy are the foremost of Räkşasas.

data.v: महाविमर्दं समरे मया सह तवाद्भुतम् । अद्य भूतानि पश्यन्तु शक्रशम्बरयोरिव ।।
data.es: "Just as the wonderful conflict between Indra and Sambara let the beings witness the mighty comb at between me and you."
data.anv: अद्य now, समरे in combat, मयासह with me, तव your, अद्भुतम् wonderful, महाविमर्दम् mighty encounter, शक्रम्बरयोरिव Indra and Sambara like, भूतानि beings, पश्यन्तु witness.
data.md: Today let all creatures witness the mighty and wonderful encounter in conflict between you and me, like to the meeting of Śakra and Sambara.

data.v: कृतमप्रतिमं कर्म दर्शितं चास्त्रकौशलम् । पातिता हरिवीराश्च त्वयैते भीमविक्रमाः ।।
data.es: "By an unequal deed done by you in the efficiency in the use of weapons has been exhibited. The monkey heroes of terrific valour have been made to fall."
data.anv: त्वया your, अप्रतिमम् unequal, कर्म deed, कृतम् done, अस्त्रकौशलं च efficiency in the use of weapons, दर्शितम् exhibited, भीमविक्रमाः of terrific valour, एते of those, हरिवीराश्च monkey heroes, पातिताः made to fall.
data.md: Unparalleled is the feat you have performed; and you have displayed your skill in weapons. And heroic monkeys endowed with dreadful vigour, have been brought down by you.

data.v: उपालम्भभयाच्चापि नासि वीर मया हतः । कृतकर्मा परिश्रान्तो विश्रान्तः पश्य मे बलम् ।।
data.es: "O Stalwart! You have not been finished by me for the fear of reproaching. You are exhausted by your deeds and resting. Having rested, witness my strength now."
data.anv: वीर stalwart, कृतकर्मपरिश्रान्तः exhausted by your deeds and resting, मया by me, उपालम्भभयात् fear of reproaching, हतः finished, नअसि are not, विश्रान्तः having rested, मे my, बलम् strength, पश्य witness.
data.md: O hero it is only because of the apprehension* of censure of the people that I do not slay you who are fatigued in consequence of the acts that you have performed. And reposing from fight, do you see my strength! *i.e. Lest people should censure me, saying, Sugrīva slew Kumbha when he was fatigued in fight.

data.v: तेन सुग्रीववाक्येन सावमानेन मानितः । अग्नेराज्यहुतस्येव तेजस्तस्याभ्यवर्धत ।।
data.es: Sugriva's words of flattering royalty captivated Kumbha's fire of energy, which doubled like fire fed with ghee.
data.anv: सावमानेन slighted, तेन by the, सुग्रीवाक्येन Sugriva's words, मानितः flattered, राज्याहुतस्य royalty captivated, अग्नेःइव like fire, तस्य his, तेजः fire of energy, अभ्यवर्धत increased.
data.md: Being thus honoured (by Sugrīva) with fair speech, (Kumbha) flamed up like a flame into which oblations have been poured.

data.v: ततः कुम्भः समुत्पत्य सुग्रीवमभिपद्य च । आजघानोरसि क्रुद्धो वज्रवेगेन मुष्टिना ।।

data.md: You did slay my father in the forest of Dandaka. Remembering your action and finding you before, my ire is excited.

data.v: बाणौघवितताः सर्वा दिशश्च विदिशस्तथा । संछन्ना वसुधा चैव समन्तान्न प्रकाशते ।।

data.v: ततः क्रुद्धो महाबाहुर्धनुश्चिच्छेद रक्षसः । अष्टाभिरथ नाराचैः सूतं विव्याध राघवः । भित्त्वा शरै रथं रामो रथाश्वान्समपातयत् ।।

data.md: Thereupon being excited with ire, Rāghava of long arms sundered his (Raksasa's) bow in conflict and with eight Näräcas pierced the charioteer.

data.v: विरथो वसुधां तिष्ठन्मकराक्षो निशाचरः । अतिष्ठद्वसुधां रक्षः शूलं जग्राह पाणिना । त्रासनं सर्वभूतानां युगान्ताग्निसमप्रभम् ।।

data.es: The night ranger whirling round and round the glowing pike furiously hurled at Raghava in that conflict.

data.md: Beholding which dart even the celestials fly away in fear to different quarters. And taking up that huge flaming dart, the night-ranger, being excited with ire, hurled it at the high-souled Rāghava.

data.v: तमापतन्तं ज्वलितं खरपुत्रकराच्च्युतम् । बाणैस्तु त्रिभिराकाशे शूलं चिच्छेद राघवः ।।
data.es: Raghava split with his three arrows the burning pike released from the hand of Khara's son while it was still flying in the sky.

data.md: Rāghava, with four shafts, sundered that dart, in the sky, flaming and hurled at him by the son of Khara.

data.v: सच्छिन्नो नैकधा शूलो दिव्यहाटकमण्डितः । व्यशीर्यत महोक्लेव रामबाणार्दितो भुवि ।।
data.es: That pike, which was decorated with gold, broke into pieces, and fell down like fire sticks by the many supreme arrows of Rama.

data.md: That flaming dart, feathered in gold, being splintered into several pieces by Rāma's arrows fell down on earth like a huge fire-brand.

data.v: तच्छूलं निहतं दृष्ट्वा रामेणाद्भुतकर्मणा । साधु साध्विति भूतानि व्याहरन्ति नभोगताः ।।
data.es: Seeing the unwearied action of Raghava in destroying the pike, the beings in the sky praised him saying," well done, well done."

data.md: Beholding that dart beffled thus by Rāma of unwearied actions all those, stationed in the welkin began to shout, “Well done! Well done!"

data.v: तद्दृष्ट्वा निहतं शूलं मकराक्षो निशाचरः । मुष्टिमुद्यम्य काकुत्स्थं तिष्ठ तिष्ठेति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: The night ranger Makaraksha seeing his pike destroyed lifting up his fist said this to Kakuthsa, "Wait, wait."

data.md: Beholding his dart thus sundered, the nightranger Makarākșa clenching his fist spoke to Kakutstha, saying, "Stay! Stay!"

data.v: स तं दृष्ट्वा पतन्तं वै प्रहस्य रघुनन्दनः । पावकास्त्रं ततो रामः संदधे स्वशरासने ।।
data.es: Then Rama the beloved of Raghus, laughing at Maka raksha, fixed missile presided by fire god.

data.v: तेनास्त्रेण हतं रक्षः काकुत्स्थेन तदा रणे । संछिन्नहृदयं तत्र पपात च ममार च ।।
data.es: Then struck in the battlefield by that missile of Kakuthsa, the Rakshasa fell down with his heart split open and died.

data.md: With that arrow the Räksa was slain by Kākutstha in battle. And having his heart pierced he fell down and died.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा ते राक्षसाः सर्वे मकराक्षस्य पातनम् । लङ्कामेव प्रधावन्त रामबालार्दितास्तदा ।।
data.es: Seeing Maka raksha fall, those Rakshasas became scared of Rama's arrow and ran straight to Lanka.
data.anv: सर्वे all, तेराक्षसाः those Rakshasas, मकराक्षस्य Maka raksha's, पातनम् fallen, दृष्टवा seeing, रामबाणभयार्धिताः scared of Rama's arrow, लङ्कामेव straight to Lanka, प्रधावन्त ran
data.md: Beholding Makarākṣa thus slain all the Rāks asas, being afraid of Rama's arrows, proceeded towards Lankā.

data.v: दशरथनृपपुत्रबाणवेगै; रजनिचरं निहतं खरात्मजं तम् । ददृशुरथ च देवताः प्रहृष्टा; गिरिमिव वज्रहतं यथा विशीर्णम् ।।
data.md: Seeing that night-ranger, the son of Khara, slain by Rāma's arrows, like to a mountain clept by a thunder-bolt, the celestials were greatly delighted.

data.md: Being thus angered, and thinking within himself what steps to take, he ordered his son Indrajit to proceed to the battle-field.

data.v: जहि वीर महावीर्यौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । अदृश्यो दृश्यमानो वा सर्वथा त्वं बलाधिकः ।।
data.es: "Oh, Valiant son! You destroy the two heroic brothers, Rama and Lakshmana, by being visible or invisible as you are always superior to them."
data.anv: वीर valiant, अदृश्यःinvisible, दृश्यमानोवाor visible, महावीर्यौ great heroes, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौRama and Lakshmana, जहि destroy, सर्वाथा always, त्वम् you, बलाधिकः superior
data.md: O hero, gifted with great prowess as you are, do you, hidden (in clouds) or appearing before them, slay the two heroic brothers Rāma and Laksmana.

data.v: त्वमप्रतिमकर्माणमिन्द्रं जयसि संयुगे । किं पुनर्मानुषौ दृष्ट्वा न वधिष्यसि संयुगे ।।
data.es: "You have won the battle with Indra of incomparable deeds. Why not kill men, onseeing them in combat?"
data.anv: त्वम् you, संयुगे in battle, अप्रतिमकर्माणम् by incomparable deeds, इन्द्रम् Indra, जयसि won, संयुगे in combat, मानुषौ men, दृष्टवा seeing, किंपुनः why again, न वधिष्यसिnot kill them
data.md: You did defeat in conflict Indra of unequalled prowess. Shall you then neglect to slay men as they are?

data.v: तथोक्तो राक्षसेन्द्रेण प्रतिगृह्य पितुर्वचः । यज्ञभूमौ स विधिवत्पावकं जुहुवे न्द्रजित् ।।

data.md: There came some she-demons with crimson turbans and waited respectfully where Rävaņa's son was offering oblations to Fire.

data.v: हुत्वाग्निं तर्पयित्वाथ देवदानवराक्षसान् । आरुरोह रथश्रेष्ठमन्तर्धानगतं शुभम् ।।

data.md: Thus offering oblations to fire and to celestials, Dänavas and Raksasas, he ascended in excellent car and soon disappeared.

data.es: " A conjurer, mean, and invisible Indrajith with the chariot, if seen, in any way the Vanara troops will forcibly kill him with their strength."

data.es: "If he enters into earth, heaven or the underground world or the subterranean world or remains hidden, my weapon will consume him, and he will fall on earth."
data.anv: यद्येषः by himself, भूमिम् into earth, विशतेयदिenters also, दिवंवा heaven or, रसातलंवापि underground, नभस्तलंवा subterranean world, एवम् in that way, निगूढोऽपि remains hidden, ममmy, अस्त्रदग्धःweapon, गतासुः consumed, भूमितले on the ground, पतिष्यतेwill fall
data.md: Truly he shall be burnt to death with my shafts and fall down on the earth albeit he entered the regions under the earth of the abode of the celestials.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं महात्मा; रघुप्रवीरः प्लवगर्षभैर्वृतः । वधाय रौद्रस्य नृशंसकर्मण;स्तदा महात्मा त्वरितं निरीक्षते ।।
data.md: Having said these words pregnant with a high significance, the high-souled and heroic descendant of Raghu, being surrounded by monkeys, began to concert various plans for the destruction of that terrible Raksasa of wicked deeds.

data.v: विज्ञाय तु मनस्तस्य राघवस्य महात्मनः । संनिवृत्याहवात्तस्मात्प्रविवेश पुरं ततः ।।
data.es: Knowing the highsouled Raghava's mind, Indrajith departed from there and entered the city.
data.anv: सः he, महात्मनः highsouled, तस्यराघवस्य that Raghava's, मनः mind, विज्ञाय victory, तस्मात् therefore, आहवात् from there, निवृत्य departed, ततः there, पुरीम् city, प्रविवेश entered
data.md: Having read the intention of that high-souled Raghava, he retired from the battle-field and entered into the city of Lankā.
