data.es: Recollecting those Rakshasas killed, the heroic, mighty and courageous Indrajith's eyes were red in anger.
data.anv: शूरः hero, सःमहाद्युति: mighty Rakshasa, तरस्विनाम् courageous, तेषांराक्षसानाम्those Rakshasas, वधम् killed, अनुस्मृत्य recollecting, क्रोधताम्रेक्षणः eyes turned red in anger, निर्जगाम went
data.md: And remembering the destruction of many a। quick-paced Raksasa, his eyes were rendered coppery with ire; and that hero, the son of Ravana, issued out of the city again.

data.v: स पश्चिमेन द्वारेण निर्ययौ राक्षसैर्वृतः । इन्द्रजित्तु महावीर्यः पौलस्त्यो देवकण्टकः ।।
data.es: Paulastya (one of the nine mind born sons of Brahma, a scion of sage Paulastya), stupendous hero, a tormentor of Devatas, Indrajith, surrounded by Rakshasas came out through the western gate.
data.anv: सुमहावीर्यः stupendous hero, देवकण्टकः tormentor of Devatas, पौलस्त्यः Paulastya, सःइन्द्रजित् that Indrajith, राक्षसैः by Rakshasas, वृतः surrounded, पश्चिमेनद्वारेण through the western gate, निर्ययौ came out
data.md: That highly powerful, Indrajit, a descendant of Pulasta and an enemy of the celestials, issued out, encircled by the Rākşasas, by the western gate.

data.v: इन्द्रजित्तु ततो दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । रणायाभ्युद्यतौ वीरौ मायां प्रादुष्करोत्तदा ।।
data.es: Indrajith, also witnessing the two brothers Rama and Lakshmana prepared for war, exhibited his trickery.
data.anv: इन्द्रजित् तुIndrajith also, ततः there, वीरौheroes, भ्रातरौ brothers, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, रणाय for war, अभ्युद्यतौ prepared, दृष्ट्या witnessing, तदा then, मायाम् by conjuring, प्रादुष्करोत्exhibited
data.md: Then beholding the heroic brothers Rāma and Lakşmaņa prepared for fight, Indrajit spread illusions.

data.v: इन्द्रजित्तु रथे स्थाप्य सीतां मायामयीं तदा । बलेन महतावृत्य तस्या वधमरोचयत् ।।
data.es: Indrajith, also through a trick, wanted to make illusory Sita and place her in the chariot surrounded by Rakshasas and thought of killing her.
data.anv: इन्द्रजित् तु Indrajith also, तदा then, मायामयीम् through a trick, सीताम् Sita, रथे chariot, स्थाप्य placed, महता great, बलेन army, आवृत्य surrounding, तस्याः her, वथम् to kill, अरोचयत् thought
data.md: Placing an illusory figure of Sītā on the car, encircled by a huge army he began to make arrangements for her destruction.

data.v: मोहनार्थं तु सर्वेषां बुद्धिं कृत्वा सुदुर्मतिः । हन्तुं सीतां व्यवसितो वानराभिमुखो ययौ ।।
data.es: Evil minded Indrajith, made up his mind to hoodwink every one who decided to kill Sita and went towards the Vanaras.
data.anv: सुदुर्मतिः evil minded, सर्वेषाम् every one, मोहनार्थम् to hoodwink, बुद्धिम् in his mind, कृत्वा did, सीताम् Sita, हन्तुम् to kill, व्यवसितः decided, वानराभिमुखः towards Vanaras, ययौ went
data.md: Desiring to charm all with his illusions, that one of wicked intent, preparing himself to slay Sītā, proceeded towards the monkeys.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा त्वभिनिर्यान्तं नगर्याः काननौकसः । उत्पेतुरभिसंक्रुद्धाः शिलाहस्ता युयुत्सवः ।।
data.es: All the forest animals perceiving Indrajithadvancing became angry and with rocks in hand faced him with enthusiasm.
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते of them, काननौकसः forest animals, अभिनिर्यान्तम् coming towards, तम् him, दृष्टवा observing, अभिसङ्क्रुद्धाः very angry, शिलाहस्ताः holding rocks in hand, युयुत्सवः enthusiastically, उत्पेतुः faced
data.md: Beholding him thus proceed, the monkeys, inflamed with ire, desirous of fighting and with crags in their hands, moved on.

data.v: हनूमान्पुरतस्तेषां जगाम कपिकुञ्जरः । प्रगृह्य सुमहच्छृङ्गं पर्वतस्य दुरासदम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, the elephant among monkeys, taking hold of a huge mountain peak that was difficult to reach marched forward and went.
data.anv: कपिकुञ्जरः elephant among monkeys, हनूमान् Hanuman, पर्वतस्य mountain, सुदुरासदम् difficult to reach, सुमहत् huge, शृङ्गम् peak, प्रगृह्य taking hold, तेषाम् marched, पुरतःforward, जगाम went
data.md: And preceded them all, Hanuman, the foremost of the monkeys, with a huge mountaintop in his hand.

data.v: स ददर्श हतानन्दां सीतामिन्द्रजितो रथे । एकवेणीधरां दीनामुपवासकृशाननाम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman beheld in the chariot of Indrajith, cheerless Sita with one braid, with no desire to live, emaciated by fasting, wearing a single cloth, body not anointed, covered with dust and dirt all over the body, who was dear to Raghava.
data.anv: सः he, इन्द्रजितः Indrajith, रथे chariot, हतानन्दाम् cheerless, एकवेणीधराम् with one braid, दीनाम् piteous, उपवासकृशाननाम् emaciated with fasting, परिक्लिष्टैकवसनाम् wearing only one cloth, अमृजाम् with no desire to live, रजोमलाभ्याम् covered with dust and mud, आलिप्तै: without any anointment, सर्वगात्रैः all over body, वरस्त्रियम् dear, राघवप्रियाम् wife of Raghava, सीताम् Sita, ददर्श saw
data.md: He beheld there, on Indrajit's car, Sita, deprived of all joy, poorly, greatly reduced with fasts and wearing a single braid.

data.anv: सः he, इन्द्रजितः Indrajith, रथे chariot, हतानन्दाम् cheerless, एकवेणीधराम् with one braid, दीनाम् piteous, उपवासकृशाननाम् emaciated with fasting, परिक्लिष्टैकवसनाम् wearing only one cloth, अमृजाम् with no desire to live, रजोमलाभ्याम् covered with dust and mud, आलिप्तै: without any anointment, सर्वगात्रैः all over body, वरस्त्रियम् dear, राघवप्रियाम् wife of Raghava, सीताम् Sita, ददर्श saw
data.md: Rāghava's beloved spouse wore a piece of soiled cloth, and though highly beautiful, the grace of her person was greatly spoiled with dirt.

data.v: तां निरीक्ष्य मुहूर्तं तु मैथिलीमध्यवस्य च । बाष्पपर्याकुलमुखो हनूमान्व्यथितोऽभवत् ।।
data.es: He looked at her for a moment and recognised her as Janaka's daughter since he had seen her not long before.
data.anv: मुहूर्तम् for a moment, ताम् her, निरीक्ष्य looked at, मैथिलीति Mythili, अध्ववस्यतु recognise, बभूवconcluded, तेन therefore, सा she, जनकात्मजा Janaka's daughter, चिरदृष्टाहिseen not before long
data.md: That daughter of Janaka, was not seen by him for a long time. And beholding her and deciding instantly that she is the daughter of Mithilā, (he became greatly sorry).

data.v: अब्रवीत्तां तु शोकार्तां निरानन्दां तपस्विनाम् । दृष्ट्वा रथे स्तितां सीतां राक्षसेन्द्रसुताश्रिताम् ।।
data.es: Great Vanara, Hanuman, gazing at miserable, joyless, ascetic woman seated in the chariot, worried, why she is in the chariot. He spoke to the best of Vanara leaders and rushed towards the son of Ravana with them.
data.anv: सःमहाकपिः that great Vanara, शोकार्ताम् miserable, निरानन्दाम् joyless, तपस्विनीम् ascetic woman, राक्षसेन्द्रसुतश्रिताम् under the sway of the son of the king of Rakshasas, ताम् her, दृष्टवा gazing, अस्य her, किम् why, समर्थितम् seated, इति thus, अब्रवीत् spoke, चिन्तयन् worried, तैः with those, वानरश्रेष्ठैःसह best of Vanaras रावणिम् son of Ravana, अभ्यधावत rushed
data.md: Seeing her on the car, innocent, poor, deprived of joy and brought under the influence of the son of the lord Rākşasas that great monkey thought within himself— 'What must be the intention of Indrajit?' and accompanied by heroic monkeys advanced towards the son of Ravana.

data.es: Great Vanara, Hanuman, gazing at miserable, joyless, ascetic woman seated in the chariot, worried, why she is in the chariot. He spoke to the best of Vanara leaders and rushed towards the son of Ravana with them.
data.anv: सःमहाकपिः that great Vanara, शोकार्ताम् miserable, निरानन्दाम् joyless, तपस्विनीम् ascetic woman, राक्षसेन्द्रसुतश्रिताम् under the sway of the son of the king of Rakshasas, ताम् her, दृष्टवा gazing, अस्य her, किम् why, समर्थितम् seated, इति thus, अब्रवीत् spoke, चिन्तयन् worried, तैः with those, वानरश्रेष्ठैःसह best of Vanaras रावणिम् son of Ravana, अभ्यधावत rushed

data.v: तद्वानरबलं दृष्ट्वा रावणिः क्रोधमूर्छितः । कृत्वा विशोकं निस्त्रिंशं मूर्ध्नि सीतां परामृशत् ।।
data.es: Indrajith saw the Vanara army coming towards him, deluded with anger, unsheathed the sword and touched Sita's forehead.
data.anv: रावणिः Indrajith, तत् there, वानरबलम् Vanara army, दृष्टवा seeing, क्रोधमूर्छितः deluded with anger, निस्त्रिंशम् unsheathed, विकोशम् sword, कृत्वा did, सीताम् Sita, मूर्ध्नि forehead, अकर्षयत् touched
data.md: Beholding that monkey host, Ravana's son became beside himself with ire and unsheathing his weapon Nistrinsha, caught her by the hair.

data.v: तं स्त्रियं पश्यतां तेषां ताडयामास रावणिः । क्रोशन्तीं राम रामेति मायया योजितां रथे ।।
data.es: As they were looking at Sita on the chariot trickishly constructed, and she was crying saying, 'O Rama, O Rama', he stood and hit her.
data.anv: रावणि: Indrajith, तेषाम् of them, पश्यताम् as they were looking, मायया trickishly, रथे on the chariot, योजिताम् constructed, रामरामेतिO Rama Rama, क्रोशन्तीम् crying, तांस्त्रियम् stood, ताडयामासhit her
data.md: The Räkşasa addressed himself to strike her in the presence of all those monkeys and that illusory figure of Sītā began to bewail saying, “O Rāma! O Rāma!”

data.v: गृहीतमूर्धजां दृष्ट्वा हनूमान्दैन्यमागतः । दुःखजं वारिनेत्राभ्यामुत्सृजन्मारुतात्मजः । अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं क्रोधाद्रक्षोऽधिपात्मजम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Indrajith holding Sita's head, Maruti's son, was immersed in grief, and shed tears of sorrow from his eyes.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजः Maruti's son, हनुमान् Hanuman, गृहीतमूर्धजाम् holding her head, दृष्टवा seeing, दैन्यम् piteously, आगतःdropped, नेत्राभ्याम् from his eyes, शोकजम् tears, वारि heroic, उत्सृजम् tears of sorrow
data.md: Seeing her thus caught by the head, Hanumān, the son of Maruta, greatly sorry, began to shed tears.

data.v: दुरात्मन्नात्मनाशाय केशपक्षे परामृशः । ब्रह्मर्षीणां कुले जातो राक्षसीं योनिमाश्रितः । धिक्त्वां पापसमाचारं यस्य ते मतिरीदृशी ।।
data.es: "O evil minded Indrajith! You are born as Rakshasa in the clan of seers of vedic mantras and sought the womb of Rakshasa woman. It is for your own self destruction you seized her hair.
data.anv: दुरात्मन् evil minded, ब्रह्मर्षीणाम् seers of vedic mantras, कुले clan, जातःborn, राक्षसीम् Rakshasa woman, योनिम् womb, आश्रितःsought, आत्मनाशाय for selfdestruction, केशपक्षे hair, परामृशःseized
data.md: It is for your destruction, O Vicious-souled one! that you have touched her hair. Being descended from that great Brahmă ascetic you are born as a Rākşasa.

data.v: नृशंसानार्य दुर्वृत्त क्षुद्र पापपराक्रम । अनार्यस्येदृशं कर्म घृणा ते नास्ति निर्घृण ।।
data.es: "You are ignoble, mean, of sinful prowess, not merciful. You have resolved to take such a sinful action which is not worthy of you. You have no compassion to act in this manner."
data.anv: नृशंशनार्य ignoble, दुर्वृत्तcruel, क्षुद्रmean, पापपराक्रम of sinful prowess, निर्घृण not merciful, यस्य such, ते by you, मतिः mind, ईदृशीresolve, पापसमाचारम्sinful action, त्वाम् your, दिक् direction, अनार्यस्य not noble, ते to you, कर्म action, ईदृशम् this manner, घृणाcompassion, नास्ति not there
data.md: O! cursed are you, since you have cherished such a desire and engaged in such a vicious deed. O vile! O wicked! O! cruel and dishonourable wight! O you having vice for your prowess!

data.v: च्युता गृहाच्च राज्याच्च रामहस्ताच्च मैथिली । किं तवैषापराद्धा हि यदेनां हन्तुमिच्छसि ।।
data.es: "This Mythili is sent away from home, from the kingdom, and also distanced from Rama's protection. You are unkind and hitting in this way. What harm has she done?"
data.anv: मैथिली Mythili, गृहाच्च from home, राज्याच्च from kingdom, रामहस्ताच्च from Rama's protection, च्युता distanced, निर्दय unkind, एनाम् this way, हन्तुम् यत् hitting, एषा like this, तव you, किम् what, अपराद्धाहिharm has she done
data.md: O shameless! Are you not ashamed of perpetrating such an inhuman deed. What has Maithili done by you, O cruel one! that you are ready to slay her—She has been banished from her home, territory and has been separated from her lord.

data.v: सीतां च हत्वा न चिरं जीविष्यसि कथंचन । वधार्हकर्मणानेन मम हस्तगतो ह्यसि ।।
data.es: "Indeed, you will not live long after killing Sita. You deserve to be killed for your actions, that is why you have come into my hands."
data.anv: सीताम् Sita, हत्वा after killing, कथञ्चन indeed, चिरम् long time, न जीविष्यसि will not live, वदार्हdeserve to be killed, अनेन many, कर्मणा actions, मम my, हस्तगतः into my hand s, असिहिcome
data.md: O you worthy of being slain, destroying Sītā, you shall not live long as you have been brought under me.

data.v: ये च स्त्रीघातिनां लोका लोकवध्यैश्च कुत्सिताः । इह जीवितमुत्सृज्य प्रेत्य तान्प्रतिलप्स्यसे ।।
data.es: "You deserve to be killed by the world here. Giving up your life, you will be thrown out and descend to the world with those who killed women have gone, after your death."
data.anv: लोकवध्येषु worthy to be killed by the world, इह here, जीवितम् life, उत्सृज्य giving up, प्रेत्यafter death, एषु with them, स्त्रीघातिनाम् one who kills woman, ये such you, कुसतिताःthrown, लोकाः world, तान् those, प्रतिपत्स्यसे descend
data.md: You shall after the death reach the place which is occupied by those who murder women, a place which is avoided even by those who commit every sort of crime punishable by law.

data.v: इति ब्रुवाणो हनुमान्सायुधैर्हरिभिर्वृतः । अभ्यधावत संक्रुद्धो राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं प्रति ।।
data.es: Hanuman was highly enraged and speaking like got prepared for war and went surrounded by the monkeys towards Indrajith, the son of Rakshasa king.
data.anv: हनुमान् Hanuman, इति thus, ब्रुवाणः speaking, सायुधैःprepared for war, हरिभिः with monkeys, वृतःsurrounded, ससुङ्कृद्धःhighly enraged, राक्षसेन्द्रसुतंप्रति towards Rakshasa king's son, अभ्यधावत् went
data.md: Saying this Hanuman, accompanied by monkeys armed with weapons, and excited with ire, proceeded towards the son of the lord or Raksasas.

data.v: आपतन्तं महावीर्यं तदनीकं वनौकसाम् । रक्षसां भीमवेगानामनीकेन न्यवारयत् ।।
data.es: Rakshasa army troops of mighty prowess, terribly angry, were advancing towards wood dwellers (Vanara troops) and were intercepted by the Vanara troops.
data.anv: आपतन्तम् intercepted, महावीर्यम् of mighty prowess, वनौकसाम् wood dwellers (Vanaras ), तत् अनीकम् that army troops, भीमकोपानाम् terribly angry, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, अनीकम् army, न्यवारयत् advancing
data.md: Beholding the highly powerful monkeys advance thus the Rākṣasas, inflamed with wrath, obstructed them.

data.v: स तां बाणसहस्रेण विक्षोभ्य हरिवाहिनीम् । हरिश्रेष्ठं हनूमन्तमिन्द्रजित्प्रत्युवाच ह ।।
data.es: Indrajith shattered the army of monkeys with a thousand arrows. Hanuman the foremost Vanara replied to them as follows.
data.anv: सः he, इन्द्रजित् Indrajith, तांहरिवाहिनीम् that army of monkeys, बाणसहस्रेण with thousand arrows, विक्षोभ्य shattered, हरिश्रेष्ठम् foremost of monkey, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, प्रत्युवाच ह replied again
data.md: Assailing the monkey-hosts with thousands of arrows, Indrajit spoke to that foremost of monkeys, Hanumān, saying.

data.v: सुग्रीवस्त्वं च रामश्च यन्निमित्तमिहागताः । तां हनिष्यामि वैदेहीमद्यैव तव पश्यतः ।।
data.es: "I will kill your Vaidehi today as you keep seeing her for whose sake Sugriva, you and Rama also came here," said Indrajith.
data.anv: सुग्रीवः Sugriva, त्वं च you also, रामश्च and Rama, यन्निमित्तम् for their sake, इह here, आगताः come, ताम् them, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, तव your, पश्यतः keep seeing, अद्यैवtoday, वधिष्यामि will kill
data.md: Today I shall slay before you all Vaidehī, for whom you, Sugriva and Rama have come. Slaying her, O monkey, I shall afterwards kill you, Rama, Laksmana and Sugriva and the dishonourable Vibhişaņa.

data.v: इमां हत्वा ततो रामं लक्ष्मणं त्वां च वानर । सुग्रीवं च वधिष्यामि तं चानार्यं विभीषणम् ।।
data.es: "O Vanara! This day, having killed her, I will kill Rama, Lakshmana, and you, also Sugriva and that ignoble Vibheeshana."
data.anv: वानर Vanara, इमाम् this day, हत्वा killing, ततः thereafter, रामम् Rama, लक्ष्मणं च and Lakshmana, त्वां च and you, सुग्रीवं च also Sugriva, अनार्यम् ignoble, तंविभीषणं च that Vibheeshana, वधिष्यामि will kill

data.v: न हन्तव्याः स्त्रियश्चेति यद्ब्रवीषि प्लवंगम । पीडा करममित्राणां यत्स्यात्कर्तव्यमेत तत् ।।
data.es: "O Hanuman! You said women should not be killed. But whoever causes trouble to the enemy, action should be taken, said Indrajith."
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम monkey, स्त्रियः woman, न हन्तव्याःइति not to be killed, यत् by that, यत् who ever, अमित्राणाम् enemy, पीडाकरम् causes trouble, स्यात् to be done, तत् that, कर्तव्यमेव that action alone
data.md: O monkey, about not destroying women, of which you were speaking (I might say) that we must always do what pains our enemies."* *There is one śloka intervening according to some texts, but it has been omitted by many. The reasons for this omission are best known to them. The purport is:-"Why did Rama slay Taraka before? And I shall therefore slay his spouse the daughter of king Janaka.” Hear in Indrajit attempts to justify himself and wants to prove that Räma is equally blameable for this.)

data.v: तमेवमुक्त्वा रुदतीं सीतां मायामयीं ततः । शितधारेण खड्गेन निजघानेन्द्रजित्स्वयम् ।।
data.es: Indrajith having spoken like that killed that crying illusory Sita with a sharpedged sword.

data.md: Saying this, Indrajit with a sharp sword, himself killed the illusory Sitā thus bewailing.

data.v: यज्ञोपवीतमार्गेण छिन्ना तेन तपस्विनी । सा पृथिव्यां पृथुश्रोणी पपात प्रियदर्शना ।।
data.es: Split diagonally, the ascetic woman with charming hips and pleasing countenance sank into the ground.
data.anv: तेन by that, यज्ञोपवीतमार्गेण diagonally in the direction of sacred thread worn on chest, भिन्ना split, तपस्विनी ascetic woman, पृथुश्रोणी of charming hips, प्रियदर्शना of pleasing countenance, सा sank पृथिव्याम् sank into the ground
data.md: Being sundered by him obliquely in a way in which a sacred thread lies on one's own person, the innocent (Sitā) having beautiful countenance fell down on the earth.

data.v: तामिन्द्रजित्स्त्रियं हत्वा हनूमन्तमुवाच ह । मया रामस्य पश्येमां कोपेन च निषूदिताम् ।।
data.es: Indrajith killed that woman and said to Hanuman" see this Vaidehi, Rama's wife, cut up by my sword. Your exertion is useless now."
data.anv: इन्द्रजित् Indrajith, ताम् that, स्त्रियम् woman, हत्वा killing, हनूमन्तम् Hanuamantha, कोपेन च angry, उवाच ह said, मया by me, शस्त्रनिषूदिताम् destroyed with sword, इमाम् this, रामस्य Rama's, पश्य see, एषा that way, च and, वैदेही Vaidehi, विशस्ता cut up, वःher, परिश्रमःexertion, निष्फलःuseless
data.md: Slaying her Indrajit spoke to Hanumān,“Behold I have slain (before you) with my sword Rāma's beloved. And Vaidehi being thus slain, all your labours have been rendered useless."

data.v: ततः खड्गेन महता हत्वा तामिन्द्रजित्स्वयम् । हृष्टः स रथमास्थाय विननाद महास्वनम् ।।
data.es: Indrajith himself with his long sword killed her, then rejoiced, he ascended the chariot and roared in a loud tone.
data.anv: सःइन्द्रजित् that Indrajith, महता long, खडगेन sword, स्वयम् by himself, ताम् her, हत्वा killed, ततः then, हृष्टःjoyful, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय ascended, महास्वनम् loud tone, ननादच roared
data.md: a Destroying her with his own hand by means of a huge sword, Indrajit, greatly pleased ascended his car and began to emit dreadful roars.

data.v: वानराः शुश्रुवुः शब्दमदूरे प्रत्यवस्थिताः । व्यादितास्यस्य नदतस्तद्दुर्गं संश्रितस्य तु ।।
data.es: The sound of his roar was heard by the Vanaras waiting for war standing not far from there, which was difficult for Indrajith to access.

data.md: The monkeys stationed near heard that terrible roar and saw him enter the castel.* *The castle built by Indrajit by means of his illusory power in the air.

data.v: तथा तु सीतां विनिहत्य दुर्मतिः; प्रहृष्टचेताः स बभूव रावणिः । तं हृष्टरूपं समुदीक्ष्य वानरा; विषण्णरूपाः समभिप्रदुद्रुवुः ।।
data.md: And slaying Sītā that wicked-minded son of Rāvana became greatly pleased. And beholding him thus delighted the monkeys being greatly sorry fled away.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तं भीमनिर्ह्रादं शक्राशनिसमस्वनम् । वीक्षमाणा दिशः सर्वा दुद्रुवुर्वानरर्षभाः ।।
data.es: The bulls among Vanaras heard the roar which was like thunder and looking at Indrajith fled in all directions.
data.anv: शक्राशनिसमस्वनम् whose roar was like thunder, भीमनिर्ह्रादम् terrible roar, श्रुत्वा hearing, वानरर्षभा bulls among Vanaras, वीक्षमाणाः looking at, सर्वाः all, दिशः directions, भृशम् at speed, दुद्रुवुः fled
data.md: Hearing that dreadful uproar resembling the sound of Indra's thunder-bolt, the monkeys, casting their looks on all sides fled away.

data.v: तानुवाच ततः सर्वान्हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । विषण्णवदनान्दीनांस्त्रस्तान्विद्रवतः पृथक् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Maruti's son, Hanuman said to all Vanaras who were looking sad, piteous, feeling singly out of fear, and running away.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, मारुतात्मजः Maruti's son, हनुमान् Hanuman, विषण्णवदनान् sad face, दीनान् piteous, त्रस्तान् in fear, पृथक् separately, विद्रवतः running away, तान् them, सर्वान् to all, उवाच said
data.md: Thereupon Hanumān, the son of Maruta, spoke to them, poorly, terrified and of a sorrowful countenance, saying.

data.v: कस्माद्विषण्णवदना विद्रवध्वं प्लवंगमाः । त्यक्तयुद्धसमुत्साहाः शूरत्वं क्व नु वो गतम् ।।
data.es: "O monkeys! Why have you lost enthusiasm to fight, looking sad and running away? Where has your valour gone?"
data.anv: प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, त्यक्तयुद्धसमुत्साहाः lost enthusiasm to fight, विषण्णवदनाःlooking sad, कस्मात् why, विद्रवध्वे running away, वः or, शूरत्वम् valour, क्व where, गतम् has it gone
data.md: O monkeys, why do you look so melancholy and why are you flying away? Why have you renounced your earnest desire for fight? And where is your heroism gone?

data.v: पृष्ठतोऽनुव्रजध्वं मामग्रतो यान्तमाहवे । शूरैरभिजनोपेतैरयुक्तं हि निवर्तितुम् ।।
data.es: "Return and come in front, close to me and follow me. It is not proper for you to win wars and be praised."
data.anv: आहवे return, अग्रतःcome in front, यान्तम् close to, माम् me, पृष्ठतः, अनुव्रजध्वम् who won wars, अभिजनोपेतैः who were praised, शूरैः heroes, निवर्तितुम् returning, अयुक्तंहि not proper
data.md: Do you remain behind me, I shall go first in the battle. It is improper for heroes of noble descent to escape from battle field.

data.v: एवमुक्ताः सुसंक्रुद्धा वायुपुत्रेण धीमता । शैलशृङ्गान्द्रुमांश्चैव जगृहुर्हृष्टमानसाः ।।
data.es: Wise son of wind god having spoken in that way, delighted in mind the Vanaras seized peaks of mountains and also trees in great fury.
data.anv: धीमता wise, वायुपुत्रेण by Son of windgod, एवम् in that way, उक्ताः having spoken, हृष्टमानसाः delighted in mind, सुसङ्क्रुद्धाः great fury, शैलशृङ्गान् peak of mountain, द्रुमान् चैव and also trees, जगृहुः seized
data.md: Being thus addressed by that highly intelligent son of the Wind-god, they were greatly excited with wrath and being pleased took up trees and। crags in their hands.

data.v: अभिपेतुश्च गर्जन्तो राक्षसान्वानरर्षभाः । परिवार्य हनूमन्तमन्वयुश्च महाहवे ।।
data.es: Surrounding Hanuman, the Vanara leaders followed him for a great fight.
data.anv: वानरर्षभाः bull among Vanaras, गर्जन्तः roaring, राक्षसान् Rakshasas, अभिपेतुः surrounding, महाहवे in great fight, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, परिवार्य Vanara leaders, अन्वयुःfollowed
data.md: Roaring thus the leading monkeys advanced towards the Rākşasas and stood encircling Hanumān in the battle-field.

data.v: स तैर्वानरमुख्यैस्तु हनूमान्सर्वतो वृतः । हुताशन इवार्चिष्मानदहच्छत्रुवाहिनीम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman went surrounded by Vanara leaders who resembled flaming fire and began to consume the enemy troops like flaming fire.
data.anv: सः he, हनुमान् Hanuman, तैः those, वानरमुख्यैः Vanara leaders, सर्वतंवृतः surrounded all over, अर्चिष्मान्, हुताशनःइव like flaming fire, शत्रुवाहिनीम् enemy troops, अदहत् consumed
data.md: Being surrounded on all sides by leading monkeys, Hanuman began to burn down enemy's host like to fire spreading its flames.

data.v: स राक्षसानां कदनं चकार सुमहाकपिः । वृतो वानरसैन्येन कालान्तकयमोपमः ।।
data.es: The Vanara army surrounded that great monkey, Hanuman, who was like Yama, the god of death and caused havoc to Rakshasas.
data.anv: वानरसैन्येन Vanara army, वृतः surrounded, सःमहाकपिः that great monkey, कालान्तकयमोपमः like Yama the spirit of death, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, कदनम् havoc, चक्रे caused
data.md: Being encircled by monkey-hosts that mighty monkey resembling death himself began to grind the Rākşasas.

data.v: स तु शोकेन चाविष्टः क्रोधेन च महाकपिः । हनूमान्रावणि रथे महतीं पातयच्छिलाम् ।।
data.es: Hanuman, overtaken by anger, filled with great sorrow hurled a huge rock at the chariot of Ravana's son.
data.anv: महता great, शोकेन sorrow, कोपेन च angry, अविष्टः overtaken, महाकपिः greatVanara, सःहनुमान् that Hanuman, रावणिरथे on the chariot of the son of Ravana, महतीम् huge, शिलाम् rock, पातयत् hurled
data.md: Being overwhelmed with grief and wrought up with ire, that monkey Hanumān, threw a huge crag on the car of that son of Rāvana.

data.v: तामापतन्तीं दृष्ट्वैव रथः सारथिना तदा । विधेयाश्व समायुक्तः सुदूरमपवाहितः ।।
data.es: Then seeing that rock coming towards the chariot yoked to obedient horses, the chariot rider drove it to a long distance.
data.anv: तदा then, अपततनीम् fallen, ताम् that, दृष्टवैव seeing, विधेयाश्वसमायुक्तः yoked to obedient horses, रथःchariot, सारथिना chariot rider, विदूरम् long distance, अपवाहितः drove
data.md: Beholding that crag about to fall down on the car, the charioteer moved his horses and it was speedily brought at some distance.

data.v: तमिन्द्रजितमप्राप्य रथथं सहसारथिम् । विवेश धरणीं भित्त्वा सा शिलाव्यर्थमुद्यता ।।
data.es: That rock hurled by Hanuman failed to reach the chariot in which Indrajith was seated and also the charioteer. It cleaved the earth and entered.
data.anv: व्यर्थम् failed, उद्यत raised up, साशिला that rock, रथस्थम् to the chariot, सहसारथिम् along with charioteer, तम् him, इन्द्रजितम् Indrajith, अप्राप्य having not reached, धरणीम् on the earth, भित्त्वा cleaving, विवेश entered
data.md: And not reaching Indrajit stationed on the car and the charioteer, that crag, uselessly hurled, fell down on the earth.

data.v: पतितायां शिलायां तु रक्षसां व्यथिता चमूः । तमभ्यधावञ्शतशो नदन्तः काननौकसः ।।
ते द्रुमांश्च महाकाया गिरिशृङ्गाणि चोद्यताः । चिक्षिपुर्द्विषतां मध्ये वानरा भीमविक्रमाः ।।
वानरैर्तैर्महावीर्यैर्घोररूपा निशाचराः । वीर्यादभिहता वृक्षैर्व्यवेष्टन्त रणक्षितौ ।।
data.es: Night rangers of dreadful appearance beaten up with trees by most fierce Vanaras, fell on the battlefield and struck one another.

data.es: Hanuman, who was endowed with great strength, killed Rakshasas capable of terrific tasks with trees having large trunks and branches and stones also.

data.md: The highly powerful monkeys destroyed his retinue, with crags, stones and trees having strong trunks. And Hanumān thus crushed many a Rākşasa of terrible deeds.

data.es: Hanuman made the enemy army retreat, and spoke to his own army," No use of defeating this army for us as our mission is not winning the army."
data.anv: सःहनूमान् that Hanuman, परानीकम् enemy army, निवार्य retreat, तान्वनौकसःhis own army, अब्रवीत् spoke, सन्निवर्तध्वम् no use defeating this army, इदम् thus, बलम् army, नः not, साध्यम् possible, न not
data.md: Obstructing the Rākṣasas (for some time) Hanumān spoke to monkeys, saying, “Stay, we should not fight now.

data.v: त्यक्त्वा प्राणान्विचेष्टन्तो राम प्रियचिकीर्षवः । यन्निमित्तं हि युध्यामो हता सा जनकात्मजा ।।
data.es: "To please Rama, we are giving up life. Let us make Rama know that the daughter of Janaka for whose sake we are fighting this war and giving up life has been killed."
data.anv: रामप्रियचिकीर्षवः What is pleasing to Rama, प्राणान् life, त्यक्त्वा giving up, विचेष्टन्तःmaking it knownयन्निमित्तम् for that sake, युध्यामः war, साजनकात्मजा that daughter of Janak, हता has been killed
data.md: That daughter of Janaka has been slain, for whom we have engaged in fight, renouncing all hope of life and desiring to accomplish Rāma's satisfaction.

data.v: इममर्थं हि विज्ञाप्य रामं सुग्रीवमेव च । तौ यत्प्रतिविधास्येते तत्करिष्यामहे वयम् ।।
data.es: "On telling this fact (that Indrajith has killed Sita) to Rama and Sugriva and knowing their reply we will do what is to be done."
data.anv: इमम् this, अर्थम् fact, रामम् to Rama, सुग्रीवमेव च and Sugriva, विज्ञाप्य telling, तौ both, यत् that which, प्रतिविधास्येते knowing their reply, तत् that, वयम् we, करिष्यामहेwill do
data.md: Let us now go and inform Rāma and Sugrīva of it. And we shall do as we shall be commanded by them.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा वानरश्रेष्ठो वारयन्सर्ववानरान् । शनैः शनैरसंत्रस्तः सबलः स न्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: The foremost of the Vanaras, kept back all the Vanaras after speaking that way to the army and slowly and slowly retreated.
data.anv: वानरश्रेष्ठः foremost of Vanaras, सर्ववानारन् all Vanaras, वारयन् keeping back, इति thus, उक्त्वा spoken, असंत्रस्तःfearless one, सबलः his army, शनैःशनैःslowly slowly, संन्यवर्तत retreated
data.md: Saying this and desisting all the monkeys from encounter that foremost of monkeys proceeded undaunted and heroically.

data.v: स तु प्रेक्ष्य हनूमन्तं व्रजन्तं यत्र राघवः । निकुम्भिलामधिष्ठाय पावकं जुहुवे न्द्रजित् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, observing Hanuman going to Raghava, the evil minded Indrajith went to Nikumbhilam desiring to offer oblations at the sanctuary.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, दुष्टात्मा evil minded, सःhe, राघवः Raghava, यत्र there, व्रजन्तम् sanctuary,, हनूमन्तं Hanuman, प्रेक्ष्य observing, होतुकामःdesiring to, निकुम्भिलाम् Nikumbhila, गतःwent
data.md: Beholding Hanumăn proceed thus where Rāghava was that wicked-minded one (Indrajit) with a view to offer oblations to fire entered the sacrificial altar Nikumbhila.

data.v: यज्ञभूम्यां तु विधिवत्पावकस्तेन रक्षसा । हूयमानः प्रजज्वाल होमशोणितभुक्तदा ।।
data.es: Indrajith reaching Nikumbhilam, the sacrificial ground, poured oblation of blood into the sacrificial fire for Devatas and the fire blazed.

data.v: सोऽर्चिः पिनद्धो ददृशे होमशोणिततर्पितः । संध्यागत इवादित्यः स तीव्राग्निः समुत्थितः ।।
data.es: The flame had swollen up with the offering of blood as oblation and risen. It was very bright and wrapped in the flames the fire resembled the sun.
data.anv: अर्चिः flameपिनद्धः wrapped, होमशोणिततर्पितः swollen with the offering of blood into the sacrificial fire, समुत्थितः risen, सुतीव्रः very bright, अग्नि: fire, सन्ध्यागतःcovered by flames, आदित्यःइव like sun, ददृशे resembled
data.md: Reaching there Indrajit lighted up fire and began to pour oblations therein. And the fire blazed up receiving oblations of blood, and being satisfied assumed the appearance of the setting sun.

data.v: अथेन्द्रजिद्राक्षसभूतये तु; जुहाव हव्यं विधिना विधानवत् । दृष्ट्वा व्यतिष्ठन्त च राक्षसास्ते; महासमूहेषु नयानयज्ञाः ।।
data.md: Indrajit conversant with all ceremonials, offered oblations in due form for the welfare of the Rākşasas. And they all stood there watching the result and desirous of ascertaining the success of the battle.* *This Sloka has been left off in some editions.

data.v: राघवश्चापि विपुलं तं राक्षसवनौकसाम् । श्रुत्वा संग्रामनिर्घोषं जाम्बवन्तमुवाच ह ।।
data.es: Hearing the great noise of war between Rakshasas and Vanaras, Rama said to Jambavantha.
data.anv: राघवश्चापि Raghava too, राक्षसवनौकसाम् Rakshasas and Vanaras, तम् them, विपुलम् विपुलम great, सङ्ग्रामनिर्घोषम् noise of the war, श्रुत्वा hearing, जाम्बवन्तम् to Jambavantha, उवाच ह said
data.md: Hearing the terrible war-cry of the Rākşasas and monkeys Rāghava spoke to Jämbavän, saying.

data.v: सौम्य नूनं हनुमता कृतं कर्म सुदुष्करम् । श्रूयते हि यथा भीमः सुमहानायुधस्वनः ।।
data.es: "O gentle Jambavan! The terrifying sound of weapons is heard. Surely Hanuman has done a difficult task."
data.anv: सौम्य gentle, सुमहान् very great, भीमः terrific, आयुधस्वनः sound of weapons, यथा like that, श्रूयते was heard, हनुमता Hanuman, सुदुष्करम् very difficult कर्म action, कृतम् done, नूनम् surely
data.md: O gentle one, forsooth has Hanumān performed some mighty act for I hear the dreadful sound of the weapons.

data.v: तद्गच्छ कुरु साहाय्यं स्वबलेनाभिसंवृतः । क्षिप्रमृष्कपते तस्य कपिश्रेष्ठस्य युध्यतः ।।
data.es: "O King of Bears! Accompanied by your army, go to the battlefield and help the best of monkeys."
data.anv: ऋक्षपतेःking of Bears, तत् therefore, स्वबलेन by your army, अभिसम्वृतः collected together, गच्छ go, युध्यतः to the battlefield, तस्य his, कपिश्रेष्ठस्य best of monkeys, क्षिप्रम् soon, साहाय्यम् to help
data.md: Do you therefore proceed speedily, O lord of bears, with all your soldiers to assist that foremost of monkeys.

data.v: ऋक्षराजस्तथेत्युक्त्वा स्वेनानीकेन संवृतः । आगच्छत्पश्चिमद्वारं हनूमान्यत्र वानरः ।।
data.es: Rama having spoken thus, King of Bears surrounded by Vanaras went to Hanuman at the western gate.
data.anv: ऋक्षराजःking of Bears, तथेति in that way, उक्त्वा spoken, स्वेन sound, अनीकेन marched, सम्वृतः sourrounded, वानरः Vanaras, हनूमान् Hanuman, यत्र there, पश्चिमद्वारम् westerngate, आगच्छत् went
data.md: Thereupon, saying, 'So be it,' that king of bears, surrounded by his forces, approached the Western gate, where the monkey, Hanumān, was stationed.

data.v: अथायान्तं हनूमन्तं ददर्शर्क्षपतिः पथि । वानरैः कृतसंग्रामैः श्वसद्भिरभिसंवृतम् ।।
data.es: Then the Lord of Bears saw Hanuman accompanied by Vanaras who fought in war coming sighing.
data.anv: अथ and then, ऋक्षपतिः Lord of Bears, कृतसङ्ग्रामैः who fought in war, श्वसद्भिः sighing, वानरैःVanara, अभिसम्वृतम् accompanied by, आयान्तम् coming, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, ददर्श saw
data.md: Then the lord of bears saw Hanumān approach, surrounded by monkeys sighing hard, who had faught the fight.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा पथि हनूमांश्च तदृष्कबलमुद्यतम् । नीलमेघनिभं भीमं संनिवार्य न्यवर्तत ।।
data.es: Hanuman seeing the terrific army of Bears marching like a dark cloud asked them to return and he also returned with them.
data.anv: हनूमान् च Hanuman also, उद्यतम् ready to fight, नीलमेघनिभम् like dark cloud, भीमम् terrific, तत् that, ऋक्षबलम् army of Bears, पथि Lord, दृष्टवा seeing, सन्निवार्य to return, न्यवर्तत he returned
data.md: Seeing on the way that host of bears dreadful and resembling dark clouds, on the march, Hanumān made them desist.

data.v: स तेन हरिसैन्येन संनिकर्षं महायशाः । शीघ्रमागम्य रामाय दुःखितो वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Hanuman of great fame accompanied by army quickly came to Rama and submitted as follows.
data.anv: महायशाः of great fame, सःhe, तेन by that, सैन्येनसह accompanied by army, शीघ्रम् quickly, सन्निकर्षम् submitted, आगम्य came, दुःखितः sorrowfully, रामाय to Rama, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत्spoken
data.md: That illustrious one along with that force, speedily presented himself (before Rāma), and with a heavy heart addressed him, saying.

data.v: समरे युध्यमानानामस्माकं प्रेक्षतां च सः । जघान रुदतीं सीतामिन्द्रजिद्रावणात्मजः ।।
data.es: "Ravana's son, Indrajith struck Sita, who was crying in front of us looking at us while we were fighting in war."
data.anv: रावणात्मजः Ravana's son, इन्द्रजित् Indrajith, समरे in war, युध्यमानानम् while we were fighting the war, प्रेक्षताम् looking, अस्माकम् in front of us, पुरःearlier, रुदतीम् crying, सीताम् Sita, जघान struck
data.md: As we were fighting the field, Ravana's son, Indrajit in our very sight slew Sītā, crying (in distress).

data.v: उद्भ्रान्तचित्तस्तां दृष्ट्वा विषण्णोऽहमरिंदम । तदहं भवतो वृत्तं विज्ञापयितुमागतः ।।
data.es: "O Tamer of enemies! Seeing her (Sita) bewildered in mind, worried, I have come to inform you accompanied by Vanaras."
data.anv: अरिन्दम tamer of enemies, ताम् her, दृष्टवा seeing, अहम् I, उद्भ्रान्तचित्तः bewildered in mind, विषण्णः worried, तत् that, वृत्तम् surrounded, भवतः you, विज्ञापयितुम् to inform you, अहम् I, आगतः have come
data.md: O subduer of enemies, seeing her (in this plight) I, with my senses bewildered, have been overwhelmed with grief. Therefore I have come to you to inform you of what has befallen.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राघवः शोकमूर्छितः । निपपात तदा भूमौ छिन्नमूल इव द्रुमः ।।
data.es: On hearing, Hanuman's words Raghava became deluded in sorrow and fell on the ground like a tree cut at the root.
data.anv: तदा then, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, राघवःRaghava, शोकमूर्छितः deluded in sorrow, छिन्नमूलः roots cut, द्रुमःइव like a tree, भूमौ on the ground, निपपात fell
data.md: Hearing these words of his, Raghava, overwhelmed with grief, dropped down to the earth, like a tree whose roots have been severed.

data.v: तं भूमौ देवसंकाशं पतितं दृश्य राघवम् । अभिपेतुः समुत्पत्य सर्वतः कपिसत्तमाः ।।
data.es: Seeing Raghava who is equal to god fallen on the ground, and the best of monkeys lifting him, the Vanaras from all over came jumping.
data.anv: भूमौ on the ground, पतितम् fallen, देवसङ्काशम् like god, तंराघवम् Raghava, दृश्य seeing, कपिसत्तमाः best of monkeys, समुत्पत्य lifting him, सर्वतः from all over, अभिपेतुः came jumping
data.md: Seeing the god-like Råghava down on the earth, the foremost monkeys from all sides rushed forward and came to where (he was).

data.v: असिञ्चन्सलिलैश्चैनं पद्मोत्पलसुगन्धिभिः । प्रदहन्तमसह्यं च सहसाग्निमिवोत्थितम् ।।
data.es: Reaching Rama, who was like a burning fire that has risen up and suddenly fallen, the Vanaras sprinkled water with fragrance of lotuses and lilies on Rama just as sprinkling water on an inextinguishable fire that has flared up suddenly.
data.anv: सहसा suddenly, उद्यतम् risen up, प्रदहन्तम् burning, अग्निमिव fire like, अनासाद्यम् reaching there, एनम् that way, पद्मोत्पलसुगन्धिभिः with lotuses and lilies fragrance, सलिलैः water, असिञ्चन् sprinkled
data.md: With water scented with lotuses, they fell to sprinkling that one resembling a furious fire that has suddenly arisen. 1. Padmotpalasugadhibhiḥ-water scented with padmas-lotuses proper, and utpalas-blue lotuses (Nymphea cerulea). 2. 'Rama,' remarks the commentator, 'was a fire lighted by his grief for Sītā.'

data.v: तं लक्ष्मणोऽथ बाहुभ्यां परिष्वज्य सुदुःखितः । उवाच राममस्वस्थं वाक्यं हेत्वर्थसंहितम् ।।
data.es: Then, Lakshmana who was very worried held the arms of Rama who was unwell and spoke these meaningful words.
data.anv: अथ and then, सुदुःखितः very worried, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अस्वस्थम् not well, तंरामम् him, Rama, बाहुभ्याम् arms, परिष्वज्य holding, हेत्वर्थसंयुतम् meaningful, वाक्यम् words, उवाचspoken
data.md: Thereat Laksmana, over-come with sorrow, embracing Rāma, spoke to his words fraught with reason and import, “Profitless* virtue is incapable, O noble one, of delivering from calamities you, who have subdued your senses, and who ever abidst in the good path. * 'Profitless, although apparently an epither of virtue, is really the predicate of the sentence. 'Virtue, incapable of delivering you is profitless.

data.v: शुभे वर्त्मनि तिष्ठन्तं त्वामार्यविजितेन्द्रियम् । अनर्थेभ्यो न शक्नोति त्रातुं धर्मो निरर्थकः ।।
data.es: "O Noble Rama! If You, who have gained over senses and sticking to a virtuous path are not protected, from this calamity by righteousness, then righteousness is useless."
data.anv: आर्य noble, शुभे virtuous, वर्त्मनि path, तिष्ठन्तम् sticking to, विजितेन्द्रियम् won the senses, त्वाम् you, धर्मःrighteous, अनर्थेभ्यः not able to protect, त्रातुम् danger, न शक्नोति not possible, निरर्थकःis useless
data.md: Thereat Laksmana, over-come with sorrow, embracing Rāma, spoke to his words fraught with reason and import, “Profitless* virtue is incapable, O noble one, of delivering from calamities you, who have subdued your senses, and who ever abidst in the good path. * 'Profitless, although apparently an epither of virtue, is really the predicate of the sentence. 'Virtue, incapable of delivering you is profitless.

data.v: भूतानां स्थावराणां च जङ्गमानां च दर्शनम् । यथास्ति न तथा धर्मस्तेन नास्तीति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: " As animate and inanimate beings are seen experiencing joy at present, righteousness is not the cause of joy, I think so."
data.anv: स्थावराणाम् inanimate, जङ्गमानां च animate, भूतानाम् created beings, दर्शनम् seen (experiencing joy), यथा in the same way, अस्ति at present, तथा like that, न not, तेन by that, धर्मःrighteousness, नास्तीतिit is not, मे I, मतिःthink
data.md: Beings and the mobile as well as the immobile cannot have that direct perception of virtue which they have of happiness. Therefore, I ween, virtue is a non-entity.

data.v: यथैव स्थावरं व्यक्तं जङ्गमं च तथाविधम् । नायमर्थस्तथा युक्तस्त्वद्विधो न विपद्यते ।।
data.es: "Just as inanimate beings which are seen happy and animate are also seen in the same manner, in which case that righteousness alone prospers is not there (for a person like you would not suffer). Knowing this you should not suffer."
data.anv: स्थावरम् inanimate, यथैव in the same way, व्यक्तम् spoken, जङ्गमं च animate also, तथाशिधम् being so, तथा like that, अयम् this, अर्थः meaning, न युक्तः not proper, त्वद्विधः knowing that, न विपद्यते not there
data.md: Inasmuch as the immobile (albeit devoid of any regard for virtue) are nevertheless happy and as the mobile also are so, this virtue cannot lead to happiness. (If it were so), one like you would have not been placed in peril.

data.v: यद्यधर्मो भवेद्भूतो रावणो नरकं व्रजेत् । भवांश्च धर्मसंयुक्तो नैवं व्यसनमाप्नुयात् ।।
data.es: "If there is unrighteousness, Ravana should be in hell. You who are endowed with righteousness should not have agony."
data.anv: अधर्मः unrighteousness, भूतः beings, भवेद्यदि if it is there, रावणः Ravana, नरकम् hell, व्रजेत् will be, धर्मसम्युक्तः endowed with righteousness, भवान् च you also, एवम् in that way, व्यसनम् agony, नाप्नुयात् not have
data.md: If unrighteousness would bring unhappiness on creatures, Ravana should hence to hell, and you possessed of virtue, should not come by misfortune.

data.v: तस्य च व्यसनाभावाद्व्यसनं च गते त्वयि । धर्मेणोपलभेद्धर्ममधर्मं चाप्यधर्मतः ।।
data.es: " As Ravana has no sorrow and you have experienced agony the contraries of each other have changed the roles of righteousness and unrighteousness."
data.anv: तस्य his, व्यसनाभावात् sorrowful feeling, त्वयि you, व्यसनम् agony, आगते experienced, धर्मेण by righteousness, अधर्मम् unrighteousness, अधर्मेण by unrighteousness, धर्मताम् righteousness, उपलभे will be acquired
data.md: Seeing that he is free from danger, and you are in itrighteousness and its opposite are found to have tendencles the very reverse of those assigned to them respectively (by the Vedas).

data.v: यदि धर्मेण युज्येरन्नाधर्मरुचयो जनाः । धर्मेण चरतां धर्मस्तथा चैषां फलं भवेत् ।।
यस्मादर्था विवर्धन्ते येष्वधर्मः प्रतिष्ठितः । क्लिश्यन्ते धर्मशीलाश्च तस्मादेतौ निरर्थकौ ।।
data.es: "Since those rooted in unrighteous develop and are wealthy, and those who follow dharma suffer both these are meaningless."
data.anv: येषु since, अधर्मः in the unrighteous, प्रतिष्ठितः is rooted, यस्मात् therefore, अर्थाःwealth, विवर्थन्ते develop, धर्मशीलाः च who follow dharma, क्लिश्यन्ते च suffer, तस्मात् therefore, एतौ both these, निरर्थकौ are meaningless
data.md: But as prosperity attend those that are established in unrighteousness, and as those regardful of righteousness fare lamentably, these*have not the senses assigned to them (by the scriptures). *Virtue and vice.

data.v: वध्यन्ते पापकर्माणो यद्यधर्मेण राघव । वधकर्महतो धर्मः स हतः कं वधिष्यति ।।
data.es: "Righteousness and unrighteousness are forms of actions, sinful or not sinful. If sinful action is unrighteous, those who have done sinful actions should suffer. Since sinful action is momentary, and as soon as the action is over unrighteousness is also gone. That being so how can unrighteousness cause pain to anyone?"
data.anv: राघव Raghava, पापकर्माणः sinful actions, अधर्मेण through unrighteous means, वध्यन्तेयदि if kills, वधकर्महतः by this action of killing, सःअधर्मः that adharma, हतः of killing, कम् whom, वधिष्यतिwill be destroy
data.md: If, O Rāghava, Rāghava, (it is contended that) unrighteousness cut off the wicked, then whom shall Unrighteousness, himself slain by the act of slaughter of the destroyer, slay in his turn?

data.v: अथ वा विहितेनायं हन्यते हन्ति वा परम् । विधिरालिप्यते तेन न स पापेन कर्मणा ।।
data.es: "Or else if a man is destroyed by killing another, destiny which is engendered by the sinful action suffers and not the doer of sinful action."
data.anv: अथवा or else, विहितेन destroyed, अयम् this, हन्यते by killing, अपरम् another, हन्तिवा or kills another, तेन by that, पापेनकर्मणा sinful action, सःविधिः destiny, लिप्यते is deprived, सः he, the agent, न not
data.md: Or if it is said that one is slain or slay another by ordinance, then it is destiny, which is touched by the sinful act and not he.

data.v: अदृष्टप्रतिकारेण अव्यक्तेनासता सता । कथं शक्यं परं प्राप्तुं धर्मेणारिविकर्शन ।।
data.es: "O Crusher of enemies! How does righteousness get encountered? It is not seen. How to know whether it is real or unreal? Is it possible to know that the best result is attained by righteousness."
data.anv: अरिविकर्षण crusher of enemies, अदृष्टप्रतिकारेणreward is not seen, त्वव्यक्तेन how to know, असतासता unreal or real, धर्मेण by righteousness, परम् best, प्राप्तुम् attained, कथम् how, शक्यम् is it possible
data.md: O chastiser of foes, incapable of meting out retribution,* unmanifest itself, and non-existent, how can virtue, even if we grant its existence, find out the person that should be slain? *"In consequence,' remarks Ramanuja, 'of their being devoid of consciousness.

data.v: यदि सत्स्यात्सतां मुख्य नासत्स्यात्तव किंचन । त्वया यदीदृशं प्राप्तं तस्मात्सन्नोपपद्यते ।।
data.es: "O foremost among the victorious! To you, who are a jewel no evil should accrue. Since such difficulty has been faced by you, the fact that good actions result in good destiny is not true."
data.anv: सताम् best among victorious, मुख्य jewel, सत् good, स्यात् यदि as such, तव your, किञ्चन even little, असत् evil, न स्यात् not accrue, त्वया by you, यत् such, ईदृशम् this difficulty, प्राप्तम् attained, तस्मात् therefore, सत् real, न उपपद्यते should not have happened
data.md: If, O foremost of the good, it had existed, you wouldst not have come by any misfortune. But inasmuch as you have fallen into this plight, there is no such thing as virtue.

data.v: अथ वा दुर्बलः क्लीबो बलं धर्मोऽनुवर्तते । दुर्बलो हृतमर्यादो न सेव्य इति मे मतिः ।।
data.es: "Or else dharma becomes feeble, ineffective, submits to might, then it is better not to follow such dharma which is feeble, I think."
data.anv: अथवा or else, धर्मःdharma, दुर्बलःfeeble, क्लीबःineffective, बलम् might, अनुवर्तते follows, दुर्बलःfeebleness, हृतमर्यादःnot to follow such dharma, न सेव्यःइति not serve like this, मे I, मतिः think
data.md: Or itself feeble and impotent, it take refuge in manliness. And being powerless and bereft of dignity, it should, I deem, by no means be followed.

data.v: बलस्य यदि चेद्धर्मो गुणभूतः पराक्रमे । धर्ममुत्सृज्य वर्तस्व यथा धर्मे तथा बले ।।
data.es: "Giving up predominance of virtue, seek courage and submit to might for succeeding in action. Seek might just as you have sought dharma earlier for success."
data.anv: पराक्रमेcourageous, धर्मःdharma, बलस्यseek strength, गुणभूतःयदिचेत् predominance of virtue, धर्मम् dharma, उत्सृज्य giving up, धर्मे dharma, यथा like that, तथा it is, बले might, वर्तस्व seek
data.md: If virtue is a property of manliness, then carefully forsaking virtue, do you follow strength as you have hitherto followed virtue.

data.v: अथ चेत्सत्यवचनं धर्मः किल परंतप । अनृतस्त्वय्यकरुणः किं न बद्धस्त्वया पिता ।।
data.es: "O scorcher of enemies! If you consider speaking the truth is dharma, why did you not bind your father (who promised to give the kingdom) and was not compassionate (spoke untruth later)."
data.anv: परन्तप scorcher of enemies, अथ now, सत्यवचनम् truthful words, धर्मःकिलचेत् if you consider as dharma, अनृतःuntruth, त्वयि you, अकरुणः not compassionate, पिता father, त्वया you, किम् why, न बद्धःdid not bind
data.md: But, O subduer of enemies, if truthfulness be virtue, are you not bound by that departing from which the king lost his life?* *Explains the commentator, 'King Dasaratha lost his life, because he did not observe his word of installing you in the kingdom. Are you not bound by his word as well?'

data.v: यदि धर्मो भवेद्भूत अधर्मो वा परंतप । न स्म हत्वा मुनिं वज्री कुर्यादिज्यां शतक्रतुः ।।
data.es: "Indra killed an ascetic (Viswarupa) and did fire sacrifice. If dharma alone is his duty, he could have done hundreds of fire sacrifices and not have killed the ascetic. If adharma is duty he would have killed the ascetic and not done fire sacrifice."
data.anv: परन्तप scorcher of enemies!, धर्मोवा if dharma alone, अधर्मोवा or adharma, भूतःpresent, भवेद्यदि and in future, वज्रीIndra, शतक्रतुः a hundred sacrifices, मुनिम् sage, हत्वा killing, इज्याम् sacrifice, न स्मकुर्यात् not performed
data.md: O chastiser of foes, if virtue must be practised above all, or if prowess must have precedence, then the thunder-handed Satakratu would not have celebrated his sacrifice, slaying the ascetic.* *The Logic is all in a jumble; but such is the text. The ascetic was Visvarūpa. The meaning, according to the commentator, is that, prowess is first and virtue next. Indra first used force, and then acquired merit.)

data.v: अधर्मसंश्रितो धर्मो विनाशयति राघव । सर्वमेतद्यथाकामं काकुत्स्थ कुरुते नरः ।।
data.es: "Kakuthsa Rama! Kings followed dharma and adharma both according to context. Whether following dharma or adharma destruction is happening. Therefore, humans keep doing both as per their desire."
data.anv: काकुत्स्थKakuthsa, राघव Raghava, अधर्मसंश्रितःfollowing adharma, धर्मःdharma, विनाशयति destruction is happening, नरः humans, एतत् in this manner, सर्वम् all, यथाकामम् as per his desire, कुरुते does
data.md: O Rāghava, virtue aided by prowess, destroy enemies. Therefore, O Kakutstha, people, for compassing their ends, resort to both virtue and prowess.

data.v: मम चेदं मतं तात धर्मोऽयमिति राघव । धर्ममूलं त्वया छिन्नं राज्यमुत्सृजता तदा ।।
data.es: "Dear Raghava! In my opinion also depending on desire and context, following dharma or adharma is proper. You have severed the roots of dharma by giving up the kingdom."
data.anv: तात dear, राघव Raghava, अयम् this, धर्मःइति dharma like this, मम च me too, इदम् thus, मतम् opinion, तदा then, राज्यम् kingdom, उत्सृजता giving up, त्वया by you, धर्ममूलम् dharma as root, छिन्नम् wonderful
data.md: This, sire, is my opinion, this, O Raghava, is virtue. But you, having then renounced the kingdom, have laid the axe at the root* of righteousness. **Root, remarks, Rāmānuja, 'which is interest!'

data.v: अर्थेभ्यो हि विवृद्धेभ्यः संवृद्धेभ्यस्ततस्ततः । क्रियाः सर्वाः प्रवर्तन्ते पर्वतेभ्य इवापगाः ।।
data.es: "Prosperity is augmented gradually and developed by all means just as rivers flow from mountains, all undertakings follow conducive to success."
data.anv: ततस्ततः, by all those means, सम्वृत्तेभ्यःaugmented, प्रवृद्धेभ्यः developed, अर्थेभ्यःprosperity, पर्वतेभ्यः mountains, अपगाःइव rivers flow, सर्वा all, क्रियाः actions, प्रवर्तन्तेहि follow
data.md: Like streams issuing out mountains, all acts spring from wealth flowing from various regions and attaining magnitude.

data.v: अर्थेन हि वियुक्तस्य पुरुषस्याल्पतेजसः । व्युच्छिद्यन्ते क्रियाः सर्वा ग्रीष्मे कुसरितो यथा ।।
data.es: "Just like streams dry up in summer, if one who is of meagre intelligence and forsakes wealth, all his actions will be interrupted."
data.anv: अर्थेन by wealth, विमुक्तस्य forsaken, अल्पचेतसःmeagre intelligence, पुरुषस्य of men, सर्वाःक्रियाःall actions, ग्रीष्मेsummer, कुसरितोयथा dries up like that, विच्छिद्यन्तेinterrupted
data.md: Like a shrunken stream in summer, all the acts of that foolish person who has been devorced by wealth, are annihilated.

data.v: सोऽयमर्थं परित्यज्य सुखकामः सुखैधितः । पापमारभते कर्तुं तथा दोषः प्रवर्तते ।।
data.es: "If one who has been happy seeks happiness on renouncing wealth then proceeds to perform sinful actions it is a mistake."
data.anv: सुखैदितः one who has been happy, सः he, अयम् this, अर्थम् wealth, परित्यज्य renouncing, सुखकामः seeking happiness, पापम् sinful, कर्तुम् will perform actions, आरभते starts, तदा then, दोषः mistake, प्रवर्ततेproceeds
data.md: He that renouncing riches, within his reach,* hankers after enjoyment, being carried away by his overmastering desire, take to getting at wealth by sinful acts; and then he incur guilt. *The commentator would have gotten riches.'

data.v: यस्यार्थास्तस्य मित्राणि यस्यार्थास्तस्य बान्धवः । यस्यार्थाः स पुमाँल्लोके यस्यार्थाः स च पण्डितः ।।
data.es: "Friends gather round him in whom riches abide. Relations stand by him who has wealth. He is considered manly in whom wealth abides, and he is learned who has wealth."
data.anv: यस्य his, अर्थाः wealth, तस्य his, मित्राणि friends, यस्य whom, अर्थाः wealth, तस्य whom, बान्धवाः relations, यस्य whose, अर्थाः wealth, सः he, लोके in this world, पुमान् manliness, यस्य his, अर्थाः wealth, सः he, पण्डितः च learned
data.md: To him that has wealth are friends, to him that has wealth are acquaintances, he that has wealth is an individuality in this world, and he that has wealth is a learned person.

data.v: यस्यार्थाः स च विक्रान्तो यस्यार्थाः स च बुद्धिमान् । यस्यार्थाः स महाभागो यस्यार्थाः स महागुणः ।।
data.es: He is gallant to whom wealth has flown, he is intelligent in whom wealth abides, he is glorious in whom wealth exists and he is superior in great virtues in whom wealth found receptacle.
data.anv: यस्य whoseअर्थाः wealth, सः च he also, विक्रान्तः gallant, यस्य his, अर्थाः wealth, सः च he is बुद्धिमान् intelligent, यस्य his, अर्थाः wealth, सः he, महाभागः glorious, यस्य his, अर्थाः wealth, ससः superior, महागुणः of great virtues
data.md: He that has wealth is powerful; he that has wealth is intelligent; he that has wealth is mighty-armed; and he that has wealth is full of all graces.

data.v: अर्थस्यैते परित्यागे दोषाः प्रव्याहृता मया । राज्यमुत्सृजता वीर येन बुद्धिस्त्वया कृता ।।
data.es: 'If you give up wealth the evils will follow you', said I. Now you left the kingdom. The basis on which you made such a resolve is not known to me.
data.anv: वीर heroic, राज्यम् kingdom, उत्सृजता giving up, त्वया by you, येन by that, बुद्धि intellect having done, कृता do, मया by me, अर्थस्य wealth, परित्यागे giving up, एते those, दोषाः evils, प्रव्याहृताःfollow
data.md: All these that I have en-numerated are the evils of forsaking fortune. (I cannot divine) what made you, renouncing the monarchy, to adopt such a course.

data.v: यस्यार्था धर्मकामार्थास्तस्य सर्वं प्रदक्षिणम् । अधनेनार्थकामेन नार्थः शक्यो विचिन्वता ।।
data.es: For one who has wealth all his actions of dharma would give pleasure and favourable. One who has no wealth and is worrying about it can't attain it.
data.anv: यस्य its, अर्थाः wealth, तस्य his, धर्मकामार्थाःdharma and pleasure,, wealth, सर्वम् all, प्रदक्षिणम् going round, अर्थकामेन desiring wealth, विचिन्वता worrying, अधनेन one who has no wealth, अर्थः wealth, न शक्यः not possible
data.md: He that has riches, has virtue and desire attending on him, and has everything auspicious. That one without wealth, that seek it, cannot secure the wealth of prowess, without riches and desire.

data.v: हर्षः कामश्च दर्पश्च धर्मः क्रोधः शमो दमः । अर्थादेतानि सर्वाणि प्रवर्तन्ते नराधिप ।।
data.es: "O Rama! Desire, delight, pride, virtue, anger, forgiveness, fortitude all these are effective through wealth."
data.anv: नराधिप Lord of humas, Rama, हर्षः delight, कामश्च desire, दर्पश्च pride, धर्मः virtue क्रोधः anger, शमः forgiveness, दमः fortitude, एतानि all these सर्वाणि everything, अर्थात् by wealth, प्रवर्तन्ते effective in action
data.md: O lord of men, cheerfulness, and desire, and pride, and piety, and anger, and self-restraint, and self-control, all these come from wealth.

data.v: येषां नश्यत्ययं लोकश्चरतां धर्मचारिणाम् । तेऽर्थास्त्वयि न दृश्यन्ते दुर्दिनेषु यथा ग्रहाः ।।
data.es: "Even if there is wealth if one renunciates wealth and follows dharma in this world they perish like planets on cloudy days."

data.md: As the planets are not discovered on a stormy day, that wealth, the want of which renders this world naught even to the ascetics practising righteousness, is not visible in you.

data.v: त्वयि प्रव्रजिते वीर गुरोश्च वचने स्थिते । रक्षसापहृता भार्या प्राणैः प्रियतरा तव ।।
data.es: "O heroic Rama! You have been faithful to the promise to your father and left home following dharma (giving up wealth), and your dear wife who is your life has been abducted by Rakshasa."

data.md: O hero, you having abode by the words of your superior and having come (to the forest), your wife dearer then life itself has been ravished by Rākṣasas.

data.md: Hearing his speech, Rāghava, overwhelmed with grief, could not perfectly comprehend what was said by the Rākşasa.

data.v: ततो धैर्यमवष्टभ्य रामः परपुरंजयः । विभीषणमुपासीनमुवाच कपिसंनिधौ ।।
data.es: Then Rama, who can win over enemies, picked up courage, said to Vibheeshana seated near him in front of Vanaras.
data.anv: ततः then, परपुरञ्जयः who can win over enemies, रामः Rama, धैर्यम् courage, अवष्टभ्य picked up, उपासीनम् seated near, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, कपिसन्निधौ in front of Vanaras, उवाच said
data.md: Then, summoning up patience, Rāma-captor of hostile capitals, spoke to Vibhisana, seated near the monkeys.

data.v: नैरृताधिपते वाक्यं यदुक्तं ते विभीषण । भूयस्तच्छ्रोतुमिच्छामि ब्रूहि यत्ते विवक्षितम् ।।
data.es: "O Lord of Rakshasas, Vibheeshana! I wish to hear the words spoken by you. You may repeat that which you wanted to convey. I wish to hear."
data.anv: नैरृताधिपते Rakshasa (progeny of Nirriti presiding the southwest), विभीषण Vibheeshana, ते you, यत् that which, वाक्यम् words, उक्तम् spoken, तत् that, भूयःspeak, श्रोतुम् wish to hear, इच्छामि wish, ते you, यत् that which, इवक्षितम् to be conveyed, तत् that, भूयः repeat again, श्रोतुम् wish to hear, इच्छामि desire
data.md: O lord of Naiſtas, I once more wish to hear what, O Vibhisana, you have said.

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः । यत्तत्पुनरिदं वाक्यं बभाषे स विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana, who was skilled in expression, spoke again as follows on hearing Raghava's words.
data.anv: सःविभीषणः Vibheeshana, वाक्यम् words, उदाहृतम् skilled in expression, राघवस्य Raghava's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, पुनः again, इदंवाक्यम् these words, यत्नात् to him, बभाषे spoke again
data.md: Hearing Raghava's words, Vibhisana, skilled in speech, again spoke these words, saying.

data.v: यथाज्ञप्तं महाबाहो त्वया गुल्मनिवेशनम् । तत्तथानुष्ठितं वीर त्वद्वाक्यसमनन्तरम् ।।
data.es: " After your command the army has been divided and placed at respective places as you said."
data.anv: महाबाहो mighty armed, वीर hero, त्वया by you, गुल्मनिवेशनम् from their respective places, यथा that which, आज्ञप्तम् command, तत् then, त्वदाक्यसमनन्तरम् according to your order, तथा like that, अनुष्ठितम् has been done
data.md: O mighty-armed one, I have stationed the forces, O hero, agreeably to your directions.

data.v: तान्यनीकानि सर्वाणि विभक्तानि समन्ततः । विन्यस्ता यूथपाश्चैव यथान्यायं विभागशः ।।
data.es: All the army forces have been collected, divided, and assigned to respective places separately.
data.anv: तानि all of them, अनीकानि army forces, सर्वाणि all, समन्ततःcollected, विभक्तानि divided, यूथपाश्चैव where ever, यथान्यायम् in the respective places, विभागशः separately, विन्यस्ताः assigned
data.md: The entire force has been divided around; and the leaders have also been placed properly.

data.v: भूयस्तु मम विजाप्यं तच्छृणुष्व महायशः । त्वय्यकारणसंतप्ते संतप्तहृदया वयम् ।।
data.es: "O great Lord! Hear me, which is yet to be submitted by me to you. You are afflicted without cause and pained at heart."
data.anv: महाप्रभो O great Lord, भूयः being, मम me, विज्ञाप्यम् which is to be submitted, तत् that, शृणुष्व hear, त्वयि to you, अकारणसन्तप्ते afflicted without any cause, वयम् you, सन्तप्तहृदयाः pained at heart
data.md: Further, O mighty master, listen to what I have to say. On your having been causelessly aggrieve, we all of us were seized with grief.

data.v: त्यज राजन्निमं शोकं मिथ्या संतापमागतम् । तदियं त्यज्यतां चिन्ता शत्रुहर्षविवर्धनी ।।
data.es: "O king! Give up this false agony which has set in. It enhances the joy of the enemy. Give up this anxiety."
data.anv: राजन् king, इमम् this, शोकम् agony, मिथ्या false, आगतम् has set in, सन्तापम् worry, त्यज give up, तत् then, शत्रुहर्षविवर्धिनी it enhances the joy of enemy, इयम् this, चिन्ता anxiety, त्यज्यताम् giveup
data.md: It this anxiety of your conduce to the joy of the enemy, do you cast it off. and, O hero, bestir yourself, and summon up spirits.

data.v: उद्यमः क्रियतां वीर हर्षः समुपसेव्यताम् । प्राप्तव्या यदि ते सीता हन्तव्यश्च निशाचराः ।।
data.es: "Let efforts be made to recover Sita. Let enthusiasm be restored to recover Sita. Rakshasas will be exterminated."
data.anv: वीर hero, ते to you, सीता Sita, प्राप्तव्या attain, निशाचराः Rakshasas, हन्तव्याश्च will be exterminated, उद्यमः effort, क्रियताम् resorted, हर्षः enthusiasm, समुपसेव्यताम् will recover
data.md: If you are to have Sītā, and if the nightrangers are to be slain by you, do you, Raghu's son, listen to my profitable speech.

data.v: रघुनन्दन वक्ष्यामि श्रूयतां मे हितं वचः । साध्वयं यातु सौमित्रिर्बलेन महता वृतः । निकुम्भिलायां संप्राप्य हन्तुं रावणिमाहवे ।।
data.es: "Delight of Raghus! You may listen to my words of advice. Let Saumithri march ahead to Nikumbhilam accompanied by the great army. On reaching, let Lakshmana who is capable of killing Indrajith discharge venomous serpents like deadly poisonous arrows from his bow in circular form and kill Rakshasas."
data.anv: रघुनन्दन delight of Raghus, मे my, हितम् advice, वचः words, श्रूयताम् you may listen, अयम् this, सौमित्रिः Saumithri, महता great, बलेन army, वृतः surrounded, निकुम्भिलायाम् Nikumbhilam, सम्प्राप्तम् reach, रावणिम् Indrajith, आहवे on reaching, धनुर्मण्डलनिर्मुक्तै: discharged from his bow in circular form, आशीविषविषोपमैः like deadly poison of venomous serpents, हन्तुम् kill, साधु excellent, यातु march ahead
data.md: Let Sumitra's son go forth, environed by a mighty force, for slaying in battle the son of Ravana, who has gone to Nikumbhila; with shafts resembling Venomous serpents, discharged from the round* of his bow. *The bow drawn to its full stretch, becomes circular.

data.v: धनुर्मण्डलनिर्मुक्तैराशीविषविषोपमैः । शरैर्हन्तुं महेष्वासो रावणिं समितिंजयः ।।
तेन वीरेण तपसा वरदानात्स्वयम्भुतः । अस्त्रं ब्रह्मशिरः प्राप्तं कामगाश्च तुरंगमाः ।।
data.es: "Lakshmana, being heroic received Brahmasira weapon from the creator by austerity and also horses which can course according to his will."
data.anv: वीरेण being hero, तेन by him, तपसा by austerity, स्वयम्भुवः creator, वरदानात् boon received, ब्रह्मशिरः Brahmasira weapon, अस्त्रम् arrow, प्राप्तम् attained, कामगाः coursing at his will, तुरङ्गमाः horses
data.md: By virtue of his austerities, that hero, from a boon conferred by the self-sprung, has obtained the Brahmasira weapon, together with steeds coursing at their will.

data.v: निकुम्भिलामसंप्राप्तमहुताग्निं च यो रिपुः । त्वामाततायिनं हन्यादिन्द्रशत्रो स ते वधः । इत्येवं विहितो राजन्वधस्तस्यैव धीमतः ।।
data.es: "O mighty armed Rama! that enemy of yours, while you have not reached Nikumbhilam and not propitiated fire sacrifice, can cause your death. Such a boon was granted to him, the enemy of Indra by the Lord of all worlds."
data.anv: महाबाहो mightyarmed, इन्द्रशत्रो enemy of Indra, यः he who, रिपुः enemy, निकुम्भिलाम् Nikumbhilam, असम्प्राप्तम् not reached, आहुताग्निं च propitiated your fire, आततायिनम् cause of your death, त्वाम् you, हन्यात् killed, सः he, ते to you, वधः kill, सर्वलोकेश्वरेण Lord of all worlds, धीमतः wise, तस्य his, इत्येवम् in this way, वरः boon, दत्तःgiven, एषः that way, वधः, विहितः ordained
data.md: When not reaching Nikumbhilā, and not having finished your offerings to fire, you, equipped with arms, are slain by a foe, O enemy of Indra, that is your death. Thus, O mightyarmed one, did the lord of all creatures confer a boon (on Indrajit), and, o king, thus was the death of this intelligent one ordained.

data.v: वधायेन्द्रजितो राम तं दिशस्व महाबलम् । हते तस्मिन्हतं विद्धि रावणं ससुहृज्जनम् ।।
data.es: Rama, you are endowed with extraordinary prowess! Order now for the destruction of Indrajith as with his death Ravana and all his kinsfolk are killed, you may know.
data.anv: महाबल endowed with extraordinary prowess, राम Rama, इन्द्रजितः Indrajith, वधाय by destruction, सन्दिशस्व order now, तस्मिन् with his, हते death, ससुहृज्जनम् all his kinsfolk, रावणं Ravana, हतम् are killed, विद्धि you may know
data.md: O Rāma, for compassing the destruction of Indrajit, do you commission a mighty force. On his being slain, know that Rāvana along with his retainers are slain.

data.v: विभीषणवचः श्रुत्व रामो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् । जानामि तस्य रौद्रस्य मायां सत्यपराक्रम ।।
data.es: Hearing Vibheeshana, Rama said" the conjuring skills of Indrajith of truthful valour is known to me."
data.anv: विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana, श्रुत्वा having heard, रामः Rama, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoken, सत्यपराक्रम of truthful valour, रौद्रस्य fierce, तस्य his, मायाम् conjuring skill, जानामि known to me
data.md: Hearing Vibhīşana's words, Rāma said, “O you having truth for prowess, I know the illusion of that fierce one.

data.v: स हि ब्रह्मास्त्रवित्प्राज्ञो महामायो महाबलः । करोत्यसंज्ञान्संग्रामे देवान्सवरुणानपि ।।
data.es: He is skilled in the use of Brahma's weapon, intelligent in conjuring, endowed with mighty prowess, and can make even varuna and Devatas unconscious.
data.anv: ब्रह्मास्त्रवित् skilled in the use of Brahma's weapon, प्राज्ञः wise, महामायः intelligent in conjuring, महाबलःendowed with mighty prowess, सःhe, सवरुणान् Varuna and others, देवानपि Devatas also, सङ्ग्रामे in war, असंज्ञान् unconscious, करोति does
data.md: Without doubt, the is skilled in the Brahma weapon, is potent in illusion and, is possessed of exceeding strength. In conflict, he deprive of consciousness even the celestials with Varuņa (at their head).

data.v: तस्यान्तरिक्षे चरतो रथस्थस्य महायशः । न गतिर्ज्ञायते वीरसूर्यस्येवाभ्रसंप्लवे ।।
data.es: When he moves in his chariot in the sky like the Sun coursing through clouds is difficult to know.

data.v: राघवस्तु रिपोर्ज्ञात्वा मायावीर्यं दुरात्मनः । लक्ष्मणं कीर्तिसंपन्नमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Knowing the wickedminded enemy of conjuring valour, Rama spoke as follows to Lakshmana, richly endowed with fame (of winning wars).
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, दुरात्मनः wicked minded, रिपोः enemy, मायावीर्यम् conjuring valour, ज्ञात्वा knowing, कीर्तिसम्पन्नम् richly endowed with fame, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, इदंवचनम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: As that illustrious (one) go about in the welkin on his chariot, none, can perceive his course, like the course of the sun when the sky is covered with clouds.” And Raghava, being well acquainted with the illusive energy of his wicked-minded foe, addressed the renowned Laksmana, saying.

data.v: यद्वानरेन्द्रस्य बलं तेन सर्वेण संवृतः । हनूमत्प्रमुखैश्चैव यूथपैः सहलक्ष्मण ।।
data.es: "O Lakshmana! Surrounded by the entire army of Vanara king, with Hanuman as commander in chief of the army, protected by Jambavan, king of Bears, put an end to the son of Ravana who is well versed in tricks."
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, वानरेन्द्रस्य Vanara king's, यत् that which, बलम् army, तेन by that, सर्वेण entire, सम्वृतः surrounded by, हनूमत्प्रमुखैः Hanuaman as chief, यूथपैश्चैवसह accompanied by commanders of the army, सहसैन्येन with army, ऋक्षपतिना Lord of Bears, जाम्बवेन with Jambavantha, सम्वृतःprotected, मायाबलविशारदम् well versed in tricks, तम् him, राक्षससुतम् son of Rakshasa, जहि put an end
data.md: Environed by the entire host of the lord of monkeys, accompanied by the leaders, O Laksmana, headed by Hanuman, with Jambavan, king of bears-and girt round by the forces, do you slay this son of the Raksasa, possessed of the strength of illusion.

data.es: "O Lakshmana! Surrounded by the entire army of Vanara king, with Hanuman as commander in chief of the army, protected by Jambavan, king of Bears, put an end to the son of Ravana who is well versed in tricks."

data.v: अयं त्वां सचिवैः सार्धं महात्मा रजनीचरः । अभिज्ञस्तस्य देशस्य पृष्ठतोऽनुगमिष्यति ।।
data.es: "This great soul, night ranger (Vibheeshana) who knows his conjuring tricks well, will follow behind you with ministers."
data.anv: तस्य his, मायानाम् by his conjuring, अभिज्ञः knows well, महात्मा great soul, अयंरजनीचरः this night ranger, सचिवैःसार्थम् with ministers, त्वाम् you, पृष्ठतः behind, अनुगमिष्यति will follow
data.md: And accompanied by his counsellors, this high-souled night-ranger shall follow at you back, in this engagement with that one skilled in illusion.

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणः सविभीषणः । जग्राह कार्मुकं श्रेष्ठमन्यद्भीमपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: "On hearing Raghava's words, Lakshmana of wonderful courage took up the best of bows accompanied by Vbheeshana."
data.anv: सविभीषणः Vibheeshana, अत्यद्भुतपराक्रमः of wonderful courage, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, राघवस्य Raghava's, वचःwords, श्रुत्वा hearing, कार्मुकश्रेष्ठम् best of bow, जग्राह took up
data.md: Then hearing Rāghava's words, Lakşmaņa endowed with dreadful prowess, with Vibhīşaņa, took up another excellent bow.

data.v: संनद्धः कवची खड्गी स शरी हेमचापधृक् । रामपादावुपस्पृश्य हृष्टः सौमित्रिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Saumithri fully equipped with shields, swords, shafts, and golden bow joyfully, touched Rama's feet with reverence and spoke.
