data.md: And donning on his mail, and putting on his armour and his sword, and furnished with arrows, and a bow in his left hand, Sumitrā's son, touching Rāma's feet, feeling elated, addressed Rāma, saying.

data.v: अद्य मत्कार्मुकोन्मुखाः शरा निर्भिद्य रावणिम् । लङ्कामभिपतिष्यन्ति हंसाः पुष्करिणीमिव ।।
data.es: Now the arrows released from my bow will drop in Lanka, just as swans descend into lotus pond and pierce into Ravana's son.
data.anv: अद्य now, मत्कार्मुकोन्मुक्ताः released from my bow, शराः arrows, रावणिम् son of Ravana's, निर्भिद्य piercing, हंसाः swans, पुष्करिणीमिव descend into lotus pond, लङ्काम् Lanka, अभिपतिष्यन्ति will drop
data.md: Today the shafts discharged from my bow, piercing Ravana's son, shall fall into Lanka, even as swans drop into a tank.

data.v: अद्यैव तस्य रौद्रस्य शरीरं मामकाः शराः । विधमिष्यन्ति हत्वा तं महाचापगुणच्युताः ।।
data.es: "Today loosed from my mighty bow, the arrows will split his fierce body and kill him."
data.anv: अद्यैव this day, महाचापगुणच्युताः loosed from mighty bow, मामकाः of mine, शराः arrows, रौद्रस्य fierce, तस्य his, शरीरम् body, भित्त्वा splitting, तम् him, विधमिष्यन्ति will kill
data.md: This very day shall my arrows, shot from my redoubtable bow-string, rive the body of that terrific one.

data.v: स एवमुक्त्वा द्युतिमान्वचनं भ्रातुरग्रतः । स रावणिवधाकाङ्क्षी लक्ष्मणस्त्वरितो ययौ ।।
data.es: Brilliant Lakshmana, having spoken that way in front of his brother, went speedily desirous of killing Ravana's son.
data.anv: द्युतिमान् brilliant, सःलक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, भ्रातुः brother, अग्रतःin front, एवम् in that way, वचनम् words, उक्त्वा spoken, रावणिवथाकाङ्क्षी desirous of killing Ravana's son, त्वरितो speedily, ययौ went
data.md: Having spoken thus, the effulgent Lakşmana, eager to slay Rāvana's son, went before his brother.

data.v: सोऽभिवाद्य गुरोः पादौ कृत्वा चापि प्रदक्षिणम् । निकुम्भिलामभिययौ चैत्यं रावणिपालितम् ।।
data.es: Greeting the tenheaded Rakshasa and going round him according to tradition, the mighty warrior went out from the abode early morning by the command of Ravana.
data.anv: बली mighty, सःhe, दशग्रीवम् tenheaded, अभिवाद्य greeting, प्रदक्षिणंकृत्वाचापि also going round him as tradition, रावणस्य Ravana's, आज्ञया by order, शुभ्रात् early morning, गृहात् from the abode, निर्जगाम went out.
data.md: Having saluted at the feet of his superior and went round him, Lakşmaņa set out for the sacrificial ground (named) Nikumbhila, protected by the son of Rāvana.

data.v: विभीषणेन सहितो राजपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । कृतस्वस्त्ययनो भ्रात्रा लक्ष्मणस्त्वरितो ययौ ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, a valourous prince having received blessings from his eldest brother, went quickly accompanied by Vibheeshana.
data.anv: राजपुत्रः prince, प्रतापवान् valourous, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, भ्रात्रा brother, कृतस्वस्त्ययनः receiving blessing, विभीषणेन by Vibheeshana, सहितःaccompanied by, त्वरितः quickly, ययौ went
data.md: Accompanied by Vibhīşaņa, that powerful son of the king-Lakşmaņa-after his brother had offered up prayers in his behalf, set off with all speed.

data.v: वानराणां सहस्रैस्तु हनूमान्बहुभिर्वृतः । विभीषणः सहामात्यस्तदा लक्ष्मणमन्वगात् ।।
data.es: Then Hanuman surrounded by many thousands of Vanaras, Vibheeshana and ministers followed Lakshmana.
data.anv: तदा then, वानराणाम् Vanaras, बहुभिः many, सहस्रैः thousands, वृतः surrounded, हनूमान् Hanuman, सामात्यः ministers, विभीषणश्च and Vibheeshana, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, अन्वगात् followed
data.md: Surrounded by thousands of monkeys, Hanumān as well as Vibhīşaņa together with his counsellors speedily went in the wake of Lakş mana.

data.v: महता हरिसैन्येन सवेगमभिसंवृतः । ऋक्षराजबलं चैव ददर्श पथि विष्ठितम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana also saw Jambavan standing on the way, with a huge Vanara army surrounded while going speedily.
data.anv: महता huge, हरिसैन्येन vanara army, सवेगम् at speed, अभिसंवृतः surrounded, पथइ on the way, विष्ठितम् standing, ऋक्षराजबलंचैव Jambavan also, ददर्श saw
data.md: And strongly encompassed by that mighty monkey-host, (Laksmana) saw the forces of the bear-king stationed on the way.

data.v: स गत्वा दूरमध्वानं सौमित्रिर्मित्रनन्दनः । राक्षसेन्द्रबलं दूरादपश्यद्व्यूहमास्थितम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, the delight of friends, witnessed from a distance the Rakshasa army arranged in battlearray.
data.anv: मित्रनन्दनः delight of friends, सःसौमित्रिः that Saumithri, दूरम् from distance, अध्वानम् afar, गत्वा gone, दूरात् from distance, व्यूहम् ranged, आश्रितम् battle array, राक्षसेन्द्रबलम् Rakshasa army, अपश्यत् witnessed
data.md: Having proceeded far, Sumitra's Sumitra's son-enhancer of the delight of friends, from a distance discovered the forces of the Rākşasmonarch, drawn up in battle-array.

data.v: स संप्राप्य धनुष्पाणिर्मायायोगमरिंदम । तस्थौ ब्रह्मविधानेन विजेतुं रघुनन्दनः ।।
data.es: The tamer of enemies and delight of the Raghu race, Lakshmana stood wielding bow in hand ready to win the conjurer conferred with boon by the creator Brahma.
data.anv: अरिन्दमः tamer of enemies, सःरघुनन्दनः that delight of Raghu race, धनुष्पाणिः wielding bow, प्राप्य taking, मायायोगम् conjurer, तम् him, ब्रह्मविधानेन by the creator Brahma, विजेतुम् prepared to win, तस्थौ stood
data.md: That subduer of enemies-Raghu's sonbearing his bow in his hand, coming upon him whose martial might lay in illusion, stopped (there) for conquering his foe agreeably to the ordinance * of Brahma. *The ordinance was that Indrajit should be slain while remaining outside Nikumbhilā, his rites not yet finished.

data.v: विविधममलशस्त्रभास्वरं त;द्ध्वजगहनं विपुलं महारथैश्च । प्रतिभयतममप्रमेयवेगं; तिमिरमिव द्विषतां बलं विवेश ।।
data.md: Accompanied by Vibhīşaņa, the heroic Angada, and the Wind-god's offspring, the powerful son of the king dived into the forces of the foe, various, blazing with burnished arms, dense with standards, and thronging with mighty cars,* capable of striking terror (into the hearts of the spectators), instinct with immeasurable energy, and resembling darkness. *Maharathai (ab.) may also mean with mighty carwarriors.

data.v: अथ तस्यामवस्थायां लक्ष्मणं रावणानुजः । परेषामहितं वाक्यमर्थसाधकमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Ravana's brother seeing Lakshmana spoke these words of advice to accomplish the task and which is not good for the enemies.
data.anv: अथ and then, रावणानुजः Ravana's brother, तस्याम् them, लक्ष्मणं Lakshmana अवस्थायाम् tendered, परेषाम् for enemies, अहितम् not good, अर्थसाधकम् to accomplish the task, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: When things were in this condition, Rāvana's younger brother addressed Lakşmaņa in words fraught with evil to foes and conducing to the welfare (of his own party), saying.

data.v: अस्यानीकस्य महतो भेदने यतलक्ष्मण । राक्षसेन्द्रसुतोऽप्यत्र भिन्ने दृश्यो भविष्यति ।।
data.es: "O Lakshmana! Shatter this mighty army of Rakshasas. When it is broken Ravana's son will become visible."
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, महतः mighty, अस्यअनीकस्य army of Rakshasas, भेदने shatter, यत that which, अत्र there, भिन्ने broken, राक्षसेन्द्रसुतोऽपि the son of Rakshasa king, दृश्यःभविष्यति will become visible
data.md: Do you without delay bring on an engagement between this cloud-black Räksasa army, which you behold, and the monkeys having rocks for their arms. O Lakşmaņa, do you exert yourself to break through his* mighty-army; and when the ranks are broken, the son of the Rákşasa-lord shall be visible. * Indrajit's, that is.

data.v: स त्वमिन्द्राशनिप्रख्यैः शरैरवकिरन्परान् । अभिद्रवाशु यावद्वै नैतत्कर्म समाप्यते ।।
data.es: "You have come to attack the enemy. Before he completes his action quickly attack him with the thunderbolt of Indra."
data.anv: सः he, त्वम् by you, इन्द्राशनिप्रख्यैः like Indra's thunderbolt, शरैः arrows, परान् at enemy, अवकिरन् use, एतत् by that, कर्म action, यावत् all, न समाप्यते not completed, आशु quickly, अभिद्रववै not attack
data.md: Scattering among the foes shafts resembling Indra's thunder-bolt, charge him while he has not yet finished this ceremony.

data.v: जहि वीरदुरात्मानं मायापरमधार्मिकम् । रावणिं क्रूरकर्माणं सर्वलोकभयावहम् ।।
data.es: "Hero, wicked minded, conjurer, unrighteous and cruel one who is a terror for all worlds is Ravana's son. Destroy him."
data.anv: वीर heroic, दुरात्मानम् of wicked mind, मायापरम् conjurer, अधार्मिकम् unrighteous, क्रूरकर्माणम् of cruel deeds, सर्वलोकभयावहम् terror for all the worlds, रावणइम् Ravana's son, जहि destroy
data.md: Slay, O hero, this wicked one, this son of Ravana, given to illusion, and of terrific feats, the fear of all the worlds.

data.v: विभीषणवचः श्रुत्वा लक्ष्मणः शुभलक्षणः । ववर्ष शरवर्षाणि राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं प्रति ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, who had auspicious marks, on hearing Vibheeshana rained showers of arrows on Ravana's son.
data.anv: शुभलक्षणः auspicious, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana's words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, राक्षसेन्द्रसुतं Rakshasa king's son प्रति in turn, शरवर्षाणि rain of arrows, ववर्ष rained
data.md: Hearing Vibhisana's.words, Laksmana graced with auspicious marks began to shower arrows on the son of the Raksasa-chief.

data.v: ऋक्षाः शाखामृगाश्चैव द्रुमाद्रिवरयोधिनः । अभ्यधावन्त सहितास्तदनीकमवस्थितम् ।।
data.es: The Bears and monkeys together initiated a fight with the army with trees, mountains, and nails as weapons.
data.anv: द्रुमद्रिनखयोधिन: trees, mountains, nails,, ऋक्षाः Bears, शाखामृगाश्चैव monkeys too, सहिताः together, अवस्थितम् drawn, तत् अनीकम् that army, अभ्यधावन्त initiated
data.md: And bears and monkeys, given to fighting excellently with trees, in a body rushed towards that army (of Rākşasa) drawn up there.

data.v: राक्षसाश्च शितैर्बाणैरसिभिः शक्तितोमरैः । उद्यतैः समवर्तन्त कपिसैन्यजिघांसवः ।।
data.es: The Rakshasas also launched attacks in the battle with sharp swords, javelins, and lances.
data.anv: राक्षसाः च Rakshasas also, समरे in battle, कपिसैन्यजिघांसवः to kill monkey army, शितैः sharp, बाणैः shafts, असिभिः swords, शक्तितोमरैः javelins and lances, उद्यतै: launched, अभ्यवर्तन्त attacked
data.md: The Rākşasas (on their part) burning to slaughter the monkey-forces, rushed in the encounter with sharpened shafts and darts and tomaras.

data.v: स संप्रहारस्तुमुलः संजज्ञे कपिरक्षसाम् । शब्देन महता लङ्कां नादयन्वै समन्ततः ।।
data.es: With both the monkeys and Rakshasas mutually striking intensely, the mighty sounds resounded all over Lanka
data.anv: कपिरक्षसाम् monkeys and Rakshasas, महता mighty, शब्देन sounds, लङ्काम् Lanka, समन्ततः all over, नादयन्वै resounded, सः that, तुमुलः intense, सम्प्रहारः mutual striking, सञ्जज्ञे equipped with
data.md: There took place a tremendous onslaught of the monkeys and the Raksasas. And Lankā resounded all around with that mighty tumult; and the sky was covered with weapons of various shapes, and whetted arrows and trees and dreadful upraised mountain-tops.

data.v: शस्त्रैर्बहुविधाकारैः शितैर्बाणैश्च पादपैः । उद्यतैर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च घोरैराकाशमावृतम् ।।
data.es: The sky was covered with weapons of various shapes, arrows, trees, mountain peaks thrown at each other and were dreadful.
data.anv: विविधाकारैः various shapes, शस्त्रः weapons, शितैः sharp, बाणैश्च arrows also, पादपैः trees, उद्यतैः thrown, घोरैः dreadful, गिरिशृङ्गैश्च mountain peaks, आकाशम् sky, आवृतम् covered
data.md: There took place a tremendous onslaught of the monkeys and the Raksasas. And Lankā resounded all around with that mighty tumult; and the sky was covered with weapons of various shapes, and whetted arrows and trees and dreadful upraised mountain-tops.

data.v: ते राक्षसा वानरेषु विकृताननबाहवः । निवेशयन्तः शस्त्राणि चक्रुस्ते सुमहद्भयम् ।।
data.es: The Rakshasas with disfigured faces and arms, attacked the Vanaras, and their bodies pierced with weapons created great fear in them.
data.anv: विकृताननबाहवः misshapen faces and arms, तेराक्षसाः those Rakshasas, वानरेषु at monkeys, शस्त्राणि weapons, निवेशयन्तः pierced in their bodies, ते in them, सुमहत् great, भयम् fear, चक्रुः created
data.md: Rākşasas having frightful faces and arms, playing their arms among the foremost monkeys, began to spread terror (there).

data.v: तथैव सकलैर्वृक्षैर्गिरिशृङ्गैश्च वानराः । अभिजघ्नुर्निजघ्नुश्च समरे राक्षसर्षभान् ।।
data.es: The monkeys likewise wounded and assailed the bulls among Rakshasas with trees and mountain peaks in the battle.
data.anv: तथैव by that, वानराश्च Vanaras, सकलैः all, वृक्षैः trees, गिरिशृङ्गैः mountain peaks, समरे in the battle, राक्षसर्षभान् bulls among Rakshasas, अभिजघ्नुः wounded, निजघ्नुः च and assailed
data.md: In the same way the monkeys in the conflict fell to slaying and wounding the Rākşasas with trees and hill-tops.

data.v: ऋक्षवानरमुख्यैश्च महाकायैर्महाबलैः । रक्षसां वध्यमानानां महद्भयमजायत ।।
data.es: Mighty Bears and Vanaras of huge body, fighting in the battle caused great fear in Rakshasas.
data.anv: महाकायैः of huge body, महाबलैः mighty, ऋक्षवानरमुख्यैः Bears and Vanara leaders, युध्यमानानाम् fighting in war, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, महत् great, भयम् fear, अजायत caused
data.md: And great was the terror that was spread among the warring Räkşasas by the flower of the bears and monkeys, possessed of gigantic persons and endowed with prodigious strength.

data.v: स्वमनीकं विषण्णं तु श्रुत्वा शत्रुभिरर्दितम् । उदतिष्ठत दुर्धर्षस्तत्कर्मण्यननुष्ठिते ।।
data.es: Indrajith, who is difficult to overpower, on hearing the cries of his own army in agony got up without completing the task (of ritual).
data.anv: दुर्धर्षः one who is difficult to overpower, सः he, शत्रुभिः enemies, अर्धितम् crying in vain, स्वम् own, अनीकम् army, विषण्णम् agony, श्रुत्वा hearing, कर्मणि action, अननुष्ठिते not completed, उदतिष्ठत got up
data.md: Hearing his own army hard beset by the enemies, and dropping, the unconquerable one, ere yet he had finished his rites, rose up.

data.v: वृक्षान्धकारान्निष्क्रम्य जातक्रोधः स रावणिः । आरुरोह रथं सज्जं पूर्वयुक्तं स राक्षसः ।।
data.es: Enraged, Indrajith coming out of the darkness of trees ascended the chariot already yoked and fixed firmly.
data.anv: जातक्रोधः enraged, सः he, रावणिः Indrajith, वृक्षान्धकारात् darkness of trees, निर्गम्य coming out, पूर्वयुक्तम् already yoked, सुसंयुतम् firmly fixed, सज्जम् ready, रथम् chariot, आरुरोह ascended
data.md: Issuing from the gloom of the trees, Ravana's son, fired with wrath, ascended his car, which had already been well yoked (with steeds).

data.v: स भीमकार्मुकशरः कृष्णाञ्जनचयोपमः । रक्तास्यनयनः क्रूरो बभौ मृत्युरिवान्तकः ।।
data.es: Indrajith, armed with a terrific bow and arrows, his body shining like a rainy cloud, with red eyes, angry face, seemed like the spirit of death.
data.anv: भीमकार्मुकशरः armed with terrific bow and arrows, कालमेघसमप्रभ: body shining like a rainy cloud, रक्तास्यनयनः with red eyes, कृद्ध: angry, सः he, अन्तकः like spirit of death, मृत्युरिव like death, बभौ seemed
data.md: Accoutred in a dreadful bow and arrows, that one, resembling a mass of collyrium, having a red face and eyes, looked dreadful like the reaper-death.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव तु रथस्थं तं पर्यवर्तत तद्बलम् । रक्षसां भीमवेगानां लक्ष्मणेन युयुत्सताम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Lakshmana prepared for war, the Rakshasa army endowed with speed surrounded him.
data.anv: रथस्थम् from the chariot, तम् him, दृष्टवैव seeing, लक्ष्मणेन Lakshmana, युयुत्सताम् prepared for war, भीमवेगानाम् endowed with terrific speed, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, तत् बलम् his army, पर्यवर्तत surrounded
data.md: As soon as they saw him mounted on his car, that host of Rākşas possessed of dreadful impetuosity, eager to engage with Lakşmaņa, stood on their ground.

data.v: तस्मिन्काले तु हनुमानुद्यम्य सुदुरासदम् । धरणीधरसंकाशी महावृक्षमरिंदमः ।।
data.es: In the meantime, Hanuman, who resembled a mountain, a tamer of enemies, who is difficult to overpower, taking up huge trees fighting with Rakshasas created havoc like fire at the time of dissolution and went about.
data.anv: तस्मिन् काले in the meantime, धरणीधरसङ्काशः who resembled mountain, अरिन्दमः tamer of enemies, हनुमान् Hanuman, सुदुरासदम् difficult to overpower, महावृक्षम् huge tree, उद्यम्य taking up, राक्षसानाम् at Rakshasas, तत् those, सैन्यम् army, कालाग्निरिव like fire at dissolution, निर्दहन् created havoc, सःhe, वानरःVanara, युधि in combat, बहुभिः many, वृक्षैः trees, निःसज्ञम् fighting, चकार went about
data.md: At this time that subduer of enemies, Hanumăn-resembling a mountain, uprooted a giant tree incapable of being handled.

data.v: स राक्षसानां तत्सैन्यं कालाग्निरिव निर्दहन् । चकार बहुभिर्वृक्षैर्निःसंज्ञं युधि वानरः ।।
data.es: In the meantime, Hanuman, who resembled a mountain, a tamer of enemies, who is difficult to overpower, taking up huge trees fighting with Rakshasas created havoc like fire at the time of dissolution and went about.
data.anv: तस्मिन् काले in the meantime, धरणीधरसङ्काशः who resembled mountain, अरिन्दमः tamer of enemies, हनुमान् Hanuman, सुदुरासदम् difficult to overpower, महावृक्षम् huge tree, उद्यम्य taking up, राक्षसानाम् at Rakshasas, तत् those, सैन्यम् army, कालाग्निरिव like fire at dissolution, निर्दहन् created havoc, सःhe, वानरःVanara, युधि in combat, बहुभिः many, वृक्षैः trees, निःसज्ञम् fighting, चकार went about
data.md: In that encounter, the monkey, consuming (the forces) like the fire risen at Doomsday, made that army of Rākşasas insensible with innumerable trees.

data.v: विध्वंसयन्तं तरसा दृष्ट्वैव पवनात्मजम् । राक्षसानां सहस्राणि हनूमन्तमवाकिरन् ।।

data.v: इह त्वं जातसंवृद्धः साक्षाद्भ्राता पितुर्मम । कथं द्रुह्यसि पुत्रस्य पितृव्यो मम राक्षस ।।

data.md: But neither kinship, nor emity, nor race, O wicked-minded one, nor co-birth, can, destroyer of righteousness, avail to make you discern your duty.

data.md: O you of perverse understanding you are indeed to be pitied; as you are worthy of being reproached by the virtuous; since, renouncing your own, you have espoused servitude under another.

data.v: नैतच्छिथिलया बुद्ध्या त्वं वेत्सि महदन्तरम् । क्व च स्वजनसंवासः क्व च नीचपराश्रयः ।।
data.es: "You do not seem to have an understanding of the difference between living with one's own people and seeking refuge from strangers. Your intellect has slackened you are not knowing."
data.anv: स्वजनसम्वासः living with own people, क्व च is it that, नीचपराश्रयः seeking refuge from strangers, क्वच is it that, एतत् this, महत् great, अन्तरम् understanding, त्वम् you, शिथिलयता slackened, बुद्ध्या intellect, न वेसति not knowing
data.md: Neither by your character nor yet your understanding did you perceive the mighty difference that Leith between living with one's own kindred, and taking refuge with the base.

data.v: गुणवान्वा परजनः स्वजनो निर्गुणोऽपि वा । निर्गुणः स्वजनः श्रेयान्यः परः पर एव सः ।।
data.es: "Even if others are virtuous and your own people are not virtuous also one should seek the refuge of one's own people. Strangers are always strangers."
data.anv: परजनः others, गुणवान्वा virtuous, स्वजनः own people, निर्गुणोपिवा not virtuous also, निर्गुणः not virtuous, स्वजनः own people, श्रेयान् welfare, यः that which, परः others, सः he, परएवहि even if he
data.md: If one that is not our own, be furnished with every grace, and if one's own be void of all merit, one's kindred, albeit unworthy, is preferable; and he that is not ours, is even always such.

data.v: निरनुक्रोशता चेयं यादृशी ते निशाचर । स्वजनेन त्वया शक्यं परुषं रावणानुज ।।
data.es: "O Ravana's brother! You have shown ruthlessness this way. O night ranger! Only you could exhibit this kind of manliness."
data.anv: रावणानुज Ravana's brother, निशाचर night ranger, ते you, इयम् this, यादृशी way, निरनुक्रोशता ruthlessness, पौरुषम् manliness, स्वजनेन own people, त्वया by you, शक्यम् is possible
data.md: O night-ranger, such is this your relentlessness, that, O Ravana's younger brother, you being a kindred, are capable of displaying your manliness (as no other person can do so).

data.v: इत्युक्तो भ्रातृपुत्रेण प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः । अजानन्निव मच्छीलं किं राक्षस विकत्थसे ।।
data.es: Indrajith having spoken like that, Vibheeshana replied," why do you speak like that as though you do not know my disposition?"
data.anv: भ्रातृपुत्रेण brother's son, इति thus, उक्तःhaving spoken, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, प्रत्युवाच replied back, राक्षस Rakshasa, मछचीलम् my disposition, अजानन्निव as though you did not know, किम् why, विकत्थसे speak like this
data.md: Thus addressed by his brother's son, Vibhis ana answered, “O Raksasa, why did you speak as if in ignorance of my character? O impious son of the Rākşasa chief, do you for ego the roughness which you assume on behalf of my dignity.* *Or, on account of your heroism.

data.v: राक्षसेन्द्रसुतासाधो पारुष्यं त्यज गौरवात् । कुले यद्यप्यहं जातो रक्षसां क्रूरकर्मणाम् । गुणोऽयं प्रथमो नॄणां तन्मे शीलमराक्षसं ।।
data.es: "Impious son of Rakshasa king! Though born in the Rakshasa clan I renounced cruel deeds and followed respectfully manliness as my primary quality. My nature is not like that of Rakshasas."
data.anv: असाधो impious, राक्षसेन्द्रसुत son of Rakshasa king, गौरवात् respectfully, पारुष्यम् manliness, त्यज renounce, अहम् I, क्रूरकर्मणाम् cruel deeds, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, कुले clan, जातःयद्यपि though born, नृणाम् king, यः he who, प्रथमः primary, गुणः quality, तत् that, मे I, अराक्षसम् not Rakshasa like, शीलम् nature
data.md: Albeit born in the race of Rākşas of cruel deeds, yet having regard to the first of principles pertaining to men, my character is not that of a Rākşasa. I do not take pleasure in the terrible; not do I revel in unrighteousness.” But how can a brother, although differing from his brother in character, be renounced by the latter?* *Some read Vişamasilena. Then the sense would be: 'How else could a brother bearing a difference in character, renounce his brother' meaning Ravana.

data.v: न रमे दारुणेनाहं न चाधर्मेण वै रमे । भ्रात्रा विषमशीलेन कथं भ्राता निरस्यते ।।
data.es: "I do not delight in cruel deeds, nor follow unrighteousness. Or else because of unfavourable disposition how can a brother be expelled by a brother?"
data.anv: अहम् I, दारुणेन cruel, न रमे not revel, अधर्मेण च unrighteousness, न रमेवै not follow, विषमशीलोऽपि of unfavourable disposition, भ्राता a brother, भ्रात्रा by a brother, कथम् how निरस्यते expelled

data.v: परस्वानां च हरणं परदाराभिमर्शनम् । सुहृदामतिशङ्कां च त्रयो दोषाः क्षयावहाः ।।
data.es: "Stealing the wealth of others, possessing others wife, distrusting friends, these three faults will destroy a person."
data.anv: परस्वानाम् others wealth, हरणम् stealing, परदाराभिमर्शनम् possessing others wife, सुहृदाम् friends, अतिशङ्का च distrusting, त्रयःदोषाः three faults, क्षयावहाः will destroy
data.md: Robbing others property, outraging the wives of others, and inspiring fear among friends, these three vices lead to destruction.

data.v: महर्षीणां वधो घोरः सर्वदेवैश्च विग्रहः । अभिमानश्च कोपश्च वैरित्वं प्रतिकूलता ।।
data.es: "Dreadful killing of sages, haughtiness towards deities, irascibility, anger, animosity, refractorinessall these faults will put an end to one's life. These faults have obscured my brother's future just as rainy clouds veil the mountain."
data.anv: महर्षीणाम् sages, घोरः dreadful, वधः killing, सर्वदेवैः all deities, विग्रहः च haughtiness, अभिमानश्च irascibility, रोषः च anger, वैरित्वं च animosity, प्रतिकूलता refractoriness, जीवितैश्वरनाशनाः put an end to one's life, एते all these, दोषाः faults, मम my, भ्रातुः brother's, गुणान् qualities, तोयदाः rainy clouds, पर्वतानिव mountains, प्रच्छादयामासुः put an end to future
data.md: The dreadful slaughter of sages, rebellion against all the gods, overweening conceit, anger long-continued enmity, and running amuck of counsel, these sins are sapping the life and fortune of my brother; and they have hidden his virtues even as clouds cover a mountain.

data.v: एते दोषा मम भ्रातुर्जीवितैश्वर्यनाशनाः । गुणान्प्रच्छादयामासुः पर्वतानिव तोयदाः ।।
data.es: "Dreadful killing of sages, haughtiness towards deities, irascibility, anger, animosity, refractorinessall these faults will put an end to one's life. These faults have obscured my brother's future just as rainy clouds veil the mountain."
data.anv: महर्षीणाम् sages, घोरः dreadful, वधः killing, सर्वदेवैः all deities, विग्रहः च haughtiness, अभिमानश्च irascibility, रोषः च anger, वैरित्वं च animosity, प्रतिकूलता refractoriness, जीवितैश्वरनाशनाः put an end to one's life, एते all these, दोषाः faults, मम my, भ्रातुः brother's, गुणान् qualities, तोयदाः rainy clouds, पर्वतानिव mountains, प्रच्छादयामासुः put an end to future
data.md: The dreadful slaughter of sages, rebellion against all the gods, overweening conceit, anger long-continued enmity, and running amuck of counsel, these sins are sapping the life and fortune of my brother; and they have hidden his virtues even as clouds cover a mountain.

data.v: दोषैरेतैः परित्यक्तो मया भ्राता पिता तव । नेयमस्ति पुरी लङ्का न च त्वं न च ते पिता ।।
data.es: "Because of these faults your father and my brother has been abandoned by me from this Lanka. This Lanka will not be there, nor your father and you too."
data.anv: तव your, पिता father, भ्राता brother, एतैःदोषैः these faults, मया by me, परित्यक्तःaband oned, इयम् this, लङ्कापुरी Lanka city, न अस्ति not be there, त्वम् च you too, न not, ते to you, पिता च father, न not
data.md: It is on account of these vices that my brother, your sire, has been deserted by me. And this city of Lankā will not be, nor you, nor your father.

data.v: अतिमानी च बालश्च दुर्विनीतश्च राक्षस । बद्धस्त्वं कालपाशेन ब्रूहि मां यद्यदिच्छसि ।।
data.es: "O Rakshasa! You are mean, proud of might, immoral and bound by the noose of death. Whatever you wish to say you may say."
data.anv: राक्षस Rakshasa, अतिमानी च mean, बालश्च proud of might, दुर्विनीतश्च immoral, कालपाशेन by noose of death, बद्धः bound, त्वम् your, माम् my, यत् यत् Whatever, इच्छसि wish to say, ब्रूहि say
data.md: You are proud, and haughty, and a boy, O Raksasa. You are fettered by the noose of Fate. Do you say to me whatever you like.

data.v: अद्य ते व्यसनं प्राप्तं किमिह त्वं तु वक्ष्यसि । प्रवेष्टुं न त्वया शक्यो न्यग्रोधो राक्षसाधम ।।
data.es: "O Lowly Rakshasa! This worry has come to you today. Entering the banyan tree is not possible for you today."
data.anv: राक्षसाधम lowly among Rakshasas, किं why, त्वम् your, वक्ष्यसि to you, अद्य today, इह here, व्यसनम् worry, प्राप्तम्? come, त्वया by you, न्यग्रोधम् banyan tree, प्रवेष्टुम् entering, न शक्यम् not possible
data.md: To-day you have addressed harshly me, who have fallen on evil days; but, O worst of Raks asas, you cannot pass this Nyagrodha.

data.v: धर्षयित्वा तु काकुत्स्थौ न शक्यं जीवितुं त्वया । युध्यस्व नरदेवेन लक्ष्मणेन रणे सह । हतस्त्वं देवता कार्यं करिष्यसि यमक्षये ।।
data.es: "Clashing with Lakshmana of Kakuthsa clan is not possible for you. By waging war with Lakshmana, you will be killed and reaching the abode of the Lord of death. You will be doing tasks of deities of Devatas."
data.anv: काकुत्स्थम् Kakuthsa, धर्षयित्वा clashing, त्वया by you, जीवितुम् life, न शक्यम् not possible, रणए in combat, नरदेवेन god of retribution, लक्ष्मणेनसहस with Lakshmana, युध्यस्व waging war, त्वम् you, हतः killed, यमक्षये abode of yama, देवताकार्यम् tasks of Devatas, करिष्यसि will be doing
data.md: Having smitten the Kākutstha, you cannot live. Fight with that man-god, Laksmana, in encounter. Being slain, you shall serve the deities in the abode of Yama.

data.v: निदर्शयस्वात्मबलं समुद्यतं; कुरुष्व सर्वायुधसायकव्ययम् । न लक्ष्मणस्यैत्य हि बाणगोचरं; त्वमद्य जीवन्सबलो गमिष्यसि ।।
data.md: Displaying you own prowess, do you spend all your weapons and all your shafts. But coming within the ken of Laksmana's arrows, your will not today go hence, living with your forces.

data.v: विभीषण वचः श्रुत्वा रावणिः क्रोधमूर्छितः । अब्रवीत्परुषं वाक्यं वेगेनाभ्युत्पपात ह ।।
data.es: Hearing Vibheeshana's words, Indrajith was deluded with fury, spoke harshly and advanced.
data.anv: विभीषणवचः Vibheeshana's words, श्रुत्वा hearing, रावणिः Indrajith, क्रोधमूर्छितः deluded with fury, परुषम् harsh, वाक्यम् words, अब्रवीत् spoke, वेगेन swiftly, अभ्युत्पपात च advanced.
data.md: Hearing Vibhisana's words, the son of Ravana, deprived of his senses by passion, spoke harshly, and rushed forward in wrath.

data.v: उद्यतायुधनिस्त्रिंशो रथे तु समलंकृते । कालाश्वयुक्ते महति स्थितः कालान्तकोपमः ।।
data.es: Lifting his long, strong huge, great terrific bow endowed with high speed and holding it drawing arrows seated in a chariot well decorated, drawn by black horses, Indrajith looked like God of Death.
data.anv: उद्यतायुधनिस्त्रिंशः lifting the strong bow, सुसमलङ्कृते well decorated, कालाश्वयुक्ते yoked to black horses महति greatरथे chariot, स्थितःseated, कालान्तकोपमः like god of death, महाप्रमाणम् long, विपुलम् huge, वेगवत् endowed with great speed भीमम् terrific, धनुः bow, उद्यम्य holding अमित्रनाशनान् for the destruction of enemies, शरांश्च arrows also, परामृश्य drawing
data.md: With upraised weapons and scimitars, he, resembling the Destroyer himself, was mounted on a mighty car yoked with black steeds, and ornamented (on all sides).

data.v: महाप्रमाणमुद्यम्य विपुलं वेगवद्दृढम् । धनुर्भीमं परामृश्य शरांश्चामित्रनाशनान् ।।
data.es: Lifting his long, strong huge, great terrific bow endowed with high speed and holding it drawing arrows seated in a chariot well decorated, drawn by black horses, Indrajith looked like God of Death.
data.anv: उद्यतायुधनिस्त्रिंशः lifting the strong bow, सुसमलङ्कृते well decorated, कालाश्वयुक्ते yoked to black horses महति greatरथे chariot, स्थितःseated, कालान्तकोपमः like god of death, महाप्रमाणम् long, विपुलम् huge, वेगवत् endowed with great speed भीमम् terrific, धनुः bow, उद्यम्य holding अमित्रनाशनान् for the destruction of enemies, शरांश्च arrows also, परामृश्य drawing
data.md: That one endowed with terrific strength upraised a huge, gigantic, strong and powerful bow, and shafts capable of destroying foes.

data.v: उवाचैनं समारब्धः सौमित्रिं सविभीषणम् । तांश्च वानरशार्दूलान्पश्यध्वं मे पराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: Lakshmana was like the Sun on the eastern mountain mounted on the back of Hanuman, the tiger among Vanaras. He saw Vibheeshana and spoke.
data.anv: हनुमत्पृष्ठम् on the back of Hanuman, आरूढम् mounted, उदयस्थरविप्रभम् like the sun on eastern mountain, सविभीषणम् that Vibheeshana, एनंसौमित्रिम् Saumithri, तान् his, वानरशार्दूलान् च tiger among Vanaras, समारब्धः mounted, उवाच spoke, मे my, पराक्रमम् valour, पश्यध्वम् saw

data.v: अद्य मत्कार्मुकोत्सृष्टं शरवर्षं दुरासदम् । मुक्तं वर्षमिवाकाशे वारयिष्यथ संयुगे ।।
data.es: "See my valour and prowess now. I will release shower of arrows from the sky like rain and it will be difficult for others to counter."
data.anv: अद्य and then, संयुगे in war, मत्कार्मुकोत्सृष्टम् see my valour and prowess, दुरासदम् difficult counter, आकाशे sky, मुक्तम् released, वर्षम् इव like rain, शरवर्षम् shower of arrows, वारयिष्यथ will not able to stop.

data.v: अद्य वो मामका बाणा महाकार्मुकनिःसृताः । विधमिष्यन्ति गात्राणि तूलराशिमिवानलः ।।
data.es: "Then my arrows delivered from the great bow will pierce the limbs and burn like a bundle of cotton by fire."
data.anv: अद्य and then, महाकार्मुलनिःसृताः having been delivered from the great bow, मामकाः mine, बाणाः arrows, वः your, गात्राणि limbs, अनलः fire, तूलराशिमिव like bundle of cotton, विधमिष्यन्ति will pierce
data.md: fo-day my shafts discharged from my mighty bow shall mangle your limbs, even as fire burn up a heap of cotton.

data.v: तीक्ष्णसायकनिर्भिन्नाञ्शूलशक्त्यृष्टितोमरैः । अद्य वो गमयिष्यामि सर्वानेव यमक्षयम् ।।
data.es: "Now I will send you to the abode of Yama with sharp arrows, tridents, pikes, spears and lances."
data.anv: अद्य and now, तीक्षणसायकनिर्भिन्नान् with sharp arrows, tridents, शूलशक्त्यृष्टितोमरैःशूल pikes, spears, lances, वः, सर्वानेव all, यमक्षयम् to the abode of Yama, गमयिष्यामि will send
data.md: To-day with your persons pierced with sharp shafts, with darts, and javelins, and Rstis and arrows, Shall I despatch you all to the abode of Yama.

data.v: क्षिपतः शरवर्षाणि क्षिप्रहस्तस्य मे युधि । जीमूतस्येव नदतः कः स्थास्यति ममाग्रतः ।।
data.es: "Who can stand in front of me if I release rain of arrows with my swift hand in the battle roaring like a rain cloud?"
data.anv: क्षिप्रहस्तस्य swift hand, सम्युगे in battle, शरवर्षाणि rain of arrows, क्षिपत: release, जीमूतस्येव like rain cloud, नदतः roar, मम my, अग्रतः front, कः who स्थास्यति can stand ?
data.md: Who shall stay before me, fleet-handed, creating an arrows shower in the field, and roaring like to clouds?

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा राक्षसेन्द्रस्य गर्जितं लक्ष्मणस्तदा । अभीतवदनः क्रुद्धो रावणिं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: On hearing Indrajith's words, Lakshmana spoke these words in anger with fearless countenance.
data.anv: तदा then, लक्ष्मण: Lakshmana, राक्षसेन्द्रस्य Indrajith's words, तत् that, गर्जितम् roaring, श्रुत्वा hearing, अभीतवदनः fearless countenance, क्रुद्धः angry, रावणिम् Indrajith, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoken
data.md: Hearing the vaunt of the Rākşasa-chief, Rahgu's son, inflamed with rage, with an undaunted countenance, spoke to Ravana's son.

data.v: उक्तश्च दुर्गमः पारः कार्याणां राक्षस त्वया । कार्याणां कर्मणा पारं यो गच्छति स बुद्धिमान् ।।
data.es: "Rakshasa! You have proclaimed that you will send me to Yama's abode and about the success in your undertakings even though it is not possible. He who is intelligent will succeed in his tasks (not in words alone).
data.anv: राक्षस Rakshasa, त्यया your, कार्याणाम् undertakings, दुर्गमः difficult, पारः proclaimed, उक्तश्च have spoken, यः that which, कार्याणा undertakings, कर्मणाम् tasks, पारम् to the abode of Yama, गच्छति will go, सः he who is, बुद्धिमान् intelligent one
data.md: O Rākşasa, hard is the achievement of the task that you have mentioned. He that compass business by act is alone intelligent. He that compass business by act is alone intelligent. But you, O wicked-minded one, incompetent as you are to bring about your end, attaining your arduous aim by words only, deem yourself as crowned with success.

data.v: अन्तर्धानगतेनाजौ यस्त्वयाचरितस्तदा । तस्कराचरितो मार्गो नैष वीरनिषेवितः ।।
data.es: "Remaining invisible and moving in the battle then is the path of a thief which is not chosen by warriors."

data.md: That your had rendered yourself invisible in the field of conflict, was the work of a thief, and not the way of a hero.

data.md: Coming within the range of your shafts, I stay here, do you display your prowess. What did you say in words.?

data.md: O son of Sumitrā, my feathered and sharpedged shafts shot from my bow, capable of destroying life, will today finish you up.

data.md: To-day, O Laksmana, swarms of jackals and hosts of hawks and vultures shall alight on you lying lifeless, having been slain by me.

data.md: Why, O Raksasa, without doing (what you say), did you simply say it? Do the deed, so that I may have regard for your utterances.

data.anv: वीरौ heroes, महाबलशरासनौ of extraordinary might and equipped with huge arms, भीमविक्रमौ of terrific valour, लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितौ Lakshmana and Indrajith, विशिखैःsharp, बाणैः arrows, अन्योन्यम् one another, जघ्नतुःstruck
data.md: And those heroes-Lakşmaņa and Indrajitequipped with exceedingly powerful bows, and endowed with heroism and dreadful prowess, wounded each other with sharp arrows.

data.v: तौ परस्परमभ्येत्य सर्वगात्रेषु धन्विनौ । घोरैर्विव्यधतुर्बाणैः कृतभावावुभौ जये ।।
data.es: Both wishing for victory, set to tear each other, pierced dreadful arrows on one another all over the limbs, opposing.
data.anv: जये wishing for victory, कृतभावौ set to tear, धवनिनौ wielding bows, उभौ both, परस्परम् one another, अभ्येत्य opposing, घोरैः dreadful, बाणैः arrows, सर्वगात्रेषु all over the limbs, विव्यधतुः pierced
data.md: And approaching each other, those bowmen, each setting his heart on victory, wounded each other all over the body with terrific shafts.

data.v: तस्मै दृढतरं क्रुद्धो हताश्वाय विभीषणः । वज्रस्पर्शसमान्पञ्च ससर्जोरसि मार्गणान् ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana of strong body, pierced five arrows like thunderbolt in impact into the chest of Indrajith.
data.anv: दृढतनुः of strong body, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, हताश्वाय horses killed, तस्मै his, क्रुद्धः angry, उरसि chest, वज्रस्पर्शमान् like thunderbolt in impact, पञ्च five, सायकान् arrows, ससर्ज pierced
data.md: And Vibhîşana of a tough bow, growing enraged, discharged at (Indrajit), who had his steeds slain, five speeding shafts having the touch of the thunder-bolt.

data.v: ते तस्य कायं निर्भिद्य रुक्मपुङ्खा निमित्तगाः । बभूवुर्लोहितादिग्धा रक्ता इव महोरगाः ।।
data.es: Those arrows released from the great bow of Lakshmana, entered the body of Indrajithand fell on the ground like a huge red serpent.
data.anv: महाकार्मुकनिःसृताः released from the great bow, तेthose, बाणाः arrows, तस्य his, कायम् body, निर्भिद्य entering, रक्ताः red, महोरगाः huge serpent, इव like, धरणीम् ground, निपेतुःdropped
data.md: The shafts discharged from his' mighty bow, person, dropped to the earth like to powerful red serpents. 1. Laksmana's. 2. Indrajit's.

data.v: स पितृव्यस्य संक्रुद्ध इन्द्रजिच्छरमाददे । उत्तमं रक्षसां मध्ये यमदत्तं महाबलः ।।
data.es: Indrajith, angry with his uncle, staying in the midst of Rakshasas, seized a mighty strong best arrow gifted by Yama.
data.anv: सःइन्द्रजित् that Indrajith, पितृव्यस्य uncle, सङ्क्रुद्धःangry, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, मध्ये midst, यमदत्तम् given by Yama, महाबलम् might strong, उत्तमम् best, शरम् arrow, आददे seized
data.md: Thereat wroth with his uncle, Indrajit took up an excellent shaft-bestowed on him by Yama himself-endowed with terrific force, the flower of shafts among all the Rākşasas.

data.v: तं समीक्ष्य महातेजा महेषुं तेन संहितम् । लक्ष्मणोऽप्याददे बाणमन्यं भीमपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Extraordinarily brilliant and of terrific valour, Lakshmana, perceiving the mighty shaft yoked by him (by Indrajith), he took up another arrow.
data.anv: महातेजाः extraordinarily brilliant, भीमपराक्रमः of terrific valour, लक्ष्मणोऽपि Lakshmana also, संहितम् yoked, महेषुम् mighty shaft, समीक्ष्य perceiving, अन्यत् another, बाणम् arrow, आददे took up
data.md: Seeing that mighty shaft set by him (on the bow-string), the highly powerful Laksmana, possessed of dreadful prowess, (in his turn) took up another arrow, bestowed by Kuvera himself of imme jurable soul in a dream, unconquerable, and incapable of being borne even by the celestials and Asuras with Indra at their head.

data.v: कुबेरेण स्वयं स्वप्ने यद्दत्तममितात्मना । दुर्जयं दुर्विषह्यं च सेन्द्रैरपि सुरासुरैः ।।
data.es: That arrow was gifted to Lakshmana in dream by Kubera, the god of wealth and even Suras or Asuras cannot resist it and is difficult to win.
data.anv: यत् that arrow, अमितात्मना god of wealth, कुबेरेण by Kubera, स्वयम् himself, स्वप्ने to him in dream, दत्तम् gifted, सेन्रन्दैः, सुरासुरैरपि even for suras and Asuras, दुर्जयम् difficult to win, दुर्विषह्यं च or to resist
data.md: Seeing that mighty shaft set by him (on the bow-string), the highly powerful Laksmana, possessed of dreadful prowess, (in his turn) took up another arrow, bestowed by Kuvera himself of imme jurable soul in a dream, unconquerable, and incapable of being borne even by the celestials and Asuras with Indra at their head.

data.v: ताभ्यां तौ धनुषि श्रेष्ठे संहितौ सायकोत्तमौ । विकृष्यमाणौ वीराभ्यां भृशं जज्वलतुः श्रिया ।।
data.es: The two best bows of both the heroes together, being powerful, shone with splendour when drawn with bowstring.
data.anv: ताभ्यांवीराभ्याम् both heroes, श्रेष्ठे best, धनुषि bows, संहितौ together, विकृष्यमाणे drawn with bowstring, सायकोत्तमौ best of arrows, भृशम् powerful, श्रिया splendour, जज्वलतुः shone brightly
data.md: On those foremost of shafts set on those excellent bows of those heroes, being drawn, flamed up in exceeding splendour.

data.v: तौ भासयन्तावाकाशं धनुर्भ्यां विशिखौ च्युतौ । मुखेन मुखमाहत्य संनिपेततुरोजसा ।।
data.es: Those arrows released from the bows lit the sky when their heads collided with each other and glowed by rubbing against each other.
data.anv: धनुर्ब्याम् from the bows, च्युतौ released, तौ those, विशिखौ arrows, आकाशम् sky, भासयन्तौ lighting, मुखेन heads collided, मुखम् hitting the head, आहत्य meeting, ओजसा glowing, सन्निपेततुः rubbed against each other
data.md: Those flaming arrows, discharged from the bows, illumining the welkin, with vehemence struck at each others head.

data.v: तौ महाग्रहसंकाशावन्योन्यं संनिपत्य च । संग्रामे शतधा यातौ मेदिन्यां विनिपेततुः ।।
data.es: In the battle both of them touching each other in conflict like the major planets flew into a hundred pieces and fell on earth.
data.anv: सङ्ग्रामे in battle, महाग्रहसङ्काशौ like major planets, तौ they both, अन्योन्यम् one another, सन्निपत्य touching with each other, शतदा hundred pieces, यातौ in conflict, मेदिन्याम् on the earth, पेततुः fell
data.md: And dashing against each other like to mighty planets, they, reduced to an hundred shivers in the encounter, saught the earth.

data.v: शरौ प्रतिहतौ दृष्ट्वा तावुभौ रणमूर्धनि । व्रीडितो जातरोषौ च लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितावुभौ ।।
data.es: Then both Lakshmana and Indrajith in the face of the battle seeing their arrows in nought with each other were abashed and got agitated.
data.anv: तदा then, तौ both, लक्ष्मणेन्द्रजितौ Lakshmana and Indrajith, उभौ both, रणमूर्धनि in the face of battle, प्रतिहतौ nought with the other, शरौ arrows, दृष्टवा seeing, व्रीडितौ abashed, जातरोषौ च got agitated
data.md: Seeing their shafts baffled, Indrajit and Laks mana, staying on the edge of the battie, were seized with shame and wrath.

data.v: सुसंरब्धस्तु सौमित्रिरस्त्रं वारुणमाददे । रौद्रं महेद्रजिद्युद्धे व्यसृजद्युधि विष्ठितः ।।
data.es: Enraged Saumithri, seizing the weapon of Varuna, skilled in warfare loosened on Indrajith (Mahendra's enemy), which was presided over by Rudra.

data.md: Thereat Sumitra's son, flying into a fury, took up a Vāruņa weapon. And the conqueror of the great Indra intent on battle, in the encounter discharged a terrific Raudra weapon; and the exceedingly wonderful Văruņa weapon was baffled by him.

data.v: तयोः सुतुमुलं युद्धं संबभूवाद्भुतोपमम् । गगनस्थानि भूतानि लक्ष्मणं पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.es: The war between both was wonderful and horripulating. Beings from the sky saw Lakshmana diverting the Asura missile.
data.anv: तयोः both, अद्भुतम् wonderful, रोमहर्षणम् one's hair stand, युद्धम् war, सम्बभूवा happened, गगनस्थानि from the sky, भूतानि beings, लक्ष्मणम् at Lakshmana, पर्यवारयन् diverting
data.md: The encounter that took place between them was wonderful and capable of making people's down stand on end. And beings stationed in the sky surrounded Lakşmaņa on all sides.

data.v: भैरवाभिरुते भीमे युद्धे वानरराक्षसाम् । भूतैर्बहुभिराकाशं विस्मितैरावृतं बभौ ।।
data.es: As the frightful war between Vanaras and Rakshasas went on, many beings surrounded in the sky were astonished and looked charming.

data.md: In that terrific encounter of the monkeys and the Rākşasas resounding with dreadful roars, the welkin was covered with innumerable beings seized with wonderment.

data.v: ऋषयः पितरो देवा गन्धर्वा गरुणोरगाः । शतक्रतुं पुरस्कृत्य ररक्षुर्लक्ष्मणं रणे ।।
data.es: The Rsis, Devatas, manes, Gandharvas, Garudas, serpents and Indra who had performed hundred sacrifices, protected Lakshmana in war.

data.es: Trunk broken off, the huge head of Indrajith bathed in blood was seen on the earth shining like gold.
data.anv: भिन्नस्कन्धम् trunk broken, रुधिरोक्षितम् bathed in blood, राक्षसतनूजस्य Indrajith's, महत् huge, तत् शिरः head, तपनीयनिभम् shining like gold, भूमौ on the earth, ददृशे seen
data.md: The mighty severed head of the Rākşasas son, resembling one made of gold, was seen covered with blood.

data.v: हतस्तु निपपाताशु धरण्यां रावणात्मजः । कवची सशिरस्त्राणो विध्वस्तः सशरासनः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Indrajith with his shield, and helmet of the head broken was thrown on earth killed.
data.anv: अत and then, कवची shield, सशिरस्त्राण helmet of the head, विद्धिस्थश रासनः protection on broken, सःरावणात्मजः that Indrajith, हतःkilled, धरण्याम् on the earth, निपपात ह thrown
data.md: And slain, Ravana's son dropped to the earth, with his armour and corslet on, and his bow fallen (from his grasp).

data.v: चुक्रुशुस्ते ततः सर्वे वानराः सविभीषणाः । हृष्यन्तो निहते तस्मिन्देवा वृत्रवधे यथा ।।
data.es: Then Vibheeshana and all the Vanaras rejoiced just as Devas, when Vrtasura was killed.
data.anv: ततः then, सविभीषणाः that Vibheeshana, ते to, सर्वे all, वानराःVanara, तस्मिन् his, निहतेkilled, वृत्रवधे when Vrtasura killed, देवाःयथा like Devas, हृष्यन्तःrejoiced, चुक्रुशुः shouted
data.md: Then all the monkeys with Vibhīşaņa set up cheers, even as the immortals cheered at the destruction of Vrtra.

data.v: अथान्तरिक्षे भूतानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् । अभिजज्ञे च संनादो गन्धर्वाप्सरसामपि ।।
data.es: Then shouts of victory aroused from the heavens from the created beings of heaven, Rsis also, Gandharvas and Apsaras.
data.anv: अथ and then, अन्तरिक्षे sky, भूतानाम् created beings, महात्मनाम् great self, ऋषीणां च Rsis also, अथ and, गन्धर्वाप्सरसां च Gandharvas, Apsaras, जयसन्नादः shout of victory, जज्ञे aroused
data.md: And in the sky there arose the victorious shouts of all beings and high souled saints, and also of Gandharvas and Apsarās.

data.v: पतितं समभिज्ञाय राक्षसी सा महाचमूः । वध्यमाना दिशो भेजे हरिभिर्जितकाशिभिः ।।
data.es: Great army of Rakshasas even though desired to win seeing (Indrajith dead), Vanaras started attacking them. Unable to bear Rakshasas screamed.
data.anv: राक्षसी Rakshasa, महाचमूः great army, जितकाशिभिः desired to win, हरिभिः Vanaras, वध्यमाना started attacking, तम् them, पतितम् fallen, अभिज्ञाय unable to bear, दिशःdirections, भेजे screamed
data.md: And knowing (Indrajit) fallen (in fight), the mighty army of Rākşasas, attacked by monkeys burning for victory, fled in the ten cardinal directions.

data.v: वनरैर्वध्यमानास्ते शस्त्राण्युत्सृज्य राक्षसाः । लङ्कामभिमुखाः सर्वे नष्टसंज्ञाः प्रधाविताः ।।
data.es: Those Rakshasas being killed by Vanaras, went running to Lanka leaving their weapons, with senses lost.
data.anv: तेराक्षसाः those Rakshasas, वानरैः Vanaras, वध्यमानाः being killed, शस्त्राणि weapons, उत्सृज्य leaving, भ्रष्टसंज्ञाःsenses lost, प्रधाविताः assaulted, लङ्काम् to Lanka, अभिमुखाःtowards, सस्रुः went running
data.md: And assailed by the monkeys, the Raksasas, pursued (by their foes), with their senses lost, rushed towards Lankā, leaving their arms behind.

data.v: दुद्रुवुर्बहुधा भीता राक्षसाः शतशो दिशः । त्यक्त्वा प्रहरणान्सर्वे पट्टसासिपरश्वधान् ।।
data.es: All Rakshasas feared and panic stricken fled in hundreds, in groups in all directions leaving their sharpedged spears, swords, and axes.
data.anv: भीताः feared, सर्वेराक्षसाः all Rakshasas, प्रहरणान् panic stricken, पट्टिशासिपरश्वधान् sharp edged spears, swords and axes, त्यक्त्वा leaving, बहुधाin groups, शतशःhundreds, दिशःdirections, दुद्रुवुःfled
data.md: And overwhelmed with fright, Rākṣasas fled in an hundred directions, all renouncing their arms-bearded darts, and swords, and axes.

data.v: केचिल्लङ्कां परित्रस्ताः प्रविष्टा वानरार्दिताः । समुद्रे पतिताः केचित्केचित्पर्वतमाश्रिताः ।।
data.es: Pained by Vanaras, some fearful entered Lanka, few had fallen in the ocean and some sought refuge in the mountain.
data.anv: वानरार्दिताः pained by Vanaras, केचित् few, परित्रस्ताःfearing, लङ्काम् Lanka, प्रविष्टाः entered, केचित् some, समुद्रे ocean, पतिताः fallen, केचित् some, पर्वतम् mountain, आश्रिताःsought refuge
data.md: And harassed by the monkeys, some hurriedly entered, Lankā, and some plunged into the sea, and some saught shelter in the mountains.

data.v: हतमिन्द्रजितं दृष्ट्वा शयानं समरक्षितौ । राक्षसानां सहस्रेषु न कश्चित्प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।
data.es: Indrajith was lying, having fallen on the ground, and not even one of the thousands of Rakshasas was present there to see.
data.anv: हतम् killed, रणक्षितौ fallen on the ground, शयानम् lying, इन्द्रजितम् Indrajith, दृष्टवा seeing, राक्षसानाम् Rakshasas, सहस्रेषु thousands, कश्चित् indeed, न प्रत्यदृश्यत not present there
data.md: Seeing Indrajit slain and lying down on the field of battle, thousands of Raksasas fled away.

data.v: यथास्तं गत आदित्ये नावतिष्ठन्ति रश्मयः । तथा तस्मिन्निपतिते राक्षसास्ते गता दिशः ।।
data.es: Just as Sun rays go away as soon as the Sun sets in the evening, the Rakshasas also went in all directions seeing Indrajith fallen.
data.anv: आदित्ये sun, अस्तङ्गते when set in the sky, रश्मयः evening, यथा so, नावतिष्ठन्ति rays goes away, तथा in the same way, तस्मिन् him, निपतिते fallen, तेराक्षसाः those Rakshasas, दिशःdirections, गताःwent
data.md: As when the Sun sets, his rays remain no longer, on that Raksasas having fallen, the Raks asas dispersed in the ten cardinal quarters, like to the sun when his rays have been rendered mild, or fire which has been extinguished.

data.v: शान्तरक्श्मिरिवादित्यो निर्वाण इव पावकः । स बभूव महातेजा व्यपास्त गतजीवितः ।।
data.es: Shorn of life, the broad shouldered Indrajith remained on the ground like the Sun whose rays have become cool, after death.
data.anv: व्यपास्तगतजीवितःshorn of life, महाबाहुः broad shouldered, सःhe, शान्तरश्मि: whose rays have become cool, आदित्यःइव sun like, निर्वाणःafter death, पावकःइव fire like, बभूव remained

data.v: प्रशान्तपीडा बहुलो विनष्टारिः प्रहर्षवान् । बभूव लोकः पतिते राक्षसेन्द्रसुते तदा ।।
data.es: Then many were at peace and rejoiced in the world, being relieved, when Ravana's son dropped dead.
data.anv: तदा then, राक्षसेन्द्रसुते Ravana's son, पतिते dropped down, लोकःworld, विनष्टारिःrelieved, प्रशान्तपीडाबहुलः many were at peace, प्रहर्षवान् rejoiced, बभूव became
data.md: The mighty-armed (Indrajit) was utterly shorn of life. And on the son of the Raksasa-chief falling, the world, having its foe slain, with its huge affliction gone off, experienced the height of joy.

data.v: हर्षं च शक्रो भगवान्सह सर्वैः सुरर्षभैः । जगाम निहते तस्मिन्राक्षसे पापकर्मणि ।।
data.es: Glorious Rakshasa of sinful deeds having been killed, all including great sages and Indra felt rejoiced.
data.anv: पापकर्मणि of sinful deeds, तस्मिन् राक्षसे that Rakshasa, निहते killed, भगवान् glorious, शक्रःIndra, सर्वैःall, महर्षिभिःसह including great sages, हर्षम् rejoiced, जगाम felt
data.md: On that unrighteous Raksasa having been slain, the reverend Sakra together with the Maharsis was filled with delight.

data.v: शुद्धा आपो नभश्चैव जहृषुर्दैत्यदानवाः । आजग्मुः पतिते तस्मिन्सर्वलोकभयावहे ।।
data.es: As the terror of all worlds had fallen and the water from the sky became pure, Devas and Danavas rejoiced and came there.
data.anv: सर्वलोकभयावहे terror for all worlds, तस्मिन् his, पतिते fall, आपः water, नभश्चैव from the sky, शुद्धाः pure, देवदानवाःDevas and Danavas, जह्रषुः rejoiced, आजग्मुः came there

data.v: ऊचुश्च सहिताः सर्वे देवगन्धर्वदानवाः । विज्वराः शान्तकलुषा ब्राह्मणा विचरन्त्विति ।।
data.es: Devas, Danavas and Ghandharvas arrived there and said, "Let the Brahmins be without anxiety and move about without fear."
data.anv: देवगन्धर्वदानवाः Devas, Gandharvas and Danavas, तुष्टाः arrived there सहिताः also ब्राह्मणा brahmanas, शान्तकलुषाः without any anxiety, विज्वराः without fear, विचरन्तु move about, इति thus, ऊचुश्च said

data.v: ततोऽभ्यनन्दन्संहृष्टाः समरे हरियूथपाः । तमप्रतिबलं दृष्ट्वा हतं नैरृतपुंगवम् ।।
data.es: When, the best of Rakshasa, a leader of extraordinary prowess was killed, the Vanara army seeing Lakshmana felt happy and greeted him.
data.anv: ततः then, समरे in battle, हतम् killed, अप्रतिबलम् extraordinary prowess, तम् him, नैरृतपुङ्गवम् best of Rakshasas, दृष्टवा seeing, हरियूथपाः Vanara army, सम्हृष्टाः happy, अभ्यनन्दन् greeted
data.md: Then the monkey-leaders, seeing that foremost of Naiſtas of unparalleled prowess slain in battle, began to gladly pay homage (to Lakş mana).

data.v: विभीषणो हनूमांश्च जाम्बवांश्चर्क्षयूथपः । विजयेनाभिनन्दन्तस्तुष्टुवुश्चापि लक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana and Hanuman, leader of Bears Jambavan praised Lakshmana and greeted him for his victory.
data.anv: विभीषणः Vibheeshana, हनूमांश्च and Hanuman, अर्क्षयूथपः army of Bears, जाम्बवान् च Jambavan also, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, विजयेन victory, अभिनन्दन्तः greeted, तुष्टुवुः praised अपि also
data.md: And Vibhīşaņa and Hanumān and Jāmabavān, leader of bears-saluted and hymned Lakşmaņa on the score of his victory.

data.v: क्ष्वेडन्तश्च नदन्तश्च गर्जन्तश्च प्लवंगमाः । लब्धलक्षा रघुसुतं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ।।
data.es: Having accomplished their goal, monkeys roaring, playing, surrounded Lakshmana, and stood.
data.anv: लब्धलक्षाः having accomplished their goal, प्लवङ्गमाः monkeys, क्ष्वेळन्तश्च playing, प्लवन्तश्च monkeys also गर्जन्तश्च roaring, रघुसुतम् Lakshmana, परवार्य surrounded, उपतस्थिरे stood
data.md: And shouting and bounding and roaring, the monkeys at this hour of high joy stood surrounding Raghu's son.* *Descendant, that is.

data.v: लाङ्गूलानि प्रविध्यन्तः स्फोटयन्तश्च वानराः । लक्ष्मणो जयतीत्येवं वाक्यं व्यश्रावयंस्तदा ।।
data.es: Then Vanaras wagging their tails and lashing them announced slogans saying," Lakshmana is winning."
data.anv: तदा then, वानराः Vanara, लाङ्गूलानि tails, प्रविध्यन्तः wagging, स्फोटयन्तः च and lashing, लक्ष्मणःजयति Lakshman is winning, इत्येवम् in this way, वाक्यम् words, विश्रावयन् slogan announced
data.md: And flourishing their tails and striking the earth (with them), the monkeys shouted, 'Victory to Laksmana!'

data.v: अन्योन्यं च समाश्लिष्य कपयो हृष्टमानसाः । चक्रुरुच्चावचगुणा राघवाश्रयजाः कथाः ।।
data.es: The monkeys feeling very happy embraced one another singing in praise of Lakshmana saying" Lakshmana has won"and stories related to Lakshmana
data.anv: हरयः monkeys, हृष्टमानसाः very happy, अन्योन्यम् one another, समालशिष्य embraced, उच्छावचगुणाःsinging in praise, राघवाश्रयसजा: Raghava has won, कथा: related stories, चक्रुः uttered
data.md: And embracing each other, the monkeys with delighted spirits began to converse in various ways touching Raghava's welfare.

data.v: तदसुकरमथाभिवीक्ष्य हृष्टाः; प्रियसुहृदो युधि लक्ष्मणस्य कर्म । परममुपलभन्मनःप्रहर्षं; विनिहतमिन्द्ररिपुं निशम्य देवाः ।।
data.md: Beholding that deed, difficult of being done, performed by their beloved friend, Laks mana, and hearing their foe, Indrajit, slain (in battle), the celestials attained the summit of joy.

data.v: रुधिरक्लिन्नगात्रस्तु लक्ष्मणः शुभलक्षणः । बभूव हृष्टस्तं हत्वा शक्रजेतारमाहवे ।।
data.es: Body having auspicious marks, smeared with blood, Lakshmana experienced the joy of having won Indra in battle.
data.anv: रुधिरक्लिन्नगात्रः body smeared with blood, शुभलक्षणः auspicious marks, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, आहवे in battle, तम् him, शक्रजेतारम् one who won Indra, हत्वा killing, हृष्टः joyful, बभूव experienced
data.md: Having in the conflict slain that conqueror of enemies, Lakşmaņa graced with auspicious marks, with his body bathed in blood, experienced delight.

data.v: ततः स जाम्बवन्तं च हनूमन्तं च वीर्यवान् । संनिवर्त्य महातेजास्तांश्च सर्वान्वनौकसः ।।
data.es: Then Valiant and mighty Lakshmana called Jambavantha, Hanumantha, all the Vanaras, following Vibheeshana and Hanuman quickly reached Sugriva and Raghava.
data.anv: ततः then, वीर्यवान् valiant, महातेजाः mighty, सःलक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavantha, हनूमन्तं च and Hanumantha, सर्वान् all, तान् them, वनौकसः च Vanaras, संनिपत्य calling, ततः that, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, हनूमन्तं च Hanuman, अवष्टभ्य following, सुग्रीवराघवौ Sugriva, Raghava यत्र there, शीघ्रम् quickly, आजगाम reached
data.md: Then supporting himself on Vibhīşana and Hanuman, the exceedingly powerful Lakşmaņa endowed with prowess, taking Jambavan, Hanuman and all the monkeys with him, speedily went to the place where Sugrīva and Raghava were.

data.v: आजगाम ततः शीघ्रं यत्र सुग्रीवराघवौ । विभीषणमवष्टभ्य हनूमन्तं च लक्ष्मणः ।।
data.es: Then Valiant and mighty Lakshmana called Jambavantha, Hanumantha, all the Vanaras, following Vibheeshana and Hanuman quickly reached Sugriva and Raghava.
data.anv: ततः then, वीर्यवान् valiant, महातेजाः mighty, सःलक्ष्मणः that Lakshmana, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavantha, हनूमन्तं च and Hanumantha, सर्वान् all, तान् them, वनौकसः च Vanaras, संनिपत्य calling, ततः that, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, हनूमन्तं च Hanuman, अवष्टभ्य following, सुग्रीवराघवौ Sugriva, Raghava यत्र there, शीघ्रम् quickly, आजगाम reached
data.md: Then supporting himself on Vibhīşana and Hanuman, the exceedingly powerful Lakşmaņa endowed with prowess, taking Jambavan, Hanuman and all the monkeys with him, speedily went to the place where Sugrīva and Raghava were.

data.v: ततो राममभिक्रम्य सौमित्रिरभिवाद्य च । तस्थौ भ्रातृसमीपस्थः शक्रस्येन्द्रानुजो यथा । आचचक्षे तदा वीरो घोरमिन्द्रजितो वधम् ।।
data.es: Thereafter Saumithri went close to Rama and offered prayers, like Indra's brother Upendra and stood close to his brother.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, सौमित्रिःSaumihri, रामम् to Rama, अभिक्रम्य went close, अभिवाद्य च and offered his prayers, शक्रस्य Indra's, अनुजोयथा like his brother Upendra, भ्रातृसमीपस्थः close to his brother, तस्थौ stood
data.md: Then going round Rāma and saluted him, Sumitra's son stood before his brother, like Indra's brother staying before Sakra.

data.v: रावणस्तु शिरश्छिन्नं लक्ष्मणेन महात्मना । न्यवेदयत रामाय तदा हृष्टो विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Then Vibheeshana gladly informed Rama that Ravana's son's head had been severed by great Lakshmana.
data.anv: तदा then, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, हृष्टः happy, महात्मना great self, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, रावणेः Ravana, शिरः head, छिन्नम् severed, रामाय to Rama, न्यवेदयत informed
data.md: Then the delighted Vibhişaņa related to Rāma how the high-souled Lakşmaņa had cut off the head of Ravana's son.

data.v: उपवेश्य तमुत्सङ्गे परिष्वज्यावपीडितम् । मूर्ध्नि चैनमुपाघ्राय भूयः संस्पृश्य च त्वरन् । उवाच लक्ष्मणं वाक्यमाश्वास्य पुरुषर्षभः ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, a bull among men, body tormented by arrows, immersed in pain, breathing heavily. Rama stroking him, restoring his confidence, quickly spoke as follows.
data.anv: पुरुषर्षभः bull among men, शल्यसम्पीडितम् tormented body arrows, शस्तम् by arrows, निःश्वसन्तम् breathing heavily, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, दुःखसन्तप्तम् immersed in pain, निःश्वासपीडितम् breathing hard, तम् him, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, भूयःagain, संस्पृश्य stroking him, आश्वास्य restoring his confidence, त्वरन्quickly, वाक्यम् words, उवाच spoke
data.md: And moved with grief, that best of persons, Rama, smelling head of Laksmana, wounded with darts and having his person pierced (with salms, sighing and breathing hard-and nursing ms body with his hand, addressed Laksmana, soothing him.

data.v: कृतं परमकल्याणं कर्म दुष्करकारिणा । निरमित्रः कृतोऽस्म्यद्य निर्यास्यति हि रावणः । बलव्यूहेन महता श्रुत्वा पुत्रं निपातितम् ।।
data.es: 'Hero! In three days and nights indeed, you have made short of Indrajith. Hearing that Ravana's son has been made short of, Ravana will come now with large army troops.'
data.anv: वीरः hero, त्रिभिः three, अहोरात्रैः nights, कथञ्चित् indeed, विनिपातितः made short, अद्य now, निरमित्रः rid of enemy, कृतःdoneअस्मि I, रावणः Ravana's, पुत्रम् son, निपातितम् made short, श्रुत्वा hearing, महता large, बलव्यूहेन army troop निर्यास्यतिहि will come and return

data.v: तं पुत्रवधसंतप्तं निर्यान्तं राक्षसाधिपम् । बलेनावृत्य महता निहनिष्यामि दुर्जयम् ।।
data.es: 'On hearing of his son's death, the Rakshasa Lord will come forth with a huge army. Turning towards him I will put an end to him.'
data.anv: पुत्रवधसन्तप्तम् sad about son's death, निर्यान्तम् coming forth, दुर्जयम् difficult to win, तं him राक्षसाधिपम् Rakshasa Lord, महता huge, बलेन with army, आवृत्य turning towards, निहनिष्यामि will put an end to him
data.md: Rāvana will for certain sally out, hearing his son brought down. That unconquerable lord of Rakşasas, aggrieved for the destruction of his son, marching out, shall I slay, environed with a mighty force.

data.v: त्वया लक्ष्मण नाथेन सीता च पृथिवी च मे । न दुष्प्रापा हते त्वद्य शक्रजेतरि चाहवे ।।
data.es: Lakshmana, with you as my protector and Indra's enemy killed, neither Sita nor earth will be difficult to get back.
data.anv: लक्ष्मण Lakshmana, नाथेन protector, त्वया by you, आहवे myself, तस्मिन् your शक्रजेतरि Indra's enemy, हते killed, मे my, सीता Sita, पृथिवी च and earth also, दुष्प्रापा difficult, न not
data.md: O Lakşmaņa, the conqueror of Sakra having in battle been slain by you-who are my lord-Sītā and the entire) earth are not incapable of being obtained by me.

data.v: स तं भ्रातरमाश्वास्य पारिष्वज्य च राघवः । रामः सुषेणं मुदितः समाभाष्येदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Rama, the celebrated scion of Raghu dynasty, restored the confidence of Lakshmana and embraced him happily. He invited Sushena and spoke as follows.
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, सःरामः that Rama, तंभ्रातरम् his brother, आश्वास्य restored confidence, परिष्वज्य च embraced, मुदितः happily, सुषेणम् Sushena, समाभाष्य inviting, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Having thus soothed and embraced his brother, Raghu's son Rama highly rejoiced calling Suşeņa said.

data.v: सशल्योऽयं महाप्राज्ञः सौमित्रिर्मित्रवत्सलः । यथा भवति सुस्वस्थस्तथा त्वं समुपाचर । विशल्यः क्रियतां क्षिप्रं सौमित्रिः सविभीषणः ।।
data.es: "O very wise Sushena! Treat Saumithri in such a way that this Lakshmana, loved by friends pained by the arrows pierced, will be relieved."
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः very wise, मित्रवत्सलः loved by friends, सशल्यः those arrows, अयंसौमित्रिः this Saumithri, सुस्वस्थः paining, यथा like this, भवति you may, तथा that way, त्वम् you, समुपाचर treat him
data.md: Do you so act that this highly wise son of Sumitrā, devoted to his friends, may be healed and be eased.

data.v: कृष वानरसैन्यानां शूराणां द्रुमयोधिनाम् । ये चान्येऽत्र च युध्यन्तः सशल्या व्रणिनस्तथा । तेऽपि सर्वे प्रयत्नेन क्रियन्तां सुखिनस्त्वया ।।
data.es: "Let Vibheeshana and Saumithri be treated quickly. Let all the army of Bears and others who fought with trees, and the heroes be treated. Let all others who fought in the battlefield and wounded be also healed by your effort and make them happy."
data.anv: सविभीषणः that Vibheeshana, सौमित्रिः Saumithri, क्षिप्रम् quickly, विशल्यः, क्रियताम् be treated, ऋक्ष्वानरसैन्यानाम् army of Bears, द्रुमयोधिनाम् who fight with trees, शूराणाम् heroes, ये च they also, अन्ये others, अत्र there, युध्यन्ति in the battle, सशल्याः the arrows, तथा so also, व्रणिनः wounds, तेसर्वेऽपि of all also, तथा so also, प्रयत्नेन by effort, सुखिनः make happy, क्रियन्ताम् healed
data.md: Do you without delay heal Sumitra's son, attached to his friends, of his wounds. And do you also carefully relieve all those heroes in the army of bears and monkeys fighting with trees, as well as others, who have been wounded and have got sores (in consequence).

data.v: एवमुक्तः स रामेण महात्मा हरियूथपः । लक्ष्मणाय ददौ नस्तः सुषेणः परमौषधम् ।।
data.es: Spoken by Rama in that manner, the great Vanara leader, Sushena gave supreme medicine to Lakshman through his nose.
data.anv: रामेण by Rama, एवम् in that way, उक्तः spoken, महात्मा great self, हरियूथपःVanara leader, सःसुषेणः that Sushena, लक्ष्मणाय to Lakshman, नस्तः through nose, परमौषधम् supreme medicine, ददौ gave
data.md: Thus addressed by Rāma, the high-souled monkey-leader administered a potent medicine to the nose of Laksmana.

data.v: स तस्य गन्धमाघ्राय विशल्यः समपद्यत । तदा निर्वेदनश्चैव संरूढव्रण एव च ।।
data.es: He then inhaled the fragrance and got freed from arrows, the pain of wounds and restored to normal state.
data.anv: सः he, तदा then, तस्य his, गन्धम् fragrance, आघ्राय breathing in, विशल्यः, निर्वेदनश्चैव freed from arrows, संरूढव्रणएव च rid of pain from wounds, समपद्यत restored to normal state
data.md: And smelling the same, he got healed; he was relieved of his pain and his outgoing vitality was shut up.

data.v: विभीषण मुखानां च सुहृदां राघवाज्ञया । सर्ववानरमुख्यानां चिकित्सां स तदाकरोत् ।।
data.es: Then by Rama's order Vibheeshana and other friends and all Vanara leaders were healed.
data.anv: तदा then, राघवाज्ञज्नाया by Rama's order, विभीषणमुखानाम् Vibheeshana and other leaders, सुहृदाम् friends, सर्ववानरमुख्यानाम् all Vanara leaders, चिकित्साम् having treated, अकरोत् performed
data.md: At the mandate of Rāghava he likewise treated his friends headed by Vibhișaņa and all the principal monkeys.

data.v: ततः प्रकृतिमापन्नो हृतशल्यो गतव्यथः । सौमित्रिर्मुदितस्तत्र क्षणेन विगतज्वरः ।।
data.es: Then Saumithri, freed from arrows, relieved from pain, anguish gone in a moment, and naturally restored, was happy.
data.anv: ततः then, सौमित्रिः Saumithri, हृतशल्यः freed from arrows, गतव्यथ: relieved from pain, विगतज्वरः anguish gone, क्षणेन in a moment, प्रकृतिम् nature, आपन्नः having restored, तत्र there, मुमुदे happy
data.md: And restored to his natural condition, Sumitrā's son, healed, and with his exhaustion removed, and his suffering gone off in a moment, experienced exhilaration of spirits.

data.v: तथैव रामः प्लवगाधिपस्तदा; विभीषणश्चर्क्षपतिश्च जाम्बवान् । अवेक्ष्य सौमित्रिमरोगमुत्थितं; मुदा ससैन्यः सुचिरं जहर्षिरे ।।
data.es: At that time, Rama, also the monkey leader, and Vibheeshana, Jambavan with their army seeing Lakshmana getting up, free from wounds were full of joy.
data.anv: तदैव at that time, रामः Rama, तथा so also, प्लवगाधिपः monkey leader, विभीषणश्च at Vibheeshana, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, क्षपतिश्च with their, ससैन्याः with army, आरोगम् free from wounds, उथतितम् getting up, सौमित्रिम् Saumithri, आवेक्ष्य seeing, सुचिरम् long time, जहर्षिरे full of joy
data.md: Rāma and the monkey-king and Vibhīşaņa! and the powerful lord of bears along with their hosts, seeing Sumitrā's son risen hale, rejoiced greatly in delight.

data.v: अपूजयत्कर्म स लक्ष्मणस्य; सुदुष्करं दाशरथिर्महात्मा । हृष्टा बभूवुर्युधि यूथपेन्द्रा; निशम्य तं शक्रजितं निपातितम् ।।
data.md: The high-souled son of Dasaratha honoured exceedingly that exceedingly hard feat of Laks amana; and the monkey-king, hearing that the conqueror of Sakra had fallen in fight, was filled with joy.

data.v: ततः पौलस्त्य सचिवाः श्रुत्वा चेन्द्रजितं हतम् । आचचक्षुरभिज्ञाय दशग्रीवाय सव्यथाः ।।
data.es: Then, having known about the distressing fall of Indrajith, the ministers of Ravana reported to the tenheaded Ravana.
data.anv: ततः then, पौलस्त्यसचिवाः ministers of Paulastya (Ravana of Paulastya dynasty), इन्द्रजितःIndrajith, वधम् killed, श्रुत्वा hearing, सव्यथा: distressing, अभिज्ञाय having known, दशग्रीवाय to tenheaded Ravana, आचचक्षुः reported
data.md: Then the counsellors of Pulastya's son, hearing of Indrajit having been slain, speedily conveyed the tidings to the Ten-necked one, who was ignorant* of the same.

data.v: युद्धे हतो महाराज लक्ष्मणेन तवात्मजः । विभीषणसहायेन मिषतां नो महाद्युते ।।
data.es: "O King! Your glorious son was killed by Lakshmana with the assistance of Vibheeshana, as we were witnessing."
data.anv: महाराज O King, तव your, महाद्युतिः highly glorious, आत्मजः son, युद्धे in battle, नः not, मिषताम् all of us were seeing, विभीषणसहायेन assisted by Vibheeshana, लक्ष्मणेन by Lakshmana, हतः killed
data.md: O mighty monarch, in our very sight your exceedingly effulgent son has been slain by Lakş maņa with the help of Vibhīşaņa.

data.v: शूरः शूरेण संगम्य संयुगेष्वपराजितः । लक्ष्णनेन हतः शूरः पुत्रस्ते विबुधेन्द्रजित् ।।
data.es: "Your son who has never been defeated in war, who won Indra, the ruler of gods, after fighting and fighting was killed by Lakshmana's arrows. He has ascended to the higher world."
data.anv: शूरः arrows, सम्युगेषु in war, अपराजितः never defeated, तेपुत्रः your son, विबुधेन्द्रिजित् who won the ruler of gods, सम्गम्य fighting and fighting, हतः killed, सः he, शरैः arrows, लक्ष्मणम् by Lakshmana, सन्ताप्य ascended, परमान् लोकान् higher world, गतः went
data.md: That hero confronted by the (other) heros, has been vanquished in fight. And the hero, you son, the conqueror of the celestial chief, has also been slain by Lakşmaņa. And having gratified Lakş maņa with his shafts, he has repaired to the supreme regions.

data.v: स तं प्रतिभयं श्रुत्वा वधं पुत्रस्य दारुणम् । घोरमिन्द्रजितः संख्ये कश्मलं प्राविशन्महत् ।।
data.es: On hearing about the enumeration of his son Indrajith's dreadful, frightening and ghastly end, Ravana gave way to swoon.
data.anv: सः he, सङ्ख्ये enumeration, पुत्रस्य about his son, इन्द्रजितः Indrajith, प्रतिभयम् frightening, दारुणम् dreadful, घोरम् ghastly, तंवधम् that killing, श्रुत्वा on hearing, महत् great, कश्मलम् swoon, प्राविशत् gave way
data.md: Hearing of that mighty terror, viz., the rueful and dreadful destruction of his son, "Indrajit, in battle, he straightway swooned away.

data.v: उपलभ्य चिरात्संज्ञां राजा राक्षसपुंगवः । पुत्रशोकार्दितो दीनो विललापाकुलेन्द्रियः ।।
data.es: Thereafter the foremost of the Rakshasas regained consciousness with great difficulty and awakened to the situation of Kumbhakarna's destruction, wailed disturbed in mind.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, राक्षसपुङ्गवः foremost of Rakshasas, कृच्छ्रात् with great difficulty, संज्ञाम् regaining, समासाद्य awakening, कुम्भकर्णवधात् Kumbhakarna's killing, दीनः desperate, आकुलेन्द्रियः disturbed in mind, विललाप wailed.
data.md: Then regaining his consciousness after a long while, that foremost of Räkşasas-the kingover-whelmed with grief for his son, and distressed, burst into lamentations, with his senses wildered, thus.

data.v: हा राक्षसचमूमुख्य मम वत्स महारथ । जित्वेन्द्रं कथमद्य त्वं लक्ष्मणस्य वशं गतः ।।
data.es: 'My son who was a chief of the Rakshasa army, a mighty one, who has won even Indra, how has he become a victim of Lakshmana'?
data.anv: हा ha, राक्षसचमूमुख्य Rakshasa army chief, ममवत्स my son, महाबल might, इन्द्रम् Indra, जित्वा had won, त्वम् such, अद्य now, कथम् how, लक्ष्मणस्य Lakshmana's, वशंगतः was a victim
data.md: O foremost in the Räkşasa army! O my child endowed with high might! Having conquered Indra himself, wherefore today have you come under the sway of Lakşmaņa?

data.v: ननु त्वमिषुभिः क्रुद्धो भिन्द्याः कालान्तकावपि । मन्दरस्यापि शृङ्गाणि किं पुनर्लक्ष्मणं रणे ।।
data.es: 'When angry, you could pierce with arrows even the time spirit or peak of Mandara mountain, why to speak of Lakshmana again'?
data.anv: क्रुद्धः angry, त्वम् you, इषुभिः arrows, कालान्तकौअपि like time spirit, मन्दरस्य Mandara mountain, शृङ्गाण्यपि the peak of, भिन्द्याः will pierce, ननुयुधि in battle, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, किंपुनः why again
data.md: Doubtless, you enraged could pierce with you arrows the Destroyer of Time himself, and the summit of Mandāra, what shall I say of Laks mana in encounted?

data.v: अद्य वैवस्वतो राजा भूयो बहुमतो मम । येनाद्य त्वं महाबाहो संयुक्तः कालधर्मणा ।।
data.es: 'O mighty armed! Today by virtue of time you have joined Yama and become esteemed King'.
data.anv: महाबाहो mightyarmed, येन by this, अद्य today, त्वम् you, कालधर्मणा by virtue of Time, संयुक्तः joining, वैवस्वतः Yama, राजा king, मम my, अद्य today, भूयः become, बहुमतः esteemed
data.md: Today king Vivasvata has raised himself immensely in my estimation, for today he, O mighty-armed one, has brought you under the law of Time.

data.v: एष पन्थाः सुयोधानां सर्वामरगणेष्वपि । यः कृते हन्यते भर्तुः स पुमान्स्वर्गमृच्छति ।।
data.es: 'Killed in war for the cause of the king and treading the path of noble warriors, one attains the heaven. Even for a human it is desirable'.
data.anv: सर्वामरगणेष्वपि noble warriors, सुयोधानाम् path trodden, एषःin that way, पन्थाः path, यः that which, भर्तुःकृते for the king, हन्यते is killed, सःपुमान् man, स्वर्गम् heaven, ऋच्छति attains
data.md: But this is the way of capable warriors as well as celestials. He that lay down his life for his lord, repair to heaven.

data.v: अद्य देवगणाः सर्वे लोकपालास्तथर्षयः । हतमिन्द्रजितं दृष्ट्वा सुखं स्वप्स्यन्ति निर्भयाः ।।
data.es: 'Today, seeing Indrajith killed, Devatas in heaven, guardians of the worlds, great sages would be fearless and be happy and comfortable'.
data.anv: अद्य today, इन्द्रजितम् Indrajith, हतम् killed, दृष्टवा seeing, सर्वे all, देवगणाः Devatas in heaven groups, लोकपालाः guardians of the worlds, महर्षयः great sages, निर्भयाः fearless, सुखम् happy, स्वप्स्यन्ति comfortably
data.md: To-day seeing Indrajit slain, the deities and the guardians of the worlds, and the mighty saints, their fear gone off, shall sleep peacefully.

data.v: अद्य लोकास्त्रयः कृत्स्नाः पृथिवी च सकानना । एकेनेन्द्रजिता हीना शूण्येव प्रतिभाति मे ।।
data.es: Today without Indrajith alone the three worlds (earth, heaven, and underworld) including forests are desolate, dark, and lustreless to me.
data.anv: अद्य today, एकेन alone, इन्द्रजिता Indrajith, हीना without, सकानना forest, कृत्स्ना dark, पृथिवी earth, मे me, शून्येव desolate, प्रतिभाति lustreless, त्रयः three, लोकाः worlds
data.md: This triple world and this entire earth with her woods, reft of one—Indrajit—appear to me as vacant.

data.v: अद्य नैरृतकन्यायां श्रोष्याम्यन्तःपुरे रवम् । करेणुसंघस्य यथा निनादं गिरिगह्वरे ।।
data.es: 'Today in the gynaecium we will hear the cries of Rakshasa maidens like the roaring of elephants in the cave'.
data.anv: अद्य today, अन्तःपुरे in the gynaecium, नैरृतकन्यानाम् Rakshasa maidens, रवम् cries, गिरिगह्वरे in the caves, करेणुसङ्घस्य like elephants, निनादंयथा roaring like, श्रोष्यामि will hear
data.md: To-day shall I hear the cries of the daughters of the Naiſtas in my inner apartment, like to the roars of she-elephants in a mountain-cavern.

data.v: यौवराज्यं च लङ्कां च रक्षांसि च परंतप । मातरं मां च भार्यां च क्व गतोऽसि विहाय नः ।।
data.es: 'O Scourge of enemies! You have left giving up prince regent, Rakshasas, from Lanka, your mother, me, and your wife also. And went. Why'?
data.anv: परन्तप scourge of enemies, यौवराज्यं च prince regent, लङ्कां च from Lanka, रक्षांसि च Rakshasas of Lanka, मातरम् mother, मां च me also, भार्याश्च wife also, नःविहाय left, क्व why, गतःwent असि you
data.md: Renouncing your state of an heir-apparent, and Lanka and Raksasas, O subduer of enemies, and your mother, and me, and your wifewhither have you gone, (leaving) us all?

data.v: मम नाम त्वया वीर गतस्य यमसादनम् । प्रेतकार्याणि कार्याणि विपरीते हि वर्तसे ।।
data.es: 'O hero! My obsequies should have been done by you. It is peculiar that I have to perform'.
data.anv: वीर hero, यमसादनम् abode of Yama, तस्य its, मम my, प्रेतकार्याणि obsequies, त्वया by you, कार्याणि performed, विपरीते peculiar, वर्तसेहि I have to do
data.md: O hero, I having gone to the region of Yama, you ought to have performed my last rites, but you stand in a relation the very reverse of this.* *i.e. I have to perform your last rites, you having fallen in fight while I am alive.

data.v: स त्वं जीवति सुग्रीवे राघवे च सलक्ष्मणे । मम शल्यमनुद्धृत्य क्व गतोऽसि विहाय नः ।।
data.es: 'While Sugriva is living, Lakshmana and Raghava also, deserting me, you have gone. Where have you gone'?
data.anv: सःत्वम् you, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, जीवति living, लक्ष्मणेन Lakshmana, राघवे Raghava, मम me, शल्यम् arrow, अनुद्धृत्य deserting, नः not, विहाय doing, क्व where, गतःअसि have you gone
data.md: And Sugriva living and Lakşmana and Raghava, without extracting my dart, whither have you gone, leaving us all?

data.v: एवमादिविलापार्तं रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् । आविवेश महान्कोपः पुत्रव्यसनसंभवः ।।
data.es: Distressed Ravana was lamenting in this way on account of his son deserting, as anger had taken over him.
