data.es: His eyes are naturally dreadful, deluded with fire of anger his form was like Rudra's and threatening.
data.anv: प्रकृत्या naturally, घोरम् dreadful, क्रोधाग्निमूर्छितम् deluded with fire of anger, तस्य his, तत् रूपम् that form, क्रुद्धस्य due to fury, रुद्रस्यइव like Rudra's, दुरासदम् threatening, बभूवappeared
data.md: And his form, terrific by nature, in consequence of the fire of his wrath having possessed it entirely, resembled the form of the enraged Rudra.

data.v: तस्य क्रुद्धस्य नेत्राभ्यां प्रापतन्नस्रबिन्दवः । दीप्ताभ्यामिव दीपाभ्यां सार्चिषः स्नेहबिन्दवः ।।
data.es: Just as drops of oil drop from flaming lamps, tears dropped from his enraged flaming eyes.
data.anv: क्रुद्धस्य enraged, तस्य his, नेत्राभ्याम् from both eyes, दीप्ताभ्याम् flaming, दीपाभ्याम् flaming lamp, सार्चिषः flaming, स्नेहबिन्दवः drops of oil, अश्रुबिन्दवः drops of tears, प्रापतन् dropped
data.md: And from the eyes of that infuriated one fell drops of tears as drop from a flaming lamp drops of burning oil.

data.v: दन्तान्विदशतस्तस्य श्रूयते दशनस्वनः । यन्त्रस्यावेष्ट्यमानस्य महतो दानवैरिव ।।
data.es: When he was biting on his teeth (enraged), the sound from his teeth resembled the sound of a grinder revolved round by Danavas.
data.anv: दन्तान् teeth, विदशतः biting, तस्य his, दशनस्वनः sound from his teeth, दानवैः by Danavas, आवेष्ट्यमाणस्य revolved round, महतः huge, यन्त्रस्येव machine like, श्रूयते heard
data.md: As the grinded his teeth, the gnashing resembled the sounds sent by the machine* drawn by the Dänavas and churing the deep. *Meaning the mountain Mandara.

data.v: कालाग्निरिव संक्रुद्धो यां यां दिशमवैक्षत । तस्यां तस्यां भयत्रस्ता राक्षसाः संनिलिल्यिरे ।।
data.es: Fearing Ravana who was enraged like the time of universal destruction, the Rakshasashid themselves in the very quarter he was looking.
data.anv: कालानगिरिव like fire of universal destruction, सङ्क्रुद्धः highly enraged, यांयाम् wherever, दिशम् direction, अवैक्षत looking, तस्यांतस्याम् in those and those, राक्षसाः Rakshasa, भयत्रस्ताः fearing, संविलियलिरे hid themselves
data.md: The Rakşasas durst not approach that one eyeing round and resembling the Destroyer himself, intent on devouring both mobile and immobile.

data.v: तमन्तकमिव क्रुद्धं चराचरचिखादिषुम् । वीक्षमाणं दिशः सर्वा राक्षसा नोपचक्रमुः ।।
data.es: The Rakshasas could not go near Ravana who was moving in anger in all directions like the moving and unmoving creations move when chased by the god of death.
data.anv: चराचरचिखादिषुम् moving and unmoving creation, क्रुद्धम् angry, अन्तकमिव like god of death, सर्वाःall, दिशःdirections, वीक्षमाणम् looking, तम् him, राक्षसाः Rakshasas, नोपचक्रमुःcould not go near
data.md: The Rakşasas durst not approach that one eyeing round and resembling the Destroyer himself, intent on devouring both mobile and immobile.

data.v: ततः परमसंक्रुद्धो रावणो राक्षसाधिपः । अब्रवीद्रक्षसां मध्ये संस्तम्भयिषुराहवे ।।
data.es: To provoke Rakshasas for battle, an angry Ravana, the king of Rakshasas, spoke as follows.
data.anv: ततः then, परमसङ्क्रुद्धः very angry, राक्षसाधिपः Rakshasa king, रावणः Ravana, आहवे battle, संस्तंभयिषुः provoke, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, मध्ये midst, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Then exceedingly enraged, Ravana-lord of Rākşasas-spoke in the midst of the Räkşasas, inciting them to battle.

data.v: मया वर्षसहस्राणि चरित्वा दुश्चरं तपः । तेषु तेष्ववकाशेषु स्वयम्भूः परितोषितः ।।
data.es: 'I have done penance for thousands of years several times and am a pleased selfborn creator'.
data.anv: मया by me, वर्षसहस्राणि thousand years, परमम् supreme, तपः austerities, चरित्वा having done, तेषुतेषु several times, अवकाशेषु in that occasion, स्वयम्भूः selfborn creator, परितोषितःpleased him
data.md: I practised severe austerities for thousands of years; and gratified the Self-sprung at times.

data.v: तस्यैव तपसो व्युष्ट्या प्रसादाच्च स्वयम्भुवः । नासुरेभ्यो न देवेभ्यो भयं मम कदाचन ।।
data.es: 'By the power of the penancedone by me once, creator Brahma has given me reward, pleased with my penance. I have no fear of Asuras or Devas'.
data.anv: तस्य by that, तपसःएव penance alone, वुष्ट्या power, स्वयम्भुवःcreator Brahma, प्रसादाच्छhaving been pleased, मम to me, कदाचनonce, असुरेभ्यः from Asuras, भयम् fear, न not, देवेभ्यः Devas, न no
data.md: Neither from Asuras nor from celestials can any fear spring to me.

data.v: कवचं ब्रह्मदत्तं मे यदादित्यसमप्रभम् । देवासुरविमर्देषु न भिन्नं वज्रशक्तिभिः ।।
data.es: 'I was given a shield by Brahma, effulgent like the Sun which the Devas or Danavas could not break with their thunderbolt fists'.
data.anv: मे I, ब्रह्मदत्तम् given by Brahma, आदित्यसमप्रभम् effulgent like sun, यत् that which, कवचम् shield, देवासुरविमर्धेषु Deva and Asura conflicts, वज्रमुष्टिभिः thunder bolts in their fists, न भिन्नम् not break
data.md: My mail conferred on me by Brahma, which in effulgence resembles the Sun himself, was not broken by blows like to thunder-bolt at the war between the deities and demons.

data.v: तेन मामद्य संयुक्तं रथस्थमिह संयुगे । प्रतीयात्कोऽद्य मामाजौ साक्षादपि पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: 'Today if I, with that shield mounted the chariot go for battle, who can dare to withstand me openly? Even Indra can't'.
data.anv: अद्य today, इह here, सम्युगे in battle, तेन by that, सम्युक्तम् together, रथस्थम् mounted on chariot, माम् me, अद्य today, कः who, आजौ can dare to oppose,, साक्षात् openly, पुरन्दरः Indra, अपि also, प्रतीयात् dare to with stand
data.md: Today who will come forward against me in battle accoutred in that and mounted on a car in the conflict? Not even Purandara himself.

data.v: यत्तदाभिप्रसन्नेन सशरं कार्मुकं महत् । देवासुरविमर्देषु मम दत्तं स्वयम्भुवा ।।
data.es: 'Let that supreme bow and the great arrows bestowed to me, by Brahma the creator who was pleased, when I fought in battle between Devas and Asuras, be brought to destroy Rama and Lakshmana today accompanied by hundreds of trumpets.'
data.anv: देवासुरविमर्धेषु when Devas and Asuras fought, तदा then, अतिप्रसन्नेन very pleased, स्वयम्भुवा creator Brahma, सशरम् that arrow, महत् great, यत् which, कार्मुकम् bow, परमाहवे supreme one, रामलक्ष्मणयोः with Rama and Lakshmana, वधायैव for destruction, अद्य today, तूर्यशतैः hundreds of trumpets, उत्थाप्यताम् be brought
data.md: Do you, beating hundreds of drums, today raise that mighty and dreadful bow of mine which, with arrows, had been bestowed on one by the gratified Self-sprung at the war of the gods and Asuras, so that I may therewith compass the destruction of Rama and Lakşmaņa in mighty battle.

data.v: अद्य तूर्यशतैर्भीमं धनुरुत्थाप्यतां महत् । रामलक्ष्मणयोरेव वधाय परमाहवे ।।
data.es: 'Let that supreme bow and the great arrows bestowed to me, by Brahma the creator who was pleased, when I fought in battle between Devas and Asuras, be brought to destroy Rama and Lakshmana today accompanied by hundreds of trumpets.'
data.anv: देवासुरविमर्धेषु when Devas and Asuras fought, तदा then, अतिप्रसन्नेन very pleased, स्वयम्भुवा creator Brahma, सशरम् that arrow, महत् great, यत् which, कार्मुकम् bow, परमाहवे supreme one, रामलक्ष्मणयोः with Rama and Lakshmana, वधायैव for destruction, अद्य today, तूर्यशतैः hundreds of trumpets, उत्थाप्यताम् be brought
data.md: Do you, beating hundreds of drums, today raise that mighty and dreadful bow of mine which, with arrows, had been bestowed on one by the gratified Self-sprung at the war of the gods and Asuras, so that I may therewith compass the destruction of Rama and Lakşmaņa in mighty battle.

data.v: स पुत्रवधसंतप्तः शूरः क्रोधवशं गतः । समीक्ष्य रावणो बुद्ध्या सीतां हन्तुं व्यवस्यत ।।
data.es: Pondering over the death of his asura son, Ravana was overtaken by fury, and reviwed thinking about the destruction of Vaidehi.
data.anv: पुत्रवधसन्तप्तः pondering over the death of son, शूरः asura, सःरावणः that Ravana, क्रोधवशम् overtaken by fury, गतःwent, बुद्ध्या thinking in mind, समीक्ष्य reviewed, वैदेह्याःVaidehi's, वधम् destruction, रोचयत् thought
data.md: And burning in grief for the destruction of his son, and coming under masterdom of passion, that hero-Ravana-reflecting (awhile) in his mind, resolved upon slaying Vaidehi.

data.v: प्रत्यवेक्ष्य तु ताम्राक्षः सुघोरो घोरदर्शनान् । दीनो दीनस्वरान्सर्वांस्तानुवाच निशाचरान् ।।
data.es: Redeyed Ravana, looking dreadful with a frightening face, desperate, spoke in a low voice to all Rakshasas as follows.
data.anv: ताम्राक्षः redeyed, सुघोरः very dreadful, घोरदर्शनः frightening looks, दीनः despearte, दीनस्वरान् in low voice, तान् he, सर्वान् all, निशाचरान् Rakshasas, प्रत्यवेक्ष्य looking at, उवाच spoke
data.md: And eyeing round, that copper-eyed and dreadful one of a terrific aspect, distressed, in a piteous voice addressed all the night-rangers, saying.

data.v: मायया मम वत्सेन वञ्चनार्थं वनौकसाम् । किंचिदेव हतं तत्र सीतेयमिति दर्शितम् ।।
data.es: 'My son showed the Vanaras there something which had been killed there to hoodwink as Sita."
data.anv: मम my, वत्सेन son, मायया by hoodwinking, वनौकसाम् the Vanaras, वञ्चनार्थम् to cheat them, तत्र there, किञ्चिदेव something which was there, हतम् killed, इयम् this, सीताइति Sita, दर्शितम् showed
data.md: By his power of illusion, my beloved child, for deceiving the wood-rangers, slaying something (else), had shown it to them as Sītā.

data.v: तदिदं सत्यमेवाहं करिष्ये प्रियमात्मनः । वैदेहीं नाशयिष्यामि क्षत्रबन्धुमनुव्रताम् । इत्येवमुक्त्वा सचिवान्खड्गमाशु परामृशत् ।।
data.es: "I myself will rejoice now in the same way (as Indarjith had done for cheating) making it true. I will destroy that lowly kshatriya, Rama's very dear Vaidehi". Having spoken like that to the ministers he took up the sword."
data.anv: अहम् I, आत्मनः myself, प्रियम् rejoice, तत् इदम् that now, तथ्यमेव in the same way, करिष्ये will do, क्षत्रबन्धुम् lowly kshatriya, अनुव्रताम् very dear, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, नाशयिष्यामि will destroy, सचिवान् ministers, इत्येवम् thus, उक्त्वा spoken, आशु his, खङ्गम् sword, परामृशत्taken
data.md: Now will I do that good office myself, Vaidehi will I slay-even her that is devoted to that friend of Ksatriyas.

From grief for his son. Råvana with his consciousness wilderd, taking up a sword; in rage, rushed towards the place where Mithila's daughter was.

data.v: व्रजन्तं राक्षसं प्रेक्ष्य सिंहनादं प्रचुक्रुशुः । ऊचुश्चान्योन्यमाश्लिष्य संक्रुद्धं प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसाः ।।
data.es: ( As Ravana marched) the Rakshasas in the abode roared like a lion seeing enraged Ravana and embraced each other (thinking of Ravana's victory) and spoke to one another.

data.md: Seeing the Räksasa rising on, some, emitted leonine roars, and seeing the Räkşasa enraged, embracing each other, said-"To-day those two brothers, seeing this one, will be exceedingly pained.

data.v: अद्यैनं तावुभौ दृष्ट्वा भ्रातरौ प्रव्यथिष्यतः । लोकपाला हि चत्वारः क्रुद्धेनानेन निर्जिताः । बहवः शत्रवश्चान्ये संयुगेष्वभिपातिताः ।।
data.es: "Seeing Ravana, the two brothers will tremble. By Ravana's fury all the four rulers of the world (Indra, Yama, Varuna, Kubera), would have disappeared. He has struck down many other enemies in wars."
data.anv: अद्य now, एनम् that, दृष्टवा seeing, तौ those two, भ्रातरौ brothers, उभौ both, प्रव्यथिष्यतःtremble, क्रुद्धेन fury, अनेन all the, चत्वारःfour, लोकपालाः ruler of the world, तर्जिताःहि would have disappeared, अन्ये others, बहवः many, शत्रवश्चापि enemies, संयुगेषु in wars, अभिपातिताःstruck down
data.md: By this one influenced with passion were the four guardians of the worlds conquered; and many other foes were brought down in battle.

data.v: तेषां संजल्पमानानामशोकवनिकां गताम् । अभिदुद्राव वैदेहीं रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः ।।
data.es: As the Rakshasas were talking in that manner, Ravana, deluded with anger, went fast to Vaidehi in Ashoka grove.
data.anv: तेषाम् in that manner, सञ्जल्पमानानाम् talking to each other, रावणः Ravana, क्रोधमूर्छितः deluded with anger, अशोकवनिकाम् Ashoka grove, गताम् went, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, अभिदुद्राव went fast
data.md: As they were speaking thus, Ravana, reft of his senses by wrath, rushed against Vaidehi, who had taken up her abode in the Asoka wood.

data.es: Highly enraged Ravana, darted just as planet Mars rushed to Rohini in the sky, even while his wellwishers were obstructing.

data.md: And dissuaded by his friends endowed with good intelligence, he wrought up with high wrath, darted (against Sītā), even as an enraged planet' rush against Rohinr in the firmament. 1. Kuja etc. 2. Hesperus.

data.v: यथायं मामभिक्रुद्धः समभिद्रवति स्वयम् । वधिष्यति सनाथां मामनाथामिव दुर्मतिः ।।
data.es: Thus spoke Sita filled with sorrow crying," This evil minded angry one is coming to me to kill me as though I am an orphan even though I have a protector."
data.anv: सीता Sita, दुःखसमाविष्टा filled with sorrow, विलपन्ती crying, इदम् this, अब्रवीत् spoke, दुर्मतिः evil minded, अयम् you are, अभिक्रुद्धः angry, यथा so also, माम् me, अभिद्रवति will kill, सनाथाम् with protector, माम् me, अनाथामिव like an orphan, वधिष्यति will kill

data.v: बहुशश्चोदयामास भर्तारं मामनुव्रताम् । भार्या भव रमस्येति प्रत्याख्यातोऽभवन्मया ।।
data.es: 'I who am devoted to my husband and this Ravana wanted me to revel with him. He has been entreated by me several times. Surely, he, having been rejected by me is dejected, filled with anger and infatuation, intends to kill me, is evident'.
data.anv: भर्तारम् husband, अनुव्रताम् devoted, माम् me, भवभार्या his consort, रमस्व revel, इति thus, बहुशः perhaps, चोदयामास entreated, मया by me, ध्रुवम् surely, प्रत्याख्यातः retaliated, सः him अयम् I, अनुपस्थाने having been rejected, माम् by me, व्यक्तम् said, नैराश्यम् dejected, आगतः has come, क्रोधमोहसमाविष्टः filled with anger and infatuation, निहन्तुम् to kill, माम् me, हन्तुम् kill, उद्यतः is evident
data.md: He did urge me much ever devoted to my lord saying Be you my wife; but forsooth I disregarded him.

data.v: सोऽयं मामनुपस्थानाद्व्यक्तं नैराश्यमागतः । क्रोधमोहसमाविष्टो निहन्तुं मां समुद्यतः ।।
data.es: 'I who am devoted to my husband and this Ravana wanted me to revel with him. He has been entreated by me several times. Surely, he, having been rejected by me is dejected, filled with anger and infatuation, intends to kill me, is evident'.
data.anv: भर्तारम् husband, अनुव्रताम् devoted, माम् me, भवभार्या his consort, रमस्व revel, इति thus, बहुशः perhaps, चोदयामास entreated, मया by me, ध्रुवम् surely, प्रत्याख्यातः retaliated, सः him अयम् I, अनुपस्थाने having been rejected, माम् by me, व्यक्तम् said, नैराश्यम् dejected, आगतः has come, क्रोधमोहसमाविष्टः filled with anger and infatuation, निहन्तुम् to kill, माम् me, हन्तुम् kill, उद्यतः is evident
data.md: And plainly in consequence of my refusal, he has given way to despair. And overcome by anger and passion, he is ready to slay me.

data.v: अथ वा तौ नरव्याघ्रौ भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । मन्निमित्तमनार्येण समरेऽद्य निपातितौ । अहो धिन्मन्निमित्तोऽयं विनाशो राजपुत्रयोः ।।
data.es: 'Or else, have the two brothers Rama and Lakshmana fallen to unworthy Ravana on my account'?
data.anv: अथवा or else, नरव्याघ्रौ tiger among men, भ्रातरौ brothers, तौरामलक्ष्मणौ both Rama and Lakshmana, अनार्येण unworthy Ravana, अद्य today, मन्निमित्तम् for my cause, समरे in war, निपातितौ fallen
data.md: Or it may be that today for me those foremost of men, the brothers-Rama and Laksmana-have been slain in encounter by this inglorious one.

data.v: हनूमतो हि तद्वाक्यं न कृतं क्षुद्रया मया । यद्यहं तस्य पृष्ठेन तदायासमनिन्दिता । नाद्यैवमनुशोचेयं भर्तुरङ्कगता सती ।।
data.es: 'I am a foolish woman. I did not follow Hanuman's advice and had I left mounted on his back, no doubt I would be on my husband 's lap. I did not think in this way'.
data.anv: क्षुद्रया foolish woman, मयाI am, हनूमतः Hanuman, तत् then, वाक्यम् words, न कृतम् not did, तदा then, अहम् I, अनिर्जिता mounted, तस्य on his, पृष्ठेन back, अयासंयदि no doubt, भर्तुः husband, अङ्कगतासती on the lap of husband, अद्य now, एवम् in this way, न अनुशोचेयम् not thought over
data.md: Fool that I am I did not then act agreeably to Hanumān's words. If I had gone away seated on his back, without waiting for the victory (of my lord). I devoted to him placed on his lap, should not have come by this repentance.

data.v: मन्ये तु हृदयं तस्याः कौसल्यायाः फलिष्यति । एकपुत्रा यदा पुत्रं विनष्टं श्रोष्यते युधि ।।
data.es: 'Kausalya will think her only son has been killed in the battle. I think her heart would break'.
data.anv: एकपुत्रा only son, यदा this, पुत्रम् son, युधि in battle, विनष्टम् perished, श्रोष्यते will think, तस्याः her, कौसल्यायाः Kausalya's, हृदयम् heart, फलिष्यति break, मन्ये I think
data.md: When Kausalya, having an only son, will hear of her son slain in battle, I fancy, her heart shall burst.

data.v: सा हि जन्म च बाल्यं च यौवनं च महात्मनः । धर्मकार्याणि रूपं च रुदती संस्रमिष्यति ।।
data.es: 'She will be crying and keep remembering his birth, childhood, youth, and his rightful actions, and his charm'.
data.anv: सा she, रुदती crying, महात्मनः great self, जन्म च of his birth, बाल्यं च of childhood also, यौवनं च of youth, धर्मकार्याणि his rightful actions, रूपं च his form, संस्मरिष्यति will keep remembering
data.md: And weeping she will remember that highsouled one's birth and weeping, she will remember that high-souled one's birth and boyhood, and youth and pious acts and loveliness.

data.v: निराशा निहते पुत्रे दत्त्वा श्राद्धमचेतना । अग्निमारोक्ष्यते नूनमपो वापि प्रवेक्ष्यति ।।
data.es: 'Son killed, Kausalya will be disappointed, lost sentience will be offering obsequies, surely and enter fire or water and drown'.
data.anv: पुत्रे O son, निहते killed, निराशा disappointed, अचेतना lost sentience, श्राद्धम् obsequies, दत्त्वा offering, नूनम् surely, अग्निम् in fire, आवेक्ष्यते will keep waiting, आपः water, प्रवेक्ष्यतिवापि may be drown herself
data.md: That one bereft of her consciousness, filled with despair, after having performed his srāddha,* will doubtless enter into fire or water. *Funereal rites performed in accordance with the injunctions of the Hindu Scriptures.

data.v: धिगस्तु कुब्जामसतीं मन्थरां पापनिश्चयाम् । यन्निमित्तमिदं दुःखं कौसल्या प्रतिपत्स्यते ।।
data.es: 'Because of the sinful resolve of hunch back Mandara, this grief has come to Kausalya surely. Let her be burnt'.
data.anv: कौसल्या Kausalya, यन्निमित्तम् for this reason, इमम् this great, शोकम् grief, प्रतिपत्स्यतेअसतीम् this grief was caused, पापनिश्चयाम् sinful resolve, कुब्जाम् hunchback, मन्थराम् Mandara, धिक् be burnt, अस्तु surely
data.md: Shame on the unchaste and hump-backed Manthara, having her heart fixed in sin, for whose sake this grief shat Rāvana's exercise Kausalya!

data.v: इत्येवं मैथिलीं दृष्ट्वा विलपन्तीं तपस्विनीम् । रोहिणीमिव चन्द्रेण विना ग्रहवशं गताम् ।।
data.es: Seeing Mythili in this manner grieving, just as Rohini fell under the sway of the Mars planet in the absence of the moon, being away from her husband, Suparsva, an upright minister of Ravana who was pure and wise spoke these words of advice to the Lord of Rakshasas in spite of other ministers trying to stop him.

data.v: सुपार्श्वो नाम मेधावी रावणं राक्षसेश्वरम् । निवार्यमाणं सचिवैरिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
कथं नाम दशग्रीव साक्षाद्वैश्रवणानुज । हन्तुमिच्छसि वैदेहीं क्रोधाद्धर्ममपास्य हि ।।
data.es: "You being the direct brother of Kubera (one of the guardians of the world), ten head Lord desires to seek Vaidehi in fury and kill her casting righteousness?"
data.anv: साक्षात् being direct, श्रवाणानुज brother of Kubera, दशग्रीव : ten headed, क्रोधात् in fury, धर्मम् righteousness, अपास्य casting, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, हन्तुम् kill, कथम् how, इच्छसि do you desire
data.md: Wherefore, O Ten-necked one, O you who are the very younger brother of Vaiśravaņa himself, Did you desire to slay Vaidehī, forsaking righteousness?

data.v: वेद विद्याव्रत स्नातः स्वधर्मनिरतः सदा । स्त्रियाः कस्माद्वधं वीर मन्यसे राक्षसेश्वर ।।
data.es: "O Hero! Lord of Rakshasas! You made a vow of celibacy essential for Vedic study, so also engaged in your obligatory duties. Do you think of killing a woman?"
data.anv: वीर hero, राक्षसेश्वर Lord of Rakshasas, वेदविद्याव्रतस्नातः made a vow of celibacy essential for study of vedic lore, तथा so also, स्वकर्मनिरतः engaged in you obligatory duties, कस्मात् how, स्त्रियः a woman, वधम् killing, मन्यसे think of
data.md: Why O hero! O lord of Rākşasas! having led the Brahmacarya mode of life, studied the Vedas, and returned from the house of your spiritual guide, and ever engaged in religious acts, today did you intend to slay a woman?

data.v: मैथिलीं रूपसंपन्नां प्रत्यवेक्षस्व पार्थिव । त्वमेव तु सहास्माभी राघवे क्रोधमुत्सृज ।।
data.es: "O King! Mythili is endowed with charm. Your anger may be exhibited on Rama in battle (not Sita)'."
data.anv: पार्थिव King, रूपसम्पन्नाम् endowed with charm, मैथिलीम् Mythili, प्रत्यवेक्षस्व think over, अस्माभिःसह you also, आहवे in battle, क्रोधम् anger, तस्मिन्नेन him only, उत्त्सृजexhibit
data.md: Do you, O king, now stay expecting Mithila's daughter' endowed with loveliness; and do you along with us vent your wrath on him." 1. Explains the commentator: till you slay Rāma in battle. 2. Rama.

data.v: अभ्युत्थानं त्वमद्यैव कृष्णपक्षचतुर्दशीम् । कृत्वा निर्याह्यमावास्यां विजयाय बलैर्वृतः ।।
data.es: "Today being the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, start on the next day that is the fifteenth dark day surrounded by the army and win."
data.anv: त्वम् you, अद्यैव in this way, कृष्णपक्षचतुर्दशीम् fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, अभ्युत्थानम् starting, कृत्वा doing, बलैः army, वृतः surrounded, अमावास्याम् on the fifteenth day, dark day, विजयाय victory, निर्याहि start
data.md: To-day being the fourteenth day of the dark fortnight, do you this very day prepare for conflict; at amăvāsyā,* environed with your forces do you march for victory. *i.e. tomorrow.

data.v: शूरो धीमान्रथी खड्गी रथप्रवरमास्थितः । हत्वा दाशरथिं रामं भवान्प्राप्स्यति मैथिलीम् ।।
data.es: "Shrewd carwarrior, you are wise. Seated in the foremost chariot with your sword, kill Dasharatha's son and attain Sita."
data.anv: शूरः shrewd warrior, धीमान् wise, रथी car warrior, खडगी sword, भावन् of yours, रथप्रवरम् foremost chariot, आस्थितः seated, दाशरथिम् Dasharatha's son, रामम् Rama, हत्वा kill, मैथिलीम् Mythili, प्राप्स्यसि attain
data.md: Heroic, and intelligent, a mighty car-warrior and swordsman, you, mounted on a car, slay the redoubtable son of Dasaratha, will obtain Mithilā's daughter.

data.v: स तद्दुरात्मा सुहृदा निवेदितं; वचः सुधर्म्यं प्रतिगृह्य रावणः । गृहं जगामाथ ततश्च वीर्यवा;न्पुनः सभां च प्रययौ सुहृद्वृतः ।।
data.md: Thus exhorted by his friend, the untighteous Rāvana accepted his virtuous speech; and then that powerful one went (back) to his house, and, surrounded by his friends, entered the court.

data.v: स प्रविश्य सभां राजा दीनः परमदुःखितः । निषसादासने मुख्ये सिंहः क्रुद्ध इव श्वसन् ।।
data.es: Ravana, the king entered the council, angry like a lion, looking piteous, very sad and sat on the seat.
data.anv: दीनः piteous, परमदुःखितः very sad, सःराजा that king, सभाम् council, प्रविश्य entered, क्रुद्धः angry, सिंहःइव like lion, श्वसन् sighing, मुख्ये chief, आसने seat, निषसाद sat
data.md: Entering his court, the king, distressed, and exceeding aggrieved sat him down on the foremost seat sighing like an enraged lion.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा सर्वान्बलमुख्यान्महाबलः । रावणः प्राञ्जलीन्वाक्यं पुत्रव्यसनकर्शितः ।।
data.es: Ravana, endowed with mighty prowess, shrunken on account of his son, greeting all the army chiefs with folded hands spoke as follows.

data.v: अनीकं दशसाहस्रं रथानां वातरंहसाम् । अष्टादशसहस्राणि कुञ्जराणां तरस्विनाम् ।।
चतुर्दशसहस्राणि सारोहाणां च वाजिनाम् । पूर्णे शतसहस्रे द्वे राक्षसानां पदातिनाम् ।।
दिवसस्याष्टमे भागे शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः । हतान्येकेन रामेण रक्षसां कामरूपिणाम् ।।
ते हताश्वा हतरथाः श्रान्ता विमथितध्वजाः । अभिपेतुः पुरीं लङ्कां हतशेषा निशाचराः ।।
data.es: Rakshasas dead, chariots destroyed, staff of chariots broken, remaining Rakshasas returned to Lanka.
data.anv: हताश्वाः dead, हतरथाः chariots destroyed, शान्ताःappeased, विमथितध्वजाः staff of chariots broken, हतशेषाः rest killed, तेनिशाचराः those night rangers, लङ्कांपुरीम् into Lanka, अभिपेतुः returned
data.md: And those night rangers, who were still left, having their horses killed, cars and flags broken fled in fear of life to the city of Lanka.

data.es: With the elephants, horses, and foot soldiers killed, the battlefield was like the ground where mighty Rudra sported in anger.

data.md: The battle field, filled with slain horses, elephants and infantry, looked like the high-souled and enraged Rudra's arena of sports.

data.v: ततो देवाः सगन्धर्वाः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । साधु साध्विति रामस्य तत्कर्म समपूजयन् ।।
data.es: The Gandharvas, gods and even siddhas felt happy and reached their stationed in the sky to see the wonderful bridge.

data.md: Thereupon the celestials with Gandarbas, Siddhas and the great ascetics glorified the wonderful feat of Rāma.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा रामः सुग्रीवं प्रत्यनन्तरम् । एतदस्त्रबलं दिव्यं मम वा त्र्यम्बकस्य वा ।।
data.es: Then righteous Sri Rama said to nearby Sugriva, Vibheeshana, Hanuman, Jambavan and leaders of Vanaras like Mainda, Dwivida, that the power of these arrows are in him and Lord Siva only.

data.md: The virtuous-souled Rāma addressed Sugrīva, Vibhīşaņa the monkey Hanumān, the leading monkeys Jämbavān, Mainda and Divada who were near him, saying, This is the power of my weapons and as well as that of Rudra.

data.v: निहत्य तां राक्षसवाहिनीं तु; रामस्तदा शक्रसमो महात्मा । अस्त्रेषु शस्त्रेषु जितक्लमश्च; संस्तूयते देवगणैः प्रहृष्टैः ।।
data.md: The high-souled Rāma, equalling Śakra in prowess, thus slaying the huge host of the lord of Rākşasas and assailing them with shafts and weapons-the celestials, delighted, saying his praises.

data.v: तानि नागसहस्राणि सारोहाणां च वाजिनाम् । रथानां चाग्निवर्णानां सध्वजानां सहस्रशः ।।
राक्षसानां सहस्राणि गदापरिघयोधिनाम् । काञ्चनध्वजचित्राणां शूराणां कामरूपिणाम् ।।
निहतानि शरैस्तीक्ष्णैस्तप्तकाञ्चनभूषणैः । रावणेन प्रयुक्तानि रामेणाक्लिष्टकर्मणा ।।
दृष्ट्वा श्रुत्वा च संभ्रान्ता हतशेषा निशाचराः । राक्षस्यश्च समागम्य दीनाश्चिन्तापरिप्लुताः ।।
data.es: "On seeing and hearing of the others left over, the night rangers felt bewildered and piteous with agony coming together, moving in groups, those who lost husband, son, kin and protectors along with associates crying, stricken with grief."

data.v: कथं शूर्पणखा वृद्धा कराला निर्णतोदरी । आससाद वने रामं कन्दर्पमिव रूपिणम् ।।
data.es: "How did that old, dreadful and hideous Surpanakha approach Rama, whose form is charming like the god of love, in the forest?"

data.md: Alas! why did the aged and grim-visaged Śūrpanakhă, having her belly extending down ward, behold in the forest Rāma graceful like Kandarpa.

data.es: "That woman of ugly appearance deserves to be killed. How is it that she was stung with love with that delicate Rama, a well wisher of all beings?"

data.md: Beholding him of great beauty and prowess, ever engaged in the welfare of all creatures, that ugly one, worthy of being slain by people, was excited with lust.

data.v: कथं सर्वगुणैर्हीना गुणवन्तं महौजसं । सुमुखं दुर्मुखी रामं कामयामास राक्षसी ।।
data.es: "How did that rakshasi of terrible appearance dare to love that virtuous Rama?"

data.es: "For that reason of Surpanakha, this enmity has been conceived by Ravana and Sita was borne away by the ten headed Rakshasa."

data.md: It was for her that Rāvana created enmity (with Răma) and Sītä was carried away by the Ten-necked Rākşasa.

data.md: But he could not spread his influence upon Sitā the daughter of king Jannak and deep rooted and eternal became the enmity with the highly powerful Rāghava.

data.v: वैदेहीं प्रार्थयानं तं विराधं प्रेक्ष्य राक्षसं । हतमेकेन रामेण पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "On perceiving that Viradha solicitous of Vaidehi, the Rakshasa was killed by Rama with one arrow. That is sufficient proof (of Rama's valour)."
data.anv: वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, प्रार्धयानम् solicitous, एकेन one, रामेण by Rama, हतम् killed, राक्षसम् Rakshasa, विराधम् Viradha, प्रेक्षय perceiving, तत् that, निदर्शनम् proof, पर्याप्तम् sufficient
data.md: Beholding the Rākşasa Virādha slain by Rāma alone (Rāvana) wishing Vaidehỉ should have regarded that as a sufficient proof of his prowess.

data.v: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् । निहतानि जनस्थाने शरैरग्निशिखोपमैः ।।
data.es: " At Janasthana fourteen thousand Rakshasas have been destroyed with his arrows like peaks of fire."
data.anv: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, भीमकर्मणाम् of dreadful deeds, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, अग्निशिखोपमैः like peaks of fire, शरैः arrow, निहतानि destroyed
data.md: And fourteen thousand Rākşasas of terrible deeds were slain by him in janasthāna with shafts resembling the flame of fire. Khara Düş aņa as well as Tricira were slain by him in conflict with arrows resembling the Sun-this was a sufficient proof (of his power).

data.v: खरश्च निहतः संख्ये दूषणस्त्रिशिरास्तथा । शरैरादित्यसंकाशैः पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "Khara was killed in that combat with sunlike arrows, so also Dooshana and Trisira. That example is sufficient proof."

data.md: And fourteen thousand Rākşasas of terrible deeds were slain by him in janasthāna with shafts resembling the flame of fire. Khara Düş aņa as well as Tricira were slain by him in conflict with arrows resembling the Sun-this was a sufficient proof (of his power).

data.v: हतो योजनबाहुश्च कबन्धो रुधिराशनः । क्रोधार्तो विनदन्सोऽथ पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "Kabhanda who lived on blood came roaring, enraged, whose arms were eight meters long was also killed and that is a sufficient example."

data.md: Yojanabāhu and Kabandha, drinking blood, were slain by him, roaring with wrath-this too was a sufficient proof of his power.

data.v: जघान बलिनं रामः सहस्रनयनात्मजम् । बालिनं मेघसंकाशं पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "Mighty Rama killed the son of thousand eyed Indra, Vali, who resembled mountain Meru. That example is sufficient proof."
data.anv: रामः Rama, बलिनम्mighty, सहस्रनयनात्मजम् son of thousand eyed Indra, मेरुसङ्काशम् resembled mountain Meru, वालिनम् Vali, जघान killed, तत् that, पर्याप्तम् sufficient, निदर्शनम् example
data.md: Rāma slew the powerful Vāli, the son of the thousand eyed one, resembling the cloud-that too was the sufficient proof of his prowess.

data.v: ऋश्यमूके वसञ्शैले दीनो भग्नमनोरथः । सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये पर्याप्तं तन्निदर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "Sugriva, who was living on Rishyamukha, dejected and disconsolate was restored with his kingdom. That is sufficient."

data.anv: क्रोधाव्यक्तरथः indistinct in anger, राक्षसेश्वरः Lord of Rakshasas, चक्षुषा eyes, निर्धहन्निव as if burning them, तत्र there, समीपस्थान् nearby, महोदरम् Mahodara, महापार्श्वम् Mahaparsva, राक्षसम् Rakshasas, विरूपाक्षम् Virupaksha, समीपस्थान् close by, राक्षसान् Rakshasas, उवाच spoke, मम me, आज्ञया order, शीघ्रम् quickly, निर्यातइति thus commanded, सैन्यानि the army, वदत spoke
data.md: Mahodara, Mahāpārsva, Virāpāksa "Do you speedily speak to the soldiers that they should sally out for battle at my command.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राक्षसास्ते भयार्दिताः । चोदयामासुरव्यग्रान्राक्षसांस्तान्नृपाज्ञया ।।
data.es: On hearing the words of the king's order, the Rakshasas stricken with fear, unagitated, started thinking.
data.anv: तेराक्षसाः those Rakshasas, तस्य their, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा on hearing, भयार्दिताः stricken with fear, अव्यग्रान् unagitated, तान् they, राक्षसान् Rakshasa's, नृपाज्ञया king's order, चोदयामासुः started thinking
data.md: Hearing his speech-those Raksasa, possessed by fear, asked by the command of the king, the Rākşasa soldiers to be ready.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे तथेत्युक्त्वा राक्षसा घोरदर्शनाः । कृतस्वस्त्ययनाः सर्वे रावणाभिमुखा ययुः ।।
data.es: All the Rakshasas with frightful looks saying 'Be it so', having prepared themselves with armor went towards the battlefield.
data.anv: सर्वे all, ते of them, भीमदर्शनाः with frightful looks, राक्षसाः Rakshasa, तथेति Be it so, उक्त्वा saying, कृतस्वस्त्वनाः having prepared themselves with armor, ते they, सर्वे all, रणाभिमुखाः towards the battlefield, ययुःwent
data.md: Thereat all those grim-visaged Rākṣasas saying 'so be it' and performing benedictory ceremonies proceeded to the battle-field.

data.v: प्रतिपूज्य यथान्यायं रावणं ते महारथाः । तस्थुः प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे भर्तुर्विजयकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: All the great chariot warrior spraying to Ravana with folded palms stood desiring success.
data.anv: महारथाः great chariot warriors, सर्वे all, ते they, यथान्यायम्, रावणम् Ravana, प्रतिपूज्यpraying in return, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms, भर्तुः Lord, विजयकाङ्क्षिणःdesiring success, तस्थुःstood
data.md: Those mighty car-warrior, worshipping Rāvana, and desiring the victory of their lord, stood before them with folded hands.

data.v: अथोवाच प्रहस्यैतान्रावणः क्रोधमूर्छितः । महोदरमहापार्श्वौ विरूपाक्षं च राक्षसं ।।
data.es: Then Ravana who was deluded with anger, laughing aloud spoke to Mahodara, Mahaparsva and Virupaksha.
data.anv: अथ and then, रावणः Ravana, क्रोथमूर्छितः deluded with anger, प्रहस्य laughing aloud, एतान् these, महोदरमहापार्श्वौMahodara, Mahaparsva, राक्षसम् Rakshasas, विरूपाक्षं च and Virupaksha, उवाच spoke
data.md: Thereupon Ravana, beside himself with anger, laughing, addressed those Raksasas, Mahodara, Mahāpārsva, and Virūpākşa, saying.

data.v: अद्य बाणैर्धनुर्मुक्तैर्युगान्तादित्यसंनिभैः । राघवं लक्ष्मणं चैव नेष्यामि यमसाधनम् ।।
data.es: Loosening the shafts from the bow, Ravana resembling the Sun at the time of dissolution of the universe said," I shall dispatch Raghava and Lakshmana to the abode of the Lord of death."
data.anv: अद्य today, धनुर्मुक्तै loosened from the bow:, युगान्तादित्यसन्निभैःresembling sun at the time of dissolution of the universe, बाणैः shafts, राघवम् Raghava, लक्ष्मणंचैव and Lakshmana, यमसादनम् the abode of Yama the god of death, नेष्यामिdispatch
data.md: Today shall I despatch both Rāma and Lakşmaņa to the abode of Death with arrows resembling the sun at the time of dissolution, discharged off my bow.

data.v: खरस्य कुम्भकर्णस्य प्रहस्तेन्द्रजितोस्तथा । करिष्यामि प्रतीकारमद्य शत्रुवधादहम् ।।
data.es: "Today by the killing the enemy I will take my revenge and also of Khara, Kumbhakarna, Prahastha and Indrajith."
data.anv: अद्य today, शत्रुवधात् by the killing of enemy, अहम् I, खरस्य Khara's, कुम्बकर्णस्य Kumbhakarn's, तथा so also, प्रहस्तेन्द्रजितोः Prahastha, Indrajith, प्रतीकारम् revenge, करिष्यामि will take
data.md: And slaying the enemies I shall repair the loss of Khara, Kumbhakarna, Prahasta and Indrajit.

data.v: नैवान्तरिक्षं न दिशो न नद्यो नापि सागरः । प्रकाशत्वं गमिष्यन्ति मद्बाणजलदावृताः ।।
data.es: "By my arrows covering the sky like clouds there will be no effulgence both in space and in the quarters and not even in the ocean."
data.anv: मद्बाणजलदावृताः my arrows like the clouds cover, अन्तरिक्षम् the sky, प्रकाशत्वम् the effulgence, न not, दिशः directions, न not, द्यौः both, न not, सागराःअपि even the ocean, न गमिष्यन्ति not move
data.md: The atmosphere, the quarters the sky and the deep being enveloped with the cloud of arrows shall become invisible.

data.v: अद्य वानरयूथानां तानि यूथानि भागशः । धनुःसमुद्रादुद्भूतैर्मथिष्यामि शरोर्मिभिः ।।
data.es: Thereafter, furious Kumbhakarna said "Now I will consume all the battalions of Vanaras just as moths are consumed by fire."
data.anv: अद्य thereafter, सङ्क्रुद्धः furious, वानरमुख्यानाम् leaders of Vanaras, तानि their, यूथानि troop, भागशः battalions, पावकः Paavaka, शलाभामिव consume moths, निर्दहिष्यामि will burn them completely.
data.md: I shall slay today all the heroic monkeys with my winged arrows.

data.v: व्याकोशपद्मचक्राणि पद्मकेसरवर्चसाम् । अद्य यूथतटाकानि गजवत्प्रमथाम्यहम् ।।
data.es: "Like an elephant now I shall torment the ponds in the form of battalions of Vanaras shining like the filaments of lotuses, with their faces resembling open lotuses."
data.anv: अद्य now, व्याकोशपद्मवक्त्राणि their faces resembling open lotuses, पद्मकेसरवर्चसाम् filaments of lotuses, यूथतटाकानि ponds in the form of battalions, अहम् I, गजवत् elephant like, प्रमथामि tormenting
data.md: I shall like an elephant distress today the monkey-like pools having their countenances for the blown lotuses, and the lustre of their bodies for the filaments.

data.v: सशरैरद्य वदनैः संख्ये वानरयूथपाः । मण्डयिष्यन्ति वसुधां सनालैरिव पङ्कलैः ।।
data.es: "Now with the arrows fixed on their faces the Vanara battalions spread on the earth will adorn the earth like lotuses spread on earth."
data.anv: अद्य now, सङ्ख्ये, वानरयूथपाः Vanara battalions, सशरैः the arrows, वदनैः faces, सनालैः fixed, पङ्कजैरिव like lotuses, वसुधाम् on earth, मण्डयिष्यन्ति will adorn
data.md: To-day in the encounter, the leaders of the monkey hosts, with their heads transfixed with arrows, shall cover the earth, like to Ictuses with their stalks.

data.v: अद्य युद्धप्रचण्डानां हरीणां द्रुमयोधिनाम् । मुक्तेनैकेषुणा युद्धे भेत्स्यामि च शतंशतम् ।।
data.es: "Today in the combat each one of the arrows released by me will pierce through one hundred monkeys vehemently fighting with trees"
data.anv: अद्य today, युद्धे in combat, मुक्तेन released, एकेषुणा each one, यूथप्रचण्डानाम् troops vehemently, द्रुमयोधिनाम् fighting with trees, हरीणाम् monkeys, शतंशतम् one hundred each, भेत्स्यामि pierce through them
data.md: I shall today with a single arrow, cleave hundreds of heroic monkeys fighting with trees in their hands.

data.v: हतो भर्ता हतो भ्राता यासां च तनया हताः । वधेनाद्य रिपोस्तासां कर्मोम्यस्रप्रमार्जनम् ।।
data.es: "Today through the destruction of the enemy I will wipe the tears of the one whose son has been killed, whose brother has been killed."
data.anv: अद्य today, रिपोः enemy, वधेन by destruction, तासां his, भ्राता brother, हतःkilled, यासाम् whose, तनयः brother, हतः killed, तासाम् whose, अश्रुप्रमार्जनम् wipe the tears, करोमि will do
data.md: I shall wipe today the tears of those whose brother or son has been slain by destroying their goe.

data.v: अद्य मद्बाणनिर्भिन्नैः प्रकीर्णैर्गतचेतनैः । करोमि वानरैर्युद्धे यत्नावेक्ष्यतलां महीम् ।।
data.es: "Today, in the combat, my arrows will split open the Vanaras and ceased of life, they will be covering the earth. It will be possible to see the ground only with effort."
data.anv: अद्य today, युद्धे in combat, मद्बाणनिर्भिन्नैः by my arrows split open, गतचेतनैः ceased of life, प्रस्तीर्णैः spread out, वानरैः Vanaras, महीम् earth, यत्नावेक्ष्यतलाम् only with effort to see, करोमि make
data.md: In the encounter today I shall, with the monkeys deprived of their breath and clept with my arrows, so cover the earth that it may not be seen by any.

data.v: अद्य गोमायवो गृध्रा ये च मांसाशिनोऽपरे । सर्वांस्तांस्तर्पयिष्यामि शत्रुमांसैः शरार्दितैः ।।
data.es: "Today I shall provide for whatever animals, eagles or flesheating animals the flesh of enemies killed by my arrows."
data.anv: अद्य today, गोमायव: whatever animalsगृध्राश्च eagles, मांसाशिनः flesh eating animals, ये those, अपरे enemy, तान् them, सर्वान् all, शरार्दितैः killed by my arrows, शत्रुमांसैः enemy's flesh, तर्पयिष्यामि will provide
data.md: I shall satisfy today with the flesh of the enemies slain by my shafts, the crows, vultures and others who live upon flesh.

data.v: कल्प्यतां मे रथशीघ्रं क्षिप्रमानीयतां धनुः । अनुप्रयान्तु मां युद्धे येऽवशिष्टा निशाचराः ।।
data.es: "Let my chariot and bow be ready and brought here. Let the night rangers who survived follow me."
data.anv: मे I, रथः chariot, शीघ्रम् quickly, कल्प्यताम् be ready, धनुः bow, क्षिप्रम् instantly, अनीयताम् brought, अत्र here, शिष्टाः survived, ये those, निशाचराः night rangers, युद्धे in combat, माम् me, अनुप्रयान्तु follow
data.md: Get ready soon my car and bring my bow. And let the remaining night-rangers follow me in battle.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा महापार्श्वोऽब्रवीद्वचः । बलाध्यक्षान्स्थितांस्तत्र बलं संत्वर्यतामिति ।।
data.es: On hearing the speech of Ravana, Mahaparsva enjoined the mighty leaders of the army standing there and spoke as follows.
data.anv: तस्य his, तत् वचनम् the speech of Ravana, श्रुत्वा hearing, महापार्श्वःMahaparsva, तत्र there, स्थितान् standing, बलाध्यक्षान् mighty leaders, बलम् of army, संत्वर्यताम् enjoined, वचः words, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Hearing his words Mahāpārsva addressed the leaders of the army who were near him, saying, "Get your soldiers ready."

data.v: बलाध्यक्षास्तु संरब्धा राक्षसांस्तान्गृहाद्गृहात् । चोदयन्तः परिययुर्लङ्कां लघुपराक्रमाः ।।
data.es: "Let the army leaders of mighty valour go hurriedly to search in every house in Lanka for Rakshasas."
data.anv: लघुपराक्रमाः mighty valour, बलाध्यक्षान्तु army chief, सम्रब्दाः hurriedly, गृहेगृहे house to house, तान् they, राक्षसान् Rakshasas, चोदयन्तः searched, लङ्काम् in Lanka, परिययुः went
data.md: The commanders too quickly went round all the houses in Lankā and asked the Rākşasas to be ready soun.

data.v: ततो मुहूर्तान्निष्पेतू राक्षसा भीमविक्रमाः । नर्दन्तो भीमवदना नानाप्रहरणैर्भुजैः ।।
असिभिः पट्टसैः शूलैर्गलाभिर्मुसलैर्हलैः । शक्तिभिस्तीक्ष्णधाराभिर्महद्भिः कूटमुद्गरैः ।।
यष्टिभिर्विमलैश्चक्रैर्निशितैश्च परश्वधैः । भिण्डिपालैः शतघ्नीभिरन्यैश्चापि वरायुधैः ।।
अथानयन्बलाध्यक्षाश्चत्वारो रावणाज्ञया । द्रुतं सूतसमायुक्तं युक्ताष्टतुरगं रथम् ।।
data.es: Then by Ravana's command. the chief of the army with chariot rider brought the chariot yoked to eight horses quickly. Then dreadful and selfeffulgent glowing Ravana ascended the chariot."
data.anv: अथ and then, बलाध्यक्षः chief of army, रावणाज्ञया by Ravana's order, सत्वरः quickly, द्रुतम् controlled, सूतसमायुक्तम् with chariot riders, युक्ताष्टतुरगम् yoked to eight horses, रथम् chariots, अथानयन by the order, तदा then, भीमः dreadful, स्वतेजसा selfeffulgent, दीप्यमानम् glowing, आरुरोह ascended

data.v: आरुरोह रथं दिव्यं दीप्यमानं स्वतेजसा । रावणः सत्त्वगाम्भीर्याद्दारयन्निव मेदिनीम् ।।
data.es: Then Ravana surrounded by many Rakshasas set out swiftly rending the earth with all his might and majesty.
data.anv: ततः then, रावणः Ravana, बहुभिः many, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, वृतः surrounded by, सत्त्वगाम्भीर्यात् majestic might, मेदिनीम् ground, दारयन्निव rending the earth, सहसाswiftly, प्रयातःset out
data.md: Thereupon proceeded Råvana, encircled by many a Raksasa as if rending the earth with the excess of his prowess. arose was

data.v: रावणेनाभ्यनुज्ञातौ महापार्श्वमहोदरौ । विरूपाक्षश्च दुर्धर्षो रथानारुरुहुस्तदा ।।
data.es: Duly permitted by Ravana, Mahaparsva and Mahodara who are difficult to overpower and also Virupaksha ascended their chariots.
data.anv: रावणेन by Ravana, अभ्यनुज्ञातौ duly permitted, महापार्श्वमहोदरौ Mahaparsva, Mahodara, दुर्धर्षः difficult to over power, विरूपाक्षश्च Virupaksha also, तदा then, रथान् chariots, आरुरुहुः ascended
data.md: Being commanded by Ravana, Mahāparrsha, Mahodara and the irrepressible Virupaksa ascended the car.

data.v: ते तु हृष्टा विनर्दन्तो भिन्दन्त इव मेदिनीम् । नादं घोरं विमुञ्चन्तो निर्ययुर्जयकाङ्क्षिणः ।।
data.es: Happy leaders, roaring exultantly, as if breaking the earth, emerged, turning round, desiring victory and sallied forth.
data.anv: ते they, हृष्टाः happy, विवर्थन्तः turning round, मेदिनीम् earth, भिन्दन्तःइव as if breaking, घोरम् terrific, नादम् roaring, विमुञ्चन्तः emerged, जयकाङ्क्षिणःdesiring victory, निर्ययुःsallied forth
data.md: They, desirous of winning victory, issued out emitting dreadful roars in delight and as if rending the earth therewith.

data.v: ततो युद्धाय तेजस्वी रक्षोगणबलैर्वृतः । निर्ययावुद्यतधनुः कालान्तकयमोमपः ।।
data.es: Then Ravana surrounded by the army of Rakshasas lifted his bow, like the Lord Yama at the time of dissolution of the universe, went for the battle glowing.
data.anv: ततः then, तेजस्वी glowing, रक्षोगणबलैः army of Rakshasas, कालान्तकयमोपमः like the time spirit Yama, उद्यतधनुः lifted bow, युद्धाय for battle, निर्ययौ went
data.md: Thereupon the highly effulgent (Ravana) resembling Death, with uplifted bow, sallied out for battle along with the army of Rākşasa.

data.v: ततः प्रजवनाश्वेन रथेन स महारथः । द्वारेण निर्ययौ तेन यत्र तौ रामलक्ष्मणौ ।।
data.es: Then from the mighty chariot yoked to exceedingly swift horses, the mighty charioteer made his exit from the entrance and saw Rama and Lakshmana there.
data.anv: ततः then, महारथः mighty charioteer, सः he, प्रजविताश्वेन exceedingly swift horses, रथेन in the chariot, तौ those, रामलक्ष्मणौ Rama and Lakshmana, यत्र there, तेन by the, द्वारेण at the entrance, निर्ययौ made his exit
data.md: That mighty car-warrior, went out in his chariot drawn by quick coursing steeds by that gate which led to where Rāma and Lakşmaņa were.

data.v: ततो नष्टप्रभः सूर्यो दिशश्च तिमिरावृताः । द्विजाश्च नेदुर्घोराश्च संचचाल च मेदिनी ।।
data.es: Then the Sun lost his radiance, and the four directions were enveloped by gloom, the birds made fearful noise and the earth shook.
data.anv: ततः then, सूर्यः Sun, नष्टप्रभः lost radiance, दिशश्च direction, तिमिरावृताः enveloped by gloom, घोराः frightening, द्विजाश्च birds, नेदुः made fearful sounds, मेदिनी च earth, सञ्चचाल shook
data.md: Thereat the sun lost its brilliance the quarters were enshrouded with darkness; the birds sent forth dreadful cried and the earth shook.

data.es: 'My heroism is shy, my bow slips from my hand, arrows are dropping, my vision is blurred with tears with my brother gone.'

data.md: Lakşmaņa enhancer of auspiciousness is not dead. His face is not distorted or blackened. Do you look at his countenance, which is beautifully bright and cheerful.

data.es: "O hero! Those who cease to live will not have such appearance and signs. He who is a tamer of foes is alive. I tell you, do not grieve."

data.md: With his person pierced with the shafts of Rāma, the lord of night-rangers having his body drenched with blood, was stricken with sadness in the midst of his forces, and was also overwhelmed with terrific wrath.

data.es: Sri Rama did not get agitated, and stood like a huge mountain, even though the network of arrows released from the bow of Ravana covered him in the conflict.

data.md: And covered with vollies of shafts discharged from (Ravana's) bow in the conflict, Kākutstha like to a mighty mountain did not shake.

data.v: स शरैः शरजालानि वारयन्समरे स्थितः । गभस्तीनिव सूर्यस्य प्रतिजग्राह वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Valiant Sri Rama stood intercepting them when streams of arrows covered him, and tolerated them like the rays of the Sun.

data.md: That one endowed with prowess stood in the field, resisting those networks of arrows, and took up shafts resembling the rays of the Sun.

data.es: Thereafter the quickhanded angry night ranger struck into the chest of Raghava thousands of arrows.

data.md: Then the fleet-handed night-ranger, fired with rage, discharged a thousand arrows at the chest of the high souled Raghava.

data.md: Thereat in that encounter Lakşmaņa's elder brother, with his body bathed in blood, appeared like a mighty Kinśuka tree in a forest.

data.es: Endowed with extraordinary energy, Kakuthsa, angered by the impact of arrows resembled the Sun at the end of universal dissolution, took up arrows.

data.es: Then with both Rama and Ravana speedily releasing (hail of) arrows on one another, the battlefield was darkened by arrows, and they were not able to see each other.
data.anv: ततः then, सुसम्रब्धौ speedily releasing arrows, तौ those, उभौ both, रामरावणौ Rama and Ravana, तदा then, शरान्धकारे darkened by the arrows, समरे in the battlefield, अन्योन्यम् one another, नोपलक्ष्यताम् not able to see
data.md: In the darkness spread by the arrows (discharged), Rama and Ravana both fired with wrath could not be discovered of each other.

data.v: ततः क्रोधसमाविष्टो रामो दशरथात्मजः । उवाच रावणं वीरः प्रहस्य परुषं वचः ।।
data.es: Then Rama, the heroic son of Dasharatha, overcome by anger, laughing at Ravana, spoke these words.
data.anv: ततः then, दशरथात्मजः Dasharatha's son, वीरः heroic, रामः Rama, क्रोधसमाविष्टः overcome by anger, प्रहस्य laughing, रावणम् at Ravana, परुषम् harsh, वचः words, उवाच spoke
data.md: Then that hero-Dasaratha's son, Rāma, Overcome with wrath, addressed Ravana, laughing, in a harsh speech, saying.

data.v: मम भार्या जनस्थानादज्ञानाद्राक्षसाधम । हृता ते विवशा यस्मात्तस्मात्त्वं नासि वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: "Lowly Rakshasa! My wife was abducted by you ignorantly when she was helpless. Therefore, you are not valiant."
data.anv: राक्षसाधम lowly Rakshasa, विवशा helpless, ममभार्या my wife, यस्मात् therefore, अज्ञानात् ignorantly, ते you, हृता abducted, तस्मात् therefore, त्वम् you, वीर्यवन् valiant, नासि not
data.md: You vile of Räkşasas, in consequence of having through lack of sense carried off my wife from Janasthana and brought her under your subjection, you have been deprived of your prowess.

data.v: मया विरहितां दीनां वर्तमानां महावने । वैदेहीं प्रसभं हृत्वा शूरोऽहमिति मन्यसे ।।
data.es: "Having abducted Vaidehi living in the forest by force, when she was desperate and separated from me, do you think that you are a hero?
data.anv: मया from me, विरहिताम् separated, दीनाम् desperate, महावने in the great forest, वर्तमानाम् living, वैदेहीम् Vaidehi, प्रसभम् forcibly, हृत्वा abducted, अहम् I, शूरः hero, इति thus, मन्यसे you think
data.md: Having forcibly carried away Vaidehi staying in that mighty forest, forlorn and without me, you think, 'I am hero.'

data.v: स्त्रीषु शूर विनाथासु परदाराभिमर्शके । कृत्वा कापुरुषं कर्म शूरोऽहमिति मन्यसे ।।
data.es: "Timid fellow! You having laid hands on another woman think you are a hero? You, who have done such an action, think that you are a hero?"
data.anv: विनाथासु timid fellow, स्त्रीषु women, शूर hero, परदाराभिमर्शक laying hands on other woman, कापुरुषम् such men, कर्म action, कृत्वा having done, अहम् I, शूरःhero, इति thus, मन्यसे thinking
data.md: Outraging the helpless wives of others, doing this craven deed, you thinkest, 'I am a hero.'

data.v: भिन्नमर्याद निर्लज्ज चारित्रेष्वनवस्थित । दर्पान्मृत्युमुपादाय शूरोऽहमिति मन्यसे ।।
data.es: "O shameless one! You have transgressed morality and traditional practice. You are dissolute and by your pride seeking death. You think that you are a hero!"
data.anv: भिन्नमर्याद transgressed morality, निर्लज्ज shameless, चारित्रे traditional practice, अनवस्थित dissolute, दर्पात् pride, मृत्युम् death, उपादाय seeking, अहम् I, शूरः heroic, इति thus, मन्यसे think
data.md: O you having your dignity destroyed! O shameless Wight! O you of volatile character, having through your violence brought destruction on yourself, you think, 'I am a hero.'

data.v: शूरेण धनदभ्रात्रा बलैः समुदितेन च । श्लाघनीयं यशस्यं च कृतं कर्म महत्त्वया ।।
data.es: "By laudable great action performed by you (of abducting Sita and your penance) you have attained fame. You are a heroic brother of Kubera, rich in might."
data.anv: शूरेण hero, धनदभ्रात्रा brother of Kubera, बलैः rich in might, समुदितेन च and risen up, त्वया by you, श्लाघनीयम् laudable, यशस्यं च attained fame, महत् great, कर्म action, कृतम् performed
data.md: A great and famous act has been performed by you, a hero, and the brother of the Bestower of riches, surrounded with your forces!

data.v: उत्सेकेनाभिपन्नस्य गर्हितस्याहितस्य च । कर्मणः प्राप्नुहीदानीं तस्याद्य सुमहत्फलम् ।।
data.es: "You will attain the great result of your hurtful action, overpowered by pride and vanity today."
data.anv: उत्सेकेन out of pride, अभिपन्नस्य overpowered, गर्हितस्य vanity, अहितस्य च hurtful, तस्यकर्मणः your action, सुमहत् great, फलम् result, अद्य today, इदानीम् this way, प्राप्नुहि attained
data.md: Today receive the mighty fruit of that infamous act done through pride, productive of evil.* *Remarks Rāmānuja, 'here and in the next world.'

data.v: शूरोऽहमिति चात्मानमवगच्छसि दुर्मते । नैव लज्जास्ति ते सीतां चोरवद्व्यपकर्षतः ।।
data.es: "O Evil minded fellow! You boast yourself as a hero, while you abducted Sita like a thief. Shame did not stand in your way."
data.anv: दुर्मते evil minded, आत्मानम् yourself, अहम् I, शूरःhero, इति thus, अवगच्छसि praise, चौरवत् like a thief, सीताम् Sita, व्यपकर्षतः abducting, ते to you, लज्जा shame, नैवअस्ति not stand
data.md: O wicked-minded one, you think of yourself, 'I am a hero; but you that have taken way Sītā like a thief, have no feeling of shame.

data.v: यदि मत्संनिधौ सीता धर्षिता स्यात्त्वया बलात् । भ्रातरं तु खरं पश्येस्तदा मत्सायकैर्हतः ।।
data.es: "If Sita had been seen by me forcibly taken by you in my presence, then you would have been killed by my arrows and seen your brother Khara."
data.anv: सीता Sita, त्वया by you, मत्सन्निधौ my presence, बलात् forcibly, धर्षिता taken, स्याद्यदि been seen, तदा then, मत्सायकैः by my arrows, हतः killed, भ्रातरम् brother, खरम् Khara, पश्येः seen
data.md: Had you forcibly outraged Sità in my very presence, you, slain by my Shafts, would have seen your brother-Khara.

data.v: दिष्ट्यासि मम दुष्टात्मंश्चक्षुर्विषयमागतः । अद्य त्वां सायकैस्तीक्ष्णैर्नयामि यमसादनम् ।।
data.es: "O selfish Ravana! Today you have come in my sight by good fortune. I shall send you to the abode of Yama with my arrows."
data.anv: दुष्टात्मन् selfish, दिष्ट्या seen now, मम by me, चक्षुर्विषयम् in my sight, आगतःअसि have come now, अद्य today, त्वाम् you, तीक्ष्णैः sharp, सायकैः by arrows, यमसादनम् abode of Yama, नयामि reach
data.md: By luck, O you of an evil soul, you have come within the range of my vision. Today by means of sharp shafts shall I bring you to death's door.

data.v: अद्य ते मच्छरैश्छिन्नं शिरो ज्वलितकुण्डलम् । क्रव्यादा व्यपकर्षन्तु विकीर्णं रणपांसुषु ।।
data.es: "Now, let your head severed by my shafts lying in dust in the battlefield with the shining earrings be dragged by the carnivorous animals."
data.anv: अद्य now, मच्छरैः by my shafts, छिन्नम् severed, रणपांसुषु in the battlefield, विकीर्णम् covered with dust, ज्वलितकुण्डलम् shining earrings, तेशिरः your head, क्रन्यादाः carnivorous animals, व्यपकर्षन्तु be dragged
data.md: Today beasts of pray will drag your head having burning ear-rings, severed by my shafts and covered with the dust of the battle-field.

data.v: निपत्योरसि गृध्रास्ते क्षितौ क्षिप्तस्य रावण । पिबन्तु रुधिरं तर्षाद्बाणशल्यान्तरोथितम् ।।
data.es: "Ravana! After your body is caused to destroy and scattered on the ground, let the vultures drink the blood oozing from your chest pierced by the heads of my arrows."
data.anv: रावण Ravana, क्षितौ caused to destroy, क्षिप्तस्य scattered, ते your, उरसि chest, निपत्य fallen, गृध्राः vultures, बाणशल्यान्तरोत्थितम् by the piercing of the heads of my arrows, रुधिरम् blood, पिबन्तु drink
data.md: O Ravana, vultures will alight on your breast, as you will lie low on the ground; and, athirst, they will drink the blood gushing out from your wounds.

data.v: अद्य मद्बाणाभिन्नस्य गतासोः पतितस्य ते । कर्षन्त्वन्त्राणि पतगा गरुत्मन्त इवोरगान् ।।
data.es: "Let the birds tear your intestines as eagles would tear off snakes, now when your body is split and fallen, split by my arrows and ceased of life."
data.anv: अद्य now, मद्बाणभिन्नस्य by my arrows splitting, गतासोः ceased of life, पतितस्य fallen, ते your, अन्त्राणि intestines, पतगाः birds, गरुत्मन्तः eagles, उरगानिव like snakes, कर्षन्तु dragging
data.md: To-day fowls of the air will keep pulling at you pierced with my shafts, and lying lifeless, as birds do serpents.

data.es: Speaking in this way to Ravana who was nearby, Rama the exterminator of enemies rained showers of arrows and covered.

data.md: Having spoken thus, that slayer of foes-Rāmashowered arrows on the lord of Rākşasas, staying before.

data.md: Seeing all these auspicious omens coming of themselves, Rama, finisher of Raksasas, set about smiting his foe more energetically than ever.

data.es: By the stones thrown by the Vanaras and rain of shafts from Raghava, the ten headed Ravana was pained and was bewildered.

data.v: किमर्थं मामवज्ञाय मच्छन्दमनवेक्ष्य च । त्वया शत्रुसमक्षं मे रथोऽयमपवाहितः ।।
data.es: Not knowing my opinion, for what reason have you removed my chariot in the presence of my enemy, belittling me?
data.anv: शत्रुसमक्षं enemy presence, मे my अवज्ञाय, not knowing, मच्छन्दम् my opinion, अनवेक्ष्य च belittling, अयम् I, मेरथः my chariot, किमर्थम् for What reason, अपवाहितः removed by you
data.md: Wherefore disregarding me, and not minding O you of my purpose, have you taken away my car from before the presence of the enemy?

data.v: त्वयाद्य हि ममानार्य चिरकालसमार्जितम् । यशो वीर्यं च तेजश्च प्रत्ययश्च विनाशितः ।।
data.es: "O evil minded one! My fame, glory, valiance and bravery earned over a long period has been wiped out by you."
data.anv: अनार्य evil minded, अद्य today, त्वया by you, मम me, चिरकालसमार्जितम् earned over a long period, यशः fame, वीर्यम् valiance, तेजश्च glory, प्रत्ययश्च bravery, विनशत्रोः has been wiped out
data.md: O abject one! by you have my long earned renown and energy and prowess and credit been brought to naught.

data.v: शत्रोः प्रख्यातवीर्यस्य रञ्जनीयस्य विक्रमैः । पश्यतो युद्धलुब्धोऽहं कृतः कापुरुषस्त्वया ।।
data.es: "While my adversary's valour is widely known, you brought me back like a timid one, while I love war, while I am to be praised in the presence of my enemy."
data.anv: प्रख्यातवीर्यस्य valour is known widely, विक्रमैः bravery, रञ्जनीयस्य one who is to be praised, शत्रोः adversary, पश्यतः as I was looking, त्वया by you, युद्धलुब्दः lover of war, अहम् I, कापुरुषः timid, कृतः did
data.md: In the very sight of an enemy of renowned prowess, and one capable of being gratified with valorous deeds, have you made me, burning for battle, look as if I were a coward.

data.v: यस्त्वं रथमिमं मोहान्न चोद्वहसि दुर्मते । सत्योऽयं प्रतितर्को मे परेण त्वमुपस्कृतः ।।
data.es: "O Evil minded one! If out of delusion you are not willing to drive, truly you are influenced by the enemy."
data.anv: दुर्मते evil minded, यःत्वम् you are, इदंरथम् this chariot, मोहात् out of delusion, न वहसिचेत् not willing to drive, अयम् I, प्रतितर्कः perversion, सत्यःtruly, त्वम् you, परेण by the enemy, उपस्कृतःare influenced
data.md: As, O wicked minded one, you did not even through heedlessness, take the car to the field of batile, I infer for certain that you have been bribed by the foe.

data.v: न हीदं विद्यते कर्म सुहृदो हितकाङ्क्षिणः । रिपूणां सदृशं चैतन्न त्वयैतत्स्वनुष्ठितम् ।।
data.es: What has been done by you is not befitting, this is What an enemy should have done. Being good at heart you have done What is good for enemy.

data.md: The act that you have done, does not appear as that of a friend seeking our welfare; but today you have acted like an enemy.

data.v: निवर्तय रथं शीघ्रं यावन्नापैति मे रिपुः । यदि वाप्युषितोऽसि त्वं स्मर्यन्ते यदि वा गुणाः ।।
data.es: "If you remember that you lived long with me and know my virtues, quickly turn back the chariot before my adversary with draws.
data.anv: त्वम् your, अध्युषितः lived with me for long, असियदि if you, मे my, गुणः virtues, यदिस्मर्यते if you remember, मेरिपुः my enemy, यावत् all that, नापैति by the way, शीघ्रम् quickly, रथम् chariot, निवर्तय take back
data.md: If you have been maintained by me, if you remember my merit, do you swiftly turn the car before my enemy has departed.

data.v: एवं परुषमुक्तस्तु हितबुद्धिरबुद्धिना । अब्रवीद्रावणं सूतो हितं सानुनयं वचः ।।
data.es: When the insensitive Ravana spoke harshly in that manner, to the charioteer who was wishing his benefit, he spoke in friendly language to Ravana.
data.anv: अबुद्धिना insensitive, एवम् in that way, परुषम् harsh, उक्तः spoken, हितबुद्धि: beneficial advice, सूतः charioteer, रावणम् to Ravana, सानुनयम् friendly, वचः words, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Thus admonished by him of slender sense, the charioteer possessed of intelligence, humbly spoke to Råvaņa words fraught with good.

data.v: न भीतोऽस्मि न मूढोऽस्मि नोपजप्तोऽस्मि शत्रुभिः । न प्रमत्तो न निःस्नेहो विस्मृता न च सत्क्रिया ।।
data.es: "I was not fearing, nor foolish, not won by the enemy, not negligent also, not lacking friendliness and not forgetting good deeds done by you."
data.anv: भीतः fearing, नास्मि me not, मूढः foolish, न अस्मि am not, शत्रुभिः enemy also, उपजप्तः won by them, न अस्मि not me, प्रमत्तः negligent, न not, निःस्नेहः friendliness, न not, सत्क्रिया च good deeds also, न not
data.md: I am not afraid, nor stupefied, nor have I been bribed by the foe, nor am I negligent. And I have not forgotten your affection or your good offices.

data.v: मया तु हितकामेन यशश्च परिरक्षता । स्नेहप्रस्कन्नमनसा प्रियमित्यप्रियं कृतम् ।।
data.es: Wishing your welfare, for your fame and to protect you with a friendly and pleasant feeling I did that which is good for you. You are unpleasant about this action.
data.anv: हितकामेन wishing your welfare, यशश्च fame, परिरक्षता to protect, स्नेहप्रसन्नमनसा with friendly and pleasant feeling, मया by me, हितम् इति that which is good for you, अप्रियम् unpleasant, कृतम् action
data.md: And studious of your welfare, I have saved your fame; and with a mind overflowing with affection I have done (to you) this unpalatable good.

data.v: नास्मिन्नर्थे महाराज त्वं मां प्रियहिते रतम् । कश्चिल्लघुरिवानार्यो दोषतो गन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "O King! I who wish your welfare ought not to be blamed like an unworthy and pettyminded person by mistake."
data.anv: महाराज O king, प्रियहिते with good intention, रतम् remain, माम् me, अस्मिन् I, अर्थे solicit, त्वम् you, कश्चित् indeed, लघुः petty, अनार्यःइव like an unworthy, दोषतः by mistake, गन्तुम् I wish you, न अर्हसि ought not
data.md: O mighty monarch, for this, you should not, like a frivolous and base one, criminate me that am ever engaged in what is good and dear to you.

data.v: श्रूयतामभिधास्यामि यन्निमित्तं मया रथः । नदीवेग इवाम्भोभिः संयुगे विनिवर्तितः ।।
data.es: "O yes! I will answer you. Please listen. like the river entering the ocean speedily is diverted, I have taken back the chariot from the battle.
data.anv: इवामंभोभिे into ocean like, नदीवेगःइव like speeding river, संयुगे in war, रथः chariot, यन्निमित्तम् for that reason, विनिवर्तितः taken back, प्रतिदास्यामि will answer you, श्रूयताम् please listen
data.md: Listen! I shall render you reason why I turned away from the field the car, rushing like a river when the sea is swelled up* *On the ascension of the Moon.

data.v: श्रमं तवावगच्छामि महता रणकर्मणा । न हि ते वीर सौमुख्यं प्रहर्षं वोपधारये ।।
data.es: "Great Ravana! After the strenuous task in the battle, there was no exhibition of your valour, and I did not cognize any superiority in your action."
data.anv: महता great, रणकर्मणा in the task of battle, तव your, श्रमम् strenuous work, अवगच्छामि took cognizance of, ते your, वीर्यसौमुख्यम् valiance, प्रकर्षंवा or superiority, नोपधारये no exhibition
data.md: I knew that you had been fatigued in consequence of your mighty exertions in the fight. And I could not perceive that your prowess then stood superior (to that of the foe).* *Two negatives in this verse amounting to an affirmative. This is the only instance of double negatives in Valmiki.

data.v: रथोद्वहनखिन्नाश्च त इमे रथवाजिनः । दीना घर्मपरिश्रान्ता गावो वर्षहता इव ।।
data.es: "The horses of my chariot were exhausted by dragging, broken down, worn out by the hot sun, and desperate like cows lashed by rain."
data.anv: मे my, रथवाजिनः chariot horses, रथोद्वहनखिन्नाः exhausted by dragging, भग्नाः broken, वर्षहताः lashed by rain, गावःइव like cows, घर्मपरिश्रान्ताः worn out with the heat of the sun, दीनाः desperate
data.md: The steeds of my car were worn out by-carrying it; and they were battered, and helpless and perspired like kine in a shower.

data.v: निमित्तानि च भूयिष्ठं यानि प्रादुर्भवन्ति नः । तेषु तेष्वभिपन्नेषु लक्षयाम्यप्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.es: I also see manifestations of good omens to start (the journey). I shall get Janaka's daughter Sita on killing Ravana.

data.md: And bad omens fast sprang up before us. And on these occurring, I perceived that things would go against us.

data.es: "Propitious and unpropitious, time and place, good and evil signs and omens, depression and liveliness of the warrior as well as strength and weakness of the one in the chariot must be ascertained."

data.md: O you endowed with exceeding might, a charioteer should be conversant with season and place, with omens, and the expressions of emotions; as also with depression of spirits, exhilaration, and grief.

data.es: "The earths' ups and downs, evenness and ruggedness, difficult locations, the right time and place for war should be known in advance and the inner weakness of the enemy also to be known."

data.md: And he should have a knowledge of low, lever and uneven grounds, and the time for conflict, and he should be able to perceive the shortcomings of the enemy.

data.v: उपयानापयाने च स्थानं प्रत्यपसर्पणम् । सर्वमेतद्रथस्थेन ज्ञेयं रथकुटुम्बिना ।।
data.es: "To hold the chariot or advance, to go near the (enemy) or retreat, to return back or advance, everything should be known to the charioteer."
data.anv: रथस्थेन by the charioteer, रथकुटुम्भिना to hold or advance, उपयानापयाने च coming near or retreating, स्थानम् in seated, प्रत्यपसर्पणम् to return back, एतत् all this, सर्वम् everything, ज्ञेयम् to be known
data.md: And a charioteer mounted on a car, should know when to draw near an enemy, when to turn away from him when to stay; and when to turn round from before the foe-all these (he should know).

data.v: तव विश्रामहेतोस्तु तथैषां रथवाजिनाम् । रौद्रं वर्जयता खेदं क्षमं कृतमिदं मया ।।
data.es: "The reason for retreating in this way is to give you rest and relieve the horses from the terrible feat and fatigue. I deserve to be excused for this action."
data.anv: तव your, विश्रामहेतोः reason is to give rest, तथा in that way, एषाम् all these, रथवाजिनाम् horses of the chariot, रौद्रम् terrific feat, खेदम् fatigue, वर्जयता to relieve, मया by me, इदम् in this way, क्षमम् deserve to be excused, कृतम् for the action
data.md: What I, for bringing respite to you as well as the horses of the car, have done by way of removing the terrific exhaustion, is proper.

data.v: न मया स्वेच्छया वीर रथोऽयमपवाहितः । भर्तृस्नेहपरीतेन मयेदं यत्कृतं विभो ।।
data.es: "Heroic Lord! I have not brought back this chariot independently (without thinking). I have acted in friendliness to the master (to give rest) not otherwise."
data.anv: वीर heroic, प्रभो Lord, अयम् I, रथः chariot, मया by me, स्वेच्छया independently, न अपवाहितः not brought back, मया by me, यत् that, कृतम् action, इदम् thus, भर्तृस्नेहपरीतेन with affection to the master
data.md: I did not, O hero, turn away the car of my own sheer will. What I have done, O lord, had been dictated by my affection for you.

data.v: आज्ञापय यथातत्त्वं वक्ष्यस्यरिनिषूदन । तत्करिष्याम्यहं वीरं गतानृण्येन चेतसा ।।
data.es: "O Tamer of enemies! Order now and in that way, I shall carry out your order in accordance with you wholeheartedly."
data.anv: अरिषूदन, tamer of enemies वीर warrior, आज्ञापय orders, त्वम् your, तत् like that, यथा so also, वक्ष्यसि order, तत् that, अहम् I, गतानृण्येन in accordance with, चेतसा wholeheartedly, करिष्यामि will carry out
data.md: Command me. What you say, O destroyer of foes. I will do every way, O hero with my whole soul.

data.v: संतुष्टस्तेन वाक्येन रावणस्तस्य सारथेः । प्रशस्यैनं बहुविधं युद्धलुब्धोऽब्रवीदिदम् ।।
data.es: Ravana was fully satisfied with the words of the charioteer. He praised the charioteer in many ways and spoke like this desiring to wage war.

data.es: "Quickly drive the chariot towards Raghava. As a policy, Ravana would never turn back on the battlefield without putting an end to the enemy."

data.md: O charioteer, do you swiftly take the car towards Rāghava. Without slaying his foe in fight, Ravana turn not away (from the field).

data.md: Speaking thus Råvaņa-lord of Rākşasas-gave the charioteer on the car an excellent ornament for the hand. Hearing Ravana's words, the charioteer drove the car.

data.v: ततो द्रुतं रावणवाक्यचोदितः; प्रचोदयामास हयान्स सारथिः । स राक्षसेन्द्रस्य ततो महारथः; क्षणेन रामस्य रणाग्रतोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: And urged on by the speech of Rāvana, the charioteer drove on the steeds, and in a moment the mighty chariot of the Rākşasa-chief appeared before Rāma in the field of battle.

data.v: मातले पश्य संरब्धमापतन्तं रथं रिपोः । यथापसव्यं पतता वेगेन महता पुनः । समरे हन्तुमात्मानं तथानेन कृता मतिः ।।

data.md: O Mătalī, behold the enraged chariot of my foe as it course on. From the furious speed with which he is again wheeling at my right, it appear that he has set his heart of slaying me in encouter.

data.md: Do you therefore heedfully drive the car right against the vehicle of my foe. I wish to destroy this one even as the wind scatter clouds that have appeared.

data.v: कामं न त्वं समाधेयः पुरंदररथोचितः । युयुत्सुरहमेकाग्रः स्मारये त्वां न शिक्षये ।।
data.es: "You are a driver of great Indra's chariot. You are not required to be told. Wishing to fight with rapt attention, I will remind you now and then not instruct you", said Rama to Matali."
data.anv: पुरन्दररथोचितः driver of the chariot of one like Indra, त्वम् you, कामम् desire, न समाधेयः not required to be told, अहम् by me, एकाग्रः single pointed, युयुत्सुः wishing to fight, त्वाम् you, स्मारये remind you, न शिक्ष्ये not instruct
data.md: Worthy of Purandara's car, you ought not to be taught by me. Desirous of encounter and my whole soul bent on fight, I simply remind younot teach you.

data.es: Matali, the best charioteer of the Devatas, was highly delighted at Rama's words and started driving.

data.md: Pleased with these words of Rāma, the excellent celestial charioteer-Mātalī-drove the car. Then leaving Ravana's mighty car on the right, he enveloped Rāvana with the dust raised by the wheels.

data.md: Thereat the Ten-necked one, enraged, with his eyes coppery and dilated (in passion), covered with arrows Rāma staying in front of his car.

And then there began a furious encounter between those (two) eager for slaying each other confronting each other like to flaming lions.

data.v: तच्छिरः पतितं भूमौ दृष्टं लोकैस्त्रिभिस्तदा । तस्यैव सदृशं चान्यद्रावणस्योत्थितं शिरः ।।

data.md: Instantly there arose another head resembling the former; and it was speedily cut off by the light-handed Rāma.

data.v: छिन्नमात्रं च तच्छीर्षं पुनरन्यत्स्म दृश्यते । तदप्यशनिसंकाशैश्छिन्नं रामेण सायकैः ।।
data.md: As soon as the second head was chopped off in the encounter by means of shafts another appeared again. And that was again severed by Rāma's shafts resembling thunder-bolts.

data.v: एवमेव शतं छिन्नं शिरसां तुल्यवर्चसाम् । न चैव रावणस्यान्तो दृश्यते जीवितक्षये ।।
data.md: Thus were severed hundred heads all equal in brilliance. But the end of Ravana's life was not seen by him.

data.md: (That Brahma weapon) irrepressible as the thunder, dreadful as the Death and discharged by Rama, fell down on Ravana's breast.

data.v: ततो विनेदुः संहृष्टा वानरा जितकाशिनः । वदन्तो राघवजयं रावणस्य च तं वधम् ।।

data.md: Thereupon the monkeys being greatly delighted roared out the victory of Rāma.

data.v: ततः सकामं सुग्रीवमङ्गदं च महाबलम् । चकार राघवः प्रीतो हत्वा राक्षसपुंगवम् ।।

data.md: Thereupon Sugrīva Vibhișana and Lakşmaņa, welcomed Rāma, of unmitigated prowess singing his glory.
