data.anv: काचित् indeed, बहुमानात् out of great respect, एनम् they, परिष्वज्य embracing, रुरोद ह roared aloud, काचित् some, चरणौ feet, आलम्ब्य holding, काचित् some, कण्ठे neck, अवलम्ब्य च started weeping
data.md: Some wept embracing him respectfullysome holding his feet and some placing themselves around his neck.

data.v: उद्धृत्य च भुजौ काचिद्भूमौ स्म परिवर्तते । हतस्य वदनं दृष्ट्वा काचिन्मोहमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Some lifting their arms threw themselves on ground, some rolled, some beholding the dead Ravana's face became deluded.
data.anv: काचित् some, भुजौ arms, उत्क्षिप्य throwing herself on ground, भूमौ on ground, सुपरिवर्तते rolled, काचित् some, हतस्य killed, वदनम् face, दृष्टवा seeing, मोहम् in delusion, उपागमत् holding
data.md: And some taking up his hand rolled on the ground and some were beside themselves (with grief) beholding the slain (Ravana's) countenance.

data.v: काचिदङ्के शिरः कृत्वा रुरोद मुखमीक्षती । स्नापयन्ती मुखं बाष्पैस्तुषारैरिव पङ्कजम् ।।
data.es: One held his head on her lap, and one held his face and looking at it shed tears, like nature covers lotus with dew and roared.
data.anv: काचित् some, शिरः head, अङ्के lap, कृत्वा holding, मुखम् face, ईक्षती looking, तुषारैः nature sheds dew, पङ्कजम् इव like from lotus, मुखम् face, बाष्पैः tears, स्नापयन्ती flowed, रुरोद roared
data.md: And some placing her head on his lap, and beholding his face, wept, bathing it with tears like a lotus enveloped with snow.

data.v: एवमार्ताः पतिं दृष्ट्वा रावणं निहतं भुवि । चुक्रुशुर्बहुधा शोकाद्भूयस्ताः पर्यदेवयन् ।।
data.es: Afflicted on beholding their husband Ravana, killed, and lying on the ground, the Rakshasa women again and again cried exceedingly in many ways overcome with grief.
data.anv: भुवि on the ground, निहतम् killed, पतिम् husband, रावणम् Ravana, दृष्टवा beholding, एवम् in that manner, आर्ताः afflicted, ताः they, बहुधा many, चुक्रुशुः again and again, शोकात् in sorrow, भूयः exceedingly, पर्यदेवयन् overcome with grief
data.md: Seeing their husband Rāvaņa thus slain on the earth, they stricken with grief bewailing again and again in sorrow, wept profusely.

data.v: येन वित्रासितः शक्रो येन वित्रासितो यमः । येन वैश्रवणो राजा पुष्पकेण वियोजितः ।।
data.es: "By whom Indra feared, by whom Yama feared, at whom king Visrava feared, by whom Pushpaka was deprived to Kubera in war, by whom Gandharvas and ascetics were afraid of, by whom high souled Suras were afraid of lies in the battlefield asleep."
data.anv: येन to whom, शक्रः Indra, वित्रासितः feared, येन to whom, यमः Yama, वित्रासितः feared, येन to whom, राजा king, वैश्रवणः Visrava, पुष्पकेण् Pushpaka, वियोजितः used by winning, येन to whom, रणे in war, गन्धर्वाणाम् Gandharvas, ऋषीणां च and ascetics, महात्मनाम् high souled, सुराणां च and Suras, भयम् fear, दत्तम् bestowed, सःअयम् he this, रणे battlefield, सतः lies, शेते asleep

data.v: गन्धर्वाणामृषीणां च सुराणां च महात्मनाम् । भयं येन महद्दत्तं सोऽयं शेते रणे हतः ।।
data.es: "By whom Indra feared, by whom Yama feared, at whom king Visrava feared, by whom Pushpaka was deprived to Kubera in war, by whom Gandharvas and ascetics were afraid of, by whom high souled Suras were afraid of lies in the battlefield asleep."
data.anv: येन to whom, शक्रः Indra, वित्रासितः feared, येन to whom, यमः Yama, वित्रासितः feared, येन to whom, राजा king, वैश्रवणः Visrava, पुष्पकेण् Pushpaka, वियोजितः used by winning, येन to whom, रणे in war, गन्धर्वाणाम् Gandharvas, ऋषीणां च and ascetics, महात्मनाम् high souled, सुराणां च and Suras, भयम् fear, दत्तम् bestowed, सःअयम् he this, रणे battlefield, सतः lies, शेते asleep

data.v: असुरेभ्यः सुरेभ्यो वा पन्नगेभ्योऽपि वा तथा । न भयं यो विजानाति तस्येदं मानुषाद्भयम् ।।
data.es: "He, who did not know fear from Asuras or Uragas, experienced fear from a mortal."
data.anv: यः he who, असुरेभ्यः from Asuras, सुरेभ्योवा or Suras, तथा so also, पन्नगेभ्योऽपि Uragas also, भयम् fear, न विजानाति not known, तस्य his, मानुषात् by human, इदम् thus, भयम् experienced fear

data.v: अवध्यो देवतानां यस्तथा दानवरक्षसाम् । हतः सोऽयं रणे शेते मानुषेण पदातिना ।।
data.es: "He, whom Devatas, Danavas and Rakshasas could not kill, lies asleep, killed by a mortal who came by walk."
data.anv: यः he who, देवतानाम् Devatas, तथा so also, दानवरक्षनाम् Danavas, Rakshasas, अवध्यः not be killed, सःअयम् he, पदातिना by walk, मानुषेण by a mortal, रणे in battle, हतः killed, शेते lies asleep
data.md: He whom the celestials, the Dānvas and the Rākşasa could not slay, has been slain in conflict by a man walking on foot.

data.v: यो न शक्यः सुरैर्हन्तुं न यक्षैर्नासुरैस्तथा । सोऽयं कश्चिदिवासत्त्वो मृत्युं मर्त्येन लम्भितः ।।
data.es: "He, who could not be killed by Suras, Asuras or Yakshas, such a hero lies like a weak person devoid of strength, killed by a mortal, is resting."
data.anv: यः he who, सुरैः Suras, हन्तुम् to kill, न शक्यः not possible, यक्षै: Yaksha, न not, तथा so also, असुरैः Asuras, न not, सः he, अयम् this, असत्त्वः weak, कश्चिदिव like one devoid of strength, मर्त्येन by death, मृत्युम् death, लम्भितः resting
data.md: He, who was incapable of being killed by the celestials, Yaksas and Asuras, has met with death like one devoid of prowess at the hands of a mortal.

data.v: एवं वदन्त्यो बहुधा रुरुदुस्तस्य ताः स्त्रियः । भूय एव च दुःखार्ता विलेपुश्च पुनः पुनः ।।
data.es: Those women grieving in that way roared aloud, lamenting again and again cried, afflicted by sorrow.
data.anv: तस्य his, दुःखिताः grieving, ताःस्त्रियःएवम् those women in that way, वदन्त्य: roaring, रुरुदुः aloud, भूयःएव च lamented again, दुःखार्ताः afflicted with sorrow, पुनःपुनः again and again, विलेपुः cried
data.md: Speaking in this wise, the she-demons, over powered with sorrow wept and bewailed again and again (saying).

data.v: अशृण्वता तु सुहृदां सततं हितवादिनाम् । एताः सममिदानीं ते वयमात्मा च पातिताः ।।
data.es: "You did not listen to the good advice of your dear and good at heart. You brought Sita and destroyed yourself and all of us at a time."
data.anv: सततम् always, हितवादिनाम् your welfare, सुहृदाम् dear and good at heart, अश्वण्वता not listened, मरणाय death, सीता Sita, आहृता brought, राक्षसाश्च Rakshasas, निपातिताः struck down, आत्मा च yourself, पातितः destroyed, समम् at a time, ते to you, एताःवयम् all of us, इदानीम् this way
data.md: Not hearing (the counsels) of your friends, always pointing out your welfare, you did bring Sītā, for your destruction as well as that of the Raksasas.

data.v: ब्रुवाणोऽपि हितं वाक्यमिष्टो भ्राता विभीषणः । धृष्टं परुषितो मोहात्त्वयात्मवधकाङ्क्षिणा ।।
data.es: "Even though good advice was given by your dear brother Vibheeshana, in your delusion evidently you sought your own destruction."
data.anv: हितम् good, वाक्यम् words, ब्रुवाणोऽपि even though told, इष्टःभ्राता dear brother, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, धृष्टम् evidently, आत्मवथकाङ्णा sought your own destruction, त्वया by you, मोहात् in delusion, परुषितः harshly
data.md: Although your brother Vibhīşana addressed you with words pregnant with your welfare-you, for your own destruction, out of your misgivings, did excite his anger and have (now) seen (the result thereof).

data.v: यदि निर्यातिता ते स्यात्सीता रामाय मैथिली । न नः स्याद्व्यसनं घोरमिदं मूलहरं महत् ।।
data.es: "If Sita, princess of Mithila had been returned by you, this great destruction of the very root and calamity with you and for us would not have happened."
data.anv: मैतिली Mythili, सीता Sita, ते to you, रामाय Rama's, निर्यातिता returned, यदिस्यात् if so with you, नः not, मूलहरम् destruction of the very root, इदम् this, महत् great, घोरम् terrific, व्यसनम् calamity, न स्यात् not happened
data.md: Have you returned Sītā the daughter of the king of Mithilā to Råma, this mighty and dreadful disaster, destroying the very root, would not have befallen us.

data.v: वृत्तकामो भवेद्भ्राता रामो मित्रकुलं भवेत् । वयं चाविधवाः सर्वाः सकामा न च शत्रवः ।।
data.es: "If your brother's desire had been fulfilled Rama would have turned to be our friend. We would not have been widows. Our enemy's desire would not have been fulfilled."
data.anv: न्राता brother, वृत्तकामः desire fulfilled, भवेत् would be, रामः Rama, मित्रकुलम् turned to be friend, भवेत् would have been, वयम् our, सर्वाः all, अध्विनाः not widows, शत्रवः च enemy's, सकामाः that desire, न not
data.md: Rāma's desire would have been encompassed his friends would have been successful (through Vibhīşaņa) we would not been widowed and out enemies would not have got their desires fulfilled.

data.v: त्वया पुनर्नृशंसेन सीतां संरुन्धता बलात् । राक्षसा वयमात्मा च त्रयं तुलं निपातितम् ।।
data.es: "With evil intention you kept Sita under detention. These Rakshasas and you and us all the three are together destroyed."
data.anv: नृशंसेन with evil intention, सीताम् Sita, बलात् forcibly, संरुन्धता kept under detention, त्वयापुनः again by you, राक्षसाः Rakshasa, वयम् these आत्मा च and you too, त्रयम् three, तुल्यम् together, निपातितम् destroyed
data.md: By there, Sītā was kept by force in captivity in a ruthless manner, and the Rākşasas, ourselves and yourself-all three equally have been slain.

data.v: न कामकारः कामं वा तव राक्षसपुंगव । दैवं चेष्टयते सर्वं हतं दैवेन हन्यते ।।
data.es: "O Foremost of Rakshasas! You have acted according to your desire alone is not sufficient as divine will make you do everything. He is killed whom destiny kills."
data.anv: राक्षसपुङ्गवः foremost of Rakshasas, कामम् desire, तव of yours, कामकारः acting to your will, न वा by you, सर्वम् all, दैवम् divine, चेष्टयते makes you do, देवेन by divine, हतम् killed, हन्यते kills
data.md: O foremost of the Rākşasas, forsooth this is not your own folly-it is Accident that unite all things and it is accident again that bring about destrucion.

data.v: वानराणां विनाशोऽयं राक्षसानां च ते रणे । तव चैव महाबाहो दैवयोगादुपागतः ।।
data.es: "O mighty armed Ravana! For Vanaras, Rakshasas and you too, this destruction in this war has come by divine grace."
data.anv: महाबाहो mighty armed, रणे in war, वानराणाम् Vanaras, राक्षसानां च Rakshasas also, तव च you too, अयम् this, विनाशः destruction, दैवयोगात् with the divine grace, उपागतः has come
data.md: O you of huge arms-the destruction of the monkeys and the Rākşasas as well as that of yourself has been brought about by Accident.

data.v: नैवार्थेन न कामेन विक्रमेण न चाज्ञया । शक्या दैवगतिर्लोके निवर्तयितुमुद्यता ।।
data.es: "In the world, to change the divine course of action, it is not possible with wealth, or will or by prowess or king's orders."
data.anv: उद्यता to lift up, दैवगतिः divine course, लोके in the world, अर्थेन by wealth, निवर्तयितुम् to stop, न शक्या not possible, कामेन with will, न not, विक्रमेण by prowess, न not, आज्ञया च king's order, न not
data.md: When the course of accident is about to bring about result-wealth, desire, prowess or command-nothing is capable of with standing it.

data.v: विलेपुरेवं दीनास्ता राक्षसाधिपयोषितः । कुरर्य इव दुःखार्ता बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणाः ।।
data.md: Thus wept piteously the wives of the lord of Rakşasas like to so many she-elephants-rendered poorly, stricken with grief and with tears in their eyes.

data.v: तासां विलपमानानां तथा राक्षसयोषिताम् । ज्येष्ठा पत्नी प्रिया दीना भर्तारं समुदैक्षत ।।
data.es: Then from among the wives lamenting, the first wife, dear to Ravana gazed at her husband lamenting piteously.
data.anv: तदा then, तासाम् of them, राक्षसयोषिताम् Rakshasa's wife, विलपमानानाम् lamenting, प्रिया dear, ज्येष्ठापत्नी first wife, दीना piteously, भर्तारम् husband, समुदैक्षत gazed
data.md: The foremost of the wives of the Rākşasas (king) bewailing piteously cast her looks poorly towards her husband. And beholding her Tennecked husband slain by Rāma of Inconceivable actions Mandodarī bewailed there piteously.

data.v: दशग्रीवं हतं दृष्ट्वा रामेणाचिन्त्यकर्मणा । पतिं मन्दोदरी तत्र कृपणा पर्यदेवयत् ।।
data.es: Looking at her husband Ravana killed by Rama of inconceivable exploits, Mandodari piteously lamented there.
data.anv: अचिन्त्यकर्मणा of inconceivable exploits, रामेण by Rama, हतम् killed, पतिम् husband, दशग्रीवम् ten headed Ravana, दृष्टवा looking, मण्डोदरी Mandodari, तत्र there, कृपणा piteously, पर्यदेवयत् lamented there
data.md: The foremost of the wives of the Rākşasas (king) bewailing piteously cast her looks poorly towards her husband. And beholding her Tennecked husband slain by Rāma of Inconceivable actions Mandodarī bewailed there piteously.

data.v: ननु नाम महाबाहो तव वैश्रवणानुज । क्रुद्धस्य प्रमुखे स्थातुं त्रस्यत्यपि पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: "O mighty armed Ravana! O, brother of Visrava! When in anger even Purandara was afraid to stand before you, it is well known."
data.anv: महाबाहो mighty armed, वैश्रवणानुज brother of Visrava, क्रुद्धस्य in anger, तव your, प्रमुखे chief, स्थातुम् to stand, पुरन्दरःअपि even Purandara, त्रस्यति fears, ननुनाम well known
data.md: O you of huge arms! O younger brother of Baishravana! Even Purandara feared to stand before you when enraged.

data.v: ऋषयश्च महीदेवा गन्धर्वाश्च यशस्विनः । ननु नाम तवोद्वेगाच्चारणाश्च दिशो गताः ।।
data.es: "For fear of you, even great seers, illustrious Gandharvas, Charanas also went in all directions, is well known."
data.anv: तव your, उद्वेगात् for fear, महान्तः great, ऋषयः seers, यशस्विनः illustrious, गन्धर्वाश्च Gandharvas also, चारणाः Charanas, दिशः directions, गताः went, ननुनाम is well known
data.md: The great Rşis-the far-famed Gandharvas and the charanas, fled away to different quarters in your fear.

data.v: स त्वं मानुषमात्रेण रामेण युधि निर्जितः । न व्यपत्रपसे राजन्किमिदं राक्षसर्षभ ।।
data.es: "O Lord of Rakshasas! Just by Rama, a mortal, you have been killed in war. Are you not shy of it?"
data.anv: राक्षसेश्वर Lord of Rakshasas, राजन् king, सःत्वम् you, मानुषमात्रेण just a mortal, रामेण by Rama, युधि in war, निर्जितः killed, न व्यपत्रपसे not shy about it, इदम् for this, किम् why
data.md: Then (how) have you been overpowered in battle by Rāma who is a mere man? Why is it that you are not ashamed of it, О king, O lord of the Raksasas?

data.v: कथं त्रैलोक्यमाक्रम्य श्रिया वीर्येण चान्वितम् । अविषह्यं जघान त्वां मानुषो वनगोचरः ।।
data.es: "Winning the three worlds by your valour, you are glorious, irresistible and beyond reach. How did the wanderer in the forest strike you?"
data.anv: त्रैलोक्यम् in the three worlds, आक्रम्य occupying, श्रिया glorious, वीर्येण च by your valour, अन्वितम् irresistible, अविषह्यम् beyond the reach, त्वाम् you, वनगोचरः wanderer in forest, मानुषः human, कथम् how, जघान struck you
data.md: Conquering the three worlds with your prowess you did attain your glory; and it is unbearable, that a man, ranging in the forest, has slain you.

data.v: मानुषाणामविषये चरतः कामरूपिणः । विनाशस्तव रामेण संयुगे नोपपद्यते ।।
data.es: "You lived in an inaccessible place and are capable of assuming any form at will. It is not believable how you have been destroyed by Rama."
data.anv: मानुषाणाम् among humans, अविषये inaccessible, चरतः live, कामरूपिणः capable of assuming any form at will, तव your, विनाशः destroyed, रामेण by Rama, संयुगे in war, नोपपद्यते is not believable
data.md: You who are capable of assuming shapes at will have been slain in conflict by Rāma, in the city of Lankā unapproachable by men.

data.v: न चैतत्कर्म रामस्य श्रद्दधामि चमूमुखे । सर्वतः समुपेतस्य तव तेनाभिमर्शनम् ।।
data.es: "You are always well equipped with the army, so such action (killing you) is not possible for Rama."
data.anv: चमूमुखे army, रामस्य of Rama, एतत् such, कर्म action, न श्रद्धधामि not action, सर्वतः always, समुपेतस्य fully equipped, तव your, तेन therefore, धर्षणम् fight
data.md: I do not believe that your destruction, who had always been crowned with success, before the forces, is work of Rāma.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि पुरा जित्वा जितं त्रिभुवणं त्वया । स्मरद्भिरिव तद्वैरमिन्द्रियैरेव निर्जितः ।।
data.es: "In the past by winning your senses you gained the three worlds. Now it seems as though the senses have recollected and taken their grudge. You have lost control over your senses, thereby you are killed by your enemy."
data.anv: पुरा in the past, त्वया by you, इन्द्रियाणि senses, जित्वा winning over, त्रिभुवनम् three worlds, जितम् gained, तत् that, वैरम् grudge, स्मरद्भिःइव as though they recollected their grudge, इन्द्रियैरेव by the senses, त्वम् you, निर्जितः killed
data.md: Subduing all your passions, you did conquer the three worlds-remembering their grudge they have now over powered you.

data.v: अथ वा रामरूपेण वासवः स्वयमागतः । मायां तव विनाशाय विधायाप्रतितर्किताम् ।।
data.es: "Or else, the god of death would have come in the form of Rama for your destruction, having right knowledge and taking an inconceivable recourse.
data.anv: अथवा or else, स्वयम् by himself, कृतान्तः god of death, तव your, विनाशाय for destruction, अप्रतितर्किताम् inconceivable recourse, मायाम् conceit, विधाय right knowledge, रामरूपेण in the form of Rama, आगतः would have come.
data.md: (Methinks) Death (himself) came there in the shape of Rāma and spread illusions unconsciously for your destruction, O you of great strength.

data.v: यदैव हि जनस्थाने राक्षसैर्बहुभिर्वृतः । खरस्तव हतो भ्राता तदैवासौ न मानुषः ।।
data.es: " At Janasthana your brother Khara, who was surrounded by many Rakshasas, was killed by a mortal in the same manner."
data.anv: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, बहुभिः many, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, वृतः surrounded by, तवभ्राता your brother, खरः Khara, हतः killed, तदैव in the same manner, असौ you, मानुषः mortal, न not
data.md: Rāma is not a man since he slew at Janasthāna your brother Khara encircied by many a Rāks asas.

data.v: यदैव नगरीं लङ्कां दुष्प्रवेषां सुरैरपि । प्रविष्टो हनुमान्वीर्यात्तदैव व्यथिता वयम् ।।
data.es: "To Lanka, which is inaccessible to anyone, Hanuman entered by increasing his valour. Knowing this we worried (that Rama may not be mere mortal)."
data.anv: यदैव by that action, हनुमान् Hanuman, सुरैरपि even Suras, दुष्प्रवेशाम् difficult to enter, लङ्कांनगरीम् Lanka city, वीर्यात् valour, प्रविष्टः increasing, तदैव like that, वयम् knowing this, व्यथिताः worried
data.md: We were sore-distressed when Hanuman, by his own prowess, entered the city of Lanka incapable of being approached even by the celestials.

data.v: क्रियतामविरोधश्च राघवेणेति यन्मया । उच्यमानो न गृह्णासि तस्येयं व्युष्टिरागता ।।
data.es: "You were advised by me not to have any hostile action with Rama. You had not listened to me. This is the result of that action."
data.anv: राघवेण with enmity, अविरोधः obstructed, क्रियताम् hostile action, इति thus, मया by me, उच्यमानम् advised, यत् that, न गृह्णासि not taken, तस्य his, इयम् thus, व्युष्टिः result, आगता has come
data.md: I prevented you from creating enmity with Rāghava but you did not pay heed to my words and this is the result (thereof).

data.v: अकस्माच्चाभिकामोऽसि सीतां राक्षसपुंगव । ऐश्वर्यस्य विनाशाय देहस्य स्वजनस्य च ।।
data.es: "O Foremost of Rakshasas! To the destruction of your wealth, life and your own people you suddenly developed passion for Sita."
data.anv: राक्षसपुङ्गवः foremost among the Rakshasas, ऐश्वर्यस्य by wealth, देहस्य life, स्वजनस्य by own people, विनाशाय destruction, सीताम् at Sita, अकस्मात् suddenly, अभिकामः passion, असि you developed

data.v: अरुन्धत्या विशिष्टां तां रोहिण्याश्चापि दुर्मते । सीतां धर्षयता मान्यां त्वया ह्यसदृशं कृतम् ।।
data.es: "O evil minded king! Sita is to be respected even more than Arundathi or Rohini. Your arrogant action to her is unworthy."
data.anv: दुर्मते evil minded, अरुन्धत्याः by Arundathi, रोहिण्याश्चापि even Rohini too, विशिष्टाम् special, मान्याम् respected, सीताम् Sita, धर्षयता arrogance, त्वया by you, असदृशम् improper, कृतंहि done

data.v: न कुलेन न रूपेण न दाक्षिण्येन मैथिली । मयाधिका वा तुल्या वा त्वं तु मोहान्न बुध्यसे ।।
data.es: "Mythili by race is not superior to me even a little, not in civility. Out of infatuation you did not perceive this."
data.anv: मैथिली Mythili, कुलेन by race, मया compared to me, अधिकावा superior, तुल्यावा न not little, रूपेण form, न not, दाक्षिण्येन in civility, न not, त्वम् you, मोहात् out of infatuation, तत् that, न बुध्यसे not perceived
data.md: Maithili is not my equal nor superior either in birth, beauty or accomplishments, but you did not perceive this by your misgivings.

data.v: सर्वथा सर्वभूतानां नास्ति मृत्युरलक्षणः । तव तावदयं मृत्युर्मैथिलीकृतलक्षणः ।।
data.es: "Death does not happen without reason for any being. To you this happened because of getting Mythili."
data.anv: सर्वभूतानाम् at all beings, सर्वदा always, अलक्षणः without reason, मृत्युः death, नास्ति not, तवतावत् to you also, अयम् this, मैथिलीकृतलक्षणः on account of getting Mythili
data.md: Death does not always visit all men without any cause-and Maithili is the cause of the death.

data.v: मैथिली सह रामेण विशोका विहरिष्यति । अल्पपुण्या त्वहं घोरे पतिता शोकसागरे ।।
data.md: And death, in consequence of Maithili, has taken you far away. And she, shorn of all sorrow, shall enjoy in the company of Rāma, and I, of limited piety, am now sunk in the ocean of grief.

data.v: कैलासे मन्दरे मेरौ तथा चैत्ररथे वने । देवोद्यानेषु सर्वेषु विहृत्य सहिता त्वया ।।
विमानेनानुरूपेण या याम्यतुलया श्रिया । पश्यन्ती विविधान्देशांस्तांस्तांश्चित्रस्रगम्बरा । भ्रंशिता कामभोगेभ्यः सास्मि वीरवधात्तव ।।
data.md: Roaming at large with you in a car unequalled in beauty on the hill Kailāsa Mandara, Meru, in the garden of Caitraratha and all other celestial gardens, beholding many a country, wearing variegated clothes and garlands, I have been deprived of all pleasures and enjoyments, O hero, by your death.

data.v: सत्यवाक्स महाभागो देवरो मे यदब्रवीत् । अयं राक्षसमुख्यानां विनाशः पर्युपस्थितः ।।
कामक्रोधसमुत्थेन व्यसनेन प्रसङ्गिना । त्वया कृतमिदं सर्वमनाथं रक्षसां कुलम् ।।
data.md: This destruction of the leading Rākṣasas has proceeded from the disaster arising from your anger and lust. For your (vicious) deeds all our good fortune is lost-(and from them) has proceeded the great disaster exterminating the race. And by you all the Raksasa families have been deprived of their lords.

data.v: न हि त्वं शोचितव्यो मे प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः । स्त्रीस्वभावात्तु मे बुद्धिः कारुण्ये परिवर्तते ।।
data.es: "You are famous for your strength and courage. I do not need to wail for you. Being a woman, by nature I am compassionate, and my mind is moving towards sorrow."
data.anv: प्रख्यातबलपौरुषः famed for strength and courage, त्वम् you, मे my, शोचितव्यः wailing, नहि not, स्त्रीस्वभावात् being woman by nature, मेबुद्धिः my intellect, कारुण्ये compassionate, परिवर्तते moving towards
data.md: You well-known for your strength and manliness, are not worthy of being grieved by me. On account of my effeminate nature my understanding is possessed by sorrow.

data.v: सुकृतं दुष्कृतं च त्वं गृहीत्वा स्वां गतिं गतः । आत्मानमनुशोचामि त्वद्वियोगेन दुःखिताम् ।।
data.es: "You have taken away the good and evil deeds done by your death. I'm thinking of myself and wailing."
data.anv: त्वम् you, सुकृतम् good work, दुष्कृतं च evil deeds, गृहीत्वा taking, स्वाम् you, गतिम् death, गतः went, त्वद्विनाशेन by your death, दुःखिताम् I am wailing, आत्मानम् about myself, अनुशोचामि thinking of
data.md: Carrying your pious and iniquitous deeds you have attained to your own state-I am only lamenting for me who have been sorry for your destruction.

data.v: नीलजीमूतसंकाशः पीताम्बरशुभाङ्गदः । सर्वगात्राणि विक्षिप्य किं शेषे रुधिराप्लुतः । प्रसुप्त इव शोकार्तां किं मां न प्रतिभाषसे ।।
data.es: "Resembling a dark cloud clad in yellow silk, why are you lying like this with limbs thrown down and body covered with blood?"
data.anv: नीलजीमूतसङ्काशः resembling dark cloud in colour, पीताम्बरशुभाङ्गद clad in yellow silk, स्वगात्राणि your own limbs, विनिक्षिप्य thrown down broken, रुधिराप्लुतः covered with blood, किम् why, शेषे lying
data.md: O you resembling the red clouds O you wearing yellow cloth and excellent Angada, stretching your person on the ground why are you in the long run bathed in blood? Why did you not like one asleep welcome me who am stricken with grief?

data.v: महावीर्यस्य दक्षस्य संयुगेष्वपलायिनः । यातुधानस्य दौहित्रीं किं त्वं मां नाभ्युदीक्षसे ।।
data.es: "You are sleeping like this while I am stricken with grief. Why are you not replying to me? I am the granddaughter of Malyavantha, a great hero who fought with Daksha. Why are you disowning me and not answering me?"
data.anv: प्रसुप्तःइव sleeping like this, शोकार्ताम् stricken with grief, माम् me, किम् why, न प्रतिभाषसे not replying, महावीर्यस्य being great hero, दक्षस्य Daksha'sसम्युगेषु in the combat, अपलायिनः disown, यातुधानस्य like husband 's brother's wife, दौहित्रीं granddaughter, माम् me, किम् why, न प्रतिभाषसे not you are not answering
data.md: I am the grand-daughter of the highly powerful Rākşasa Sumālī who never flies away from the field of battle; why did you not welcome me.

data.v: येन सूदयसे शत्रून्समरे सूर्यवर्चसा । वज्रो वज्रधरस्येव सोऽयं ते सततार्चितः ।।
data.es: "The iron bar of yours which is effulgent like the Sun and closely resembles the thunderbolt of Indra, with which you have terminated your enemies in the combat, which is regularly worshipped by you, which is adorned with a network of gold, is broken into thousand pieces and lies scattered."

data.v: धिगस्तु हृदयं यस्या ममेदं न सहस्रधा । त्वयि पञ्चत्वमापन्ने फलते शोकपीडितम् ।।
data.es: "You have returned to the five elements. This heart of mine distressed with grief is not breaking into a thousand pieces."
data.anv: त्वयि by you, पञ्चत्वम् five elements, आपन्ने attained, यस्याः its, इदंहृदयम् this heart, शोकपीडितम् distressed in grief, सहस्रधा thousand, स फलते pieces, धिगअस्तु not breaking
data.md: Why did you lie on the battle-field embracing her like your beloved spouse? Why did you not wish tr welcome me like one not beloved to you? Ok fie on this heart of mine which is not sundered into thousand (pieces) albeit distressed with the grief of your death!

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे रामो विभीषणमुवाच ह । संस्कारः क्रियतां भ्रातुः स्त्रियश्चैता निवर्तय ।।
data.es: Thereafter, Rama spoke to Vibheeshana like this." Let the obsequies be carried out and all the women comforted."
data.anv: एतस्मिन् thereafter, अन्तरे in the meantime, रामः Rama, विभीषणम् to Vibheeshana, उवाच ह spoke, भ्रातुः brother, संस्कारः obsequies, क्रियताम् to do, स्त्रीगणः all women, परिसान्त्व्यताम् be comforted
data.md: In the meantime Rama said to Vibhrsana, “Do you perform the funeral ceremonies of your brother and console his wives."

data.v: तं प्रश्रितस्ततो रामं श्रुतवाक्यो विभीषणः । विमृश्य बुद्ध्या धर्मज्ञो धर्मार्थसहितं वचः । रामस्यैवानुवृत्त्यर्थमुत्तरं प्रत्यभाषत ।।
त्यक्तधर्मव्रतं क्रूरं नृशंसमनृतं तथा । नाहमर्होऽस्मि संस्कर्तुं परदाराभिमर्शकम् ।।
data.es: "This Ravana had given up righteous conduct, was cruel, merciless, untrue, and had laid hands on others' wives. I do not deserve to perform obsequies to him.
data.anv: त्यक्तधर्मव्रतम् who had given up righteous conduct, क्रूरम् cruel, नृशंसम् merciless, तथा so also, अनृतम् untrue, परदाराभिमर्शिनमसंस्कर्तुम् laid hands on others wives, अहम् I, अर्हः not deserve, न अस्मि not do
data.md: "I do not think it proper to perform his cremation ceremony who had renounced all pious deeds was wicked cruel, liar and who had ravished others' wives.

data.v: भ्रातृरूपो हि मे शत्रुरेष सर्वाहिते रतः । रावणो नार्हते पूजां पूज्योऽपि गुरुगौरवात् ।।
data.es: "This Ravana remained doing harm to all and does not deserve the respect of his elder brother, or prayers. He is an enemy in the form of brother. He does not deserve to be worshipped.
data.anv: सर्वाहिते doing harm to all, रतः remained, एषःरावणः this Ravana, गुरुगौरवात् does not deserve respect of elder brother, पूज्योऽपि prayers, भ्रातृरूपः in brother form, मेशत्रुः my enemy, पूजाम् to worship, न अर्हते not deserve
data.md: He is my enemy in the shape of a brother ever engaged in doing injury to others and Rāvana is not worthy of my adoration albeit he is adorable by virtue of his being my elder brother.

data.v: नृशंस इति मां राम वक्ष्यन्ति मनुजा भुवि । श्रुत्वा तस्य गुणान्सर्वे वक्ष्यन्ति सुकृतं पुनः ।।
data.es: "If I am not performing obsequies to my elder brother, the people in this world will call me ruthless. Again, on hearing his blemishes they will say that it is good not to do it for him."
data.anv: राम Rama, भुवि in this world, मनुजाः humans, माम् me, नृशंसःइति ruthless, वक्ष्यन्ति will say, सर्वे all, पुनःagain, तस्य his, अगुणान् blemishes, श्रुत्वा on hearing, सुकृतम् good deed, वक्ष्यन्ति will speak
data.md: O Rāma, perhaps people of this earth will call me cruel but they will again recognise my act as good when they will hear of his vicious deeds.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा परमप्रीतो रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । विभीषणमुवाचेदं वाक्यज्ञो वाक्यकोविदम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Vibheeshana's words, Rama, who is good at expression, very affectionately, upholding virtues, spoke as follows to Vibheeshana.
data.anv: तत् then, श्रुत्वा on hearing, परमप्रीतः very affectionately, धर्मभृताम् best in upholding virtue, वरः choicest, वाक्यकोविदः good at expression, रामः Rama, वाक्यज्ञम् words, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, इदम् this, उवाच spoke
data.md: Hearing those words, Rāma, the foremost of the pious and conversant with the skill of speech greatly delighted, spoke to Vibhisana (equally) skilled in speech.

data.v: तवापि मे प्रियं कार्यं त्वत्प्रभवाच्च मे जितम् । अवश्यं तु क्षमं वाच्यो मया त्वं राक्षसेश्वर ।।
data.es: "O Lord of Rakshasas! You are dear to me. It is by your strength I could be victorious. I have to do some kind deed for you.
data.anv: राक्षसेश्वर Rakshasa Lord, तव your, मेअपि me also, प्रियम् dear, कार्यम् deed, त्वत्प्रभावात् by your strength, मया to me, जितम् could be victorious, अवश्यम् surely, मया to me, क्षमम् kindly action, वाच्यः said
data.md: It behove me to encompass your welfare since by your help I have gained the victory. I lord of Räkșasas, forsooth, you should hear my wellmeaning words.

data.v: अधर्मानृतसंयुक्तः काममेष निशाचरः । तेजस्वी बलवाञ्शूरः संग्रामेषु च नित्यशः ।।
data.es: "This nightranger is full of unrighteousness and untrue. But he was a strong, energetic hero in combat."
data.anv: एषः like that, निशाचरः night ranger, अधर्मानृतसंयुक्तःकामम् full of unrighteousness and untrue, तु you, तेजस्वी energetic, बलवान् strong, सङ्ग्रामेषु in combat, नित्यशः always, शूरः च a hero
data.md: Although this night-ranger perpetrated many vicious and impious deeds still he was ever powerful, heroic and strong in warfare.

data.v: शतक्रतुमुखैर्देवैः श्रूयते न पराजितः । महात्मा बलसंपन्नो रावणो लोकरावणः ।।
data.es: "Though he is richly endowed with prowess, he is a tyranny to the world, who has performed a hundred sacrifices (like Indra) and never got defeated, I heard."
data.anv: महात्मा great self, बलसम्पन्नः rich in prowess, लोकरावणः tyranny to the world, रावणः Ravana, शतक्रुमुखैः a hundred sacrifices, वीरैः hero, न पराजितः not defeated, श्रूयते heard
data.md: I have heard that this high-souled Ravana, gifted with strength and a dread to all people was not defeated (even) by the celestials headed by the performer of hundred sacrifices.

data.v: मरणान्तानि वैराणि निर्वृत्तं नः प्रयोजनम् । क्रियतामस्य संस्कारो ममाप्येष यथा तव ।।
data.es: "There is no hostility after death for heroes. Let us perform his obsequies. I am also like that in this regard.
data.anv: वैराणि for heroes, मरणान्तानि after death, नः no, प्रयोजनम् no use, निर्वृत्तम् hostility, अस्य his, संस्कारः obsequies, क्रियताम् be done, एषः in that, ममापि me also, तव your, यथा like that
data.md: With death our enmity has terminated and our object has been accomplished: he is as dear to me as to you: perform (therefore) his funeral rites.

data.v: त्वत्सकाशान्महाबाहो संस्कारं विधिपूर्वकम् । क्षिप्रमर्हति धर्मज्ञ त्वं यशोभाग्भविष्यसि ।।
data.es: "Ten headed Ravana being so (knower of righteousness), he deserves your performance of his last rites as per tradition and righteously You will attain fame by doing this deed."
data.anv: दशग्रीवः ten headed, त्वत्सकाशात् being so, विधिपूर्वकम् as per tradition, संस्कारम् ritual of obsequies, प्राप्तुम् to attain, धर्मेण righteously, क्षिप्रविथौत्देल्य, अर्हति deserves, त्वम् from you, यशोभाक् you will attain fame, भविष्यसि by doing this
data.md: O you of long-arms it behove the to perform speedily with due rites and religious ceremonies his funeral ceremony-you shall be the object of praise (to people).

data.v: राघवस्य वचः श्रुत्वा त्वरमाणो विभीषणः । संस्कारेणानुरूपेण योजयामास रावणम् ।।
data.es: On hearing Raghava's words, Vibheeshana hastened to perform the last rites of his brother Ravana who had been killed.
data.anv: विभीषणःVibheeshana, राघवस्य Raghava's, वचःwords, श्रुत्वा on hearing, त्वरमाणः hastened, हतम् killed, भ्रातरम् brother, रावणम् Ravana's, संस्कारयितुम् for his last rites, आरेभे performed
data.md: Hearing the words of Rāghava, Vibhīşaņa hastened on and began to make arrangements for the cremation of his slain brother Råvana.

data.v: स ददौ पावकं तस्य विधियुक्तं विभीषणः । ताः स्त्रियोऽनुनयामास सान्त्वमुक्त्वा पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: Vibhīşaņa according to due rites put fire to his (funeral pyre). Bathing and with wetted cloth, offering duly linseed and sacrificial grass mixed with water and consoling (Ravana's) wives again and again, he entreated them to go back.

data.v: प्रविष्टासु च सर्वासु राक्षसीषु विभीषणः । रामपार्श्वमुपागम्य तदातिष्ठद्विनीतवत् ।।
data.es: After the women entering the city, Vibheeshana came towards Rama and stood in a submissive manner.
data.anv: स्त्रीषु women also, पुरीम् Lanka, प्रविष्टासु on entering, सर्वासु all over, राक्षसीषु Rakshasa women, विभीषणः Vibhishana, तदा then, रामपार्श्वम् towards Rama, उपागम्य came towards, विनीतवत् submissive manner, अतिष्ठत् standing
data.md: They then entered the city. And those damsels having entered the city, Vibhisana, the lord of Rākşasas, approaching Rāma, stood by his side gently.

data.v: रामोऽपि सह सैन्येन ससुग्रीवः सलक्ष्मणः । हर्षं लेभे रिपुं हत्वा यथा वृत्रं शतक्रतुः ।।
data.es: Enemy killed, Rama also accompanied by Sugriva, Lakshmana, and army experienced joy, like Indra (who performed a hundred sacrifices) after killing Vrta.
data.anv: ससुग्रीवः Sugriva, सलक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, सैन्येनसह accompanied by the army, रामोऽपि Rama also, रिपुम् enemy, हत्वा killed, वृत्रम् Vrta, हत्वा killed, शतक्रतु: Indra who did a hundred sacrifices, यथा that manner, हर्षम् happy, लेभे experienced
data.md: Rāma too, along with his army, Sugrīva and Lakşmana, was greatly delighted after slaying (the demon) Vitra.

data.es: In the meantime, Devas, Gandharvas, Danavas speaking to each other an auspicious story of Ravana's destruction went in their respective aerial cars.
data.anv: ते in the meantime, देवगन्धर्वदानवाः Devas, Gandharvas, Danavasरावणवधम् Ravana's destruction, दृष्टवा seeing, ते they, शुभाःauspicious, कथाः story, कथयन्तः speaking to each other, स्वैःस्वैः their, विमानैः aerial cars, जग्मुः went
data.md: Beholding the destruction of Rāvaņa the celestials, Gandharvas and Dänavas ascending their respective cars went away chanting this excellent theme.

data.es: Speaking about the highly respected Raghava's prowess, the end of dreadful Ravana, the good fighting of Vanaras, counsel of Sugriva, valour of Hanuman, love of Lakshmana, fidelity of Sita, all rejoiced and returned as they had come.

data.v: राघवस्तु रथं दिव्यमिन्द्रदत्तं शिखिप्रभम् । अनुज्ञाय महाभागो मातलिं प्रत्यपूजयत् ।।
data.es: Bidding farewell to Matali joyously, honourable Raghava returned the aerial chariot bestowed to him by Indra.
data.anv: महाभागो honourable, राघवस्तु Raghava too, इन्द्रदत्तम् bestowed by Indra, शिखिप्रभम् aerial chariot, दिव्यम् wonderful, रथम् chariot, अनुज्ञाय bidding farewell, मातलिम् Matali, प्रत्यपूजयत् joyously returned
data.md: Rāghava, having long arms, permitting the charioteer Mātali to take back the celestial car bright as the sky sent by Indra, honoured him greatly.

data.v: राघवेणाभ्यनुज्ञातो मातलिः शक्रसारथिः । दिव्यं तं रथमास्थाय दिवमेवारुरोह सः ।।
data.es: Matali, charioteer of Indra too taking Raghava's permission went to heaven in that wonderful chariot.
data.anv: रा: he, राघवेण by Raghava, अभ्यनुज्ञातः with permission, शक्रसारथिः Indra's charioteer, मातलिःMatali, दिव्यम् wonderful, तंरथम् that chariot, आस्थाय taking, दिवमेव heaven, आरुरोह went
data.md: And being commanded by Rāghava Mātali, the charioteer of Sakra taking the celestial car, rose up in the welkin.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु दिवमारूढे सुरसारथिसत्तमे । राघवः परमप्रीतः सुग्रीवं परिषस्वजे ।।
data.es: "On Matali ascending to heaven, Raghava very dearly embraced Sugriva for his help in his victory."
data.anv: तस्मिन् on his, दिवम् heaven, आरूढे ascended, सुसारथि that charioteer, सन्तमे rejoiced, राघवःRaghava, परमप्रीतः very dearly, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिषस्वजे embraced
data.md: That charioteer rising up into the celestial region, Rāghava, the foremost of car-warriors, greatly delighted, embraced Sugrīva.

data.v: परिष्वज्य च सुग्रीवं लक्ष्मणेनाभिवादितः । पूज्यमानो हरिश्रेष्ठैराजगाम बलालयम् ।।
data.es: On embracing Sugriva, greeted by Lakshmana, and worshipped by the army of Vanaras, Rama returned to the camp.
data.anv: सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, परिष्वज्य च embracing, लक्ष्मणेन Lakshmana, अभिवादितः initiated by, हरिगणैः Vanara troops, पूज्यमानः worshipped, बलालयम् by the army, आजगाम went
data.md: Embracing Sugrīva, bowed to by Lakşmaņa and worshipped by the monkey he repaired to the camp of his soldiers.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा रामः समीपपरिवर्तिनम् । सौमित्रिं सत्त्वसंपन्नं लक्ष्मणं दीप्ततेजसं ।।
data.es: And then, Kakuthsa spoke to Saumithri, of auspicious nature and endowed richly with prowess, who stood close by.
data.anv: अथ and then, सःकाकुत्स्थ: Kakuthsa, समीपपरिवर्तिनम् nearby surrounded, सौमित्रिम् Saumithri, सत्त्वसम्पन्नम् rich in prowess, शुभलक्षणम् of auspicious nature, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उवाच spoke

data.v: विभीषणमिमं सौम्य लङ्कायामभिषेचय । अनुरक्तं च भक्तं च मम चैवोपकारिणम् ।।
data.es: "Gentle Lakshmana! Vibheeshana is friendly to me and devoted. He has done me good work in the past. Consecrate him in Lanka."
data.anv: सौम्य gentle, अनुरक्तम् very friendly, भक्तं च devotion, तथा so also, पूर्वोपकारिणम् done good work in the past, इमम् him, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, लङ्कायाम् in Lanka, अभिषेचय consecrate

data.v: एष मे परमः कामो यदिमं रावणानुजम् । लङ्कायां सौम्य पश्येयमभिषिक्तं विभीषणम् ।।
data.es: "O gentle Lakshmana! I desire to see this Vibheeshana, Ravana's brother, consecrated at Lanka"
data.anv: सौम्य gentle, एषः being so, मे to me, परमः very, कामः desire, यत् that, रावणानुजम् Ravana's brother, इमंविभीषणम् this Vibheeshana, लङ्कायाम् at Lanka, अभिषिक्तम् consecrate, पश्येयम् wish to see
data.md: This is my great desire that I may behold Vibhīşaņa the younger brother of Rāvana installed on the throne of Lankā.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु सौमित्री राघवेण महात्मना । तथेत्युक्त्वा तु संहृष्टः सौवर्णं घटमाददे ।।
data.es: Great selfRaghava having spoken like that, Saumithri, very happily arranged to get a golden vessel.
data.anv: महात्मना great self, राघवेण by Raghava, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, सौमित्रि Saumithri, तथेति same way, सुसम्हृष्टः very happy, सौवर्णम् golden, घटम् vessel, आददे arranged to get
data.md: Being thus addressed by the high-souled Raghava, the son of Sumitra, saying, “So be it" and greatly delighted, brought a golden jar. And placing that jar at the hands of the lord of monkeys, that one, gifted with great energy, ordered them to bring water from the Ocean.

data.v: घटेन तेन सौमित्रिरभ्यषिञ्चद्विभीषणम् । लङ्कायां रक्षसां मध्ये राजानं रामशासनात् ।।
data.es: (Rama) having spoken that way, Saumithri crowned Vibheeshana as crowned king on the command of Rama amid Vanara army chiefs.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्ताः having spoken, सौमित्रि: Saumithri, वानमुख्यानाम् chiefs of army of Vanaras, मध्ये: midst, रामशासनात् by the command of Rama, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, राजानम् as king, अभ्यषिञ्चत् coronated.

data.v: अभ्यषिञ्चत्स धर्मात्मा शुद्धात्मानं विभीषणम् । तस्यामात्या जहृषिरे भक्ता ये चास्य राक्षसाः ।।
दृष्ट्वाभिषिक्तं लङ्कायां राक्षसेन्द्रं विभीषणम् । राघवः परमां प्रीतिं जगाम सहलक्ष्मणः ।।
data.md: Beholding Vibhīşaņa the lord of Rākşasas installed in the city of Lankä, Räghava along with Lakşmaņa attained to an excess of delight.

data.v: स तद्राज्यं महत्प्राप्य रामदत्तं विभीषणः । प्रकृतीः सान्त्वयित्वा च ततो राममुपागमत् ।।
अक्षतान्मोदकाँल्लाजान्दिव्याः सुमनसस्तथा । आजह्रुरथ संहृष्टाः पौरास्तस्मै निशाचराः ।।
data.es: Consoling the subjects of the kingdom with good words, Vibheeshana sought Rama's presence. The people were very happy and brought curds, yellow rice grains (rice mixed with turmeric), flowers and sweets and parched grain and offered.

data.es: Valiant Vibheeshana, who is difficult to encounter, presented the benign offerings and auspicious ones received by him to Rama and Lakshmana.

data.v: कृतकार्यं समृद्धार्थं दृष्ट्वा रामो विभीषणम् । प्रतिजग्राह तत्सर्वं तस्यैव प्रियकाम्यया ।।
data.es: Rama having accomplished the task, thoughtfully pleased did not desire for the offerings, accepted them to please Vibheeshana.
data.anv: रामः Rama, कृतकार्यम् accomplished, समृद्धार्थम् richly endowed, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, दृष्टवा seeing, तस्य his, प्रियकाम्ययाएव to please, तत् those, सर्वम् all, प्रतिजग्राह received in return
data.md: Beholding Vibhīşaņa crowned with prosperity and success, Rāma accepted them all for his satisfaction.

data.v: ततः शैलोपमं वीरं प्राञ्जलिं पार्श्वतः स्थितम् । अब्रवीद्राघवो वाक्यं हनूमन्तं प्लवंगमम् ।।
data.es: Then Rama, seeing a heroic mountain like Hanuman, who stood there in supplicant mood greeting him with joined palms, spoke these words.
data.anv: ततः then, रामःRama, शैलोपमम् like mountain, वीरम् hero, प्राञ्जलिम् greeting with joined palms, प्रणतम् supplicant mood, स्थितम् stood, प्लवङ्गमम् Vanara, हनूमन्तम् Hanuman, इदंवचः these words, उवाच spoke
data.md: Thereupon Rāma spoke to the heroic monkey Hanumān, resembling a mountain and standing before him humbly with folded hands saying.

data.v: अनुमान्य महाराजमिमं सौम्य विभीषणम् । प्रविश्य रावणगृहं विनयेनोपसृत्य च ।।
data.es: "O Gentle Hanuman! Taking the permission of the great king Vibheeshana, entering the city of Lanka, enquire the wellbeing of Mythili."

data.v: आज्ञप्ता रावणेनैता राक्षस्यो मामतर्जयन् । हते तस्मिन्न कुर्युर्हि तर्जनं वानरोत्तम ।।
data.es: "By Ravana's order they threatened me so. Now with his death, they will not be threatening me."
data.anv: मारुतात्मज Maruti's son, इह here, राक्षसेन by Rakshasa, आज्ञप्ताः order, राक्षस्यः rakshsas, माम् me, तर्जयन्ति threatened, तस्मिन् with his, हते death, तर्जनम् threaten, न कुर्वन्ति not to be done
data.md: And he being slain they shall not repress me any longer, O son of the Wind-god.

data.v: अयं व्याघ्रसमीपे तु पुराणो धर्मसंहितः । ऋक्षेण गीतः श्लोको मे तं निबोध प्लवंगम ।।
data.es: "O Monkey! In olden days a bear had uttered a verse which conforms to righteousness. I shall tell you now."
data.anv: प्लवङ्गम monkey, व्याघ्रसमीपे by the side of tiger, ऋक्षेण by a bear, गीतः verse, पुराणः old saying, धर्मसंहितः conformed with righteousness, श्लोकः verse, अस्ति now, तम् you, निबोध tell
data.md: Do you, O monkey, hear of a śloka, related in a Purana and pregnant with religious import, which was uttered by a boar to a tiger.

data.v: न परः पापमादत्ते परेषां पापकर्मणाम् । समयो रक्षितव्यस्तु सन्तश्चारित्रभूषणाः ।।

data.es: "Sinners or noble men, having done a wrong deed and deserve death. Also noble, will show compassion and not commit harm."

data.es: "Rakshasas by nature are cruel in their deeds and can assume any form according to their will. No sinful actions to be done even if they do sinful actions."

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु हनुमान्सीतया वाक्यकोविदः । प्रत्युवाच ततः सीतां रामपत्नीं यशस्विनीम् ।।
data.es: Sita, having spoken that way to Hanuman, he, who was capable of good expression, replied as follows to Rama's consort, who was irreproachable.
data.anv: सीतया by Sita, एवम् in this way, उक्तःhaving spoken, वाक्यकोविदःone who is good at expression, हनुमान् Hanuman, ततः then, रामपत्नीम् Rama's consort, यशश्विनीम्irreproachable one, सीताम् to Sita, प्रत्युवाच replied as follows
data.md: Being thus addressed by Sītā, Hanumān, skilled in speech, spoke to the blameless Rama's spouse, saying.

data.v: युक्ता रामस्य भवती धर्मपत्नी यशस्विनी । प्रतिसंदिश मां देवि गमिष्ये यत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: "Devi! you are the righteous wife of Rama and earned fame. Give me the right message to Rama in return. I will go."
data.anv: देवि Devi, यशश्विनी famous, भवती you are, रामस्यto Rama, युक्ता right, धर्मपत्नी righteous wife, माम् to me, प्रतिसन्दिश message in return, राघवःRaghava, यत्र there, गमिष्ये will go
data.md: You are the worthy spouse of Răma, religiously wedded and crowned with many qualities. Permit me, O worshipful dame, to proceed where Rāghava is.

data.v: एवमुक्ता हनुमता वैदेही जनकात्मजा । अब्रवीद्द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भर्तारं वानरोत्तम ।।
data.es: Hanuman, having spoken that way to Vaidehi, daughter of Janaka, she said" I desire to see my husband."
data.anv: हनुमताHanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्ता spoken, जनकात्मजा by Janaka's daughter, सा she, वैदेहिVaidehi, अब्रवीत् said, वानरोत्तम foremost of Vanaras, भर्तारम्to my husband, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि I desire
data.md: Being thus accosted by Hanumān, Vaidehi, the daughter of king Janaka, said, “I wish to see my lord, ever fond of those who are devoted to him."

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा हनुमान्पवनात्मजः । हर्षयन्मैथिलीं वाक्यमुवाचेदं महाद्युतिः ।।
data.es: On hearing Mythili, wise Hanuman spoke these words to her bringing joy to her.
data.anv: मारुतात्मजःMaruti's son, महामतिः wise, हनुमान् Hanuman, तस्याःhis, तत् those, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, मैथिलीम् Mythili, हर्षयन् joy, इदंवाक्यम् these words, उवाच spoke.
data.md: Hearing these words, the high-minded Hanumăn, the son of Maruta, pleasing Maithili said.

data.v: पूर्णचन्द्राननं रामं द्रक्ष्यस्यार्ये सलक्ष्मणम् । स्थिरमित्रं हतामित्रं शचीव त्रिदशेश्वरम् ।।
data.es: "Now you will see Sri Rama whose countenance resembles the moon, with Lakshmana, with friends who are alive, with friends whose enemies are gone, just as Sachi, the consort of Indra, the Lord of gods saw."
data.anv: पूर्णचन्द्रमुखम् countenance resembles moon, सलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, स्थिरमित्रम् with friends who are alive, हतामित्रम् whose enemies are gone, रामम् Rama, शची Sachi, त्रिदशेश्वरम् इव like Indra the Lord of gods, अद्य now, द्रक्ष्यसि will see
data.md: You shall behold Rama, having a countenance like the full moon, with Laksmana, surrounded by his friends and having his enemies slain as ſaci behold Indra the king of the celestials.

data.v: तामेवमुक्त्वा राजन्तीं सीतां साक्षादिव श्रियम् । आजगाम महावेगो हनूमान्यत्र राघवः ।।
data.es: Hanuman reached Raghava with extraordinary speed assuring Sita, who shone like Lakshmi, goddess of prosperity, and had spoken like that.
data.anv: महावेगो endowed with extraordinary speed, हनूमान् Hanuman, साक्षात् as it is, श्रियमिव like goddess Lakshmi, राजन्तीम् shining, ताम् him, एवम् in that way, उक्त्वा having spoken, राघवःRaghava, यत्र there, आजगाम reached
data.md: Addressing these words to Sītă appearing like Sree herself the highly effulgent Hanuman returned where Rāghava was.

data.v: स उवाच महाप्रज्ञमभिगम्य प्लवंगमः । रामं वचनमर्थज्ञो वरं सर्वधनुष्मताम् ।।
data.es: Highly learned Hanuman greeted and spoke meaningfully to Rama, the foremost among the wielders of bow.
data.anv: महाप्राज्ञः highly learned, सःप्लवङ्गमः that monkey, वचनमर्थज्ञो meaningful, सर्वधनुष्मताम् foremost among the wielders of bow, वरम् choicest, तंरामम् Rama, अभिवाद्य greeted, उवाच spoke
data.md: Thereupon bowing to Rāma, the foremost of bowmen, having eyes, resembling lotus-petals, the highly wise monkey said.

data.v: यन्निमित्तोऽयमारम्भः कर्मणां च फलोदयः । तां देवीं शोकसंतप्तां मैथिलीं द्रष्टुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "You ought to see that noble lady Mythili, who was immersed in grief, for whose sake these actions were started and has borne fruit."
data.anv: कर्मणाम् these actions, अयम् this, आरम्बः started, यन्निमित्तः for whose sake, यः he who, फलोदयः has borne fruit, ताम् her, शोकसन्तप्ताम् immersed in grief, देवीम् noble lady, मैथिलीम् Mythili, द्रष्टुम् to see, अर्हसि ought to
data.md: It behove you now to see Maithili, stricken with grief for whom you did initiate all these works and the fruit whereof has now been attained.

data.v: सा हि शोकसमाविष्टा बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा । मैथिली विजयं श्रुत्वा तव हर्षमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: "Mythili who is overcome with grief on hearing your victory, was filled with tears in her eyes and desired to see you."
data.anv: शोकसमाविष्टाः who is overcome with grief, सामैथिली she, Mythili, विजयम् victory, श्रुत्वा hearing, बाष्पपर्याकुलेक्षणा eyes filled with tears, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, अभिकाङ्क्षति desired
data.md: Hearing of your victory Maithilī, possessed by grief and having eyes full of tears, expressed her desire to see you.

data.v: पूर्वकात्प्रत्ययाच्चाहमुक्तो विश्वस्तया तया । भर्तारं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि कृतार्थं सहलक्ष्मणम् ।।
data.es: "In an earlier occasion having known me and trusting me expressed that she desires to see Rama with Lakshmana after victory and with gratitude."
data.anv: पूर्वकात् earlier occasion, प्रत्ययात् expressed, विश्वस्तया trust, तया so also, अहम् I, उक्तः said, कृतार्थम् gratitude, सहलक्ष्मणम् with Lakshmana, भर्तारम् husband, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छामि desire
data.md: I was told by her, confident of her previous trust, with profuse tears in her eyes, “I wish to see my husband."

data.v: एवमुक्तो हनुमता रामो धर्मभृतां वरः । अगच्छत्सहसा ध्यानमासीद्बाष्पपरिप्लुतः ।।
data.es: When Hanuman had spoken like that, Rama, the upholder of righteousness, shed tears slightly and suddenly became thoughtful.
data.anv: हनुमता Hanuman, एवम् in that way, उक्तः having spoken, धर्मभृताम् upholder of righteousness, वरः best, रामः Rama, ईषत् slightly, बाष्पपरिप्लुतः shed tears from eyes, सहसा suddenly, ध्यानम् thoughtful, आगच्छत् became
data.md: Being addressed by Hanuman Rāma the foremost of the pious being bathed in tears, engaged instantly in meditation. Thereupon sighing hard and casting his looks upon the ground he spoke to Vibhīşaņa resembling clouds, who was near him.

data.v: दीर्घमुष्णं च निश्वस्य मेदिनीमवलोकयन् । उवाच मेघसंकाशं विभीषणमुपस्थितम् ।।
data.es: Drawing a long hot breath, looking at the ground, he spoke to Vibheeshana, who was like a cloud standing there.
data.anv: दीर्घम् long, उष्णम् hot, विनिःश्वस्य drawing breath, जगतीम् on the world, अवलोकयन् looking at, उपस्थितम् standing, मेघसङ्काशम् resembling a cloud in colour, विभीषणम् Vibheeshana, उवाच spoke

data.v: दिव्याङ्गरागां वैदेहीं दिव्याभरणभूषिताम् । इह सीतां शिरःस्नातामुपस्थापय माचिरम् ।।
data.anv: शिरःस्नाताम् after head bath, दिव्याङ्गरागाम् anointed with fragrance, दिव्यायभरणभूषिताम् decorated with wonderful ornaments, सीताम् Sita, इह here, उपस्थापय bring, चिरम् quickly, मा bring
data.md: Do you speedily bring Sītā here-the daughter of the king of Mithila-bathed, sprinkled with celestial pasted and adorned with celestial ornaments.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण त्वरमाणो विभीषणः । प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं सीतां स्त्रीभिः स्वाभिरचोदयत् ।।
data.es: When Rama had spoken in that manner, Vibheeeshana for his part hastened to the Gynaeceum and assigned through the women to convey to Sita.
data.anv: एवम् in that manner, रामेण by Rama, उक्तः spoken, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, त्वरमाणः hastened, अन्तःपुरम् to the gynaeceum, प्रविश्य entered, स्वाभिः for his part, स्त्रीभिः women, सीताम् to Sita, अचोदयात् conveyed
data.md: Being thus addressed by Rāma, Vibhişaņa hastened on and entering the inner apartment sent information to Sītă through the female attendants.

data.v: दिव्याङ्गरागा वैदेही दिव्याभरणभूषिता । यानमारोह भद्रं ते भर्ता त्वां द्रष्टुमिच्छति ।।
data.es: "Vaidehi! Anointed with a wonderful fragrance, decked with beautiful ornaments, auspicious and ascending the palanquin, your husband desires to see you."
data.anv: वैदेही Vaidehi, दिव्याङ्गरागा anointed with wonderful fragrance, दिव्याभरणभूषिता decked with beautiful ornaments, यानम् palanquin, आरोह ascending, ते you, भद्रम् auspicious, भर्ता husband, त्वाम् you, द्रष्टुम् to see, इच्छति desires
data.md: O Vaidehi, may good betide you; sprinkled with celestial paste and adorned with celestials ornaments do you ascend this car: your husband wish to see you.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही प्रत्युवाच विभीषणम् । अस्नाता द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भर्तारं राक्षसाधिप ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana, having spoken that way, Vaidehi said to the Lord of Rakshasas that she would like to see him without having a bath.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्ता spoken, वैदेही Vaidehi, विभीषणम् to Vibheeshana, प्रत्युवाच replied, राक्षसेश्वर Lord of Rakshasas, अस्नात्वा without bath, भर्तारम् husband, द्रष्टुम् see, इच्छामि I desire
data.md: Being thus accosted by Hanumān, Vaidehi, the daughter of king Janaka, said, “I wish to see my lord, ever fond of those who are devoted to him."

data.v: तस्यास्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रत्युवाच विभीषणः । यथाह रामो भर्ता ते तत्तथा कर्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: Hearing Sita's words Vibheeshana replied saying," You will and ought to do what your husband Rama has said."

data.md: Hearing those words VibhIşaņa replied, "It behove you to do what your lord Rama has said." on a

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा मैथिली भर्तृदेवता । भर्तृभक्तिव्रता साध्वी तथेति प्रत्यभाषत ।।
data.es: Noble Mythili (on hearing Vibheeshana), who looked upon her husband as God, said in reply, 'Alright'.
data.anv: पतिदेवता husband as god, साध्वी noble, मैथिली Mythili, तस्य her, तत् that, वचनम् words, श्रुत्वा hearing, भर्तृभक्त्या in devotion, वृता adorned, तथेति alright, प्रत्यभाषत replied in turn
data.md: Whereto the chaste maithilee, regarding her husband as God and filled with devotion to her husband, replied saying "so be it."

data.v: ततः सीतां शिरःस्नातां युवतीभिरलंकृताम् । महार्हाभरणोपेतां महार्हाम्बरधारिणीम् ।।
आरोप्य शिबिकां दीप्तां परार्ध्याम्बरसंवृताम् । रक्षोभिर्बहुभिर्गुप्तामाजहार विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Thereafter Vibheeshana, making Sita to ascend the palanquin, covered with valuable clothes and guarded by numerous Rakshasas after she adorned herself in the best of ornaments and put on glowing wonderful clothes brought to Rama.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, शिरःस्नाताम् head bath, प्रतिकर्मणा personal decoration, संयुक्ताम् together, महार्हाभरणोपेताम् best of ornaments, महार्हाम्बरधारिणीम् wonderful clothes, सीताम् Sita, दीप्ताम् glowing, परार्घ्याम्बरसंवृताम् covered with wonderful clothes, बहुभिः numerous, राक्षसैः Rakshasas, गुप्ताम् guarded by, शिबिकाम् palanquin, आरोप्य ascended, आजहार brought

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य महात्मानं ज्ञात्वाभिध्यानमास्थितम् । प्रणतश्च प्रहृष्टश्च प्राप्तां सीतां न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: Knowing that Sita reached also, great Rama was seen in a meditative mood absorbed in thought. Vibheeshana announced saying, 'Sita has been brought' and greeted with folded palms, full of joy.
data.anv: सः he, ज्ञात्वापि after knowing, द्यानम् meditative mood, आस्थितम् absorbed in thought, महात्मानम् great, अभिगम्य having reached, प्रणतः च greeting with folded palms, प्रहृष्टश्च full of joy, सीताम् Sita, प्राप्ताम् arrived, न्यवेदयत् announced
data.md: Thereupon approaching the high-souled Rama, who, bearing informed of (Vibhisana's approach) was engaged in meditation, Vibhīşaņa bowing down and delighted communicated to him the arrival of Sită.

data.v: तामागतामुपश्रुत्य रक्षोगृहचिरोषिताम् । हर्षो दैन्यं च रोषश्च त्रयं राघवमाविशत् ।।
data.es: On hearing that Sita had arrived, who stayed in Rakshasa's abode for long, Raghava had experienced joy, indignation, and anger, all the three at the same time.

data.es: "For women it is not the house, boundary wall or clothes or protective wall or screen of cloth or even this kind of royal treatment or surrounding, is the protection."

data.es: "The appearance of a woman in public is not condemned in times of difficulty, in straits, in conflicts, in the selection of a husband, or in sacrificial ceremonies or marriage ceremonies."

एवमुक्तस्तु रामेण सविमर्शो विभीषणः । रामस्योपानयत्सीतां संनिकर्षं विनीतवत् ।।

विस्मयाच्च प्रहर्षाच्च स्नेहाच्च परिदेवता । उदैक्षत मुखं भर्तुः सौम्यं सौम्यतरानना ।।

data.md: Beholding Maithili standing humbly by him, Räma began to give vent to his pent-up feelings.

data.v: एषासि निर्जिता भद्रे शत्रुं जित्वा मया रणे । पौरुषाद्यदनुष्ठेयं तदेतदुपपादितम् ।।
data.es: "O Auspicious Sita! You are won by destruction of the enemy in the battlefield. What was worth doing has been done with all my effort."
data.anv: भद्रे auspicious, एषा this, रणाजिरे battlefield, शत्रुम् enemy, जित्वा won, निर्जिता destruction, असि I, पौरुषात् with effort, यत् that which, अनुष्ठेयम् worth doing, तत् that, मया by me, उपपादितम् has been done
data.md: O gentle one, destroying all the enemies in the arena of battle I have subdued your enemy-I have done all that can be accomplished by manliness.

data.v: गतोऽस्म्यन्तममर्षस्य धर्षणा संप्रमार्जिता । अवमानश्च शत्रुश्च मया युगपदुद्धृतौ ।।
data.es: "I have put an end to the indignity that I lost. I gained reward for the insult. The indignity offered by the enemy has been wiped out all at once."
data.anv: अमर्षस्य by indignation, अन्तम् put an end, गतःअस्मि I lost, धर्षणा insult, सम्प्रमार्जिता gained reward, मया by me, अवमानश्च indignity, शत्रुश्च enemy, युगपत् all at once, निहतौ by killing
data.md: I have reached the other end of my anger, rubbed off (the insult) for my spouse being taken away by the enemy and have killed simultaneously my disgrace and enemy.

data.v: अद्य मे पौरुषं दृष्टमद्य मे सफलः श्रमः । अद्य तीर्णप्रतिज्ञत्वात्प्रभवामीह चात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Now you see the result of my effort. I am successful and fulfilled my vow. Today I am independent."
data.anv: अद्य now, मे my, पौरुषम् effort, दृष्टम् see, अद्य today, मे my, श्रमः effort, सफलः successful, अद्य now, अहम् I, तीर्णप्रतिज्ञः vow fulfilled, अद्य today, आत्मनः I am, प्रभवामि independent
data.md: My manliness has been displayed today, my laboúr has been crowned with success and today I have fulfilled my promise by my own prowess.

data.v: या त्वं विरहिता नीता चलचित्तेन रक्षसा । दैवसंपादितो दोषो मानुषेण मया जितः ।।
data.es: "When you were alone you were abducted by the fickle minded Rakshasa. The fault of destiny has been won by me, a mortal by the will of god।।"
data.anv: यात्वम् when you, विरहिता were alone, चलचित्तेन fickle minded, रक्षसा Rakshasa, नीता abducted, दैवसम्पादितः by the will of god, दोषः fault, मानुषेण by a mortal, मया by me, जितः won
data.md: That accidental misfortune, under the influence where of you were carried away by the fickle-minded Räksasa in my absence, has been subdued today by me, a man.

data.v: संप्राप्तमवमानं यस्तेजसा न प्रमार्जति । कस्तस्य पुरुषार्थोऽस्ति पुरुषस्याल्पतेजसः ।।
data.es: "What is the purpose of might however great he might be, if he is petty minded and does not wipe off the insult?"
data.anv: यः he who, सम्प्राप्तम् gets, अवमानम् insult, तेजसा might, न प्रमार्जति not, अल्पचेतसः petty minded, तस्य his, महतापि however great, पौरुषेण by the, कःअर्थः What is the purpose
data.md: What is the use of his manliness, who when insulted, cannot remove it? Even if he be a great man he may be called mean.

data.v: लङ्घनं च समुद्रस्य लङ्कायाश्चावमर्दनम् । सफलं तस्य तच्छ्लाघ्यमद्य कर्म हनूमतः ।।
data.es: "Hanuman's leaping across the ocean and devastating action of Lanka has yielded results now."
data.anv: तस्य his, हनूमतः Hanuman, समुद्रस्य ocean's, लङ्घनम् leaping across, लङ्कायाः of Lanka, मर्धनंच Devastation, श्लाघ्यम् laudable, कर्म action, अद्य now, सफलम् result
data.md: The praise-worthy works of Hanumān-the crossing of the deep and the devastation of Lankā, have been crowned with success today.

data.es: "The prowess of Sugriva and also his army, his good advice and efforts in combat have become successful."
data.anv: युद्धे in the combat, विक्रमतः prowess, तथा so also, हितम् good advice, मन्त्रयतः tendered, ससैन्यस्य and his army, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, परिश्रमः effort, अद्य now, सफलः successful
data.md: The labour of Sugrīva with his army, who displayed valour in the encounter and gave me good counsels, has borne fruit today.

data.v: निर्गुणं भ्रातरं त्यक्त्वा यो मां स्वयमुपस्थितः । विभीषणस्य भक्तस्य सफलोऽद्य परिश्रमः ।।
इत्येवं ब्रुवतस्तस्य सीता रामस्य तद्वचः । मृगीवोत्फुल्लनयना बभूवाश्रुपरिप्लुता ।।
data.es: Sita's broad eyes which were like that of female deer were filled with tears on hearing the words of Rama.
data.anv: सीता Sita, इत्येवम् in this way, वदतः speaking, रामस्य Rama's, तत् those, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, मृगीव eyes like that of female deer, उत्फुल्लनयना wide open eyes, अश्रुपरिप्लुता filled with tears, बभूव became
data.md: Hearing those words of Rāma, Sītā began to look wistfully like a hind, with eyes full of tears.

data.v: पश्यतस्तां तु रामस्य भूयः क्रोधोऽभ्यवर्तत । प्रभूताज्यावसिक्तस्य पावकस्येव दीप्यतः ।।
स बद्ध्वा भ्रुकुटिं वक्त्रे तिर्यक्प्रेक्षितलोचनः । अब्रवीत्परुषं सीतां मध्ये वानररक्षसाम् ।।
यत्कर्तव्यं मनुष्येण धर्षणां परिमार्जता । तत्कृतं सकलं सीते शत्रुहस्तादमर्षणात् ।।
data.es: "That which my mind desired as a duty of a human being, to get rid of the insult has been done by killing Ravana."

data.v: निर्जिता जीवलोकस्य तपसा भावितात्मना । अगस्त्येन दुराधर्षा मुनिना दक्षिणेव दिक् ।।
data.es: "Though the southern quarter is difficult to assail for the world of mortals, Agastya, a realized sage, has won by the power of his austerity. In the same way I have won you."
data.anv: तपसा by austerity, भावितात्मना realized master, अगस्त्येन by Agastya, जीवलोकस्य world of mortals, दुराधर्षा difficult to assail, दक्षिणाधिक् इव southern quarter, निर्जिता killing
data.md: As the southern quarter, incapable of being got at by the people, was conquered by the selfcontrolled great ascetic Agasty, so for you slaying Ravana, I (always) anxious to have honour, have removed my insult-as is the duty of a man.

data.v: विदितश्चास्तु भद्रं ते योऽयं रणपरिश्रमः । स तीर्णः सुहृदां वीर्यान्न त्वदर्थं मया कृतः ।।
data.es: "Sita! This effort in carrying out with the assistance of valiant friends is not done for your sake. Let it be known to you. I have done this to protect good conduct and my illustrious race from scandal and rid of obloquy from all sides."
data.anv: यः this, रणपरिश्रमः effort in war, सुहृदाम् friends, वीर्यात् valour, सुतीर्णः assistance, अयम् this, मया by me, त्वदर्थम् meaning, न कृतः not done, विदितः let you know, अस्तु this, ते to you, भद्रम् auspicious, अस्तु you be, वृत्तम् from all sides, सर्वतः all over, अपवादं च scandal, रक्षतां to protect, प्रख्यातस्य illustrious, आत्मवंशस्य my race, व्यङ्गम् obloquy, परिमार्जता to get rid of, मया I have done
data.md: May good betide you-do you know that all my labour in the battle-field, backed by the prowess of my friends, is for you.

data.v: रक्षता तु मया वृत्तमपवादं च सर्वशः । प्रख्यातस्यात्मवंशस्य न्यङ्गं च परिमार्जता ।।
data.es: "Sita! This effort in carrying out with the assistance of valiant friends is not done for your sake. Let it be known to you. I have done this to protect good conduct and my illustrious race from scandal and rid of obloquy from all sides."
data.anv: यः this, रणपरिश्रमः effort in war, सुहृदाम् friends, वीर्यात् valour, सुतीर्णः assistance, अयम् this, मया by me, त्वदर्थम् meaning, न कृतः not done, विदितः let you know, अस्तु this, ते to you, भद्रम् auspicious, अस्तु you be, वृत्तम् from all sides, सर्वतः all over, अपवादं च scandal, रक्षतां to protect, प्रख्यातस्य illustrious, आत्मवंशस्य my race, व्यङ्गम् obloquy, परिमार्जता to get rid of, मया I have done
data.md: To uphold the dignity of my well-known family, to remove the ignominy consequent upon your being stolen away as well as to wipe off my own insult I have encompassed this.

data.v: प्राप्तचारित्रसंदेहा मम प्रतिमुखे स्थिता । दीपो नेत्रातुरस्येव प्रतिकूलासि मे दृढम् ।।
data.es: "In the event of doubtful conduct also you are standing firmly like a glowing lamp for me suffering from sore eyes and disagreeable to me."
data.anv: प्राप्तचारित्रसन्देहा in the event of doubtful conduct, मम my, प्रतिमुखे in front, स्थिता standing, नेत्रातुरस्य sore eyes, दीपःइव like glowing, मे to me, दृढम् firmly, प्रतिकूलाअसि disagreeable you are
data.md: I have suspected your character; you, (Therefore) standing before me, are distressing me like to a lamp before one who is subject to an eye-desease.

data.v: तद्गच्छ ह्यभ्यनुज्ञाता यतेष्टं जनकात्मजे । एता दश दिशो भद्रे कार्यमस्ति न मे त्वया ।।
data.es: "O Janaka's daughter! therefore now you are permitted to go wherever to any quarter. Let you be auspicious. I have no work with you."
data.anv: जनकात्मजे Janaka's daughter, तत् therefore, अद्य now, त्वाy our, अनुजाने permission, यथेष्टम् freedom, एताः any, दश direction, दिशः quarter, गच्छ go, भद्रे be auspicious, मे to me, त्वया by you, कार्यम् work, नास्ति nothing
data.md: Do you therefore proceed, O daughter of king Janaka, wherever you like to one of these ten quarters. I permit you, O gentle one. I have nothing to do with you.

data.v: कः पुमान्हि कुले जातः स्त्रियं परगृहोषिताम् । तेजस्वि पुनरादद्यात्सुहृल्लेखेन चेतसा ।।
data.es: "Which eminent man born in a good race will again consciously accept a wife who lived in another's home?"
data.anv: कुले good race, जातः born, तेजस्वी eminent, कःपुमान्? which man, परगृहोषिताम् in other's home, स्त्रियम् lived, सुहृल्लेख्येन kind, चेतसा consciously, पुनः again, अदत्यात् accept
data.md: What powerful man, born in a high family, take back his wife considering her as friend out of lust, who has lived long in another's house?

data.v: रावणाङ्कपरिभ्रष्टां दृष्टां दुष्टेन चक्षुषा । कथं त्वां पुनरादद्यां कुलं व्यपदिशन्महत् ।।
data.es: "You are thrown out of the arms of Ravana. You have been seen by him with lustful eyes, have been seen by all with evil eyes. How can one born in a great race accept you again?"
data.anv: महत् great, कुलम् race, व्यपदिशन् thrown out, रावणाङ्कपरिक्लिष्टाम् squeezed from the arms of Ravana, दुष्टेन seeing, चक्षुषा with eyes, दृष्टाम् have been seen (with evil eyes by all), त्वाम् you, पुनः again, कथम् how, आदद्याम् accept
data.md: You were taken by Rāvana on his lap, beheld by him with sinful eyes; how can I, taking you back, bring disgrace upon my great family?

data.v: तदर्थं निर्जिता मे त्वं यशः प्रत्याहृतं मया । नास्ति मे त्वय्यभिष्वङ्गो यथेष्टं गम्यतामितः ।।
data.es: "The reason for winning you back is to get rid of the insult. Now I have no interest in you. You may go to the place of your choice."
data.anv: त्वम् your, तदर्थम् the purpose, मे my, निर्जिता to rid of, मया by me, यशः fame, प्रत्याहृतम् won back, मे by me, त्वयि in you, अभिष्वङ्गः no interest, नास्ति not,
data.md: The object, with which I have gained you back, has been accomplished. I have got no attachment for you-do you go wherever you wish, O gentle one.

data.v: इति प्रव्याहृतं भद्रे मयैतत्कृतबुद्धिना । लक्ष्मणे भरते वा त्वं कुरु बुद्धिं यथासुखम् ।।
data.es: " Auspicious one! This utterance has been thought over well today. You may go wherever you find happiness, either to Lakshmana or else to Bharata. Think well and do."
data.anv: भद्रे auspicious, तत् therefore, अद्य today, कृतबुधदिना thought over well, मया by me, एतत् this, व्याहृतम् utterance, यथासुखम् where there is happiness, लक्ष्मणेवा with Lakshmana, अथ or else, भरते with Bharata, बुधदिम् think well, कुरु do

data.v: सुग्रीवे वानरेन्द्रे वा राक्षसेन्द्रे विभीषणे । निवेशय मनः सीते यथा वा सुखमात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Sita! You can go to Shatrughna or else Sugriva or even Rakshasa Vibheeshana, wherever you feel like to live."
data.anv: सीते Sita, शत्रुघ्नेवा or Shatrughna, अथ or else, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, राक्षसे Rakshasa, विभीषणेवा Vibheeshana, आत्मनः your own, यथा like that, सुखम् happiness, मनः mind, निवेशय live

data.v: न हि त्वां रावणो दृष्ट्वा दिव्यरूपां मनोरमाम् । मर्षयते चिरं सीते स्वगृहे परिवर्तिनीम् ।।
data.es: "Sita! You are endowed with beauty and having you in his own house for so long and seeing you, how Ravana could have resisted or detained you."
data.anv: सीते Sita, दिव्यरूपाम् wonderful appearance, मनोरमाम् beautiful, स्वगृहे his own house, चिरम् long, पर्यवस्थिताम् resisted, त्वाम् you, दृष्टवा seeing, रावणः Ravana, नमर्षयेतहि not have detained
data.md: O Sita, (I do not think) Ravana has overlooked you, who lived in his house, beholding you so graceful and beautiful.

data.v: ततः प्रियार्हश्वरणा तदप्रियं; प्रियादुपश्रुत्य चिरस्य मैथिली । मुमोच बाष्पं सुभृशं प्रवेपिता; गजेन्द्रहस्ताभिहतेव वल्लरी ।।
data.md: Thereupon hearing those unpleasant words from her beloved (husband) Sītā, always sensitive and who had never heard such unpleasant words, trembling like a creeper torn by the trunk of an elephant, began to weep shedding tears profusely.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु वैदेही परुषं लोमहर्षणम् । राघवेण सरोषेण भृशं प्रव्यथिताभवत् ।।
data.es: Vaidehi heard the harsh horripilating words spoken by Rama in anger and was very much afflicted.
data.anv: सरोषेण in anger, राघवेण by Raghava, एवम् in that way, परुषम् harsh, रोमहर्षणम् horripilating, उक्ता spoken, वैदेहि Vaidehi, श्रुत्वा having heard, प्रव्यथिता afflicted, अभवत् became
data.md: Being thus addressed by Rāghava, enraged, with those harsh words Sīta was greatly pained.

data.v: सा तदश्रुतपूर्वं हि जने महति मैथिली । श्रुत्वा भर्तृवचो रूक्षं लज्जया व्रीडिताभवत् ।।
data.es: Then Mythili hearing her husband 's harsh words, in the presence of a large number of people, stayed bent with shyness.
data.anv: तदा then, सामैथिली she, Mythili, महति large number, जने people, अश्रुतपूर्वम् filled with tears, घोरम् ruthless, भर्तुः husband 's, वचःwords, श्रुत्वा hearing, लज्जया shy, अवनता bent, अभवत् stayed
data.md: Hearing those words of her lord, unheard of, before the great assembly Maithili was greatly humiliated with shame.

data.v: प्रविशन्तीव गात्राणि स्वान्येव जनकात्मजा । वाक्शल्यैस्तैः सशल्येव भृशमश्रूण्यवर्तयत् ।।
data.es: As if pierced by those arrowlike words, Janaka's daughter shed tears excessively, shrinking into her own limbs.
data.anv: साजनकात्मजा she Janaka's daughter, स्वानि her own, गात्राणि limbs, प्रविशन्तीव shrinking, तैःthose, चाक्षरैः from eyes, सशल्येव by the arrows, भृशम् excessively, अश्रूणि tears, अवर्तयत् shed
data.md: As if entering to her own person (with shame) and greatly pained with these arrow like words the daughter of king Janaka began to shed tears.

data.v: ततो बाष्पपरिक्लिष्टं प्रमार्जन्ती स्वमाननम् । शनैर्गद्गदया वाचा भर्तारमिदमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Thereafter, wiping her face clean from flowing tears she spoke slowly in a choked voice in broken words to her husband.
data.anv: ततः thereafter, बाष्पपरिक्लिन्नम् flowing tears clean, स्वम् her, आननम् face, प्रमार्जन्ती wiping off, भर्तारम् to husband, गद्गदया in broken tone, वाचा words, शनैः slowly, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Thereupon wiping the tears off her countenance, she with sorrowful words, addressed her husband.

data.v: किं मामसदृशं वाक्यमीदृशं श्रोत्रदारुणम् । रूक्षं श्रावयसे वीर प्राकृतः प्राकृतामिव ।।
data.es: "Hero! Why are you addressing me in such harsh unkind words in a rude manner, in a harsh tone like a common man?"
data.anv: वीर hero, माम् me, प्राकृतः address, प्राकृतामिव like a common man, माम् to me, असदृशम् unkind, ईदृशब् this kind of tone, श्रोत्रदारुणम् harsh to hear, रूक्षम् rude, वाक्यम् words, किम् why, श्रावयसे speaking
data.md: Why did you, O hero, like a common man addressing an ordinary woman, make me hear these, harsh and unbecoming words painful to ears?

data.v: न तथास्मि महाबाहो यथा त्वमवगच्छसि । प्रत्ययं गच्छ मे स्वेन चारित्रेणैव ते शपे ।।
data.es: "O Mighty armed! I am not as you think of me, so also show me a proof of it in my past. I swear on my past."
data.anv: महाबाहो mighty armed, माम् me, यथा similarly, अवगच्छसि not as you think of me, तथा so also, न अस्मिI am not, मे my, प्रत्ययम् proof, गच्छ period, स्वेन myself, चारित्रेण my past, ते to you, शपे vow
data.md: O you of long arms, I am not what you have taken me to be. Do you believe me-I do swear by my own character.

data.v: पृथक्स्त्रीणां प्रचारेण जातिं त्वं परिशङ्कसे । परित्यजेमां शङ्कां तु यदि तेऽहं परीक्षिता ।।
data.es: "You give up judging all womankind by the path followed by vulgar women. You give up these doubts if you have examined."
data.anv: पृथकस्त्रीणां vulgar women, प्रचारेण extending, त्वम् you, जातिम् race, परिशङ्कसे doubting, अहम् I, ते to you, परीक्षितायदि if you have examined, एनाम् these, शङ्काम् doubts, परित्यज give up
data.md: Seeing the ordinary women you are distrusting the whole sex. Do you renounce this suspicion since you have tried me.

data.v: यद्यहं गात्रसंस्पर्शं गतास्मि विवशा प्रभो । कामकारो न मे तत्र दैवं तत्रापराध्यति ।।
data.es: "O Lord! I was helpless when Ravana contacted my limbs in the past. I was not acting according to my will. My fate is to be blamed and not me."
data.anv: प्रभो Lord, विवशा helpless, अहम् I am, गात्रसम्पर्शम् touching the limbs, गता in the past, अस्मि by me, इतियत् all this, तत्र there, मे to me, कामकारः acting at will, न not, तत्र there, दैवम् fate, अपराध्यति to be blamed
data.md: O lord, though my person was touched by another-but it was not in my power; nor was it an wilful act (of mine); accident is to blame in this.

data.v: मदधीनं तु यत्तन्मे हृदयं त्वयि वर्तते । पराधीनेषु गात्रेषु किं करिष्याम्यनीश्वरा ।।
data.es: "That mind which is under my control is my heart and it abides in you. What can I do about my limbs when I am at others' mercy?"
data.anv: यत् that which, मदधीनम् mind under my control, तत् that, मे is my, हृदयंतु heart, त्वयि you, वर्तते abides, पराधीनेषु at others' mercy, गात्रेषु limbs, अनीश्वरी not possible, किम् what, करिष्यामि can I do
data.md: My heart is under my control and that is in you;-and what could I do of my body which was subject to another and of which I was not the mistress.

data.v: सहसंवृद्धभावाच्च संसर्गेण च मानद । यद्यहं ते न विज्ञाता हता तेनास्मि शाश्वतम् ।।
data.es: "Honourable Rama! If I am not understood by you despite our growing up together with love and in spite of our intimate relationship, I am done forever."
data.anv: मानद honourable, सहसम्वृद्धभावेन by our growing up together with love, संसर्गेणच our intimate relationship, अहम् I, ते to you, न विज्ञातायदि if I am not known, तेन by you, शाश्वतम् permanently, हताअस्मि I am done
data.md: O you the conferrer of honour-our affection towards one another was increased by our living continually for a long time; even then if you have not been able to understand me I am ruined for ever.

data.v: प्रेषितस्ते यदा वीरो हनूमानवलोककः । लङ्कास्थाहं त्वया वीर किं तदा न विसर्जिता ।।
data.es: "King! When the great hero Hanuman was sent by you to find me in Lanka, why did you not leave me then."
data.anv: राजन् king, महावीरः great hero, हनुमान् Hanuman, अवलोककः to find, ते by you, प्रेषितः sent, लङ्कास्था in Lanka, अहम् I, त्वया by you, तदा then, किम् why, न विसर्जिता did you not leave
data.md: O king, when the great hero Hanumān was despatched by you of Lankā to see me why did you not renounce me then?

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं वानरेन्द्रस्य त्वद्वाक्यसमनन्तरम् । त्वया संत्यक्तया वीर त्यक्तं स्याज्जीवितं मया ।।
data.es: "O hero! Had you given me up immediately on receiving your message from Vanara I would have given up my life in the presence of Hanuman there itself."
data.anv: वीर heroic, अस्य your, वानरस्य with Vanara, प्रत्यक्षम् in his presence, तद्वाक्यसमनन्तरम् after your message, त्वया by you, सन्त्यक्तया, मया by me, जीवितम् life, त्यक्तम् given up, स्यात् there itself
data.md: Had you deputed the monkey with that message I would have renounced my life there and then, O hero.

data.v: न वृथा ते श्रमोऽयं स्यात्संशये न्यस्य जीवितम् । सुहृज्जनपरिक्लेशो न चायं निष्फलस्तव ।।
data.es: "O Life! If you had a doubt this exertion to you is wasteful. This fruitless hard work was perhaps not required on your part nor your friends."
data.anv: जीवितम् life, संशये doubt, न्यस्य exertion, ते to you, वृधा wasteful, अयंश्रमः this hard work, न स्यात् perhaps not required, अयम् this, विफलः failure, तव your, सुहृज्जनपरिक्लेशः nor your friends, न च and not
data.md: You would not have been required to undergo this toil at the risk of your own life and giving unnecessary trouble to your friends.

data.v: त्वया तु नरशार्दूल क्रोधमेवानुवर्तता । लघुनेव मनुष्येण स्त्रीत्वमेव पुरस्कृतम् ।।
data.es: "O tiger among kings! You also gave up yourself to anger like a weak man and adopted womanliness"
data.anv: नृपशार्दूल tiger among kings, रोषमेव gave yourself to anger, अनुवर्तता following, त्वयातु you also, लघुना weak, मनुष्येणइव like a man, स्त्रीत्वमेव womanliness, प पुरस्कृतम् adopting
data.md: O foremost of kings, being subject to ire-you did not perceive anything but womanhood in me, like an ordinary man.

data.v: अपदेशेन जनकान्नोत्पत्तिर्वसुधातलात् । मम वृत्तं च वृत्तज्ञ बहु ते न पुरस्कृतम् ।।
data.anv: वृत्तज्ञ divine birth, अपदेशेव mentioned, जनकात् birth, वसुधातलात् in the ground, उत्पततिः risen, मम me, बहु many, वृत्तं च divine origin, ते you, पुरस्कृतम् considered
data.md: Although I am known to have a father but in fact I am born of the earth. You did not sufficiently honour my character, O you conversant with character. are

data.v: न प्रमाणीकृतः पाणिर्बाल्ये बालेन पीडितः । मम भक्तिश्च शीलं च सर्वं ते पृष्ठतः कृतम् ।।
data.es: "When in my young age you held my hand as a mark of acceptance (in our marriage), has it not been considered by you? Has my devotion, character and chastity not been taken into account?"
data.anv: बाल्ये young, निपीडितः pressed, ममपाणिः my hand, न प्रमाणीकृतः as a mark of acceptance, मम my, भक्तिश्च with devotion, शीलं च my character, सर्वम् all, ते to you, पृष्ठतः chastity, कृतम् not taken into account
data.md: Your marriage with me in boyhood shall be disproved and you not sufficiently considering all my devotion and good conduct to you.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणा रुदती बाष्पगद्गदभाषिणी । अब्रवील्लक्ष्मणं सीता दीनं ध्यानपरं स्थितम् ।।
data.es: Thus speaking, and weeping with tears, with choked throat, Sita was absorbed in her mind and piteous. She spoke to Lakshmana.
data.anv: इति thus, बृवन्ती speaking, रूदती weeping, बाष्पगद्गदभाषिणी with tears and choked throat, सीता Sita, दीनम् piteous, ध्यानपरायणम् absorbed in mind, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, उवाच spoke
data.md: Saying thus with accents choked in tears and weeping Sītā spoke to Lakşmaņa, poorly and engaged in meditation.

data.v: चितां मे कुरु सौमित्रे व्यसनस्यास्य भेषजम् । मिथ्यापवादोपहता नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: "Saumithri! Cure for this sorrow is only pyre. Arrange for pyre as I do not desire to live with false reproaches."
data.anv: सौमित्रे Saumithri, मे I, अस्य this, व्यसनस्य sorrow, भेषजम् cure, चिताम् pyre, कुरु arrange, मिथ्यापवादोपहता false reproaches, अहम् I, जीवितुम् to live, न उत्सहे not desire
data.md: Make a funeral pyre for me, O Saumitri, that is the only remedy for this disaster. Being thus branded with an unfounded stigma I do not like to keep my life.

data.v: अप्रीतस्य गुणैर्भर्तुस्त्यक्तया जनसंसदि । या क्षमा मे गतिर्गन्तुं प्रवेक्ष्ये हव्यवाहनम् ।।
data.es: "When my husband is not pleased with my virtues, renounces me in the gathering of people, I have only that path for me, that is, entering fire and offering myself as oblation."
data.anv: गुणैः virtues, अप्रीतेन not pleased, भर्त्रा husband, जनसंसदि gathering of people, त्यक्तायाः left out, मे I, या that, गतिः path, गन्तुम् will go, क्षमा tolerance, हव्यवाहनम् offer myself to oblations, प्रवेक्ष्यामि will enter fire
data.md: To adopt the proper course for me who had been renounced before this assembly by my disaffected husband I shall enter this.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु वैदेह्या लक्ष्मणः परवीरहा । अमर्षवशमापन्नो राघवाननमैक्षत ।।
data.es: Spoken in that manner by Vaidehi, Lakshmana, the destroyer of enemies, overcome with indignation looked at Raghava.
data.anv: वैदेह्या by Vaidehi, एवम् in that manner, उक्तः spoken, परवीरहा destroyer of enemies, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, अमर्षवशम् with indignation, आपन्नः overcome, राघवम् Raghava, समुदैक्षत looked at
data.md: Being thus addressed by Vaidehī, Lakşmaņa, the slayer of enemies, being possessed by anger, looked towards Rāghava.

data.v: स विज्ञाय मनश्छन्दं रामस्याकारसूचितम् । चितां चकार सौमित्रिर्मते रामस्य वीर्यवान् ।।
data.es: Understanding Rama's indication from his looks, Saumithri started to prepare the earth for pyre.
