data.v: दृष्ट्वा त्वामभिषेकार्द्रं कौसल्यामभिवाद्य च । अचिरेणागमिष्यामः स्वान्गृहान्नृपतेः सुत ।।
data.es: "O Jewel among kings! We will see you being consecrated and see Kausalya, greet her and return back to our own house."
data.anv: नृपसत्तम jewel among kings, अभिषेकार्द्रम् getting consecrated, त्वाम् you, दृष्टवा seeing, कौसल्याम् Kausalya, अभिवाद्य च greeting, अचिरात् soon, स्वगृहान् own house, अगमिष्यामः will return
data.md: Beholding you installed and bowing to Kausalya, we shall soon return to our respective homes, O foremost of kings.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु धर्मात्मा वानरैः सविभीषणैः । अब्रवीद्राघवः श्रीमान्ससुग्रीवविभीषणान् ।।
data.es: Vibheeshana and Vanaras had spoken in that way, Rama replied to Sugriva, Vibheeshana and Vanaras as follows.
data.anv: सविभीषणैः Vibheeshana, वानरैः Vanaras, एवम् in that way, उक्तः spoken, धर्मात्मा righteous, सःरामः he, Rama, ससुग्रीवविभीषणान् Sugriva and Vibheeshana, वानरान् Vanaras, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Being thus accosted by the monkeys with Vibhisana, the virtuous-souled Rama, spoke to them and Sugriva and Vibhisana, saying.

data.v: प्रियात्प्रियतरं लब्धं यदहं ससुहृज्जनः । सर्वैर्भवद्भिः सहितः प्रीतिं लप्स्ये पुरीं गतः ।।
data.es: "If I with my dear and near and together with you go to Ayodhya, that will give more happiness with Sita coming and with all of you."
data.anv: अहम् I, ससुहृज्जनः with my dear and near, सर्वैः all, भवद्भिः you also, सहितः together, पुरीम् Ayodhya, गतः go, प्रीतिम् happy, यत् that, लप्स्ये gain, प्रियात् dear Sita, प्रियतरम् very happy, लब्दम् give
data.md: Dearer than the dear, I shall attain to, when returning my city, along with you all, I shall enjoy in the company of all my friends and relatives.

data.v: क्षिप्रमारोह सुग्रीव विमानं वानरैः सह । त्वमध्यारोह सामात्यो राक्षसेन्द्रविभीषण ।।
data.es: Sugriva and the Vanaras, quickly ascended the aerial car. Vibheeshana, the king of Rakshasas and ministers all of them ascended.
data.anv: सुग्रीव Sugriva, वानरैःसह with Vanaras, क्षिप्रम् quickly, विमानम् aerial car, आरोह ascended, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, विभीषण Vibheeshana, सामात्यः ministers, त्वमपि all, आरोह ascended
data.md: O Sugrīva, do you soon ascend the car along with the monkeys. Do you ascend too, O Vibhisana, lord of Raksasas, with all your courtiers.

data.v: ततस्तत्पुष्पकं दिव्यं सुग्रीवः सह सेनया । अध्यारोहत्त्वरञ्शीघ्रं सामात्यश्च विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Then Sugriva with Vanaras happily joined the wonderful Pushpaka, Vibheeshana and his ministers also ascended.
data.anv: ततः then, सःसुग्रीवः Sugriva, वानरैःसह with Vanaras, मुदा happy, युक्तः joined, दिव्यम् wonderful, पुष्पकम् Pushpaka, आरुरोह ascended, सामात्यः ministers, विभीषणश्च Vibheeshana
data.md: Thereupon ascended that celestial car Puş paka, Sugriva, greatly delighted with the monkeys and Vibhisana, with his courtiers.

data.v: तेष्वारूढेषु सर्वेषु कौबेरं परमासनम् । राघवेणाभ्यनुज्ञातमुत्पपात विहायसं ।।
data.es: All the Vanaras and others having got into Kubera's Pushpaka with Rama's permission, it flew into the sky.
data.anv: तेषु those, सर्वेषु all, आरूढेषु having got in, कौबेरम् Kubera's, परमासनम् supreme seat, राघवेण by Raghava, अभ्यनुज्ञातम् with his permission, विहायसम् sky, उत्पपात flew
data.md: They all having got up, the excellent car, of Kuvera at the command of Raghava, rose up in the welkin.

data.v: ययौ तेन विमानेन हंसयुक्तेन भास्वता । प्रहृष्टश्च प्रतीतश्च बभौ रामः कुबेरवत् ।।
data.es: Delighted and thrilled, Rama was flying in the sky in Pushpaka and with shining swans, he shone like Kubera.
data.anv: प्रहृष्टश्च delighted, प्रतीतश्च thrilled, रामः Rama, खगतेन in the sky, हंसयुक्तेन with pictures of swans, भास्वता shining, विमानेन by the aerial car, कुबेरवत् like Kubera, बभौ shone
data.md: And in that car coursing at will land drawn by effulgent ganders, Rāma greatly delighted appeared like Kuvera (himself).

data.v: अनुज्ञातं तु रामेण तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् । उत्पपात महामेघः श्वसनेनोद्धतो यथा ।।
data.es: Swan shaped Pushpak, unsurpassed in appearance like swan, making great sound started to fly with the permission of Rama.
data.anv: अनुत्तमम् unsurpassed, हंसयुक्तम् like swan, महानादम् great sound, तत् that, विमानम् aerial car, रामेण by Rama, अनुज्ञातम् permission, विहायसम् started to fly, उत्पपात rising up
data.md: Being commanded by Räma, that excellent car, drawn by ganders, with a huge noise, rose high up in the welkin.

data.v: पातयित्वा ततश्चक्षुः सर्वतो रघुनन्दनः । अब्रवीन्मैथिलीं सीतां रामः शशिनिभाननाम् ।।
data.es: Then Rama, the enhancer of the joy of Raghu race casting his gaze at the moon like face of Sita spoke.
data.anv: ततः then, रघुनन्दनः enhancer of joy of Raghu race, रामः Rama, चक्षुः eyes, सर्वतः all sides, पातयित्वा casting, शशिनिभाननाम् moon like face, मैथिलीम् of Mythili, सीताम् Sita, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Casting his looks on all sides, Rama, the descendant of Raghus, spoke to Sītā, the daughter of the kind of Mithila, having a moonlike countenance, saying.

data.v: कैलासशिखराकारे त्रिकूटशिखरे स्थिताम् । लङ्कामीक्षस्व वैदेहि निर्मितां विश्वकर्मणा ।।
data.es: "Vaidehi, you may see the peak of Trikuta which stands on Lanka in the shape of the peak of Kailasa, constructed by Viswakarma."
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, कैलासशिखराकारे of the shape of the peak of Kailasa, त्रिकूटशिखरे peak of Trikuta, स्थिताम् stands, विश्वकर्मणा by Viswakarma, निर्मिताम् constructed, लङ्काम् Lanka, ईक्षस्व you may see
data.md: O Vaidehi, do you behold Lanka, situate on the summit of the mount Citrakūta, resembling that of Kailasa and constructed by Viswakarma.

data.v: एतदायोधनं पश्य मांसशोणितकर्दमम् । हरीणां राक्षसानां च सीते विशसनं महत् ।।
data.es: "Sita, see the mire of flesh and blood of the carnage of many monkeys and Rakshasas on the battlefield."
data.anv: सीते Sita, मांसशोणितकर्दमम् mire of flesh and blood, हरीणाम् monkeys, राक्षसानां च and Rakshasas, विशसनम् carnage, महत् many, एतत् all these, अयोधनम् battlefield, पश्य see
data.md: Behold, O Sītā, that huge arena of battle, bathed in the blood and flesh of the monkeys and Raksasas.

data.v: तवहेतोर्विशालाक्षि रावणो निहतो मया । कुम्भकर्णोऽत्र निहतः प्रहस्तश्च निशाचरः ।।
लक्ष्मणेनेन्द्रजिच्चात्र रावणिर्निहतो रणे । विरूपाक्षश्च दुष्प्रेक्ष्यो महापार्श्वमहोदरौ ।।
data.md: The Rākşasa named Vikața was slain there by Angada-and Virūpākșa, hard to look at and Mahāpārśva and Mahodara.

data.v: अकम्पनश्च निहतो बलिनोऽन्ये च राक्षसाः । त्रिशिराश्चातिकायश्च देवान्तकनरान्तकौ ।।
data.es: "There is the Rakshasa by name Vikata killed by Angada, and Virupaksha (killed by Sugriva), Mahaparsva (killed by Rshaba), Mahodara (killed by Neela), Akampana and other Rakshasas, like Trisira killed by the mighty Hanuman and Atikaya by Lakshmana and Devanthaka (by Hanuman), and Naranthaka (by Angada)."
data.anv: अत्र there, अङ्गदेन by Angada, विकटोनाम Vikata by name, राक्षसः Rakshasa, निहतः killed, दुष्प्रेक्षः Dupreksha, विरूपाक्षश्च Virupaksha, महापार्श्वमहोदरौ Mahaparsva and Mahodara, अकम्पनश्च and Akampana, निहतः killed, बलिनः mighty, अन्ये others, राक्षसाः च Rakshasas, त्रिशिराः Trisira, अतिकायश्च Atikaya, देवान्तकनरान्तकौ Devanthaka and Naranthaka

data.v: अत्र मन्दोदरी नाम भार्या तं पर्यदेवयत् । सपत्नीनां सहस्रेण सास्रेण परिवारिता ।।
data.es: "Mandodari wife of Ravana, with a thousand cowives is on the seashore surrounded by associates."
data.anv: अत्र there, सपत्नीनाम् with cowives, साग्रेण on the sea shore, सहस्रेण a thousand, परिवारिता associates, मन्दोदरीनाम Mandodari by name, भार्या wife, तम् her, पर्यदेवयत् surrounded by
data.md: (And there was slain) Suryaśatru and Brahmaśatru (And there bewailed for Rāvana) his spouse Mandodarī, surrounded by his thousand other wives.

data.v: एतत्तु दृश्यते तीर्थं समुद्रस्य वरानने । यत्र सागरमुत्तीर्य तां रात्रिमुषिता वयम् ।।
data.es: "Charming lady! You see the seashore there, where we crossed the sea that night and slept on the shore."
data.anv: वरानने charming lady, समुद्रस्य ocean's, एतत् this, तीर्थम् shore, दृश्यते see, सागरम् ocean, उत्तीर्य landed, वयम् we, तांरात्रिम् that night, यत्र there, उषिताः slept
data.md: O you having an excellent countenance, do you behold the descending place of the ocean, where I spent the night after crossing the deep for you.

data.v: एष सेतुर्मया बद्धः सागरे सलिलार्णवे । तवहेतोर्विशालाक्षि नलसेतुः सुदुष्करः ।।
data.es: "Broad eyed lady! Here is the bridge built on the salty ocean by Nala, which was difficult to construct."
data.anv: विशालाक्षि broad eyed, एषः here, सागरे on the ocean, सलिलार्णवे salt ocean, मया by me, बद्धः bridge, सुदुष्करः very difficult, नलसेतुः built by Nala (called Nalasethu as it was built by Nala)
data.md: O you having expansive eyes, for you, this difficult construction of the bridge was made by me over the deep by the help of Nala.

data.v: पश्य सागरमक्षोभ्यं वैदेहि वरुणालयम् । अपारमभिगर्जन्तं शङ्खशुक्तिनिषेवितम् ।।
data.es: "Vaidehi! See the abode of Varuna, impenetrable and immeasurable roaring aloud filled with conches and oystershells."
data.anv: वैदेहि Vaidehi, अक्षोभ्यम् imperturbable, वरुणालयम् abode of Varuna, अपारमिव immeasurable, अभिगर्जन्तम् roaring aloud, शङ्खशुक्तिसमाकुलम् hoarding conches, oystershells, सागरम् ocean, पश्य see
data.md: Do you O Vaidehī, behold the unagitated deep-the abode of Varuņa, appearing as if without the other end, roaring and abounding in conchs and pearl oysters.

data.v: हिरण्यनाभं शैलेन्द्रं काञ्चनं पश्य मैथिलि । विश्रमार्थं हनुमतो भित्त्वा सागरमुत्थितम् ।।
data.es: "Mythili! See the mountain which has golden caves and has risen cleaving the ocean in order to give place for Hanuman to rest while crossing the ocean."
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, हनुमतः Hanumantha, विश्रमार्थम् in order to rest, सागरम् ocean, भित्त्वा cleaving, उत्थितम् risen up, काञ्चनम् golden, हिरण्यनाभम् golden mountain, पश्य see
data.md: O Maithili, do you behold the golden mount, which rose above the deep for affording a resting place to Hanumăn.

data.v: अत्र राक्षसराजोऽयमाजगाम विभीषणः ।।
एषा सा दृश्यते सीते किष्किन्धा चित्रकानना । सुग्रीवस्य पुरी रम्या यत्र वाली मया हतः ।।
data.es: "Sita! You are seeing the capital of Sugriva, beautiful Kishkinda with lovely woods. Vali was killed here by me."
data.anv: सीते Sita, सुग्रीवस्य Sugriva's, पुरी capital, रम्या beautiful, चित्रकानना lovely woods, सा he, एषा of this, किष्किन्धा Kishkinda, दृश्यते seeing, यत्र there, मया by me, वाली Vali, हतः was killed
data.md: Do you behold, O Sita, Kiskindha, having beautiful gardens, the pleasant city of Sugrīva, where Vālī was slain by me.

data.v: दृश्यतेऽसौ महान्सीते सविद्युदिव तोयदः । ऋश्यमूको गिरिश्रेष्ठः काञ्चनैर्धातुभिर्वृतः ।।
data.es: "Sita! Rshyamuka is seen covered with streaks of gold minerals, glowing like clouds with lightning."
data.anv: सीते Sita, काञ्चनैः gold, धातुभिः minerals, वृतः covered, सविद्युत् glowing, तोयदः cloud, इव like असौ oh, गिरिवरः jewel among mountains, ऋष्यमूकः Rshyamuka, दृश्यते is seen
data.md: Do you behold there, O Sītā, the huge and foremost mount Rishyamuka abounding in gold and various metals, like to clouds accompanied with lightnings.

data.v: अत्राहं वानरेन्द्रेण सुग्रीवेण समागतः । समयश्च कृतः सीते वधार्थं वालिनो मया ।।
data.es: "Here is the place I met the Vanara king Sugriva and made an agreement to put an end to Vali."
data.anv: सीते Sita, अत्र here, अहम् I, वानरेन्द्रेण for Vanara king, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, समागतः met, मया by me, वालिनः Vali, वधार्थम् for putting an end, समयश्च agreement, कृतः made
data.md: There I was joined by Sugrīva, the lord of monkeys. And there I entered into an agreement, O Sita, for the destruction of Vali.

data.v: एषा सा दृश्यते पम्पा नलिनी चित्रकानना । त्वया विहीनो यत्राहं विललाप सुदुःखितः ।।
data.es: "Here is seen lovely woods and Pampa waters. I lamented here, separated from you."
data.anv: नलिनी waters, चित्रकानना lovely woods, एषा here, पम्पा Pampa, दृश्यते is seen, यत्र there, अहम् I, त्वया by me, विहीनः separated, सुदुःखितः afflicted, विललाप lamented
data.md: There is (the lake) Pampa abounding in lilies and skirted by picturesque forest where separated from you, I bewailed piteously.

data.v: अस्यास्तीरे मया दृष्टा शबरी धर्मचारिणी । अत्र योजनबाहुश्च कबन्धो निहतो मया ।।
data.es: "On its bank (Pampa) I saw Sabari, who was following the righteous path. Kabhanda, of eight miles long arms, was killed by me."
data.anv: अस्याः its, तीरे bank, धर्मचारिणी following righteous path, शबरी Sabari, मया by me, दृष्टा saw, अत्र there, मया by me, योजनबाहुः arms as long as yojana (eight miles), कबन्धः Kabhanda, निहतः was killed
data.md: And on its bank I beheld the pious Savari. And you I slew Kabandha and Yojanabāhu.

data.v: दृश्यतेऽसौ जनस्थाने सीते श्रीमान्वनस्पतिः । यत्र युद्धं महद्वृत्तं तवहेतोर्विलासिनि । रावणस्य नृशंसस्य जटायोश्च महात्मनः ।।
data.es: "Sita, here is Janasthana, where a mighty tree is seen. Oh sportive lady! There the exceptionally strong and highly energetic vulture Jatayu got killed by Ravana on account of you."
data.anv: सीते Sita, जनस्थाने Janasthana, श्रीमान् prosperous, असौ oh, वनस्पतिः mighty tree, दृश्यते seen, विलासिनि sportive lady, यत्र there, तवहेतोः on your account, पक्षिणाम् vulture, प्रवरः exceptionally, बली strong, महातेजाः highly energetic, जटायुश्च Jatayu, रावणेन by Ravana, निहतः was killed

data.v: खरश्च निहतश्संख्ये दूषणश्च निपातितः । त्रिशिराश्च महावीर्यो मया बाणैरजिह्मगैः ।।
पर्णशाला तथा चित्रा दृश्यते शुभदर्शना । यत्र त्वं राक्षसेन्द्रेण रावणेन हृता बलात् ।।
data.es: "O excellent lady! Here is the location where Khara was killed by my straight going arrows and Dushana had fallen. Here is our hermitage covered with leaves, a well known site. It is from here that Ravana had borne you away forcibly."
data.anv: वरवर्णिनि excellent lady, एतत् this, यत्र there, मया by me, अजिह्मगैः going straight, शरैः arrows, खरश्च Khara, निहतः killed, दूषणश्च Dushana, निपातितः fallen, तत् that, अस्माकम् our, आश्रमपदम् hermitage, तथा similarly, शुभदर्शने well known site, त्वम् you, यत्र there, राक्षसेन्द्रेण Rakshasa king, रावणेन by Ravana, बलात् forcibly, हृता borne away, पर्णशाला hut covered with leaves, दृश्यते is seen
data.md: Do you behold there, O you of a beautiful person, O you of auspicious looks, our hermitage and the beautiful cottage of leaves, where from you had been carried away by force by the lord of Raksasas.

data.v: एषा गोदावरी रम्या प्रसन्नसलिला शिवा । अगस्त्यस्याश्रमो ह्येष दृश्यते पश्य मैथिलि ।।
data.es: "Here is an auspicious, beautiful Godavari with pure water. Here is also seen the hermitage of Agastya surrounded by banana plants."
data.anv: एषा here is, प्रसन्नसलिला pure water, शुभा auspicious, रम्या beautiful, गोदावरी Godavari, कदलीवृतः surrounded by banana plants, अगस्त्यस्य Agastya's, आश्रमश्चैव hermitage also, दृश्यते is seen
data.md: Do you behold there the beautiful and sacred river Godāvarī having clear water and the hermitage of Agastya, surrounded by plantain trees.

data.v: वैदेहि दृश्यते चात्र शरभङ्गाश्रमो महान् । उपयातः सहस्राक्षो यत्र शक्रः पुरंदरः ।।
data.es: "See the glowing hermitage of the great sage Sutikshna. Vaidehi, see Sarabhanga's hermitage here, where the thousand eyed Indra, the destroyer of citadels (Purandara) had come."
data.anv: दीप्तः glowing, एषःआश्रमः this hermitage, महात्मनः great sage, सुतीक्षणस्य Sutikshna, वैदेहि Vaidehi, महान् great, शरभङ्गाश्रमःचैव Sarabhanga's hermitage, दृश्यते is seen, यत्र here, सहस्राक्षः thousand eyed, पुरन्दरः Purandara, शक्रः Indra, उपयातः had come
data.md: Do you behold there, O Vaidehi, the great hermitage of Sarabhanga, where came the thousand-eyed, Sakra, the subduer of enemies cities.

data.v: एते ते तापसावासा दृश्यन्ते तनुमध्यमे । अत्रिः कुलपतिर्यत्र सूर्यवैश्वानरप्रभः । अत्र सीते त्वया दृष्टा तापसी धर्मचारिणी ।।
data.es: "There are seen the abodes of ascetics. Here was seen by you hermitage of Atri (whose wife Anasuya you had seen) glowing like sun and fire."
data.anv: तनुमध्यमे of slender waist, एते there, हि is, तापसाः ascetics, वासा abodes, दृश्यन्ते is seen, यत्र there, सूर्यवैश्वानरोपमः like sun and fire, अत्रिः Atri, कुलपतिः head

data.v: अस्मिन्देशे महाकायो विराधो निहतो मया ।।
data.es: "In these countries was a Rakshasa, called Viradha of gigantic size who was killed by me. There is an ascetic woman Anasuya practicing virtues whom you saw."
data.anv: अस्मिन्देशे in these countries, महाकायः of gigantic body size, विराधः Viradha, मया by me, निहतः killed, सीते Sita, अत्र there, धर्मचारिणी practicing virtues, तापसी ascetic, त्वया you, दृष्टा saw

data.v: असौ सुतनुशैलेन्द्रश्चित्रकूटः प्रकाशते । यत्र मां कैकयीपुत्रः प्रसादयितुमागतः ।।
data.es: "O Charming lady! See the best of the mountains Chitrakuta shining there. Kaikeyi's son had come here to request me to accept the kingdom."
data.anv: सुतनु charming lady, असौ oh, शैलेन्द्रः best of mountains, चित्रकूटः Chitrakuta, प्रकाशते shining, अत्र there, कैकयीपुत्रः Kaikeyi's son, माम् me, प्रसादयितुम् to request, आगतः had come here

data.v: एषा सा यमुना दूराद्दृश्यते चित्रकानना । भरद्वाजाश्रमो यत्र श्रीमानेष प्रकाशते ।।
data.es: "Mythili! See the wonderful woods bordering beautiful Yamuna. Glorious hermitage of Bharadwaja is seen there."
data.anv: मैथिलि Mythili, एषा this, चित्रकानना wonderful woods, रम्या beautiful, सायमुना that Yamuna, दृश्यते is seen, श्रीमान् glorious, एषः this, भरद्वाजाश्रमः Bharadwaja's hermitage, दृश्यते is seen

data.v: एषा त्रिपथगा गङ्गा दृश्यते वरवर्णिनि । शृङ्गवेरपुरं चैतद्गुहो यत्र समागतः ।।
एषा सा दृश्यतेऽयोध्या राजधानी पितुर्मम । अयोध्यां कुरु वैदेहि प्रणामं पुनरागता ।।
data.es: Sita! My father's capital Ayodhya is seen. We have come here. Offer your salutations."

data.md: Behold there the city of ſîngavera, where I made friendship with Guha. Behold there, O Sītā, the capital of my father. Do you bow to Ayodhya, O Vaidehi.

data.md: You should read the signs expressive of joy or asas sorrow that Bharata shall display on hearing this and infer therefrom his attitude towards me.

data.md: You should know, from the colour of his countenance, his looks and his words, all the movements and actions of Bharata.

data.es: "Whose mind will not be tempted at the abundance of elephants and horses of father's and grandfather's kingdom?"

data.md: Whose mind does not change obtaining such an ancestral kingdom, filled with all prosperity and abounding in elephants, horses and chariots?

data.es: "If the glorious Bharata who is an enhancer of the joy of Raghus having enjoyed the kingdom for long himself, let him rule all the entire earth it is laudable."
data.anv: श्रीमान् glorious, भरतः Bharata, सङ्गत्या meeting, राज्येन in the kingdom, अर्थी, स्वयम् by himself, भवेत् become, रघुनन्दनः enhancer of the joy of Raghus, सर्वाम् all, अखिलाम् entire, वसुधाम् on the earth, प्रशास्तु lauded
data.md: If the effulgent Bharata, the descendant of Raghu, ruling over it, wish the kingdom for himself, let him lord over the entire earth.

data.v: तस्य बुद्धिं च विज्ञाय व्यवसायं च वानर । यावन्न दूरं याताः स्मः क्षिप्रमागन्तुमर्हसि ।।
data.es: "Hanuman, making an effort to know his mind you ought to come quickly before we go too far a distance."

data.md: Therefore, O monkey, it behove you to come back speedily apprised of his intention and movements, before we proceed further.

data.v: इति प्रतिसमादिष्टो हनूमान्मारुतात्मजः । मानुषं धारयन्रूपमयोध्यां त्वरितो ययौ ।।
data.es: Having been commanded, Hanuman offered prayers to Vibheeshana and entered Lanka.
data.anv: इति thus, प्रतिसमादिष्टः commanded, मारुतात्मजः son of Maruti, हनुमान् Hanuman, निशाचरैः night ranger, पूज्यमानः offered prayers, लङ्कांपुरीम् into Lanka, प्रविवेश entered
data.md: Being thus commanded, Hanumān, the son of Wind-god, assuming a human shape speedily proceeded towards Ayodhyā.

data.v: सखा तु तव काकुत्स्थो रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । ससीतः सह सौमित्रिः स त्वां कुशलमब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: "Your friend Rama, truly valiant one, with his wife Sita, with Lakshmana conveys his welfare to you."

He shall leave that place tomorrow.

data.es: Highly energetic Hanuman, was thrilled, overcome with happiness (that he was able to communicate to Guha) and unmindful of the fatigue, being endowed with speed and swift movement, went up.

data.v: क्रोशमात्रे त्वयोध्यायाश्चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् । ददर्श भरतं दीनं कृशमाश्रमवासिनम् ।।
जटिलं मलदिग्धाङ्गं भ्रातृव्यसनकर्शितम् । फलमूलाशिनं दान्तं तापसं धर्मचारिणम् ।।
समुन्नतजटाभारं वल्कलाजिनवाससं । नियतं भावितात्मानं ब्रह्मर्षिसमतेजसं ।।
पादुके ते पुरस्कृत्य शासन्तं वै वसुंधराम् । चतुर्वर्ण्यस्य लोकस्य त्रातारं सर्वतो भयात् ।।
उपस्थितममात्यैश्च शुचिभिश्च पुरोहितैः । बलमुख्यैश्च युक्तैश्च काषायाम्बरधारिभिः ।।
न हि ते राजपुत्रं तं चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् । परिमोक्तुं व्यवस्यन्ति पौरा वै धर्मवत्सलाः ।।
data.es: The citizens (of Ayodhya) who were lovers of virtues did not enjoy any luxuries, not inclined for pleasures as the prince himself was wearing bark of trees and skin of antelope.
data.anv: धर्मवत्सलाः lovers of virtues, तेपौराः those citizens, चीरकृष्णाजिनाम्बरम् wore bark of trees and skin of antelope, राजपुत्रम् prince, तम् them, परिभोक्तुम् to enjoy luxuries, न व्यवस्यन्तिहि not inclined for pleasures
data.md: All those citizens, fond of piety, did not like to use good clothes beholding the prince use bark and deer skin.

data.es: Maruti's son Hanuman offered salutations to Bharata who was seen like a supreme body of dharma itself as if he was another form of dharma.

data.md: Thereupon Hanumān, the son of Māruta spoke with folded hands to him, conversant with piety like virtue incarnate, saying.

data.es: "That Kakuthsa for whom you are worrying and living as he was at Dandaka forest with bark tree fabric, and matted hair sent me to tell you about his welfare."

data.md: (He was then sprinkled by) the Rittigas, Brāhmaṇas, maidens enquired after your welfare. Do you, O worshipful sire speak out your welfare and renounce the dreadful grief. You shall in this moment be reconciled to your brother Rāma.

data.md: Slaying Ravana, and regaining Maithili, Rāma, having accomplished his end, has arrived here with his valiant friends. The highly effulgent Lakşmaņa and the famed Vaidehi (have also come). Sītā fare well with Rāma like to Sacī in the company of Mahendra.

निशम्य रामागमनं नृपात्मजः; कपिप्रवीरस्य तदाद्भुतोपमम् । प्रहर्षितो रामदिदृक्षयाभव;त्पुनश्च हर्षादिदमब्रवीद्वचः ।।
data.md: And hearing from that leading monkey of that wonderful return of Rāma, the son of the king, delighted became anxious to behold him and again addressed joyously Hanuman with the following words.

data.v: बहूनि नाम वर्षाणि गतस्य सुमहद्वनम् । शृणोम्यहं प्रीतिकरं मम नाथस्य कीर्तनम् ।।
data.es: "I am hearing the good news of my Lord returning from the forest, who was living in the great forest for many years."
data.anv: बहूनि many, वर्षाणि years, सुमहत् great, वनम् forest, गतस्य living, ममनाधस्य my Lord, प्रीतिकरम् returning, कीर्तनम् news, अहम् I, शृणोमिनाम hearing his name
data.md: I hear the tidings of my brother affording me great delight who has been living in the huge forest for many a year.

data.v: कल्याणी बत गाथेयं लौकिकी प्रतिभाति मे । एति जीवन्तमानन्दो नरं वर्षशतादपि ।।
data.es: The saying that "If a human being lives (long), for a hundred years, he will experience joy" is true and auspicious.
data.anv: जीवन्तम् living, नरम् humans, वर्षशतादपि for a hundred years, आनन्दः happy, एति such, इयम् this, लौकिकी saying, गाथा story, मे to me, कल्याणी auspicious, प्रतिभाति true
data.md: The saying of the people appear to me as instinct with well meaning that a man, if alive, may attain to joy even after a century.

data.v: राघवस्य हरीणां च कथमासीत्समागमः । कस्मिन्देशे किमाश्रित्य तत्त्वमाख्याहि पृच्छतः ।।
data.es: "How did the alliance of monkeys happen with Rama? Where and why? I am asking you. Tell me truly."
data.anv: राघवस्य च Raghava's, कपीनां च with the monkeys, कस्मिन् देवे where with Rama, किम् why, आश्रित्य alliance, कथम् how, समागमः friendshipmeeting, आसीत् asking, पृच्छतः tell, तत्त्वम् truly आख्याहि please tell
data.md: Do you relate truly to me, how and in what country the union between Rāghava and the monkeys was brought about.

data.v: स पृष्टो राजपुत्रेण बृस्यां समुपवेशितः । आचचक्षे ततः सर्वं रामस्य चरितं वने ।।
data.es: Prince Bharata seated comfortably on kusa grass asked Hanuman for all the history that happened in the forest, wishing to hear from him.

data.md: Being thus accosted by the prince and seated on Kusa, he, thereupon, began to describe Rama's life in the forest.

data.v: यथा प्रव्रजितो रामो मातुर्दत्ते वरे तव । यथा च पुत्रशोकेन राजा दशरथो मृतः ।।
यथा दूतैस्त्वमानीतस्तूर्णं राजगृहात्प्रभो । त्वयायोध्यां प्रविष्टेन यथा राज्यं न चेप्सितम् ।।
चित्रकूटं गिरिं गत्वा राज्येनामित्रकर्शनः । निमन्त्रितस्त्वया भ्राता धर्ममाचरिता सताम् ।।
स्थितेन राज्ञो वचने यथा राज्यं विसर्जितम् । आर्यस्य पादुके गृह्य यथासि पुनरागतः ।।
सर्वमेतन्महाबाहो यथावद्विदितं तव । त्वयि प्रतिप्रयाते तु यद्वृत्तं तन्निबोध मे ।।
अपयाते त्वयि तदा समुद्भ्रान्तमृगद्विजम् । प्रविवेशाथ विजनं सुमहद्दण्डकावनम् ।।
data.es: "When you had gone away the beasts and birds scared of your army got agitated and had a doleful appearance."
data.anv: त्वयि by you, तदा then, अपयाते gone away, समुद्भ्रान्तमृगद्विजम् beasts and birds scared of your army, अत्यर्थम् meaning, परिध्यIनम् agitated, इव like that, तत् then, वनम् forest, समपद्यत doleful appearance
data.md: Yourself having returned thence, all the bird and animals were overwhelmed with terror and that forest appeared as if distressed. Thereupon he entered the solitary and huge and dreadful forest Daņdaka distressed by the elephants and abounding in lion, tigers and deer.

data.v: तेषां पुरस्ताद्बलवान्गच्छतां गहने वने । विनदन्सुमहानादं विराधः प्रत्यदृश्यत ।।

data.md: Your entering the dense forest there appeared before them the powerful Virādha* emitting a dreadful sound. *A demon of that name.

data.v: तमुत्क्षिप्य महानादमूर्ध्वबाहुमधोमुखम् । निखाते प्रक्षिपन्ति स्म नदन्तमिव कुञ्जरम् ।।
data.es: "That Viradha uplifted his arms and bent his head low screamed like an elephant. The three dug up a pit and threw him into it."

data.v: तत्कृत्वा दुष्करं कर्म भ्रातरौ रामलक्ष्मणौ । सायाह्ने शरभङ्गस्य रम्यमाश्रममीयतुः ।।
data.es: "Both the brothers Rama and Lakshmana encountered Viradha who was difficult to attack and having completed their task, reached the beautiful hermitage of Sarabhanga in the evening."

data.md: Having accomplished that difficult work the two brothers Rāma and Lakşmaņa, arrived in the evening at the pleasant hermitage of Sarabhanga.

data.v: शरभङ्गे दिवं प्राप्ते रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । अभिवाद्य मुनीन्सर्वाञ्जनस्थानमुपागमत् ।।

data.md: Śarabhanga having attained to heaven, Rāma, having truth for his prowess, saluting all the ascetics, repaired to Janasthāna.

data.v: चतुर्दशसहस्राणि रक्षसां भीमकर्मणाम् । हतानि वसता तत्र राघवेण महात्मना ।।
data.es: " At Janasthana fourteen thousand Rakshasas have been destroyed with his arrows like peaks of fire."
data.anv: जनस्थाने at Janasthana, भीमकर्मणाम् of dreadful deeds, रक्षसाम् Rakshasas, चतुर्दश fourteen, सहस्राणि thousand, अग्निशिखोपमैः like peaks of fire, शरैः arrow, निहतानि destroyed
data.md: And by the high-souled Rāghava, living there, fourteen thousand inhabitants of janasthāna were slain.

data.v: ततः पश्चाच्छूर्पणखा रामपार्श्वमुपागता । ततो रामेण संदिष्टो लक्ष्मणः सहसोत्थितः ।।

रावणानुचरो घोरो मारीचो नाम राक्षसः । लोभयामास वैदेहीं भूत्वा रत्नमयो मृगः ।।

data.v: ततो रामो धनुष्पाणिर्धावन्तमनुधावति । स तं जघान धावन्तं शरेणानतपर्वणा ।।
data.es: "Rama, wielder of bow, chased the deer and followed it chasing and attacked with his arrow."
data.anv: ततः then, रामःRama, धनुष्पाणिः wielder of bow, तंमृगम् that deer, अनुधावति chased, सः he, धावन्तम् chasing, तम् that, आपतपर्वणा followed, शरेण by arrow, जघान attacked
data.md: Thereupon Rāma, with bow in his hand, pursued that deer and with one shaft destroyed it.

data.v: अथ सौम्या दशग्रीवो मृगं याते तु राघवे । लक्ष्मणे चापि निष्क्रान्ते प्रविवेशाश्रमं तदा । जग्राह तरसा सीतां ग्रहः खे रोहिणीमिव ।।
data.es: "When gentle Raghava went after the deer and Lakshmana also went from there, the ten headed Ravana entered the hermitage."

data.md: O gentle one, Räghava going out on hunting, and Lakṣmaṇa having issued out of the hermitage, the Ten-necked (demon) entered therein.

data.v: ततस्त्वद्भुतसंकाशाः स्थिताः पर्वतमूर्धनि । सीतां गृहीत्वा गच्छन्तं वानराः पर्वतोपमाः । ददृशुर्विस्मितास्तत्र रावणं राक्षसाधिपम् ।।
data.es: "Standing on the mountain top, the Vanaras who were like mountains in size watched the wonderful feat of the king of Rakshasas of wonderful form taking Sita."
data.anv: ततः then, अद्भुतसङ्काशाः wonderful feat, पर्वतमूर्धनि from the top of the mountain, स्थिताःstood, पर्वतोपमाः mountain like, वानराःVanara, सीताम् Sita, गृहीत्वा being taken, गच्छन्तम् going, राक्षसाधिपम् Lord of Rakshasas, रावणम् Ravana, विस्मिताकाराः of wonderful form, ददृशुः saw
data.md: Thereupon some monkeys resembling mountains, stationed on the summit of a mountain, stricken with wondrous fear and astonishment, beheld Ravana, the lord of Rākşasas proceed with Sītā.

data.v: प्रविवेर्श तदा लङ्कां रावणो लोकरावणः ।।
तां सुवर्णपरिक्रान्ते शुभे महति वेश्मनि । प्रवेश्य मैथिलीं वाक्यैः सान्त्वयामास रावणः ।।
data.es: "Ravana kept Mythili in an auspicious huge mansion with golden walls and consoled her with good words."

data.md: Entering the huge and excellent golden palace Ravana consoled Maithili with (diverse) words.

data.v: निवर्तमानः काकुत्स्थो दृष्ट्वा गृध्रं प्रविव्यथे ।।
गृध्रं हतं तदा दग्ध्वा रामः प्रियसखं पितुः । गोदावरीमनुचरन्वनोद्देशांश्च पुष्पितान् । आसेदतुर्महारण्ये कबन्धं नाम राक्षसं ।।
ततः कबन्धवचनाद्रामः सत्यपराक्रमः । ऋश्यमूकं गिरिं गत्वा सुग्रीवेण समागतः ।।
data.es: "While going in the huge forest the valiant and truthful Rama saw a Rakshasa by the name Kabhanda. According to Kabhanda's words of advice they went to Rshyamuka mountain and met Sugriva."
data.anv: महारण्ये in the huge forest, कबन्धंनाम by name Kabhanda, राक्षसम् Rakshasa, आसेदतुः while going, ततः then, सत्यपराक्रमः righteous and valiant, रामः Rama, कबन्धवचनात् Kabhanda's words, ऋष्यमूकगिरिम् Rshyamuka mountain, गत्वा went, सुग्रीवेण with Sugriva, समागतः met

data.v: तयोः समागमः पूर्वं प्रीत्या हार्दो व्यजायत । इतरेतर संवादात्प्रगाढः प्रणयस्तयोः ।।
data.es: "Even before they met, they had a happy feeling at heart towards each other. Earlier Sugriva was banished by his enraged brother (Vali). On mutual talk and discussion, they both developed deep friendship."
data.anv: पूर्वम् before, तयोः both, समागमः met, प्रीत्या affectionately, हार्दः happy at heart, व्यजायत developed, पुरा earlier, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्रुद्धेन enraged, भ्रात्रा brother, वालिना Vali, निरस्तः banished, इतरेतरसंवादात् mutual discussion, तयोः both, प्रणयः affection, प्रगाढः was deep
data.md: There had grown mutual love in them before they were known to each other. Sugrīva was driven away by his angry brother Váli. And informed of each other's affairs their friendship grew closer.

data.v: रामः स्वबाहुवीर्येण स्वराज्यं प्रत्यपादयत् । वालिनं समरे हत्वा महाकायं महाबलम् ।।
data.es: "Rama of mighty arms killed Vali of gigantic body and mighty prowess and restored Sugriva's own kingdom to him."
data.anv: रामः Rama, स्वबाहुवीर्येण might of his arms, महाकायम् gigantic body, महाबलम् mighty prowess, वालिनम् Vali, समरे in combat, हत्वा killed, स्वराज्यम् his kingdom, प्रत्यपादयत् restored
data.md: Thereupon slaying the huge-bodied and highly powerful Vāli in the conflict by virtue of the strength of his own arms Rāma obtained (for Sugriva) his own kingdom.

data.v: सुग्रीवः स्थापितो राज्ये सहितः सर्ववानरैः । रामाय प्रतिजानीते राजपुत्र्यास्तु मार्गणम् ।।
data.es: "Sugriva attained the kingdom and established. He promised to search with all Vanaras and promised to find Sita."
data.anv: राज्ये kingdom, स्थापितः established, सर्ववानरैःall Vanaras, सहितः together, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, रामाय Rama's, राजपुत्य्राः kingdom attained, मार्गणम् search, प्रतिजानीते promised to find
data.md: Being placed on the throne with all the monkeys, Sugrīva promised to Rāma the enquiry of the Princess (Sītā).

data.es: "Vanara Lord Sugriva ordered the monkeys to go to all countries and all directions and dispatched them to find Sita."
