data.md: Did you not resort to the usual fickleness of the monkeys? We do not behold the worshipful Răma, the descendant of Kākutstha the slayer of foes. Nor do we behold the monkeys assuming shapes at will.

data.v: अथैवमुक्ते वचने हनूमानिदमब्रवीत् । अर्थं विज्ञापयन्नेव भरतं सत्यविक्रमम् ।।
data.es: And then Bharata having spoken that way, Hanuman understood the meaning of his words and spoke thus.
data.anv: अथ and then, एवम् in that way, वचने words, उक्ते spoken, हनूमान् by Hanuman, सत्यविक्रमम् righteous, भरतम् Bharata, विज्ञापयन्नेव knowing, अर्थ्यम् meaning, इदम् thus, अब्रवीत् spoke

data.v: सदा फलान्कुसुमितान्वृक्षान्प्राप्य मधुस्रवान् । भरद्वाजप्रसादेन मत्तभ्रमरनादितान् ।।
तस्य चैष वरो दत्तो वासवेन परंतप । ससैन्यस्य तदातिथ्यं कृतं सर्वगुणान्वितम् ।।
निस्वनः श्रूयते भीमः प्रहृष्टानां वनौकसाम् । मन्ये वानरसेना सा नदीं तरति गोमतीम् ।।
data.md: Hear the dreadful noise of the delighted monkeys. Methinks the monkey host has crossed the river Gomati.

data.v: रजोवर्षं समुद्भूतं पश्य वालुकिनीं प्रति । मन्ये सालवनं रम्यं लोलयन्ति प्लवंगमाः ।।
data.es: "See the rain of dust started at Sala Forest. Vanaras are shaking the beautiful Sala grove, I think."
data.anv: सालवनंप्रति Sala forest, समुद्भूतम् started, रजोवर्षम् rain of dust, पश्य see, प्लवङ्गमाः Vanaras, रम्यम् beautiful, सालवनम् Sala grove, लोलयन्ति shaking, मन्ये I think

data.v: तदेतद्दृश्यते दूराद्विमलं चन्द्रसंनिभम् । विमानं पुष्पकं दिव्यं मनसा ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् ।।
data.es: Pushpaka is seen at a distance, resembling the moon. This wonderful Pushpaka has been created through Brahma's mind.
data.anv: चन्द्रसन्निभम् resembling the moon, तत् that, एतत् this, विमानम् aerial car, दूरात् at a distance, दृश्यते is seen, दिव्यम् wonderful, पुष्पकंविमानम् Pushpaka, ब्रह्मणा by Brahma, मनसा by his mind, निर्मितम् created

data.v: रावणं बान्धवैः सार्धं हत्वा लब्धं महात्मना । धनदस्य प्रसादेन दिव्यमेतन्मनोजवम् ।।
data.es: "Rama's vehicle is amazing, and he got it by killing Ravana and his relatives. It shines brightly like the rising sun, and it speeds at the thought of mind. Kubera got this aerial car by Brahma's grace."
data.anv: रावणम् Ravana, बान्दवैःसार्थम् relatives, हत्वा killed, महात्मना great, लब्दम् got, तरुणादित्यसङ्काशम् shines like the rising sun brightly, रामवाहनम् Rama's vehicle, एतत् this, दिव्यम् amazing, मनोजवम् speeds at mind thought, विमानम् aerial car, प्रसादेन by the grace, धनदस्य to Kubera

data.v: एतस्मिन्भ्रातरौ वीरौ वैदेह्या सह राघवौ । सुग्रीवश्च महातेजा राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः ।।
data.es: "Heroic Raghava brothers are there with Vaidehi, that highly energetic Sugriva and Rakshasa Vibheeshana also."
data.anv: वीरौ heroes, भ्रातरौ brothers, वैदेह्यासह with Vaidehi, राघवौ Raghavas, महातेजाः highly energetic, सुग्रीवश्च Sugriva, राक्षसः Rakshasa, विभीषणश्च Vibheeshana too, एतस्मिन् all in that
data.md: (There are) the two heroic brothers-the descendants of Raghu with Vaidehi, the highly effulgent Sugriva and the Räkşasa Vibhīşana.

data.v: ततो हर्षसमुद्भूतो निस्वनो दिवमस्पृशत् । स्त्रीबालयुववृद्धानां रामोऽयमिति कीर्तितः ।।
data.es: Then when "Sri Rama is here" was uttered a fantastic expression of joy of the women, young, youth and aged was heard, which reached the heaven.
data.anv: तः then, अयम् this, रामःSri Rama, इति there, कीर्तिते uttered, स्त्रीबालयुववृद्धानाम् women, young, youth and aged, हर्षसमुद्भूतः fantastic expression of joy, निःस्वनःsky, दिवम् sky, अस्पृशत् indistinct
data.md: Thereupon with the sound of there is Rama' there arose a joyous noise reaching the abode of the celestials from among women, children, the young and the old.

data.v: रथकुञ्जरवाजिभ्यस्तेऽवतीर्य महीं गताः । ददृशुस्तं विमानस्थं नराः सोममिवाम्बरे ।।
data.es: Those people on the chariots, elephants and horses got down and saw them on the moon like Pushpaka.
data.anv: रथकुञ्जरवाजिभ्यः chariots, elephants and horses, अवतीर्य got down, महीम् on ground, गताः went, तेनराः those people, विमानस्थम् in the Pushpaka, तम् them, अम्बरे sky, सोममिव like moon, ददृशुः saw
data.md: Thereupon descending upon the earth from chariots, elephants and horses all people beheld him (Rāma) stationed on the car like to the moon in the sky.

data.v: प्राञ्जलिर्भरतो भूत्वा प्रहृष्टो राघवोन्मुखः । स्वागतेन यथार्थेन ततो राममपूजयत् ।।
data.es: Highly rejoiced, Bharata offered salutations standing as he ought to within himself and worshiped Sri Rama from a distance.
data.anv: प्राञ्जलिः salutations, प्रहृष्टः highly rejoiced, भरतः Bharata, राघवोन्मुखः Raghava's face, भूत्वा standing, यथार्हेण as he ought to, स्वागतेन in himself, रामम् Sri Rama, अपूजयत् worshipped
data.md: Facing Rāghava and with folded hands Bharata delightedly worshipped him with agreeable words, Arghya and water to wash his feet.

data.v: मनसा ब्रह्मणा सृष्टे विमाने लक्ष्मणाग्रजः । रराज पृथुदीर्घाक्षो वज्रपाणिरिवापरः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama, elder brother of Bharata shone in the aerial car created by Brahma like another Indra.
data.anv: मनसा in his mind, ब्रह्मणा Brahmana, सृष्टे created, विमाने aerial car, पृथुदीर्घाक्षः broad eyed, भरताग्रजः Bharata's elder brother, अपरः another, वज्रपाणिरिव like Indra, रराज shone
data.md: There appeared in the car constructed by Brahmā's mind the elder brother of Bharata having expansive eyes like the immortal wielder of thunder-bolt.

data.v: ततो विमानाग्रगतं भरतो भ्रातरं तदा । ववन्दे प्रणतो रामं मेरुस्थमिव भास्करम् ।।
data.es: Then Bharata offered salutations with joined palms to Sri Rama seated in the peak of Pushpaka like saluting Sun from the mountain Meru.
data.anv: ततः then, भरतः Bharata, विमानाग्रगतम् peak of Pushpaka, मेरुस्थम् like Meru mountain, भास्करंयथा like the sun, रामम् Sri Rama, तदा then, प्रणतः salutations with joined palms, ववन्दे offered
data.md: Thereupon Bharata humbly saluted his brother Rāma seated on the top of the car like to the Sun on the summit (of the mount Meru).

data.v: आरोपितो विमानं तद्भरतः सत्यविक्रमः । राममासाद्य मुदितः पुनरेवाभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: Bharata of unfailing valour duly permitted to ascend Pushpaka by Sri Rama, reached Rama and once again offered salutations to Rama.
data.anv: ततविमानम् that Pushpaka, आरोपितः lifted on, सत्यविक्रमः unfailing valour, भरतः Bharata, रामम् Rama, आसाद्य reached, पुनरेव once again, अभ्यवादयत् greeted
data.md: Ascending that car, Bharata, having truth for his prowess, reaching Rāma, delighted, again bowed to him.

data.v: तं समुत्थाप्य काकुत्स्थश्चिरस्याक्षिपथं गतम् । अङ्के भरतमारोप्य मुदितः परिषष्वजे ।।
data.es: Kakuthsa Rama happily lifting up Bharata, who came into his sight after long, on to his thigh embraced him.
data.anv: काकुत्स्थः Kakuthsa, चिराय after long, अक्षिपथम् who came in his sight, गतम् arrived at, तम् him, भरतम् Bharata, समुत्थाप्य lifting up, अङ्कम् thigh, आरोप्य lifted to, मुदितःhappily, परिषस्वजे embraced
data.md: Raising Bharata up who had been seen after a long time and placing him on his lap Kākutstha, delighted, embraced him.

data.v: ततो लक्ष्मणमासाद्य वैदेहीं च परंतपः । अभ्यवादयत प्रीतो भरतो नाम चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.es: Then the tormentor of enemies, Bharata approached Lakshmana and then greeted Vaidehi and announced his name.
data.anv: ततः then, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, भरतः Bharata, प्रीतः lovingly, लक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana, वैदेहीं च and Vaidehi, आसाद्य approached, अथ and then, अभ्यवादयत् greeted, नाम name, अब्रवीत् च announced
data.md: Thereupon Bharata, the slayer of foes, bowed to Vaidehī and welcomed Lakşmaņa.

data.v: सुग्रीवं कैकयी पुत्रो जाम्बवन्तं तथाङ्गदम् । मैन्दं च द्विविदं नीलमृषभं चैव सस्वजे ।।
data.es: Bharata, the son of Kaikeyi thereafter embraced Sugriva, Jambavantha, Angada, Mainda, Dwivivida, Nila and Rshaba.
data.anv: अथ and then, केकयीपुत्रः Kaikeyi's son, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, जाम्बवन्तम् Jambavantha, अङ्गदम् Angada, मैन्दम् Mainda, द्विविदंचैव and Dwivivida, नीलम् Nila, ऋषभम् Rshaba, परषस्वजे embraced
data.md: The son of Kaikeyi (then in turn) embraced Sugrīva, Jāmbavān, Angada, Mainda, Dvivida, Nīla and Rşabha.

data.v: ते कृत्वा मानुषं रूपं वानराः कामरूपिणः । कुशलं पर्यपृच्छन्त प्रहृष्टा भरतं तदा ।।
data.es: Then he inquired about the welfare of those Vanaras who can take any form at will, who were in human form and was delighted.
data.anv: तदा then, कामरूपिणः who can take any form at will, तेवानराः those Vanaras, मानुषंरूपम् in human form, कृत्वा doing, प्रहृष्टाः delighted, भरतम् Bharata, कुशलम् welfare, पर्यपृच्छन् inquired
data.md: He then embraced Sușeņa, Nala, Gavākşa, Gandhamadana, Sarabha, and Panasa. And assuming human shapes, those monkeys, assuming shapes at will, delightedly enquired after Bharata's well being.

data.v: विभीषणं च भरतः सान्त्वयन्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । दिष्ट्या त्वया सहायेन कृतं कर्म सुदुष्करम् ।।
data.es: And then Bharata spoke this good word. "Luckily with your help, the very difficult task was done."
data.anv: अथ and then, भरतः Bharata, विभीषणं च Vibheeshana, सान्त्ववाक्यम् good word, अब्रवीत् spoke, दिष्ट्या luckily, सहायेन help, त्वया by you, सुदुष्करम् very difficult, कर्म task, कृतम् was done
data.md: Bharata then addressed Vibhiṣaṇa with soothing words, “It is by fortune that through your help he has accomplished such a difficult work."

data.v: शत्रुघ्नश्च तदा राममभिवाद्य सलक्ष्मणम् । सीतायाश्चरणौ पश्चाद्ववन्दे विनयान्वितः ।।
data.es: Then hero Shatrughna and Lakshmana also greeted Rama and then worshipped Sita also.
data.anv: तदा then, वीरः hero, शत्रुघ्नश्च Shatrughna also, सलक्ष्मणम् Lakshmana also, रामम् Rama, अभिवाद्य greeted, सीतायाः and Sita, चरणौ feet, विनयात् obediently, अभ्यवादयत् worshipped
data.md: Thereupon the heroic Satrughna saluting Rāma and Lakşmaņa, respectfully bowed to Sitā.

data.v: रामो मातरमासाद्य विषण्णं शोककर्शिताम् । जग्राह प्रणतः पादौ मनो मातुः प्रसादयन् ।।
data.es: Rama reached his mother who was pale and emaciated in grief and offered salutations clasping her feet in obedience and was delighted in his mind.
data.anv: रामः Rama, विवर्णाम् pale, शोककर्शिताम् emaciated by grief, मातरम् mother, आसाद्य reached, प्रणतः offered salutations, मातुः to mother, मनः in mind, प्रहर्षयन् delighted, पादौ feet, जग्राह clasped
data.md: Having approached his mother, pale and pulled down with grief, Rāma humbly touched her feet and enhanced her delight.

data.v: अभिवाद्य सुमित्रां च कैकेयीं च यशस्विनीम् । स मातॄश्च तदा सर्वाः पुरोहितमुपागमत् ।।
data.es: Then he greeted Sumitra, and illustrious Kaikeyi also and then all the mothers and the priests who had come.
data.anv: सः he, सुमित्रां च Sumitra also, यशस्विनीम् illustrious, कैकेयीं च Kaikeyi also, अभिवाद्य greeted, सर्वाः all, मात्रूश्च mothers, ततः then, पुरोहितम् priests, उपागमत् had come
data.md: Thereupon saluting Sumitrā, famed Kaikeyi and all his mothers he approached the priests.

data.v: स्वागतं ते महाबाहो कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन । इति प्राञ्जलयः सर्वे नागरा राममब्रुवन् ।।
data.es: "Welcome to you mighty armed Rama, enhancer of Kausalya's joy" saying so citizens of the city spoke with folded hand s greeting Rama.
data.anv: महाबाहो mightyarmed, कौसल्यानन्दवर्धन enhancer of Kausalya's joy, ते you, स्वागतम् welcome, सर्वे all, नागराः people of the city, प्राञ्जलयः with folded palms, अब्रुवन् spoke
data.md: Thereupon all the citizens with folded hands welcomed him saying, “Welcome are you, O you of long arms! O you the enhancer of Kausalya's joy!"

data.v: तन्यञ्जलिसहस्राणि प्रगृहीतानि नागरैः । आकोशानीव पद्मानि ददर्श भरताग्रजः ।।
data.es: The citizens in thousands greeting Rama, elder brother of Bharata lifting up their hand s with folded palms seemed like lotus buds.
data.anv: नागरैः citizens, प्रगृहीतानि taking up, तानि they, अञ्जलिसहस्राणि thousands greeting with folded palms, भरताग्रजः elder brother of Bharata, व्याकोचानि displayed, पद्मानीव like lotus buds, ददर्श seemed
data.md: The elder brother of Bharata observed the folded hands of the citizens like so many blown lotuses.

data.v: पादुके ते तु रामस्य गृहीत्वा भरतः स्वयम् । चरणाभ्यां नरेन्द्रस्य योजयामास धर्मवित् ।।
data.es: Taking the sandals given to Bharata, the knower of dharma put on the sandals on Rama's feet by himself.
data.anv: धर्मवित् knower of dharma, भरतः Bharata, रामस्य Rama's, ते you, पादुके sandals, गृहीत्वा taking, स्वयम् himself, नरेन्द्रस्य king's, चरणाभ्याम् to both feet, योजयामास placed
data.md: And himself taking the sandals of Rāma, Bharata, conversant with piety, placed them at the feet of that lord of men. Thereupon Bharata with folded hands spoke to Rāma, saying.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा रामं भरतः स कृताञ्जलिः । एतत्ते रक्षितं राजन्राज्यं निर्यातितं मया ।।
data.es: Bharata then greeted Rama with folded palms, spoke saying, "this kingdom and everything held in trust by me is returned to you."
data.anv: सःभरतः he, Bharata, कृताञ्जलिः greeting with folded palms, तदा then, रामम् to Rama, अब्रवीच्च spoke, न्यासम् held in trust, ते to you, सकलम् everything, एतत् this, राज्यम् kingdom, मया by me, निर्यातितम् returned

data.v: अद्य जन्म कृतार्थं मे संवृत्तश्च मनोरथः । यस्त्वां पश्यामि राजानमयोध्यां पुनरागतम् ।।
data.es: Today my life is fulfilled, my wish is completed. I am seeing you returned to Ayodhya again as king of this kingdom.
data.anv: अद्य today, मे I, जन्म life, कृतार्थम् fulfilled, मनोरथः च my wish, सम्वृत्तः completed, यत् that, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, पुनः again, आगतम् have returned, त्वाम् you, राजानम् kingdom, पश्यामि seeing
data.md: This all your kingdom, which you did leave to my care, I return you. Blessed is my birth today and accomplished is my desire, since I behold you again as king in Ayodhyā after your return.

data.v: अवेक्षतां भवान्कोशं कोष्ठागारं पुरं बलम् । भवतस्तेजसा सर्वं कृतं दशगुणं मया ।।
data.es: You may review your treasury, granary, palaces, army. Everything has increased tenfold by me by virtue of your brilliance.
data.anv: भवान् you, कोशम् treasury, कोष्ठागारम् granary, गृहम् palaces, बलम् army, अवेक्षताम् may see, भवतः by your, तेजसा brilliance, मया by me, सर्वम् all, दशगुणम् tenfold, कृतम् done
data.md: Do you examine your wealth treasury, palace and army. By your favour I have increased all these ten fold.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणं भरतं दृष्ट्वा तं भ्रातृवत्सलम् । मुमुचुर्वानरा बाष्पं राक्षसश्च विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Seeing Bharata, the lover of his brother, who spoke like that, the Vanaras, Rakshasas, and Vibheeshana shed tears.
data.anv: तथा so also, ब्रुवाणम् spoke, भ्रातृवत्सलम् lover of brother, तंभरतम् that Bharata, दृष्टवा seeing, वानराः Vanaras, बाष्पम् tears, मुमुचुः shed, राक्षसः Rakshasa, विभीषणं च Vibheeshana also
data.md: Hearing Bharata speak in that wise and beholding him devoted to his brother all the monkeys and the Rākşasa Vibhîşana shed tears.

data.v: ततः प्रहर्षाद्भरतमङ्कमारोप्य राघवः । ययौ तेन विमानेन ससैन्यो भरताश्रमम् ।।
data.es: Then rejoiced Raghava took Bharata on his lap and flew to Bharata's hermitage with the army.
data.anv: ततः then, राघवः Raghava, प्रहर्षात् rejoiced, भरतम् Bharata, अङ्कम् thigh, आरोप्य lifted up, ससैन्यः that army, भरताश्रमम् from Bharata's hermitage, ययौ flew
data.md: Thereupon placing Bharata, in delight, on his lap, Raghava, with his army in that car, proceeded towards Bharata's abode.

data.v: भरताश्रममासाद्य ससैन्यो राघवस्तदा । अवतीर्य विमानाग्रादवतस्थे महीतले ।।
data.es: Raghava alighted from the top of the Pushpaka on reaching the hermitage of Bharata and stood on ground.
data.anv: तदा then, राघवः Raghava, भरताश्रमम् Bharata's hermitage, आसाद्य alighted, ससैन्यः that army, विमानाग्रात् top of Pushpaka, अवतीर्य landed, महीतले on ground, अवतस्थे stood
data.md: That time reaching Bharata's palace Räghava from the top of the aerial car with his army descended upon the earth.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च तदा रामस्तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् । वह वैश्रवणं देवमनुजानामि गम्यताम् ।।
data.es: Then Rama told Pushpaka that he was permitted to go to God Vysravana.
data.anv: तदा then, रामः Rama, अनुत्तमम् best, तत् that, विमानम् Pushpaka, अब्रवीत् told, देवम् god, वैश्रवणम् Vysravana, वह there अनुजानामि permit, गम्यताम् to go
data.md: Thereupon Rāma said to the excellent car, Do you (now) go to Vaisravana, I do permit you.

data.v: ततो रामाभ्यनुज्ञातं तद्विमानमनुत्तमम् । उत्तरां दिशमुद्दिश्य जगाम धनदालयम् ।।
data.es: Then that excellent Pushpaka which had pictures of swans on it came down to the ground with Rama's permission.
data.anv: ततः then, अनुत्तमम् excellent, हंसयुक्तम् with pictures of swan, महावेगम् high speed, तत् that विमानम् aerial car, रामाभ्यनुज्ञातम् Rama's permission, महीतले on the ground, निपपात came down
data.md: Commanded by Rāma that excellent car drawn by ganders got down on the earth with great velocity.

data.v: पुरोहितस्यात्मसमस्य राघवो; बृहस्पतेः शक्र इवामराधिपः । निपीड्य पादौ पृथगासने शुभे; सहैव तेनोपविवेश वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: And touching the feet of his priest the powerful Rāghava sat on a separate and excellent seat like to Sakra, the lord of immortals (by the side of) Brhaspati.

data.v: शिरस्यञ्जलिमादाय कैकेयीनन्दिवर्धनः । बभाषे भरतो ज्येष्ठं रामं सत्यपराक्रमम् ।।
data.es: Bharata, the enhancer of Kaikeyi's joy, of unfailing valour, with folded palms on head submitted to his elder brother.
data.anv: कैकेय्यानन्दवर्धनः enhancer of Kaikeyi's joy, भरतः Bharata, शिरसि head, अञ्जलिम् folded hands, आधाय submitted, सत्यपराक्रमम् unfailing valour, ज्येष्ठम् to elder, रामम् Rama, बभाषे spoke
data.md: Thereupon having placed her palms on his head Bharata, the enhancer of Kaikeyi's joy spoke to his elder brother Rāma, having truth for his prowess, saying.

data.v: पूजिता मामिका माता दत्तं राज्यमिदं मम । तद्ददामि पुनस्तुभ्यं यथा त्वमददा मम ।।
data.es: "This kingdom was bestowed on me and my mother. I return it back to you now again."
data.anv: मामिका mine, माता mother, पूजिता worshipped, इदंराज्यम् this kingdom, मम myself, दत्तम् bestowed, तत् that, त्वम् to you, मम me, यथा as it is, आददाः returning, पुनः again, तुभ्यम् and now, ददामि giving
data.md: Abiding by my mother's request you did confer this kingdom upon me; I do return you the kingdom you did give me.

data.v: धुरमेकाकिना न्यस्तामृषभेण बलीयसा । किशोरवद्गुरुं भारं न वोढुमहमुत्सहे ।।
data.es: "I am not able to bear the heavy burden transferred to me any more like a young ox can't bear like a bull.
data.anv: बलीयसा strong, एकाकिना alone, वृषभेण young ox, न्यस्ताम् transferred to, धुरम् burden, किशोरवत् like young, गुरुम् heavy, भारम् burden, अहम् I, वोढुम् bull, न उत्सहे not able to bear
data.md: Like to a young one unable to carry a heavy burden thrown off by a powerful bull I am unable to carry this huge burden of the kingdom).

data.v: वारिवेगेन महता भिन्नः सेतुरिव क्षरन् । दुर्बन्धनमिदं मन्ये राज्यच्छिद्रमसंवृतम् ।।
data.es: "If the kingdom containing vulnerable points is not protected on all sides, it can't stand, just as a strong rush of water can be prevented from breach only by constructing a dam.
data.anv: महता great, वारिवेगेन strong rush of water, भिन्नः breached, क्षरन् have no effect, सेतुरिव like dam, इदम् this, राज्यच्छ्रिदम् kingdom containing vulnerable points, असम्वृतम् not protected well, दुर्बन्धम् difficult, मन्ये I think
data.md: I do consider this kingdom infested with thieves, difficult to govern, as it is difficult to reconstruct a bridge broken down by a powerful current of water.

data.v: गतिं खर इवाश्वस्य हंसस्येव च वायसः । नान्वेतुमुत्सहे देव तव मार्गमरिंदम ।।
data.es: "O Rama! Donkey can't run like horse crow can't run like swan. I am not able to bear the burden of kingdom like you, O tormentor of enemies."
data.anv: खरइवा like donkey, गतिं not go, श्वस्य horse, हंसस्येव च and like swan च वायसः crow not run, अरिन्दम tormentor of enemies, तव your, मार्गम् way, अन्वेतुम्, राम Rama, न उत्सहे not able to नान्वेतु like you
data.md: As an ass cannot follow the course of a horse and a crow cannot follow that of a gander, so I am unable, O hero, O slayer of foes, to follow your footsteps.

data.v: यथा च रोपितो वृक्षो जातश्चान्तर्निवेशने । महांश्च सुदुरारोहो महास्कन्धः प्रशाखवान् ।।
शीर्येत पुष्पितो भूत्वा न फलानि प्रदर्शयेत् । तस्य नानुभवेदर्थं यस्य हेतोः स रोप्यते ।।
एषोपमा महाबाहो त्वमर्थं वेत्तुमर्हसि । यद्यस्मान्मनुजेन्द्र त्वं भक्तान्भृत्यान्न शाधि हि ।।
जगदद्याभिषिक्तं त्वामनुपश्यतु सर्वतः । प्रतपन्तमिवादित्यं मध्याह्ने दीप्ततेजसं ।।
data.es: "Raghava, let you be consecrated in the afternoon and the world will see you dazzling in brilliance like the sun today."
data.anv: राघव Raghava, जगत् world, अद्य today, अभिषिक्तम् consecration, त्वाम् you, मध्याह्ने in the afternoon, प्रतपन्तम् dazzling, दीप्ततेजसम् in brilliance, आदित्यमिव like the sun, अनुपश्यतु see you
data.md: Let the world, O Raghava, behold you installed (today) liku to the powerful midday Sun burning in effulgence.

data.v: तूर्यसंघातनिर्घोषैः काञ्चीनूपुरनिस्वनैः । मधुरैर्गीतशब्दैश्च प्रतिबुध्यस्व शेष्व च ।।
data.es: May you wake up to the sounds of musical instruments and the tinkling of ornaments worn around the waist and anklets and sweet sounds of singing.
data.anv: तूर्यसङ्घान्तिर्घोषैः sounds of musical instruments, काञ्चीनूपुरनिःस्वनैः tinkling of ornaments strung with tiny bells, मधुरैः sweet, गीतशब्दैश्च sounds of singing, प्रतिबुध्यस्व worn around waist and anklets, शेष्व च and sweet
data.md: Do you sleep and rise up with the sound of stringed instruments, women's girdles and Nupuras and charming songs.

data.v: यावदावर्तते चक्रं यावती च वसुंधरा । तावत्त्वमिह सर्वस्य स्वामित्वमभिवर्तय ।।
data.es: As long as the stellar sphere goes round, and as long as the earth revolves around that long you enjoy the rulership of the world."
data.anv: चक्रम् stellar sphere, यावत् as long as, आवर्तते goes round, वसुन्धरा earth, यावत् that long, तावत् till then, इह here, लोकस्य in the world, स्वामित्वम् rulership, अनुवर्तय revolves
data.md: Do you govern the people as long as the solar system exists and as far as the earth extends.

data.v: भरतस्य वचः श्रुत्वा रामः परपुरंजयः । तथेति प्रतिजग्राह निषसादासने शुभे ।।
data.es: Hearing Bharata's words, the conqueror of enemies, Rama said 'Be it so'. Then Bharata took the auspicious seat.
data.anv: परपुरञ्जयः conqueror of enemies, रामः Rama, भरतस्य Bharata's, वचः words, श्रुत्वा hearing, तथेति be it so, प्रतिजग्राह replied, शुभे auspicious, आसने seat, निषषाद seated
data.md: Hearing the words of Bharata, Rāma the conqueror of enemies cities, saying, “So be it" sat on an excellent seat.

data.v: ततः शत्रुघ्नवचनान्निपुणाः श्मश्रुवर्धकाः । सुखहस्ताः सुशीघ्राश्च राघवं पर्युपासत ।।
data.es: Then at the command of Shatrughna's words, experts with hand work (barbers) who had soft skills quickly surrounded Raghava.
data.anv: ततः then, शत्रुघ्नवचनात् Shatrughna's words, निपुणाः expert, सुखहस्ताः skilled at hand, सुशीघ्राश्च hastily, श्मश्रुवर्धनाः soft skilled, राघवम् Raghava, पर्यवारयन् surrounded
data.md: Thereupon at the command of Satrughna, expert, skilful and quick-handed barbers gathered round Rāghava.

data.v: पूर्वं तु भरते स्नाते लक्ष्मणे च महाबले । सुग्रीवे वानरेन्द्रे च राक्षसेन्द्रे विभीषणे ।।
data.es: Bharata had his bath first, and mighty Lakshmana, Sugriva the monkey king, and Vibheeshana the Rakshasa king followed him. Sri Rama removed the matted hair, had bath, adorned with colourful garlands, and daubed with sandal paste and clothed in exquisite robes stood glowing and shining.
data.anv: पूर्वम् first, भरते Bharata, स्नाते had bath, महाबले mighty, लक्ष्मणे च Lakshmana also, वानरेन्द्रे Vanara king, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, राक्षसेन्द्रे Rakshasa king, विभीषणे Vibheeshana, विशोधितजटः removed the matted hair, स्नातः had bath, चित्रमाल्यानुलेपनः adorned with colourful garlands and daubed with sandal paste, महार्हवसनोपेतः clothed in exquisite robes, तत्र then, श्रिया shining, ज्वलन् glowing, तस्थौ stood
data.md: At first, Bharata, the highly powerful Laks maņa, Sugrīva the lord of monkeys, and Vibhīs aņa the lord of Rākşasas bathed. Thereupon shorn of his matted hairs, bathed, with paste excellent garlands and precious clothes on, he appeared there shining in grace.

data.v: विशोधितजटः स्नातश्चित्रमाल्यानुलेपनः । महार्हवसनोपेतस्तस्थौ तत्र श्रिया ज्वलन् ।।
data.es: Bharata had his bath first, and mighty Lakshmana, Sugriva the monkey king, and Vibheeshana the Rakshasa king followed him. Sri Rama removed the matted hair, had bath, adorned with colourful garlands, and daubed with sandal paste and clothed in exquisite robes stood glowing and shining.
data.anv: पूर्वम् first, भरते Bharata, स्नाते had bath, महाबले mighty, लक्ष्मणे च Lakshmana also, वानरेन्द्रे Vanara king, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, राक्षसेन्द्रे Rakshasa king, विभीषणे Vibheeshana, विशोधितजटः removed the matted hair, स्नातः had bath, चित्रमाल्यानुलेपनः adorned with colourful garlands and daubed with sandal paste, महार्हवसनोपेतः clothed in exquisite robes, तत्र then, श्रिया shining, ज्वलन् glowing, तस्थौ stood
data.md: At first, Bharata, the highly powerful Laks maņa, Sugrīva the lord of monkeys, and Vibhīs aņa the lord of Rākşasas bathed. Thereupon shorn of his matted hairs, bathed, with paste excellent garlands and precious clothes on, he appeared there shining in grace.

data.v: प्रतिकर्म च रामस्य कारयामास वीर्यवान् । लक्ष्मणस्य च लक्ष्मीवानिक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धनः ।।
data.es: Then valiant and prosperous, Shatrughna, who is an enhancer of the glory of Ikshvaku race decorated Sri Rama and Lakshmana (duly with ornaments).
data.anv: वीर्यवान् valiant, लक्ष्मीवान् prosperous, इक्ष्वाकुकुलवर्धनः enhancer of the glory of Ikshvaku race, रामस्य Rama's, लक्ष्मणस्य च and Lakshmana's, प्रतिकर्म decorated, कारयामास did
data.md: The valiant and graceful Śatrughna the upholder of the dignity of Ikşvāku race, himself got ready the dresses for Rāma and Lakşmaņa.

data.v: प्रतिकर्म च सीतायाः सर्वा दशरथस्त्रियः । आत्मनैव तदा चक्रुर्मनस्विन्यो मनोहरम् ।।
data.es: Then all the nobleminded Dasharatha's wives themselves decorated Sita beautifully.
data.anv: तदा then, सर्वाः all, मनस्विन्यः nobleminded, दशरथस्त्रियः Dasharatha's wives, सीतायाः for Sita, मनोहरम् beautiful, प्रतिकर्म decoration, आत्मनैव themselves, चक्रुः did
data.md: All the high-minded wives of Dasaratha with their own hands decked Sītă with various charming (ornaments).

data.v: ततो राघवपत्नीनां सर्वासामेव शोभनम् । चकार यत्नात्कौसल्या प्रहृष्टा पुत्रवत्सला ।।
data.es: The very delighted Kausalya, lover of her sons started making effort to decorate the wives of all Vanaras in a splendid manner.
data.anv: ततः then, प्रहृष्टाः very delighted, पुत्रवत्सला lover of her sons, कौसल्या Kausalya, सर्वासाम् all, वानरपत्नीनाम् for the wives of Vanaras, यत्नात् took effort, शोभनम् in splendid manner to decorate, चकार started
data.md: Thereupon Kausalyā, delighted and fond of her son, herself with great care, decorated the wives of monkeys.

data.v: ततः शत्रुघ्नवचनात्सुमन्त्रो नाम सारथिः । योजयित्वाभिचक्राम रथं सर्वाङ्गशोभनम् ।।
data.es: Then Sumantra the charioteer, commanded by Shatrughna came there with all parts of the chariot decorated and yoked.
data.anv: ततः then, सुमन्त्रोनाम named Sumantra, सारथिःcharioteer, शत्रुघ्नवचनात् by the command of Shatrughna, सर्वाङ्गशोभनम् all parts of the body, रथम् chariot, योजयित्वा yoked, अभिचक्राम came there
data.md: Thereupon at the words of ſatrughna, the charioteer by name Sumantra got ready the perfectly beautiful car.

data.v: अर्कमण्डलसंकाशं दिव्यं दृष्ट्वा रथं स्थितम् । आरुरोह महाबाहू रामः सत्यपराक्रमः ।।
data.es: Seeing the wonderful chariot like the radiance of the planet sun, mighty armed Rama the conqueror of hostile enemies ascended.
data.anv: अर्कमण्डलसङ्काशम् like the radiance of the planet sun, स्थितम् stood, दिव्यम् wonderful, रथम् chariot, दृष्टवा seeing, महाबाहुः mighty armed, परपुरंञ्जयः the conqueror of hostile enemies, रामः Rama, आरुरोह ascended
data.md: Beholding that celestial car, bright as the fire of the sun, stationed before him, Rama, having long arms, the conqueror of enemies cities, ascended it.

data.v: अयोध्यायां तु सचिवा राज्ञो दशरथस्य ये । पुरोहितं पुरस्कृत्य मन्त्रयामासुरर्थवत् ।।
data.es: At Ayodhya also, king Dasharatha's ministers, priests started to Vasishta and thought of the required arrangements.
data.anv: अयोध्यायातु at Ayodhya also राज्ञः king, दशरथस्य Dasharatha's, सचिवाः ministers, पुरोहितम् priests, पुरस्कृत्य started, अर्थवत् to Vasishta, मन्त्रयामासुः thought of the required arrangements
data.md: All the ministers of king Dasaratha in Ayodhyā began to hold consultation respectfully with the priest.

data.v: मन्त्रयन्रामवृद्ध्यर्थं वृत्त्यर्थं नगरस्य च । सर्वमेवाभिषेकार्थं जयार्हस्य महात्मनः । कर्तुमर्हथ रामस्य यद्यन्मङ्गलपूर्वकम् ।।
data.es: For the success of the great soul Rama's consecration, whatever was auspicious, all that ought to be done as he deserves.
data.anv: जयार्हस्य for the success, महात्मनः of great soul, रामस्य Rama's, अभिषेकार्थम् for the consecration, यद्यत् Whatever, सर्वम् all, मङ्गलपूर्वकम् auspicious, कर्तुम् to do, अर्हथ who deserves
data.md: (Thereupon they ordered the servants) saying, Do you collect materials necessary for the auspicious installation of the high-souled (Rama) worthy of being crowned with victory.

data.v: इति ते मन्त्रिणः सर्वे संदिश्य तु पुरोहितम् । नगरान्निर्ययुस्तूर्णं रामदर्शनबुद्धयः ।।
data.es: All those ministers, priests thus communicating with each other, speedily set forth to have a glance at Sri Rama.
data.anv: ते they, सर्वे all, मत्रनिणःministers, पुरोहितम् priests, इति thus, सन्दिश्य communicating, रामदर्शनबुद्धयः for having a glance of Rama, तूर्णम् speedily, नगरात् from the city, निर्ययुः set forth
data.md: The priest and the ministers having ordered thus all speedily issued out of the city to behold Rama.

data.v: हरियुक्तं सहस्राक्षो रथमिन्द्र इवानघः । प्रययौ रथमास्थाय रामो नगरमुत्तमम् ।।
data.es: Like the thousand eyed Indra seated in the excellent chariot yoked to green horses, the sinless Rama departed to the city.
data.anv: सहस्राक्षः thousand eyed, इन्द्रः Indra, हरियुक्तम् green horses, रथमिव chariot like, अनघः sinless, रामः Rama, उत्तमम् excellent, रथम् chariot, आस्थाय seated, नगरम् to the city, प्रययौ departed
data.md: Like to the thousand-eyed Indra in his car, drawn by horses the blameless Rāma; seated in his car, proceeded towards the excellent city.

data.v: जग्राह भरतो रश्मीञ्शत्रुघ्नश्छत्रमाददे । लक्ष्मणो व्यजनं तस्य मूर्ध्नि संपर्यवीजयत् ।।
data.es: Bharata held the reins, Shatrughna took hold of the parasol, Lakshmana standing in front held the fan, and the Rakshasa king Vibheeshana held a white whisk which was like a moon for driving the air.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, रमशीन् reins, जग्राह took hold, शत्रुघ्नः Shatrughna, छत्रम् parasol, तस्य his, मूर्ध्नि in front, आददे took, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, व्यजनम् fan, सम्पर्यवीजयत् for fanning, परितः held, स्थितः stood, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, चन्द्रसङ्काशम् like the moon, श्वेतम् white, अपरम् whisk, वालव्यजनम् for driving the air, जगृहे took hold
data.md: Bharata took up the reins, ſatrughna held the umbrella and Lakşmaņa began to fan him on the head with Chowries.

data.v: श्वेतं च वालव्यजनं सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः । अपरं चन्द्रसंकाशं राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Shatrughna held white auspicious parasol, Sugriva the Vanara Lord held a white whisk, Vibheeshana the Lord of Rakshasas held a white whisk shining like the moon.
data.anv: शत्रुघ्नः Shatrughna, तस्य his, पाण्डुरम् white, शुभम् auspicious, छत्रम् parasol, जग्राह held, वानरेश्वरः Vanara Lord, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, श्वेतम् white, वालव्यजनम् whisk, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, चन्द्रसङ्काशम् shining like moon, अपरंच white whisk
data.md: Vibhīşaņa, the lord of Rākşasas standing on one side, took up the white Chowrie shining like the second moon.

data.v: ऋषिसंघैर्तदाकाशे देवैश्च समरुद्गणैः । स्तूयमानस्य रामस्य शुश्रुवे मधुरध्वनिः ।।
data.es: Then the host of sages, Rudras and gods from the heaven started praising Rama with sweet sounding chanting.
data.anv: तदा then, रामस्य Rama's, ऋषिसङ्घैः host of sages, समरुद्गणैः Rudras, देवैश्च gods, आकाशे in the sky, स्तूयमानस्य started praising, मधुरध्वनिः sweet sounding, शुश्रुवे heard.
data.md: There was audible the sweet encomium of Rāma chanted by the crowd of ascetics in the sky, the celestials and the Marutas.

data.v: ततः शत्रुंजयं नाम कुञ्जरं पर्वतोपमम् । आरुरोह महातेजाः सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः ।।
data.es: Then resplendent Sugriva, the bull among Vanaras, ascended the mountain like elephant by the name Satrumjaya.
data.anv: ततः then, प्लवगर्षभः bull among monkeys, महातेजाः resplendent, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, शत्रुञ्जयंनाम Satrumjaya by name, पर्वतोपमम् like a mountain, कुञ्जरम् elephant, आरुरोह ascended
data.md: Thereupon the highly effulgent Sugrīva, the foremost of monkeys, got up upon an elephant named Śatruñjaya resembling a mountain.

data.v: नवनागसहस्राणि ययुरास्थाय वानराः । मानुषं विग्रहं कृत्वा सर्वाभरणभूषिताः ।।
data.es: Assuming human semblance, the Vanaras adorned with ornaments ascended nine thousand elephants and departed.
data.anv: वानराः Vanara, मानुषम् human, विग्रहम् semblance, कृत्वा assuming, सर्वाभरणभूषिताः adorned with ornaments, नवनागसहस्राणि nine thousand elephants, आस्थाय ascended, ययुः departed
data.md: And riding nine thousand elephants proceeded the monkeys assuming human shapes and adorned with various ornaments.

data.v: शङ्खशब्दप्रणादैश्च दुन्दुभीनां च निस्वनैः । प्रययू पुरुषव्याघ्रस्तां पुरीं हर्म्यमालिनीम् ।।
data.es: Sri Rama the tiger among men went accompanied by sounds of blasts of conches and shouts and roll of drums along the rows of mansions in the city.
data.anv: पुरुषव्याघ्रः tiger among men, शङ्खशब्दप्रणादैश्च sound of blasts of conches and shouts, दुन्दुभीनाम् roll of drums, निःस्वनैः च making noise, हर्म्यमालिनीम् rows of mansions, तांपुरीम् that city, प्रययौ went
data.md: And with the music of conches and bugles that foremost of men entered the city abounding in houses.

data.v: ददृशुस्ते समायान्तं राघवं सपुरःसरम् । विराजमानं वपुषा रथेनातिरथं तदा ।।
data.es: Then they saw all those who had gone to Ayodhya coming in advance in accordance with tradition, to receive Rama, the great car warrior, who was shining brightly advancing by the chariot.
data.anv: तदा then, ते they, सपुरःसरम् having gone to Ayodhya, वपुषा god, विराजमानम् shining brightly, रथेन by chariot, समायान्तम् coming with all in accordance with tradition, अतिरथम् great car warrior, राघवम् Raghava, ददृशुः saw
data.md: They (citizens) beheld Raghava enter the city with a graceful person and seated in the car.

data.v: ते वर्धयित्वा काकुत्स्थं रामेण प्रतिनन्दिताः । अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं भ्रातृभिः परिवारितम् ।।
data.es: They were blessing Sri Rama in turn and Rama responded to them very happily. Surrounded by brothers and all followed Rama the great soul.
data.anv: ते they, काकुत्स्थम् Kakuthsa, वर्धयित्वाblessing, रामेण Rama, प्रतिनन्दिताः in turn very happily responded, भ्रातृभिः brothers also, परिवारितम् surrounded, महात्मानम् great, अनुजग्मुःfollowed
data.md: They having bowed to that descendant of Kākutstha were welcomed by him. And they followed that high souled one encircled by his brothers.

data.v: अमात्यैर्ब्राह्मणैश्चैव तथा प्रकृतिभिर्वृतः । श्रिया विरुरुचे रामो नक्षत्रैरिव चन्द्रमाः ।।
data.es: Surrounded by ministers, brahmins and common people, glorious Rama shone brightly like the moon surrounded by stars.
data.anv: अमात्यैः ministers, ब्राह्मणैश्चैव brahmins, तथा so also, प्रकृतिभिः common people, वृतः surrounded, रामः Rama, नक्षत्रैः star, चन्द्रमाःइव like moon, श्रिया glorious, विरुरुचे shone brightly.
data.md: And surrounded by his courtiers, Brāhmaṇas and subjects Rāma appeared beautiful like to the Moon encircled by stars.

data.v: स पुरोगामिभिस्तूर्यैस्तालस्वस्तिकपाणिभिः । प्रव्याहरद्भिर्मुदितैर्मङ्गलानि ययौ वृतः ।।
data.es: He went forward surrounded by bands, trumpets, wooden cymbals and swastikas and very happily singing auspicious festive songs.
data.anv: सः he, पुरोगामिभिः went forward, तूर्यैः bands, तालस्वस्तिकपाणिभिः with trumpets, wooden cymbals and swastikas, मङ्गलानि auspicious, प्रव्याहरद्भिः singing festive songs, मुदितैः very happily, वृतः covered, ययौ went
data.md: He went preceded by men who play on stringed instruments, by people with Karatal and Sustika in their hands and by men chanting delightedly auspicious songs.

data.v: अक्षतं जातरूपं च गावः कन्यास्तथा द्विजाः । नरा मोदकहस्ताश्च रामस्य पुरतो ययुः ।।
data.es: Taking yellow rice (rice smeared with turmeric) appearing like gold, cows, virgin women, brahmins with Modakas in hand went before Rama.
data.anv: अक्षतम् yellow rice जातरूपं च appearing like gold, गावः cows, कन्याः virgin women, सहद्विजाः with brahmins, मोदकहस्ताः with Modakas in hand, नराः men, रामस्य Rama's, पुरतः before, ययुः went
data.md: Persons with Aksata and gold in their hands, kine, girls, Brāhmaṇas and persons with Modaka in their hands went before Rāma.

data.v: सख्यं च रामः सुग्रीवे प्रभावं चानिलात्मजे । वानराणां च तत्कर्म व्याचचक्षेऽथ मन्त्रिणाम् । श्रुत्वा च विस्मयं जग्मुरयोध्यापुरवासिनः ।।
data.es: Rama narrated about his friendship with Sugriva and the distinct performance of Hanuman and Vanaras to the ministers.
data.anv: अथ and then, रामः Rama, सुग्रीवे Sugriva, सख्यं च friendship, अनिलात्मजे of the son of wind god, प्रभावं च distinct performance, वानराणाम् Vanaras, तत् that, कर्म च actions, मन्त्रिणाम् to ministers, आचचक्षे narrated
data.md: Thereupon before the ministers Rāma began to describe the friendship of Sugrīva, the prowess of the Wind-gods son and the works accomplished by the monkeys.

data.v: द्युतिमानेतदाख्याय रामो वानरसंवृतः । हृष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णामयोध्यां प्रविवेश ह ।।
data.es: Sri Rama narrated about Vibheeshana's friendship to the ministers. Splendorous Rama then entered Ayodhya filled with very happy people accompanied by Vanaras.
data.anv: अथ and then, मन्त्रिणाम् ministers, विभीषणस्य Vibheeshana, संयोगम् friendship, आचचक्षे narrated, द्युतिमान् splendorous, सः he, रामःRama, एतत् all that, आख्याय told, वानरसंयुतः accompanied by Vanaras, हृष्टपुष्टजनाकीर्णाम् very happy filled with people, अयोध्याम् Ayodhya, प्रविवेश entered
data.md: Having related thus (the works of the monkeys) the graceful Rāma encircled by the monkeys entered (the city of) Ayodhya abounding in delighted and plump persons.

data.v: ततो ह्यभ्युच्छ्रयन्पौराः पताकास्ते गृहे गृहे । ऐक्ष्वाकाध्युषितं रम्यमाससाद पितुर्गृहम् ।।
data.es: The citizens of Ayodhya held the flags up in every house. Thereupon Rama reached the beautiful home of his father, the abode of the Ikshvaku dynasty.
data.anv: ततः thereupon, पौराः citizens, गृहेगृहे every house, पताकाः flag, अभ्युच्छ्रयन् lifted up and held, ऐक्ष्वाकाध्युषितम् abode of Ikshvaku dynasty, पितुः father, रम्यम् beautiful, गृहम् home, आससाद reached.
data.md: Thereupon the citizens hoisted up flags upon every house and he reached the picturesque abode of his ancestors inhabited by the descendants of Ikşvāku.

data.v: पितुर्भवनमासाद्य प्रविश्य च महात्मनः । कौसल्यां च सुमित्रां च कैकेयीं चाभ्यवादयत् ।।
data.es: And thereafter prince Rama, the joy of Raghus, the great soul reached father's mansion and then to Kausalya's and to Sumitra, to Kaikeyi and greeted them. He then spoke meaningful words to virtuous Bharata in a sweet tone.
data.anv: अथ and then, राजपुत्रः prince, रघुनन्दनः the joy of Raghus, महात्मनः great soul, पितुः father, भवनम् mansion, आसाद्य reached, कौसल्यां च and Kausalya's, सुमित्रां च and Sumitra's, कैकेयीं च and Kaikeyi's, अभिवाद्य च greeted them, धर्मिणाम् virtuous, परम् supreme, भरतम् Bharata, अर्थोपहितया meaningful, वाचा words, मधुरम् sweet tone, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Having reached and entered his ancestral palace and bowed to Kausalyä, Sumitra and Kaikeyī, the high-souled prince, the enhancer of the joy of the descendants of Raghu, addressed Bharata the foremost of the pious, with sweet words instinct with meaning, saying.

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्राजपुत्रो भरतं धर्मिणां वरम् । अथोपहितया वाचा मधुरं रघुनन्दनः ।।
data.es: And thereafter prince Rama, the joy of Raghus, the great soul reached father's mansion and then to Kausalya's and to Sumitra, to Kaikeyi and greeted them. He then spoke meaningful words to virtuous Bharata in a sweet tone.
data.anv: अथ and then, राजपुत्रः prince, रघुनन्दनः the joy of Raghus, महात्मनः great soul, पितुः father, भवनम् mansion, आसाद्य reached, कौसल्यां च and Kausalya's, सुमित्रां च and Sumitra's, कैकेयीं च and Kaikeyi's, अभिवाद्य च greeted them, धर्मिणाम् virtuous, परम् supreme, भरतम् Bharata, अर्थोपहितया meaningful, वाचा words, मधुरम् sweet tone, अब्रवीत् spoke
data.md: Having reached and entered his ancestral palace and bowed to Kausalyä, Sumitra and Kaikeyī, the high-souled prince, the enhancer of the joy of the descendants of Raghu, addressed Bharata the foremost of the pious, with sweet words instinct with meaning, saying.

data.v: यच्च मद्भवनं श्रेष्ठं साशोकवनिकं महत् । मुक्तावैदूर्यसंकीर्णं सुग्रीवस्य निवेदय ।।
data.es: Let the splendid, excellent mansion attached to Ashoka grove, encrusted with cat's eye gems and pearls be placed at the disposal of Sugriva.
data.anv: श्रेष्टं splendid, साशोकवनिकम् palace with Ashoka grove, मुक्तावैदूर्यसङ्कीर्णम् encrusted with pearls cat's eye gems, महत् excellent, तत् that, मद्भवनम् that mansion, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, निवेदय be place at his disposal
data.md: Kākutstha, living in the forest of Dandaka with bark and matted hairs, for whom you are lamenting, has, “Do you set apart for Sugrīva my huge and excellent palace abounding in pearls and Vaiduryas."

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा भरतः सत्यविक्रमः । पाणौ गृहीत्वा सुग्रीवं प्रविवेश तमालयम् ।।
data.es: Then that upright Bharata hearing the words of Rama taking the hand of Sugriva led him to that temple like abode.
data.anv: ततः then, सत्यविक्रमःupright, भरतःBharata, तस्य his, तत् वचनम् that words, श्रुत्वा hearing, सुग्रीवम् to Sugriva, हस्ते hand, गृहीत्वा taking, तम् to him आलयम् that temple like abode, प्रविवेश entered
data.md: Hearing those words, Bharata, having truth for his prowess, taking Sugrīva by the hand, conducted him to the palace.

data.v: ततस्तैलप्रदीपांश्च पर्यङ्कास्तरणानि च । गृहीत्वा विविशुः क्षिप्रं शत्रुघ्नेन प्रचोदिताः ।।
data.es: Then as commanded by Shatrughna, people taking glowing oil lamps and coverlets for the couches quickly entered the palace.
data.anv: ततः then, शत्रुघ्नेन by Shatrughna, प्रचोदिताः commanded, तैलप्रदीप्तांश्च glowing oil lamps, पर्यङ्कास्तरणानि च coverlets for the couches, गृहीत्वा taking, क्षिप्रम् quickly, विविशुःentered
data.md: And commanded by Śatrughna, (servants) speedily entered (that palace) with oil, lamps, bedsteads and beddings.

data.v: उवाच च महातेजाः सुग्रीवं राघवानुजः । अभिषेकाय रामस्य दूतानाज्ञापय प्रभो ।।
data.es: Highly brilliant Sugriva said to Bharata, "Let envoys be sent for the consecration of Rama."
data.anv: महातेजाः highly brilliant, राघवानुजःRaghava's brother, सुग्रीवम् Sugriva, उवाच च spoke, प्रभोking, रामस्य Rama's, अभिषेकाय for the consecration, दूतान्envoys, आज्ञापयmay be ordered
data.md: Thereupon the highly effulgent younger brother of Raghava spoke to Sugriva, saying, "Do you, O lord, order some (to bring water) for Rama's installation."

data.v: सौवर्णान्वानरेन्द्राणां चतुर्णां चतुरो घटान् । ददौ क्षिप्रं स सुग्रीवः सर्वरत्नविभूषितान् ।।
data.es: Sugriva instantly gave four golden pots decorated well to the four Vanara leaders.
data.anv: स: he, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, क्षिप्रम् instantly, चतुर्णाम् four, वानरेन्द्राणाम् Vanara leaders, सौवर्णान् golden, सर्वरत्नविभूषितान् well decorated, चतुरः four, घटान् pots, ददौ gave
data.md: Sugrīva conferred upon four leading monkeys four golden jars crested with diverse jewels and said to them.

data.v: यथा प्रत्यूषसमये चतुर्णां सागराम्भसाम् । पूर्णैर्घटैः प्रतीक्षध्वं तथा कुरुत वानराः ।।
data.es: Sugriva gave four pots to the four of the Vanaras to get them filled with the water of the four oceans and get them by early morning and said to await for him.
data.anv: वानराः Vanaras, चतुर्याम् four of them, सागराम्बसाम् waters from the ocean, पूर्णैःfilled, घटैःpots, प्रत्यूषसमये early morning time, यथा so, प्रतीक्षध्वम् wait for me, तथाकुरुतyou do
data.md: "Do you so conduct, O monkeys, that you may return by the dawn with the jars filled with the water of the four oceans."

data.v: एवमुक्ता महात्मानो वानरा वारणोपमाः । उत्पेतुर्गगनं शीघ्रं गरुडा इव शीघ्रगाः ।।
data.es: Having spoken like that by Sugriva, the Vanaras of mountainlike forms fled like Garuda into the sky quickly.
data.anv: एवम् in that way, उक्ताःspoken, वारणोपमाः like mountain in form, गरुडाःइव like Garuda, शीघ्रगाःsped, महात्मानःgreat souls, वानराः Vanaras, शीघ्रम् quickly, गगनम् into the sky, उत्पेतुःrose up
data.md: Being thus addressed by the high-souled (Sugrīva) the monkeys resembling the elephants speedily rose up in the welkin like to quick coursing vultures.

data.v: जाम्बवांश्च हनूमांश्च वेगदर्शी च वानरः । ऋषभश्चैव कलशाञ्जलपूर्णानथानयन् । नदीशतानां पञ्चानां जले कुम्भैरुपाहरन् ।।
data.es: Jambavan, Hanuman, Vegadarsa and Rshaba brought pots of water from the seas. Another five hundred monkeys brought five hundred pots from five hundred rivers of the country. Jambavan richly endowed with courage brought in a pot encrusted with all kinds of gems. Sushena brought water from the eastern sea.
data.anv: जाम्बवांश्च Jambavantha, हनूमांश्च Hanuman, वेगदर्शी Vegadarsa, वानरः Vanara, ऋषभश्चैव Rshaba, कलशा pots, न्जलपूर्णा filled with sea water, नथानयन् different rivers, नदीशतानां a hundred rivers, पञ्चानां five, जलंwater, कुम्भैरुपाहरन् brought in pots, अथ and then, सत्त्वसम्पन्नः richly endowed with courage, सुषेणः Sushena, पूर्वात् eastern समुद्रात् ocean, सर्वरत्नविभूषितम् decorated with all kinds of gems, जलपूर्णम् pot filled with water, कलशम् pot, आनयत् brought
data.md: Jambavan, Hanumān, the monkey Vegadarsi and Rşabha brought the jars filled with water and another monkeys brought the water in jars from five hundred rivers.

data.v: पूर्वात्समुद्रात्कलशं जलपूर्णमथानयत् । सुषेणः सत्त्वसंपन्नः सर्वरत्नविभूषितम् ।।
data.md: Suşeņa, gifted with prowess, brought that jar crested with gems, filled with water from the Eastern Ocean.

data.v: ऋषभो दक्षिणात्तूर्णं समुद्राज्जलमाहरत् ।।
data.es: Rshaba quickly brought water from the southern sea in a golden pot covered with sandal paste.
data.anv: ऋषभः Rshaba, दक्षिणात् समुद्रात् from southern sea, रक्तचन्दनशाखाभिः covered with red sandal paste, संवृतम् covered, काञ्चनम् golden, घटम् pot, जलम् water, तूर्णम् quickly, आनयत् brought

data.v: रक्तचन्दनकर्पूरैः संवृतं काञ्चनं घटम् । गवयः पश्चिमात्तोयमाजहार महार्णवात् ।।
data.md: Rşabha speedily brought water from the southern Ocean. Gavaya brought from the great Western Ocean in that golden jar, water perfumed with the fragrance of red sandal and camphor.

data.v: रत्नकुम्भेन महता शीतं मारुतविक्रमः । उत्तराच्च जलं शीघ्रं गरुडानिलविक्रमः ।।
data.md: The virtuous-souled Wind-gods son, gifted with all accomplishments and the prowess of Garuda and Wind-god, brought, speedily from the Northern Ocean, water in that large jewelled jar.

data.v: अभिषेकाय रामस्य शत्रुघ्नः सचिवैः सह । पुरोहिताय श्रेष्ठाय सुहृद्भ्यश्च न्यवेदयत् ।।
data.es: Then seeing the water brought by the monkeys for Rama's consecration Shatrugna along with ministers placed them at the disposal of the supreme priest along with friends.
data.anv: ततः then, सचिवैःसह along with ministers, शत्रुघ्नः Shatrughna, रामस्य Rama's, अभिषेकाय for the consecration, तैः they, वानरश्रेष्ठैः foremost of Vanaras, आनीतम् brought by, तत् that, जलम् water, श्रेष्ठाय supreme, पुरोहिताय priest, सुहृद्भ्यः च friends, न्यवेदयत् placed
data.md: Beholding water thus brought by the leading monkeys for the installation of Rāma, Satrughna, with his ministers, communicated that to the leading priests and friends.

data.v: ततः स प्रयतो वृद्धो वसिष्ठो ब्राह्मणैः सह । रामं रत्नमयो पीठे सहसीतं न्यवेशयत् ।।
data.es: Then accompanied by brahmins, sage Vasishta, active though aged, asked Sita and Sri Rama to occupy the plank made with full of precious stones.
data.anv: ततः then, ब्राह्मणैःसह with brahmins, वृद्धःaged, वसिष्ठः Vasishta, प्रयतः active, ससीतम् Sita, रामम्Rama, रत्नमये full of precious stones, पीठे plank, सन्नयवेशयत् to take seat.
data.md: Thereupon the self-controlled Vasistha, stricken in years, along with other Brāhmaṇas placed Rāma with Sītā on a jewelled seat.

data.v: वसिष्ठो वामदेवश्च जाबालिरथ काश्यपः । कात्यायनः सुयज्ञश्च गौतमो विजयस्तथा ।।
data.es: Eight sages, Vasishta, Vama Deva, Jabali, Kasyapa, Katyayana, Suyajna, Gautama and Vijaya consecrated Sri Rama, the tiger among men, with pure fragrant waters as the Vasus consecrated the thousand eyed Indra.
data.anv: वसिष्ठः Vasishta, वामदेवश्चजाबालिः VamaDeva, Jabali अथ and, काश्यपः Kasyapa, कात्यायनः Katyayana, सुयज्ञः Suyajna, गौतमः Gautam, तथा so also, विजयः Vijaya, प्रसन्नेन pure, सुगन्धिभा fragrant, सलिलेन waters, वसवः Indra, सहस्राक्षम् thousand eyed, वासवंयथा like Vasus, नरव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, अभ्यषिञ्चन् consecrated

data.v: अभ्यषिञ्चन्नरव्याघ्रं प्रसन्नेन सुगन्धिना । सलिलेन सहस्राक्षं वसवो वासवं यथा ।।
data.es: Eight sages, Vasishta, Vama Deva, Jabali, Kasyapa, Katyayana, Suyajna, Gautama and Vijaya consecrated Sri Rama, the tiger among men, with pure fragrant waters as the Vasus consecrated the thousand eyed Indra.
data.anv: वसिष्ठः Vasishta, वामदेवश्चजाबालिः VamaDeva, Jabali अथ and, काश्यपः Kasyapa, कात्यायनः Katyayana, सुयज्ञः Suyajna, गौतमः Gautam, तथा so also, विजयः Vijaya, प्रसन्नेन pure, सुगन्धिभा fragrant, सलिलेन waters, वसवः Indra, सहस्राक्षम् thousand eyed, वासवंयथा like Vasus, नरव्याघ्रम् tiger among men, अभ्यषिञ्चन् consecrated
data.md: Vasistha, Vijaya, Jabali, Katyayana, Gautama and Vāmadeva, sprinkled that foremost of men, with clear and fragrant water as Vasus did the thousand eyed Vasava.

data.v: ऋत्विग्भिर्ब्राह्मणैः पूर्वं कन्याभिर्मन्त्रिभिस्तथा । योधैश्चैवाभ्यषिञ्चंस्ते संप्रहृष्टाः सनैगमैः ।।
data.es: First by priests, followed by brahmins, virgin women, so also ministers, merchants, warriors consecrated. Those who stood in the sky, the gods, the rulers of the four quarters, and all gods consecrated by sprinkling water containing medicinal herbs. All were very delighted.
data.anv: सम्प्रहृष्टाः very delighted, ते they, पूर्वम् first, ऋत्विग्भि: priests, ब्राह्मणैः brahmins, कन्याभिः virgin women, तथा so also, मन्त्रिभिः ministers, सनैगमैः merchants,, योथौश्च warriors, नभसि in the sky, स्थितैः stood, देवैः gods, चतुर्भिः four, लोकपालैश्च rulers of quarters, सङ्गतैः assembled, सर्वैः all, देवैश्च gods, सर्वौषथरसाश्चैपि all kinds of medicinal herbs, अभ्यषिञ्चन् consecration
data.md: Ministers, soldiers and the merchants all delighted. (Thereupon with the juice of Oshadhis (he was sprinkled by) the celestials stationed in the sky, the deities presiding over four quarters and all other celestials collected.

data.v: सर्वौषधिरसैश्चापि दैवतैर्नभसि स्थितैः । चतुर्हिर्लोकपालैश्च सर्वैर्देवैश्च संगतैः ।।
data.es: First by priests, followed by brahmins, virgin women, so also ministers, merchants, warriors consecrated. Those who stood in the sky, the gods, the rulers of the four quarters, and all gods consecrated by sprinkling water containing medicinal herbs. All were very delighted.
data.anv: सम्प्रहृष्टाः very delighted, ते they, पूर्वम् first, ऋत्विग्भि: priests, ब्राह्मणैः brahmins, कन्याभिः virgin women, तथा so also, मन्त्रिभिः ministers, सनैगमैः merchants,, योथौश्च warriors, नभसि in the sky, स्थितैः stood, देवैः gods, चतुर्भिः four, लोकपालैश्च rulers of quarters, सङ्गतैः assembled, सर्वैः all, देवैश्च gods, सर्वौषथरसाश्चैपि all kinds of medicinal herbs, अभ्यषिञ्चन् consecration

data.v: छत्रं तस्य च जग्राह शत्रुघ्नः पाण्डुरं शुभम् । श्वेतं च वालव्यजनं सुग्रीवो वानरेश्वरः । अपरं चन्द्रसंकाशं राक्षसेन्द्रो विभीषणः ।।
data.es: Bharata held the reins, Shatrughna took hold of the parasol, Lakshmana standing in front held the fan, and the Rakshasa king Vibheeshana held a white whisk which was like a moon for driving the air.
data.anv: भरतः Bharata, रमशीन् reins, जग्राह took hold, शत्रुघ्नः Shatrughna, छत्रम् parasol, तस्य his, मूर्ध्नि in front, आददे took, लक्ष्मणः Lakshmana, व्यजनम् fan, सम्पर्यवीजयत् for fanning, परितः held, स्थितः stood, राक्षसेन्द्रः Rakshasa king, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, चन्द्रसङ्काशम् like the moon, श्वेतम् white, अपरम् whisk, वालव्यजनम् for driving the air, जगृहे took hold
data.md: Śatrughna held the white and excellent umbrella and Sugrīva the lord of monkeys took the white Chowrie. And Vibhīşaņa the lord of Rákşasas took up another Chowrie resembling the moon.

data.v: मालां ज्वलन्तीं वपुषा काञ्चनीं शतपुष्कराम् । राघवाय ददौ वायुर्वासवेन प्रचोदितः ।।
data.es: The WindGod prompted by deity Indra presented a dazzling golden garland of hundred flowers to Raghava.
data.anv: वायुः wind god, वासवेन by Indra, प्रचोदितः prompted, वपुषा deity, ज्वलन्तीम् dazzling, मालां garland, शतपुष्कराम् of a hundred flowers, काञ्चनीम् gold राघवाय to Raghava, ददौ gave
data.md: The wind commanded by Väsava conferred upon Rāghava, a garland or hundred golden lotuses, shining in their native lustre. And the wind commanded by Sakra conferred upon that lord of men a jewelled garland crested with diverse gems.

data.v: सर्वरत्नसमायुक्तं मणिरत्नविभूषितम् । मुक्ताहारं नरेन्द्राय ददौ शक्रप्रचोदितः ।।
data.es: Urged by Indra the wind god gave a dazzling pearls chain intercepted by several kinds of gems and precious stones to the ruler of the world.
data.anv: शक्रप्रचोदितः urged by Indra, सर्वरत्नसमायुत्तम् intercepted by several kinds of gems, मणिभिश्च precious stones, विभूषितम् dazzling, मुक्ताहारम् of pearls, नरेन्द्राय to the ruler of the world, ददौ gave

data.v: प्रजगुर्देवगन्धर्वा ननृतुश्चाप्सरो गणाः । अभिषेके तदर्हस्य तदा रामस्य धीमतः ।।
data.es: The Gandharvas from among the gods sang and Apsara groups danced for Rama's consecration.
data.anv: तदा then, तदर्हस्य, रामस्य Rama's, अभिषेके consecration, देवगन्धर्वाः gods and Gandharvas, प्रजगुः sang, अप्सरोगणाः Apsara groups ननृतुः danced
data.md: The intelligent and worthy Rāma being installed the celestials and the Gandharvas sang and the Apsaras danced.

data.v: भूमिः सस्यवती चैव फलवन्तश्च पादपाः । गन्धवन्ति च पुष्पाणि बभूवू राघवोत्सवे ।।
data.es: At the time of celebration of Rama's coronation, earth became green with crops, trees bore fruits and filled with flowers which spread fragrance.
data.anv: राघवोत्सवे at the celebration of Rama, भूमिः earth, सस्यवती as green with crops, पादपाः trees, फलवन्तश्च filled with fruits, पुष्पाणि flowers, गन्धवन्ति च spread fragrance, बभूवुः became
data.md: The earth was filled with crops, the trees with fruits and the flowers were fragrant on the occassion of Rāghava's installation.

data.v: सहस्रशतमश्वानां धेनूनां च गवां तथा । ददौ शतं वृषान्पूर्वं द्विजेभ्यो मनुजर्षभः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama, the bull among men gave first, a hundred thousand cows with just born calves to hundred thousand brahmins.
data.anv: मनुजर्षभः bull among men, पूर्वम् first, अश्वानाम् horses, सहस्रशतम् hundred thousand, तथा so also, धेनूनाम् calves, गवां च cows that just delivered, शतवृषान् hundred thousand, द्विजेभ्यः brahmins, ददौ gave
data.md: That foremost of men conferred upon the twice-born ones one million of horses, hundred thousand cows and hundred thousand bulls. And Rāghava again conferred upon the Brāhmaṇas thirty crores of golden coins and diverse costly ornaments and clothes.

data.v: त्रिंशत्कोटीर्हिरण्यस्य ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददौ पुनः । नानाभरणवस्त्राणि महार्हाणि च राघवः ।।
data.es: Raghava again gave brahmins thirty crores of golden coins and different kinds of ornaments and clothes.
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, पुनः again, ब्राह्मणेभ्यः brahmins, हिरण्यस्य golden, त्रिशत्कोटीः thirty crores, महार्हाणि excellent, नानाभरणवस्त्राणि different kinds of ornaments and clothes, ददौ gave
data.md: That foremost of men conferred upon the twice-born ones one million of horses, hundred thousand cows and hundred thousand bulls. And Rāghava again conferred upon the Brāhmaṇas thirty crores of golden coins and diverse costly ornaments and clothes.

data.v: अर्करश्मिप्रतीकाशां काञ्चनीं मणिविग्रहाम् । सुग्रीवाय स्रजं दिव्यां प्रायच्छन्मनुजर्षभः ।।
data.es: Sri Rama gave a wonderful golden garland with a stretch of gems tied to it which was dazzling like the sun's rays to Sugriva.
data.anv: मनुजाधिपः Lord of the people, सुग्रीवाय Sugriva, अर्करश्मिप्रतीकाशाम् dazzling like sun's rays, मणिविग्रहाम् stretch of gems, काञ्चनीम् golden, दिव्याम् wonderful, स्रजम् tied, सुग्रीवाय to Sugriva, प्रायच्छत् presented
data.md: Thereupon that lord of men conferred upon Sugriva a celestial garland brilliant like the rays of the Sun and crested with gold and jewels.

data.v: वैदूर्यमणिचित्रे च वज्ररत्नविभूषिते । वालिपुत्राय धृतिमानङ्गदायाङ्गदे ददौ ।।
data.es: Very lovingly Rama gave Angada the son of Vali, wonderful armlets encrusted with cat's eye stones and precious gems.
data.anv: धृतिमान् very lovingly, वैदूर्यमयचित्रे च wonderful with cat's eyes stones, मणिरत्नविभूषिते fixed with gems and precious gems, अङ्गदे to Angada, वालिपुत्राय son of Vali, अङ्गदाय to Angada, ददौ gave
data.md: And he, gifted with intelligence, conferred upon Angada, Vali's son, two Angadas (A kind of ornament worn on upper arms.) brilliant as the rays of the moon and made of Vaidurya.

data.v: मणिप्रवरजुष्टं च मुक्ताहारमनुत्तमम् । सीतायै प्रददौ रामश्चन्द्ररश्मिसमप्रभम् ।।
data.es: Rama gave Sita an unsurpassed pearl chain (given to him by the wind god) encrusted with the best of gems and corals wonderfully shining like moonbeams. And Sita looking at Rama presented that immaculate wonderful pearl chain, and splendid clothes with some ornaments to Hanuman.
data.anv: रामः Rama, मणिप्रवरजुष्टम् encrusted with gems and corals, अनुत्तमम् best, तम् them, चन्द्ररश्मि moon beams समप्रभम् unsurpassed, मुक्ताहारम् pearl chain, अरजे immaculate, दिव्ये wonderful, वाससी clothes, शुभानि splendid, आभरणानि च ornaments, सीतायै to Sita, प्रददौ presented अवेक्षमाणा looking at, वैदेही Vaidehi, प्रददौ gave, वायुसूनवे Hanuman
data.md: Rāma conferred upon Sitā an excellent pearl necklace crested with precious jems, celestial clothes and various excellent ornaments.

data.v: अरजे वाससी दिव्ये शुभान्याभरणानि च । अवेक्षमाणा वैदेही प्रददौ वायुसूनवे ।।
data.es: Rama gave Sita an unsurpassed pearl chain (given to him by the wind god) encrusted with the best of gems and corals wonderfully shining like moonbeams. And Sita looking at Rama presented that immaculate wonderful pearl chain, and splendid clothes with some ornaments to Hanuman.
data.anv: रामः Rama, मणिप्रवरजुष्टम् encrusted with gems and corals, अनुत्तमम् best, तम् them, चन्द्ररश्मि moon beams समप्रभम् unsurpassed, मुक्ताहारम् pearl chain, अरजे immaculate, दिव्ये wonderful, वाससी clothes, शुभानि splendid, आभरणानि च ornaments, सीतायै to Sita, प्रददौ presented अवेक्षमाणा looking at, वैदेही Vaidehi, प्रददौ gave, वायुसूनवे Hanuman

data.v: अवमुच्यात्मनः कण्ठाद्धारं जनकनन्दिनी । अवैक्षत हरीन्सर्वान्भर्तारं च मुहुर्मुहुः ।।
data.es: Removing the pearl chain from her neck, Janaki looked at all the monkeys as well as her husband again and again.
data.anv: जनकनन्दिनी enhancer of Janaka's joy, आत्मनः own, कण्ठात् from her neck, हारम् that chain, अवमुच्य to give away, सर्वान् all, हरीन् monkeys, भर्तारं च husband also, मुहुर्मुहुः again and again, अवैक्षत looking
data.md: And taking off the necklace from her person Vaidehi, the daughter of king Janaka, conferred it upon the Wind-god's son remembering the services (rendered by him) and cast her looks again and again upon her lord and the monkeys.

data.v: तामिङ्गितज्ञः संप्रेक्ष्य बभाषे जनकात्मजाम् । प्रदेहि सुभगे हारं यस्य तुष्टासि भामिनि ।।
data.es: Seeing Janaki looking at him, Rama who could read her mind, and said" Lovely Sita, Beautiful young lady, give the pearl chain to one with whom you are pleased." Sita you may give the chain to one in whom you always found to have brilliance, determination, fame, dexterity, capacity, modesty, prudence, virility, prowess, and intelligence always.
data.anv: इङ्गितज्ञः one who could read the mind, ताम् her, सम्प्रेक्ष्य seeing, ताम् her, जनकात्मजाम् Janaki, बभाषे said, सुभगे lovely, भामिनि beautiful young lady, यस्य his, तुष्टा pleased, असि to them, यस्मिन् your, तेजः brilliance, दृतिः determination, यशः fame, दाक्ष्यम् dexterity, सामर्थ्यम् capacity, विनयः modesty, नयः prudence, पौरुषम् virility, विक्रमः prowess, बुद्धिः intelligence, एतानि all these, सर्वदा ever, हारम् garland, प्रदेहि gift
data.md: Beholding that (Rāma) capable of reading the gestures, spoke to the daughter of king Janaka, saying, "O fortunate and beautiful lady, do you confer this necklace upon him with whom you are pleased."

data.v: पौरुषं विक्रमो बुद्धिर्यस्मिन्नेतानि नित्यदा । ददौ सा वायुपुत्राय तं हारमसितेक्षणा ।।
हनूमांस्तेन हारेण शुशुभे वानरर्षभः । चन्द्रांशुचयगौरेण श्वेताभ्रेण यथाचलः ।।
data.es: Blackeyed Sita, gave that chain to Hanuman, the bull among Vanaras who shone like a mountain behind white silver like cloud.
data.anv: असितेक्षणा blackeyed, सा she, तंहारम् that chain, वायुपुत्राय to Hanuman ददौ give, वानरर्षभः bull among Vanaras, हनूमान् Hanuman, चन्ध्रांशुचयगौरेण like moonbeams, तेनहारेण to him that monkey, श्वेताभ्रेण silver like cloud, अचलःयथा like mountain, शुशुभे shone

data.v: ततो द्विविद मैन्दाभ्यां नीलाय च परंतपः । सर्वान्कामगुणान्वीक्ष्य प्रददौ वसुधाधिपः ।।
data.es: Then Sri Rama, the tormentor of enemies, the ruler of the earth looking at Mainda, Dwivida and Neela presented articles according to their desires. For the aged among the Vanaras and the foremost Vanaras, he gave ornaments and garments duly as much as they deserved and worshipped.
data.anv: ततः then, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, वसुधाधिपः ruler of the earth, वीक्ष्य looking, मैन्दद्विविदाभ्याम् Mainda, Dwivida, नीलाय च Neela also, सर्वान् all, कामगुणान् desires, प्रददौ gaveसर्वे all, वानरवृद्धाश्च aged Vanaras, ये who, अन्ये others, वानरोत्तमाःforemost of Vanaras, यथार्हम् according to What they deserve, वासोभिः garments, भूषणैश्चैव ornaments, प्रतिपूजिताः worshipped in turn
data.md: Thereupon, the lord of earth and the slayer of foes conferred, all wished for things, upon Dvivida, Mainda and Nila.

data.v: सर्ववानरवृद्धाश्च ये चान्ये वानरेश्वराः । वासोभिर्भूषणैश्चैव यथार्हं प्रतिपूजिताः ।।
data.es: Then Sri Rama, the tormentor of enemies, the ruler of the earth looking at Mainda, Dwivida and Neela presented articles according to their desires. For the aged among the Vanaras and the foremost Vanaras, he gave ornaments and garments duly as much as they deserved and worshipped.
data.anv: ततः then, परन्तपः tormentor of enemies, वसुधाधिपः ruler of the earth, वीक्ष्य looking, मैन्दद्विविदाभ्याम् Mainda, Dwivida, नीलाय च Neela also, सर्वान् all, कामगुणान् desires, प्रददौ gaveसर्वे all, वानरवृद्धाश्च aged Vanaras, ये who, अन्ये others, वानरोत्तमाःforemost of Vanaras, यथार्हम् according to What they deserve, वासोभिः garments, भूषणैश्चैव ornaments, प्रतिपूजिताः worshipped in turn
data.md: All other elderly and leading monkeys were respectively honoured with clothes and ornaments.

data.v: यथार्हं पूजिताः सर्वे कामै रत्नैश्च पुष्कलैर् । प्रहृष्टमनसः सर्वे जग्मुरेव यथागतम् ।।
data.es: And thereafter Vibheeshana, Sugriva, Hanuman, Jambavan, all Vanara chiefs of unwearied action having received gifts, abundant gems, and desired objects as they deserved from Rama. They worshipped Rama and very delighted at heart went to their respective places.
data.anv: अथ and then, विभीषणः Vibheeshana, सुग्रीवः Sugriva, हनुमान् Hanuman, तथा so aslo, जाम्बवान् Jambavan, सर्वे all, वानरमुख्याश्च chiefs of Vanaras, सर्वे all, अक्लिष्टकर्मणा unwearied in action, रामेण from Rama, कामैः desired objects, पुष्कलैः abundant, रत्नैः gems, यथार्हम् as they deserved, प्रतिपूजिताः worshipped in return, सर्वे all, प्रहृष्टमानसः very delighted in mind, यथागतम् respective places, जग्मुरेव went
data.md: Being honoured by Rāma of unwearied actions with enough of jewels and other wishedfor objects, Vibhisana, Sugriva, Hanuman, Jambavan and other leading monkeys, delighted, returned to their respective habitations.

data.v: राघवः परमोदारः शशास परया मुदा । उवाच लक्ष्मणं रामो धर्मज्ञं धर्मवत्सलः ।।
data.md: Having slain his foes, the highly generous and glorious Rama, ruled in great delight, the kingdom extending all over the earth. And Rama, fond of the pious, spoke to Laksmana, conversant with piety, saying-

data.v: आतिष्ठ धर्मज्ञ मया सहेमां; गां पूर्वराजाध्युषितां बलेन । तुल्यं मया त्वं पितृभिर्धृता या; तां यौवराज्ये धुरमुद्वहस्व ।।
data.es: "Lakshmana! You are a knower of dharma and a lover of dharma. Prior to my consecration, this kingdom was ruled by former kings, fathers, and forefathers also with the help of the army. You bear the burden equally with me by being installed as Prince Regent", said Rama.
data.anv: धर्मज्ञं knower of dharma, धर्मवत्सल: lover of dharma, लक्ष्मणं Lakshmana, रामो Rama, उवाच spoke, धर्मज्ञ knower of dharma, पूर्वराजाध्युषिताम्, prior to consecration इमाम् these, गाम् kingdom, बलेन army, मयासह with me, आतिष्ठ get up, या he who, पितृभिः father, धृता grandfather, ताम् all of them, धुरम् previous kings, त्वम् you, मया with me, तुल्यम् togetherequally, यौवराज्ये prince regent, उद्वहस्व bear the burden
data.md: O you conversant with piety, do you with me and four fold forces, govern this kingdom, ruled by our predecessors. Like to our ancestors do you now carry the burden of an associate in the throne.

data.v: सर्वात्मना पर्यनुनीयमानो; यदा न सौमित्रिरुपैति योगम् । नियुज्यमानो भुवि यौवराज्ये; ततोऽभ्यषिञ्चद्भरतं महात्मा ।।
data.es: When Saumithri was compelled repeatedly to accept the position of Prince Regent by the high soul great Rama, he had not accepted. Rama consecrated Bharata as Prince Regent.
data.anv: यौवराज्ये Prince Regent, नियुज्यमानः compelling, अपि also, सौमित्रिः Saumithri, पर्यनुनीयमानः repeatedly, यदा that, सर्वात्मना high souled, योगम् the position of Regent, नोपैति not accepted, ततः then, महात्मा great soul, भरतम् Bharata, अभ्यषिञ्चत् consecrated
data.md: When the son of Sumitrā did not accept the heir apparentship albeit solicited earnestly again and again, the high-souled (Rāma) conferred upon Bharata that dignity.

data.v: राघवश्चापि धर्मात्मा प्राप्य राज्यमनुत्तमम् । ईजे बहुविधैर्यज्ञैः ससुहृद्भ्रातृबान्धवः ।।
data.es: Righteous Rama also, having inherited the kingdom, conducted several sacrifices with brothers, friends and relatives.
data.anv: धर्मात्मा righteous, राघवश्चापि Rama too, अनुत्तमम् supreme, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्य having inherited, ससुतभ्रातृबान्धवः with brothers, friends and relatives, बहुविधैः of several kinds, यज्ञैः sacrifices, ईजे held
data.md: Obtaining that excellent kingdom, the virtuous souled Raghava performed many sacrifices with his sons, brothers and friends.

data.v: पौण्डरीकाश्वमेधाभ्यां वाजपेयेन चासकृत् । अन्यैश्च विविधैर्यज्ञैरयजत्पार्थिवर्षभः ।।
data.es: Rama, the son of Dasharatha, had performed many a time Pundarika, Aswamedha, Vajapeya and several other yajnas and propitiated gods.
data.anv: पार्धिवात्मजः son of king Dasharatha, पौण्डरीकाश्वमेधाभ्याम् Paundarika, Aswamedha, वाजपेयेन Vajapeya, विविधैः several, अन्यैः other, यज्ञैः yajnas, असकृत् performed, अयजत् several times
data.md: That son of king performed various sacrifices such as Paundarika, Asvamedha', Vajimedha and other of various kinds. 1. A kind of sacrifice. 2. A kind of Sacrifice in which a horse is slain.

data.v: राज्यं दशसहस्राणि प्राप्य वर्षाणि राघवः । शताश्वमेधानाजह्रे सदश्वान्भूरिदक्षिणान् ।।
data.es: Raghava in the ten thousand years of his rule performed hundred horse sacrifices with excellent horses and gave donations liberally.
data.anv: राघवः Raghava, दशसहस्राणि ten thousand, वर्षाणि years, राज्यम् kingdom, प्राप्य got, सदश्वान् excellent horses, भूरिदक्षिणान् liberal donations, शताश्वमेधान् hundred horse sacrifices, आजह्रे performed
data.md: And governing the kingdom for ten thousand years Rāghava performed ten horse-sacrifices with excellent horses and profuse presents.

data.v: आजानुलम्बिबाहुश्च महास्कन्धः प्रतापवान् । लक्ष्मणानुचरो रामः पृथिवीमन्वपालयत् ।।
data.es: Sri Rama whose arms reached unto knees, endowed with broadchest and stupendous glory, ruled this earth with Lakshmana as his follower.
data.anv: आजानुलम्बिबाहुः whose arms reached unto knees, महावक्षाः broadchested, प्रतापवान् stupendous, सः he, रामः Rama, लक्ष्मणानुचरः Lakshmana s his follower, इमाम् in this, पृथिवीम् earth, शशास ruled
data.md: That highly powerful Rāma, having his arms extended up to the knee-joint, having a spacious breast and Lakşmaņa as his attendant, ruled the earth (in this.wise).

data.v: न पर्यदेवन्विधवा न च व्यालकृतं भयम् । न व्याधिजं भयं वापि रामे राज्यं प्रशासति ।।
data.es: While Rama was ruling there was no lamentation of widows (over their loss), fear of cruel animals, or fear of disease.
data.anv: रामे Rama, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासति ruling, विधवाःwidows, न पर्यदेवयन् not there to lament, व्यालकृतम् of cruel animals, भयम् fear, नासीत् not there, व्याधिजम् disease, भयम् fear, न not
data.md: Rāma governing the kingdom, the widows were not distressed and there was no fear from voracious animals or from diseases.

data.v: निर्दस्युरभवल्लोको नानर्थः कंचिदस्पृशत् । न च स्म वृद्धा बालानां प्रेतकार्याणि कुर्वते ।।
data.es: There were no thieves, indeed there was no loss, aged did not perform obsequies (no deaths in the young population) for the young and no harm to people.
data.anv: लोकः world, निर्दस्युःthieves, अभवत् not there, कश्चित् indeed, अनर्थम् lossन अस्पृशत् no harm, वृद्धाः aged, बालानाम् youngsters, प्रेतकार्याणि obsequies, न कर्वतेस्मnot do
data.md: The people were saved from the thieves and there was no other trouble. And the old were not constrained to perform the funeral ceremonies of the children.

data.v: सर्वं मुदितमेवासीत्सर्वो धर्मपरोऽभवत् । राममेवानुपश्यन्तो नाभ्यहिंसन्परस्परम् ।।
data.es: All were happy, and followed the righteous path, looking at Rama alone and no one hit another.
data.anv: सर्वम् all, मुदितमेव happy, आसीत् remained, सर्वः all, धर्मपरः followed the righteous path, अभवत् became, राममेव Rama alone, अनुपश्यन्तः looking at Rama, परस्परम् one another, नाभ्यहिंसन् not hurt
data.md: All were delighted and devoted to pious observances. And beholding Rāma they did not envy one another.

data.v: आसन्वर्षसहस्राणि तथा पुत्रसहस्रिणः । निरामया विशोकाश्च रामे राज्यं प्रशासति ।।
data.es: While Rama was ruling for thousands of years, people were blessed with thousands of sons and lived free from trouble and sorrow.
data.anv: रामे while Rama, राज्यम् kingdom, प्रशासति ruling, वर्षसहस्राणि thousand years, तथा like that, पुत्रसहस्रिणः thousand sons, निरामयाः free from trouble, विशोकाश्च free from sorrow, वसन् lived
data.md: Rāma governing the kingdom, (people) lived for thousand years and had thousand children, they were freed from diseases and sorrow.

data.v: नित्यपुष्पा नित्यफलास्तरवः स्कन्धविस्तृताः । कालवर्षी च पर्जन्यः सुखस्पर्शश्च मारुतः ।।
data.es: The trees were always in bloom, and always bore fruits. Clouds sent rain when desired. People lived with delightful feelings.
data.anv: तत्र there, तरवः trees, नित्यपुष्पाः always in bloom, नित्यफलाः always bore fruits, निर्व्रणाः clouds sent down, पर्जन्यः rained, कालवर्षी when desired, मारुतः wind, सुखस्पर्शः delightful feeling
data.md: The trees bore fruits and flowers perpetuallythere were showers at will and the wind blew pleasant.

data.v: स्वकर्मसु प्रवर्तन्ते तुष्ठाः स्वैरेव कर्मभिः । आसन्प्रजा धर्मपरा रामे शासति नानृताः ।।
data.es: While Rama ruled brahmins, kshatriyas, vaisyas and sudras were free from avarice, were engaged in their own avocations and delighted. People remained righteous, pious, and never told lies.
data.anv: ब्राह्मणा brahmins, क्षत्रियाः kshatriya, वैश्याः vaisyas, शूद्राः sudras, लोभविवर्जिताः free from avarice, स्वैः their, कर्मभिरेव avocations, तुष्टाः delighted, स्वकर्मसु in own work, प्रवर्तन्ते engaging in, रामे while Rama, शासति ruled, प्रजाः people, धर्मपराः remained righteous, आसन् pious, अनृताः lies, न not told
data.md: The people delighted engaged in their respective works and the subjects grew pious and truthful, under Rāma's regime, and were devoted to the observances of all pious works and gifted with all auspicious marks. And Rāma ruled the kingdom for ten thousand years.

data.v: सर्वे लक्षणसंपन्नाः सर्वे धर्मपरायणाः । दशवर्षसहस्राणि रामो राज्यमकारयत् ।।
data.es: All were endowed with signs of good culture, given to righteous behaviour. Rama ruled the kingdom for ten thousand years with brothers.
data.anv: सर्वे all, लक्षणसम्पन्नाः richly endowed with good signs, सर्वे all, धर्मपरायणाः given to righteous behaviour, रामः Ram, दश ten, वर्षसहस्राणि thousand years, राज्यम् kingdom, भ्रातृभि: brothers सहितः with श्रीमान glorious, रामो Rama, अकारयत् ruled
data.md: The people delighted engaged in their respective works and the subjects grew pious and truthful, under Rāma's regime, and were devoted to the observances of all pious works and gifted with all auspicious marks. And Rāma ruled the kingdom for ten thousand years.

data.v: प्राप्तराज्यस्य रामस्य राक्षसानां वधे कृते । आजग्मुरृषयः सर्वे राघवं प्रतिनन्दितुम् ।।
data.md: On the Rākṣasas having been slain, all the ascetics, for the purpose of congratulating Rāghava, came to Rāma as he gained (back) his kingdom.

data.v: कौशिकोऽथ यवक्रीतो रैभ्यश्च्यवन एव च । कण्वो मेधातिथेः पुत्रः पूर्वस्यां दिशि ये श्रिताः ।।
स्वस्त्यात्रेयश्च भगवान्नमुचिः प्रमुचुस्तथा । आजग्मुस्ते सहागस्त्या ये श्रिता दक्षिणां दिशम् ।।
पृषद्गुः कवषो धौम्यो रौद्रेयश्च महानृषिः । तेऽप्याजग्मुः सशिष्या वै ये श्रिताः पश्चिमां दिशम् ।।
data.md: Nrisadgu, and Kavasi, and Dhaumya, and that mighty sage-Kauseya-who abode in th quarter, came there accompanied by their disciples.

data.v: वसिष्ठः कश्यपोऽथात्रिर्विश्वामित्रोऽथ गौतमः । जमदग्निर्भरद्वाजस्तेऽपि सप्तमहर्षयः ।।
data.md: Vasiştha and Kasyapa and Atri and Viśvāmitra with Gautama and Jamadagni and Bharadvāja and also the seven sages*, who for aye resided in the northern quarter, (came there). *Ursa Major, or the great bear, the seven stars of which are the souls of as many saints, Marici, Atri, Angiras, Pulastya, Pulaha, Kratu and Vasistha.

data.v: संप्राप्यैते महात्मानो राघवस्य निवेशनम् । विष्ठिताः प्रतिहारार्थं हुताशनसमप्रभाः ।।
data.md: On arriving at the residence of Rāghava, those high-souled ones, resembling the fire in radiance, stopped at the gate, with the intention of communicating their arrival (to Rama) through the warder.

data.v: प्रतिहारस्ततस्तूर्णमगस्त्यवचनादथ । समीपं राघवस्याशु प्रविवेश महात्मनः ।।
स रामं दृश्य सहसा पूर्णचन्द्रसमद्युतिम् । अगस्त्यं कथयामास संप्राप्तमृषिभिः सह ।।
श्रुत्वा प्राप्तान्मुनींस्तांस्तु बालसूर्यसमप्रभान् । तदोवाच नृपो द्वाःस्थं प्रवेशय यथासुखम् ।।
data.md: Hearing of the arrival of the anchorets, possessed of the effulgence of the sun new-risen, he answered the warder, saying, "Do you usher them in, having regard to their comfort."

data.v: दृष्ट्वा प्राप्तान्मुनींस्तांस्तु प्रत्युत्थाय कृताञ्जलिः । रामोऽभिवाद्य प्रयत आसनान्यादिदेश ह ।।
data.md: Seeing the ascetics him, Rāma with joined hands worshipped their feet with arghyas, and with regard consecrated a cow to each, and saluting them with the collecting mind, he ordered seats (for the saints).

data.v: तेषु काञ्चनचित्रेषु स्वास्तीर्णेषु सुखेषु च । यथार्हमुपविष्टास्ते आसनेष्वृषिपुंगवाः ।।

data.md: Then the highly energetic Brahmā along with the Indra and the celestials, coming to that asylum, addressed (Vaisravana), saying, '0 child, I am well-pleased with you for this act of your, O you of excellent vows. Do you, good betide you, ask for the 'boon (that you would have), for, O magnanimous one, you are worthy of a boon.'

data.v: परितुष्टोऽस्मि ते वत्स कर्मणानेन सुव्रत । वरं वृणीष्व भद्रं ते वरार्हस्त्वं हि मे मतः ।।
data.md: Then the highly energetic Brahmā along with the Indra and the celestials, coming to that asylum, addressed (Vaisravana), saying, '0 child, I am well-pleased with you for this act of your, O you of excellent vows. Do you, good betide you, ask for the 'boon (that you would have), for, O magnanimous one, you are worthy of a boon.'

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्वैश्रवणः पितामहमुपस्थितम् । भगवँल्लोकपालत्वमिच्छेयं वित्तरक्षणम् ।।
data.md: Then Vaisravaņa said to the Pitāmaha, who was present, 'O reverend one, I crave for the power of maintaining and protecting people.'

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीद्वैश्रवणं परितुष्टेन चेतसा । ब्रह्मा सुरगणैः सार्धं बाढमित्येव हृष्टवत् ।।
data.md: Thereat, Brahmä along with the deities gladly said to Vaiśravana in a gratified spirit, Very well!

data.v: अहं हि लोकपालानां चतुर्थं स्रष्टुमुद्यतः । यमेन्द्रवरुणानां हि पदं यत्तव चेप्सितम् ।।
data.md: I am about to create the fourth of the Protectors of the creatures-Yama, Indra and Varuna, the position which is sought for by you.

data.v: तत्कृतं गच्छ धर्मज्ञ धनेशत्वमवाप्नुहि । यमेन्द्रवरुणानां हि चतुर्थोऽद्य भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: Do you, O you cognisant of righteousness, attain the same; do you receive the position of the lord of riches. You shall be the fourth among the Sakra, the lord of waters, etc.

data.v: एतच्च पुष्पकं नाम विमानं सूर्यसंनिभम् । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व यानार्थं त्रिदशैः समतां व्रज ।।
data.md: Do you take for your vehicle this car, named Puşpaka, resembling the Sun himself, and thus raise yourself to an equality with the celestials.

data.v: स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामः सर्व एव यथागतम् । कृतकृत्या वयं तात दत्त्वा तव महावरम् ।।
data.md: Good betide you! We shall (now) go whither we had come, having, my child, done my duty and bestowed on you the couple of boons.

data.v: गतेषु ब्रह्मपूर्वेषु देवेष्वथ नभस्तलम् । धनेशः पितरं प्राह विनयात्प्रणतो वचः ।।
भगवँल्लब्धवानस्मि वरं कमलयोनितः । निवासं न तु मे देवो विदधे स प्रजापतिः ।।
तत्पश्य भगवन्कंचिद्देशं वासाय नः प्रभो । न च पीडा भवेद्यत्र प्राणिनो यस्य कस्यचित् ।।
एवमुक्तस्तु पुत्रेण विश्रवा मुनिपुंगवः । वचनं प्राह धर्मज्ञ श्रूयतामिति धर्मवित् ।।
लङ्का नाम पुरी रम्या निर्मिता विश्वकर्मणा । राक्षसानां निवासार्थं यथेन्द्रस्यामरावती ।।
रमणीया पुरी सा हि रुक्मवैदूर्यतोरणा । राक्षसैः सा परित्यक्ता पुरा विष्णुभयार्दितैः । शून्या रक्षोगणैः सर्वै रसातलतलं गतैः ।।
स त्वं तत्र निवासाय रोचयस्व मतिं स्वकाम् । निर्दोषस्तत्र ते वासो न च बाधास्ति कस्यचित् ।।
एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु धर्मात्मा धर्मिष्ठं वचनं पितुः । निवेशयामास तदा लङ्कां पर्वतमूर्धनि ।।
data.md: Hearing the righteous speech of his sire, that virtuous-souled one along with thousands of delighted and joyous Rākşasas, began to reside in Lanka stationed on the ion of the mount.

data.v: नैरृतानां सहस्रैस्तु हृष्टैः प्रमुदितैः सदा । अचिरेणैककालेन संपूर्णा तस्य शासनात् ।।
data.md: In a short time (Lankā), through his sway, abounded (in wealth). And that foremost of Nairtas, the righteous-son of Visrava, wellpleased, abode in Lankā having the Ocean for her entrenchment.

data.v: अथ तत्रावसत्प्रीतो धर्मात्मा नैरृताधिपः । समुद्रपरिधानायां लङ्कायां विश्रवात्मजः ।।
काले काले विनीतात्मा पुष्पकेण धनेश्वरः । अभ्यगच्छत्सुसंहृष्टः पितरं मातरं च सः ।।
