श्रुत्वागस्त्येरितं वाक्यं रामो विस्मयमागतः । पूर्वमासीत्तु लङ्कायां रक्षसामिति संभवः ।।
data.md: Hearing the words uttered by Agastya, Răma wondered as to how formerly Rākşasas were generated in Lanka.

data.v: ततः शिरः कम्पयित्वा त्रेताग्निसमविग्रहम् । अगस्त्यं तं मुहुर्दृष्ट्वा स्मयमानोऽभ्यभाषत ।।
data.md: Then shaking his head, he, struck with wonder, momentarily eyeing Agastya, addressed Agastya resembling fire, saying.

data.v: भगवन्पूर्वमप्येषा लङ्कासीत्पिशिताशिनाम् । इतीदं भवतः श्रुत्वा विस्मयो जनितो मम ।।
data.md: O worshipful one, hearing your words that formerly Lankā had been in the possession of the flesh-eaters, I have been seized with great amazement.

data.v: पुलस्त्यवंशादुद्भूता राक्षसा इति नः श्रुतम् । इदानीमन्यतश्चापि संभवः कीर्तितस्त्वया ।।
data.md: We had heard that the Rākṣasas had sprung in the race of Pulastya. But now you have said that they owe their origin to a different source.

data.v: रावणात्कुम्भकर्णाच्च प्रहस्ताद्विकटादपि । रावणस्य च पुत्रेभ्यः किं नु ते बलवत्तराः ।।
data.md: But were they more powerful than Rāvana, Kumbhakarma and Prahasta and Vikața and the sons of Rāvana?

data.v: क एषां पूर्वको ब्रह्मन्किंनामा किंतपोबलः । अपराधं च कं प्राप्य विष्णुना द्राविताः पुरा ।।
data.md: Who was their progenitor? And what was the name of that terrific strength? And through what transgression were they driven out by Vişnu?

data.v: एतद्विस्तरतः सर्वं कथयस्व ममानघ । कौतूहलं कृतं मह्यं नुद भानुर्यथा तमः ।।
data.md: All this, O sinless one, do you tell me in detail, and do you dispel my curiosity even as the sun dispels darkness.

data.v: राघवस्य तु तच्छ्रुत्वा संस्कारालंकृतं वचः । ईषद्विस्मयमानस्तमगस्त्यः प्राह राघवम् ।।
data.md: Hearing Rāghava's words, fair and fraught with polished phrase and period, Agastya, struck with surprise, said to Rāghava.

data.v: प्रजापतिः पुरा सृष्ट्वा अपः सलिलसंभवः । तासां गोपायने सत्त्वानसृजत्पद्मसंभवः ।।
data.md: The lord of creatures sprang from water, first created water. And the lotus-born one generated creatures for protecting that element.

data.md: Thereupon those creatures humbly presented themselves before the creator, saying, What shall we do? We are sore tried by hunger and thirst.

data.v: प्रजापतिस्तु तान्याह सत्त्वानि प्रहसन्निव । आभाष्य वाचा यत्नेन रक्षध्वमिति मानदः ।।
data.md: The lord of creatures, laughing, addressed them, saying, “You men, do you carefully guard this (water).”

data.v: रक्षाम इति तत्रान्यैर्यक्षामेति तथापरैः । भुङ्क्षिताभुङ्क्षितैरुक्तस्ततस्तानाह भूतकृत् ।।
data.md: Thereat some said 'Raksama,' (i.e. we shall protect.) and others 'Yaksāma.' (We shall worship.) Thus accosted by those afflicted with hunger and thirst, the creator said.

data.md: And there sprang the brothers-repressors of foes-Heti and Praheti lords of Raksasas, resembling Madhu Kaitabha himself.

data.md: Praheti, who was righteous, went to the wood of asceticism. And Heti exerted himself to the utmost to get himself wived.

data.v: स कालभगिनीं कन्यां भयां नाम भयावहाम् । उदावहदमेयात्मा स्वयमेव महामतिः ।।
data.md: And that magnanimous one of immeasurable soul married the exceedingly terrific sister of Kala, named Bhayā (Fear.)

data.md: And on her Heti-foremost of Rākşasas and best of those having sons-beget a son, known as Vidyutkeśa.

data.md: Heti's son, the exceedingly energetic Vidyutkeśa, possessed of the splendour of the sun, grew up even like a lotus in water.

data.v: स यदा यौवनं भद्रमनुप्राप्तो निशाचरः । ततो दारक्रियां तस्य कर्तुं व्यवसितः पिता ।।
data.md: And when that night-ranger arrived at proper youth, his sire turned his attention towards his marriage.

data.v: संध्यादुहितरं सोऽथ संध्यातुल्यां प्रभावतः । वरयामास पुत्रार्थं हेती राक्षसपुंगवः ।।
data.md: And that best of Rākṣasas-heti-in the interests of his son asked for the hand of Sandhya's daughter; like to Sandhyā* herself in the potency. * The evening Twilight-spouse of the Sun.

data.md: Sandhya, reflecting that she needs must have to be given away by her, bestowed her on Vidyutkesa, O Raghava. Having obtained Sandhya's daughter, the night-ranger Vidyutkeśa, sports with her even as Maghavan does with the daughter of Puloma.

data.v: संध्यायास्तनयां लब्ध्वा विद्युत्केशो निशाचरः । रमते स तया सार्धं पौलोम्या मघवानिव ।।
data.md: Sandhya, reflecting that she needs must have to be given away by her, bestowed her on Vidyutkesa, O Raghava. Having obtained Sandhya's daughter, the night-ranger Vidyutkeśa, sports with her even as Maghavan does with the daughter of Puloma.

data.v: केनचित्त्वथ कालेन राम सालकटंकटा । विद्युत्केशाद्गर्भमाप घनराजिरिवार्णवात् ।।
data.md: It came to pass that after a length of time, O Răma, Sälakatankata was filled with child by Vidyutkeśa, as the clouds are furnished with water by the Ocean,

data.v: ततः सा राक्षसी गर्भं घनगर्भसमप्रभम् । प्रसूता मन्दरं गत्वा गङ्गा गर्भमिवाग्निजम् ।।
data.md: Then repairing to Mandara, the Rākşasi brought forth her child, having the splendour of rain-charged clouds; even as Gangā had delivered herself of the child begotten by fire.* And having delivered herself of her offspring, she again became bent on disporting with Vidyutkeśa. *Mahesvara.

data.v: तमुत्सृज्य तु सा गर्भं विद्युत्केशाद्रतार्थिनी । रेमे सा पतिना सार्धं विस्मृत्य सुतमात्मजम् ।।
तयोत्सृष्टः स तु शिशुः शरदर्कसमद्युतिः । पाणिमास्ये समाधाय रुरोद घनराडिव ।।
data.md: And forsaken by them both, the infant furnished with the brightness of the autumnal sun, entering his clenched fist into his mouth, began to cry slowly.

अमरं चैव तं कृत्वा महादेवोऽक्षयोऽव्ययः । पुरमाकाशगं प्रादात्पार्वत्याः प्रियकाम्यया ।।
उमयापि वरो दत्तो राक्षसीनां नृपात्मज । सद्योपलब्धिर्गर्भस्य प्रसूतिः सद्य एव च । सद्य एव वयःप्राप्तिर्मातुरेव वयः समम् ।।
data.md: O son of the king, Umă also bestowed a boon: “Henceforth the Rāksasis shall conceive in a day, bring forth (child) in a day, and the child shall in a day be furnished with the age of its mother.'

data.v: ततः सुकेशो वरदानगर्वितः; श्रियं प्रभोः प्राप्य हरस्य पार्श्वतः । चचार सर्वत्र महामतिः खगः; खगं पुरं प्राप्य पुरंदरो यथा ।।
data.md: Then the great and magnanimous Sukeśa, puffed up with the receipt of boons, having obtained auspiciousness at the hands of the lord, Hara, began to range everywhere, even as Purandara did on having obtained heaven.

data.v: सुकेशं धार्मिकं दृष्ट्वा वरलब्धं च राक्षसम् । ग्रामणीर्नाम गन्धर्वो विश्वावसुसमप्रभः ।।
तस्य देववती नाम द्वितीया श्रीरिवात्मजा । तां सुकेशाय धर्मेण ददौ दक्षः श्रियं यथा ।।
वरदानकृतैश्वर्यं सा तं प्राप्य पतिं प्रियम् । आसीद्देववती तुष्टा धनं प्राप्येव निर्धनः ।।
data.md: And like an indigent person on obtaining wealth, Devavati, on obtaining her beloved husband, affluent in consequence of having received the boon, was (greatly) delighted. And in her company, that night-ranger appeared graceful, even as a mighty elephant sprung from Añjanā* does in the company of a she-elephant. *The designation of an elephant.

data.v: स तया सह संयुक्तो रराज रजनीचरः । अञ्जनादभिनिष्क्रान्तः करेण्वेव महागजः ।।
देववत्यां सुकेशस्तु जनयामास राघव । त्रींस्त्रिनेत्रसमान्पुत्रान्राक्षसान्राक्षसाधिपः । माल्यवन्तं सुमालिं च मालिं च बलिनां वरम् ।।
त्रयो लोका इवाव्यग्राः स्थितास्त्रय इवाग्नयः । त्रयो मन्त्रा इवात्युग्रास्त्रयो घोरा इवामयाः ।।
data.md: That lord of Rākşasas begot (on her) three sons, resembling his three eyes the Raksasas, Mālyavän, Sumāli and that foremost of the strong-Māli; all resembling the three worlds possessing themselves in calmness; like to the three Fires established; fierce like to the three mantras, dreadful like three diseases springing respectively from morbid Air, Bile and Phlegm.* *The entire edifice of Hindu Pathology is based on the three-fold division of the morbid humours into Air, Bile and Phlegm. This division, albeit it may appear crude and unscientific to Europeans, taken all, in all, wonderfully answers its purpose. The tact displayed by Hindu physicians in diagnosing diseases on this method is wonderful. From feeling the Pulse alone, a Hindu physician, getting at the predominance of one or more morbid humours of the system, can accurately ascertain a patient's health. The infallibility with which predictions of death are generally made, attests the scientific soundness of the division in question, and renders superfluous any elaborate argument in its defence.

data.v: त्रयः सुकेशस्य सुतास्त्रेताग्निसमवर्चसः । विवृद्धिमगमंस्तत्र व्याधयोपेक्षिता इव ।।

data.v: इत्येवं त्रिदशैरुक्तो निशम्यान्धकसूदनः । शिरः करं च धुन्वान इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Thus addressed by the deities, the slayer of Andhaka, hearing their speech, said, shaking his head and hands.

data.v: अवध्या मम ते देवाः सुकेशतनया रणे । मन्त्रं तु वः प्रदास्यामि यो वै तान्निहनिष्यति ।।
data.md: I shall not slay them, you gods; they are incapable of being slain by me. But I shall unfold to you the way in which they will be destroyed.

data.v: यः स चक्रगदापाणिः पीतवासा जनार्दनः । हनिष्यति स तान्युद्धे शरणं तं प्रपद्यथ ।।
data.md: Do you seek the shelter of him who hold the discus and mace in his hands, and who is clad in a yellow attire, of Janardana, Hari, even of the auspicious Nārāyaṇa.

data.v: हरान्नावाप्य ते कामं कामारिमभिवाद्य च । नारायणालयं प्राप्तास्तस्मै सर्वं न्यवेदयन् ।।
data.md: Having received this counsel of Hara, they, rendering reverence to that enemy of Kāma, came the abode of Nārāyana and communicated everything to him.

data.v: ततो नारायणेनोक्ता देवा इन्द्रपुरोगमाः । सुरारीन्सूदयिष्यामि सुरा भवत विज्वराः ।।
data.md: Then Nārāyana spoke to the celestials with Indra at their head, I will slay those foes of the celestials. You gods, cast off all fear!

data.v: देवानां भयभीतानां हरिणा राक्षसर्षभौ । प्रतिज्ञातो वधोऽस्माकं तच्चिन्तयथ यत्क्षमम् ।।
data.md: to O foremost of Rākşasas, Hari promised to the frightened celestials that he would slay us. Therefore do you think as to what is fit.

data.v: हिरण्यकशिपोर्मृत्युरन्येषां च सुरद्विषाम् । दुःखं नारायणं जेतुं यो नो हन्तुमभीप्सति ।।
ततः सुमाली माली च श्रुत्वा माल्यवतो वचः । ऊचतुर्भ्रातरं ज्येष्ठं भगांशाविव वासवम् ।।
data.md: Thereat Sumāli and Māli, hearing the words of Malyavān, said to their eldest brother, like the Asvins addressing Vāsava.

data.v: स्वधीतं दत्तमिष्टं च ऐश्वर्यं परिपालितम् । आयुर्निरामयं प्राप्तं स्वधर्मः स्थापितश्च नः ।।
data.md: We have studied, performed sacrifices, practised charity, and obtained riches; and attaining long health and long life, we have established sterling righteousness in our path.

data.v: देवसागरमक्षोभ्यं शस्त्रौघैः प्रविगाह्य च । जिता देवा रणे नित्यं न नो मृत्युकृतं भयम् ।।
data.md: With arms plunging into the sea of celestials, we have conquered our unrivalled enemies. Therefore, we have no fear touching death.

data.v: नारायणश्च रुद्रश्च शक्रश्चापि यमस्तथा । अस्माकं प्रमुखे स्थातुं सर्व एव हि बिभ्यति ।।
data.md: Even Narayana and Rudra, Sakra and Yama, ever fear to stay before us (in the field).

data.v: विष्णोर्दोषश्च नास्त्यत्र कारणं राक्षसेश्वर । देवानामेव दोषेण विष्णोः प्रचलितं मनः ।।
data.md: O lord of Raksasas. There is no occasion for Visnu's displeasure of us. The mind of Visnu has wavered in consequence of the evil caused by the celestials.

data.v: तस्मादद्य समुद्युक्ताः सर्वसैन्यसमावृताः । देवानेव जिघांसामो येभ्यो दोषः समुत्थितः ।।
data.md: Therefore, will we even avenge ourselves on the gods, from whom has sprung this wrong.

data.v: इति माली सुमाली च माल्यवानग्रजः प्रभुः । उद्योगं घोषयित्वाथ राक्षसाः सर्व एव ते । युद्धाय निर्ययुः क्रुद्धा जम्भवृत्रबला इव ।।
स्यन्दनैर्वारणेन्द्रैश्च हयैश्च गिरिसंनिभैः । खरैर्गोभिरथोष्ट्रैश्च शिंशुमारैर्भुजंगमैः ।।
मकरैः कच्छपैर्मीनैर्विहंगैर्गरुडोपमैः । सिंहैर्व्याघ्रैर्वराहैश्च सृमरैश्चमरैरपि ।।
त्यक्त्वा लङ्कां ततः सर्वे राक्षसा बलगर्विताः । प्रयाता देवलोकाय योद्धुं दैवतशत्रवः ।।
लङ्काविपर्ययं दृष्ट्वा यानि लङ्कालयान्यथ । भूतानि भयदर्शीनि विमनस्कानि सर्वशः ।।
data.md: Perceiving the destruction of Lanka hand, those deities that had taken up their quarters there, everywhere were struck with fear and felt their spirits depressed.

data.v: भौमास्तथान्तरिक्षाश्च कालाज्ञप्ता भयावहाः । उत्पाता राक्षसेन्द्राणामभावायोत्थिता द्रुतम् ।।
data.md: At the command of Kala, terrible evil omens foreshadowing the destruction of the Raksasachief began to arise on the earth well as in the sky.

data.v: अस्थीनि मेघा वर्षन्ति उष्णं शोणितमेव च । वेलां समुद्रोऽप्युत्क्रान्तश्चलन्ते चाचलोत्तमाः ।।
data.md: The clouds showered down bones and hot blood. The oceans overleapt their continents and the mountains shook.

data.v: अट्टहासान्विमुञ्चन्तो घननादसमस्वनान् । भूताः परिपतन्ति स्म नृत्यमानाः सहस्रशः ।।
गृध्रचक्रं महच्चापि ज्वलनोद्गारिभिर्मुखैः । राक्षसानामुपरि वै भ्रमते कालचक्रवत् ।।
तानचिन्त्य महोत्पातान्राक्षसा बलगर्विताः । यन्त्येव न निवर्तन्ते मृत्युपाशावपाशिताः ।।
माल्यवांश्च सुमाली च माली च रजनीचराः । आसन्पुरःसरास्तेषां क्रतूनामिव पावकाः ।।
माल्यवन्तं तु ते सर्वे माल्यवन्तमिवाचलम् । निशाचरा आश्रयन्ते धातारमिव देहिनः ।।
data.md: Even as the gods take refuge under Dhātā, the night-rangers take refuge under Mālyavân resembling the mountain, Mälyavān.

data.v: तद्बलं राक्षसेन्द्राणां महाभ्रघननादितम् । जयेप्सया देवलोकं ययौ माली वशे स्थितम् ।।
data.md: Under the command of Māli that host of Raksasas, roaring like mighty clouds, inspired with the desire of victory, went to the celestial regions.

data.v: राक्षसानां समुद्योगं तं तु नारायणः प्रभुः । देवदूतादुपश्रुत्य दध्रे युद्धे ततो मनः ।।
data.md: The lord Nārāyana, hearing of the preparations of the Rākşasas from a celestial messenger, set his heart on fight. And equipped with weapons and quivers, he mounted on Vinata's offspring.* *Garuda, Narayana's vehicle.

data.v: स देवसिद्धर्षिमहोरगैश्च; गन्धर्वमुख्याप्सरसोपगीतः । समाससादामरशत्रुसैन्यं; चक्रासिसीरप्रवरादिधारी ।।
data.md: And hymned by Siddhas and celestials and sages and mighty (semi-divine) serpents and Gandharvas and Yakşas, the enemy of the Asura hosts presented himself, bearing in his hands the discus, sword, that weapon Śärnga and the conch.

data.v: सुपर्णपक्षानिलनुन्नपक्षं; भ्रमत्पताकं प्रविकीर्णशस्त्रम् । चचाल तद्राक्षसराजसैन्यं; चलोपलो नील इवाचलेन्द्रः ।।
data.md: The Raksasa-hosts, struck by the wind produced by the wings of Suparņa, with their pennons swinging to and fro and their weapons scattered about, quaked like the blue summit of a mountain with its crags tossed about.

data.v: ततः शितैः शोणितमांसरूषितै;र्युगान्तवैश्वानरतुल्यविग्रहैः । निशाचराः संपरिवार्य माधवं; वरायुधैर्निर्बिभिदुः सहस्रशः ।।
data.md: Then the night-rangers, hemming in Madhava,* began to pierce him with thousands of excellent sharpened weapons dyed in flesh and blood, and resembling the fire of Doomsday. *One of the many designations of Visnu.

data.v: नारायणगिरिं ते तु गर्जन्तो राक्षसाम्बुदाः । अवर्षन्निषुवर्षेण वर्षेणाद्रिमिवाम्बुदाः ।।
data.md: As clouds assail a mountain with showers, then the Raksasas, representing clouds, setting up shouts, began to assail Nārāyaṇa representing a mountain.

data.v: श्यामावदातस्तैर्विष्णुर्नीलैर्नक्तंचरोत्तमैः । वृतोऽञ्जनगिरीवासीद्वर्षमाणैः पयोधरैः ।।
data.md: Visnu of a bright brown-blue hue, being surrounded by the flower of the night-rangers with dark visages, resembled the Añjana mountain, on which the clouds pour down.

data.v: शलभा इव केदारं मशका इव पर्वतम् । यथामृतघटं जीवा मकरा इव चार्णवम् ।।
तथा रक्षोधनुर्मुक्ता वज्रानिलमनोजवाः । हरिं विशन्ति स्म शरा लोकास्तमिव पर्यये ।।
data.md: As locusts (flood) a field, knots (throng) about a flame, gad-flies (cluster) around a pot of honey, or makaras (range) in the sea, so the shafts shot by the bows of the Rākṣasa, having (the energy of) the thunder-bolt and endowed with (the velocity of) the wind or thought, pierce Hari as if at the universal dissolution.

data.v: स्यन्दनैः स्यन्दनगता गजैश्च गजधूर्गताः । अश्वारोहाः सदश्वैश्च पादाताश्चाम्बरे चराः ।।
राक्षसेन्द्रा गिरिनिभाः शरशक्त्यृष्टितोमरैः । निरुच्छ्वासं हरिं चक्रुः प्राणायाम इव द्विजम् ।।
data.md: Those mounted on cars (assailed him) with their cars, and those mounted on the backs of elephants (assailed him) with their elephants, and those riding horses (assailed him) with their horses, and the foot-soldiers attacked him, stationed in the sky; and the foremost of Rākşasas resembling mountains, by means of darts, rstis and tomaras, suspended the respiration of Hari even as the prāņāyāma* does that of a twice-born one. *The practice of regulation respiration and finally suspending the same. This is practised by the Yogis of India, who attribute wonderful virtues to it.

data.v: निशाचरैस्तुद्यमानो मीनैरिव महातिमिः । शार्ङ्गमायम्य गात्राणि राक्षसानां महाहवे ।।
data.md: On being sore tried by the night-rangers, like the great Ocean by the fishes (residing in it), that invincible one, taking his ſārņga, showered shafts among the Rākşasas.

data.v: शरैः पूर्णायतोत्सृष्टैर्वज्रवक्त्रैर्मनोजवैः । चिच्छेद तिलशो विष्णुः शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।।
data.md: With sharpened arrows resembling the thunder, and endowed with the velocity of the wind, shot from his bow drawn to its fullest stretch, Visnu cut off (Raksasas) by hundreds and by thousands.

data.v: विद्राव्य शरवर्षं तं वर्षं वायुरिवोत्थितम् । पाञ्चजन्यं महाशङ्खं प्रदध्मौ पुरुषोत्तमः ।।
data.md: And dashing away (the Rākṣasa ranks) with his arrowy shower, even as the wind aroused dashes away a downpour, that best of male beings blew his mighty conch Pāñcajanya.

data.v: सोऽम्बुजो हरिणा ध्मातः सर्वप्राणेन शङ्खराट् । ररास भीमनिह्रादो युगान्ते जलदो यथा ।।
data.md: Winded by Hari with his utmost might, that water-sprung king of conchs, endowed with terrific blares, roared, as if afflicting the three worlds.

data.v: शङ्खराजरवः सोऽथ त्रासयामास राक्षसान् । मृगराज इवारण्ये समदानिव कुञ्जरान् ।।
data.md: The sounds of that king of conchs struck terror into the Rākşasas, even as in a mighty forest a lion (strikes terror into the hearts of) elephants in rut.

data.v: न शेकुरश्वाः संस्थातुं विमदाः कुञ्जराभवन् । स्यन्दनेभ्यश्च्युता योधाः शङ्खरावितदुर्बलाः ।।
data.md: Thereat the horses could not keep their ground, and the elephants were reſt of their temporal flow, and shorn of their virtue at the roars of the conch, heroes began to topple down from their cars.

data.v: शार्ङ्गचापविनिर्मुक्ता वज्रतुल्याननाः शराः । विदार्य तानि रक्षांसि सुपुङ्खा विविशुः क्षितिम् ।।
data.md: And dight with dainty feathered parts having heads, the shafts discharged from the śārnga, resembling thunder-bolts, riving those Rākşása, entered the earth.

data.v: भिद्यमानाः शरैश्चान्ये नारायणधनुश्च्युतैः । निपेतू राक्षसा भीमाः शैला वज्रहता इव ।।
data.md: In that conflict, pierced by the arrows discharged from Nārāyana's arm, the Rākşasa began to drop to the ground like mountains struck with the thunder-bolt.

data.v: व्रणैर्व्रणकरारीणामधोक्षजशरोद्भवैः । असृक्क्षरन्ति धाराभिः स्वर्णधारामिवाचलाः ।।
data.md: The wounds on the persons of the foes inflicted by the discus of Vişnu discharge blood in streams, like mountains discharging streams of red chalk.

data.v: शङ्खराजरवश्चापि शार्ङ्गचापरवस्तथा । राक्षसानां रवांश्चापि ग्रसते वैष्णवो रवः ।।
data.md: The sound of that king of conchs, as well as those of the Sārnga, combined with the roars emitted by Vişņu himself, swallowed up the roars of the Rākşasas.

data.v: सूर्यादिव करा घोरा ऊर्मयः सागरादिव । पर्वतादिव नागेन्द्रा वार्योघा इव चाम्बुदात् ।।
तथा बाणा विनिर्मुक्ताः शार्ङ्गान्नरायणेरिताः । निर्धावन्तीषवस्तूर्णं शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ।।
शरभेण यथा सिंहाः सिंहेन द्विरदा यथा । द्विरदेन यथा व्याघ्रा व्याघ्रेण द्वीपिनो यथा ।।
द्वीपिना च यथा श्वानः शुना मार्जारका यथा । मार्जारेण यथा सर्पाः सर्पेण च यथाखवः ।।
तथा ते राक्षसा युद्धे विष्णुना प्रभविष्णुना । द्रवन्ति द्राविताश्चैव शायिताश्च महीतले ।।
राक्षसानां सहस्राणि निहत्य मधुसूदनः । वारिजं नादयामास तोयदं सुरराडिव ।।
data.md: Then, having despatched thousands of Rākşasas, the destroyer of Madhu blew his water-sprung (conch), even as the sovereign of the celestials filleth clouds (with rain).

data.v: नारायणशरग्रस्तं शङ्खनादसुविह्वलम् । ययौ लङ्कामभिमुखं प्रभग्नं राक्षसं बलम् ।।
data.md: Agitated by the arrows of Nārāyaṇa, with their senses bewildered by the blares of the conch, the broken Raksasa forces made for Lankā.

data.v: प्रभग्ने राक्षसबले नारायणशराहते । सुमाली शरवर्षेण आववार रणे हरिम् ।।
data.md: On the Rākşasa army having been broken in consequence of the beating it got at the hands of Nārāyaṇa, Sumāli with showers of shafts resisted Hari in the encounter.

data.v: उत्क्षिप्य हेमाभरणं करं करमिव द्विपः । ररास राक्षसो हर्षात्सतडित्तोयदो यथा ।।
data.md: As an elephant flourishes its trunk, that Rāks asa, lifting up his arm adorned with ornaments, began to roar from rapture, like a mass of clouds, lighted up with lightening.

data.v: सुमालेर्नर्दतस्तस्य शिरो ज्वलितकुण्डलम् । चिच्छेद यन्तुरश्वाश्च भ्रान्तास्तस्य तु रक्षसः ।।
data.md: And (Visņu) cut off the head flaming with ear rings of the charioteer of the shouting Sumáli; and thereat the horses of that Raksasa aimlessly strayed hither and thither.

data.v: तैरश्वैर्भ्राम्यते भ्रान्तैः सुमाली राक्षसेश्वरः । इन्द्रियाश्वैर्यथा भ्रान्तैर्धृतिहीनो यथा नरः ।।
data.md: And with his bewildered steeds Sumali wanders like a person deprived of patience, whose senses are under hallucination.

data.v: माली चाभ्यद्रवद्युद्धे प्रगृह्य सशरं धनुः । मालेर्धनुश्च्युता बाणाः कार्तस्वरविभूषिताः । विविशुर्हरिमासाद्य क्रौञ्चं पत्ररथा इव ।।
data.md: Like birds entering the Krauñca mountain, the arrows discharged from Mali's bow, graced with gold, hit Hari and entered (into his body).

data.v: अर्द्यमानः शरैः सोऽथ मालिमुक्तैः सहस्रशः । चुक्षुभे न रणे विष्णुर्जितेन्द्रिय इवाधिभिः ।।
data.md: Thereat, as a person holding his senses under subjection is not thrown out of his mental balance, Vişnu, assailed in that encounter with thousands of arrows shot by Māli, was not disturbed ever so little.

data.v: अथ मौर्वी स्वनं कृत्वा भगवान्भूतभावनः । मालिनं प्रति बाणौघान्ससर्जासिगदाधरः ।।
data.md: Then that creator of all beings, the reverend Gadādhara,* twanging his bow-string, showered volleys of shafts on Máli. *Lit. the holder of the mace, a name of Visnu.

data.v: ते मालिदेहमासाद्य वज्रविद्युत्प्रभाः शराः । पिबन्ति रुधिरं तस्य नागा इव पुरामृतम् ।।
data.md: And getting at Mali's body, the arrows furnished with the luminousness of lightening drink his blood, like to serpents drinking nectar.

data.v: मालिनं विमुखं कृत्वा मालिमौलिं हरिर्बलात् । रथं च सध्वजं चापं वाजिनश्च न्यपातयत् ।।
data.md: And baffling Māli, the holder of the conch, discus, and mace, brought down Māli's crown, standard, bow and steeds.

data.v: विरथस्तु गदां गृह्य माली नक्तंचरोत्तमः । आपुप्लुवे गदापाणिर्गिर्यग्रादिव केषरी ।।
data.md: Then that foremost of night-rangers, on being deprived of his car, sprang forward, mace in hand, even as lion bounds up from the brow of a hillock.

data.v: स तया गरुडं संख्ये ईशानमिव चान्तकः । ललाटदेशेऽभ्यहनद्वज्रेणेन्द्रो यथाचलम् ।।
data.md: He with his mace smote at the forehead of that lord of birds, even as the Destroyer had smitten Isana,* or as Indra smites a mountain with his thunder-bolt. *There took place an encounter betwcen Radra and Yama in the Sveta forest, for the protection of Märkandeya and a certain king. In this battle, Yama had smitten Rudra. This is narrated in the Puranas.

data.v: गदयाभिहतस्तेन मालिना गरुडो भृशम् । रणात्पराङ्मुखं देवं कृतवान्वेदनातुरः ।।
data.md: On being severely struck by Mali with his mace, Garuda, writhing in torments, moved the god away from the field of battle.

data.v: पराङ्मुखे कृते देवे मालिना गरुडेन वै । उदतिष्ठन्महानादो रक्षसामभिनर्दताम् ।।
data.md: On the god having been removed from the field by Mäli as well as Garuda, there arose a mighty din of Raksasa roaring (in chorus).

data.v: रक्षसां नदतां नादं श्रुत्वा हरिहयानुजः । पराङ्मुखोऽप्युत्ससर्ज चक्रं मालिजिघांसया ।।
data.md: Hearing the cheers of the Raksasa, Indra's younger brother, the reverend Hari, sitting on that lord of birds, albeit moved off from the scene of conflict, waxing enraged, from a desire of slaying (Mali) hurled his disc at him.

data.v: तत्सूर्यमण्डलाभासं स्वभासा भासयन्नभः । कालचक्रनिभं चक्रं मालेः शीर्षमपातयत् ।।
data.md: Thereat the disc, possessed of the splendour of the solar disc, and resembling the wheel itself of Kāla, flooding all the heavens with radiance, brought down Māli's head to the ground.

data.v: तच्छिरो राक्षसेन्द्रस्य चक्रोत्कृत्तं विभीषणम् । पपात रुधिरोद्गारि पुरा राहुशिरो यथा ।।
data.md: That head of lord of Rākşasas, terrific to behold, on being cut off (by Visnu), vomiting blood, fell down before (the Rākşasas), as formerly Rahu's head had fallen.

data.v: ततः सुरैः सुसंहृष्टैः सर्वप्राणसमीरितः । सिंहनादरवो मुक्तः साधु देवेति वादिभिः ।।
data.md: Then the deities experiencing excess of joy set up leonine cheers with might and main, crying,' Excellent, O god.' Seeing Mali slain, Sumali and Mālyavån, burning in grief, fled precipitately towards Lankä along with their forces.

data.v: मालिनं निहतं दृष्ट्वा सुमाली मल्यवानपि । सबलौ शोकसंतप्तौ लङ्कां प्रति विधावितौ ।।
data.md: Then the deities experiencing excess of joy set up leonine cheers with might and main, crying,' Excellent, O god.' Seeing Mali slain, Sumali and Mālyavån, burning in grief, fled precipitately towards Lankä along with their forces.

data.v: गरुडस्तु समाश्वस्तः संनिवृत्य महामनाः । राक्षसान्द्रावयामास पक्षवातेन कोपितः ।।
data.md: Garuda, being cheered, turned round, and growing enraged, as before drove the Rākşasas with the wind of his wings.

data.v: नारायणोऽपीषुवराशनीभि;र्विदारयामास धनुःप्रमुक्तैः । नक्तंचरान्मुक्तविधूतकेशा;न्यथाशनीभिः सतडिन्महेन्द्रः ।।
data.md: And as the thunder-bolt with lightening (riveth) a mighty mass of clouds, Narayana by means of the thunder-bolts of his arrows discharged from his bow, rived the night-rangers with their hair dishevelled and streaming (in the wind).

data.v: भिन्नातपत्रं पतमानशस्त्रं; शरैरपध्वस्तविशीर्णदेहम् । विनिःसृतान्त्रं भयलोलनेत्रं; बलं तदुन्मत्तनिभं बभूव ।।
data.md: The forces having their umbrellas rent, their arms falling off, their goodly garments scattered, their entrails coming out and their eyes rolling, became incapable of distinguishing their own party from that of the foe.

data.v: सिंहार्दितानामिव कुञ्जराणां; निशाचराणां सह कुञ्जराणाम् । रवाश्च वेगाश्च समं बभूवुः; पुराणसिंहेन विमर्दितानाम् ।।
data.md: Even like (the roars and the vehemence) displayed by elephants on being attacked by lions, the roars, and the vehemence of the nightrangers and their elephants, sore assailed by the Primaeval Lion,* were equal. *Vişnu as a man-lion had formerly taken the conceit out of Hiranyakasipu the Asura king-and slain him, to rid his devotee Prahlada of his mortal foc in the from of a father.

data.v: संछाद्यमाना हरिबाणजालैः; स्वबाणजालानि समुत्सृजन्तः । धावन्ति नक्तंचरकालमेघा; वायुप्रणुन्ना इव कालमेघाः ।।
data.md: And driven by Hari's networks of arrows, and discharging (all the while) their own showers of shafts, those night-rangers resembling the clouds of doom, are driven like the veritable clouds of the universal dissolution drifted by the wind.

data.v: चक्रप्रहारैर्विनिकृत्तशीर्षाः; संचूर्णिताङ्गाश्च गदाप्रहारैः । असिप्रहारैर्बहुधा विभक्ताः; पतन्ति शैला इव राक्षसेन्द्राः ।।
data.md: Their heads cut by discus, their parts of bodies crushed with the mace, and hewn in twain with swords, thus they foremost of Rākşasas fell like to hills (toppling headlong).

data.v: चक्रकृत्तास्यकमला गदासंचूर्णितोरसः । लाङ्गलग्लपितग्रीवा मुसलैर्भिन्नमस्तकाः ।।
data.md: And (some) with their lotus-faces cut by the discus, (some) with their chests crushed with the mace, (some) with their necks torn off by the plough, (some) with their heads riven by the club, and some hewn by the sword, and others pierced by arrows, the Rākṣasas began to drop fast from the sky into the waters of the ocean.

data.v: केचिच्चैवासिना छिन्नास्तथान्ये शरताडिताः । निपेतुरम्बरात्तूर्णं राक्षसाः सागराम्भसि ।।
data.md: And (some) with their lotus-faces cut by the discus, (some) with their chests crushed with the mace, (some) with their necks torn off by the plough, (some) with their heads riven by the club, and some hewn by the sword, and others pierced by arrows, the Rākṣasas began to drop fast from the sky into the waters of the ocean.

data.v: तदाम्बरं विगलितहारकुण्डलै;र्निशाचरैर्नीलबलाहकोपमैः । निपात्यमानैर्ददृशे निरन्तरं; निपात्यमानैरिव नीलपर्वतैः ।।
data.md: The Earth was seen to be (covered) with night-rangers resembling dark clouds, adorned with jewelled necklaces and ear rings, falling down, as if covered with dark mountains dropping down.

data.v: हन्यमाने बले तस्मिन्पद्मनाभेन पृष्ठतः । माल्यवान्संनिवृत्तोऽथ वेलातिग इवार्णवः ।।
data.md: On that host being sore pressed at its back by Padmanabha,* Mālyavăn turned back even as the ocean does on meeting with its shore. *Lit. the lotus-naveled-a name of Visnu.

data.v: संरक्तनयनः कोपाच्चलन्मौलिर्निशाचरः । पद्मनाभमिदं प्राह वचनं परुषं तदा ।।
data.md: And with his eyes reddened, that night-ranger waxing wroth, shaking his head, addressed that prime of male persons Padmanabha, saying.

data.v: नारायण न जानीषे क्षत्रधर्मं सनातनम् । अयुद्धमनसो भग्नान्योऽस्मान्हंसि यथेतरः ।।
data.md: O Nārāyaṇa, you are ignorant of the timehonoured morality of Kşatriyas; and therefore like a base wight you slay us, desisting from fight and exercised with fear.

data.v: पराङ्मुखवधं पापं यः करोति सुरेश्वर । स हन्ता न गतः स्वर्गं लभते पुण्यकर्मणाम् ।।
data.md: O lord of the celestials, he that commits the crime of slaying one that desists from fight cannot go to the celestial regions as the fruit of meritorious acts.

data.v: युद्धश्रद्धाथ वा तेऽस्ति शङ्खचक्रगदाधर । अहं स्थितोऽस्मि पश्यामि बलं दर्शय यत्तव ।।
data.md: If you are bent upon battle, a holder of the conch, the discus and the mace, taking up my post (here), I shall see (your strength). Do you show (me) the same.

data.v: उवाच राक्षसेन्द्रं तं देवराजानुजो बली । युष्मत्तो भयभीतानां देवानां वै मयाभयम् । राक्षसोत्सादनं दत्तं तदेतदनुपाल्यते ।।
data.md: I have removed the fear of the deities, affrighted at you, by promising that I will make root and branch work with the Räkşasas; and that same promise I am now fulfilling.

data.v: प्राणैरपि प्रियं कार्यं देवानां हि सदा मया । सोऽहं वो निहनिष्यामि रसातलगतानपि ।।
data.md: I should always lay down my life for serving the celestials and you I will slay even if you should go to the nethermost regions.

data.v: देवमेवं ब्रुवाणं तु रक्ताम्बुरुहलोचनम् । शक्त्या बिभेद संक्रुद्धो राक्षसेन्द्रो ररास च ।।
data.md: As that god of gods having eyes resembling the red lotuses was speaking thus, the lord of Rākşasas in high wrath pierced his breast with a dart.

data.v: माल्यवद्भुजनिर्मुक्ता शक्तिर्घण्टाकृतस्वना । हरेरुरसि बभ्राज मेघस्थेव शतह्रदा ।।
data.md: And hurled by the hand of Mālyavān, the dart resonant with bells, appeared graceful on Hari's breast like lightening embosomed in clouds.

data.v: ततस्तामेव चोत्कृष्य शक्तिं शक्तिधरप्रियः । माल्यवन्तं समुद्दिश्य चिक्षेपाम्बुरुहेक्षणः ।।
data.md: Thereat drawing out the same dart, that one dear to the Wielder of the Dart,* having eyes resembling red lotuses, aiming at Mālyāvan, hurled it at him. *A name of Kārtikeya, the celestial generallissimo.

data.v: स्कन्दोत्सृष्टेव सा शक्तिर्गोविन्दकरनिःसृता । काङ्क्षन्ती राक्षसं प्रायान्महोल्केवाञ्जनाचलम् ।।
data.md: Thereat the dart discharged by the hand of Govinda like to the Dart discharged by the hand of Skanda, rushing towards the Rākṣasa like a meteor coursing towards the Anjana mountain, descended on the spacious chest of the lord of the Rākşasas decked with the weight of a chain, even as the thunder clap bursts at the summit of the mountain.

data.v: सा तस्योरसि विस्तीर्णे हारभासावभासिते । अपतद्राक्षसेन्द्रस्य गिरिकूट इवाशनिः ।।
तया भिन्नतनुत्राणाः प्राविशद्विपुलं तमः । माल्यवान्पुनराश्वस्तस्तस्थौ गिरिरिवाचलः ।।
data.md: On having his mail rent, Mālyāvan was utterly deprived of his senses; but (anon) reposing for a while, he again stood like a moveless hill.

data.v: ततः कार्ष्णायसं शूलं कण्टकैर्बहुभिश्चितम् । प्रगृह्याभ्यहनद्देवं स्तनयोरन्तरे दृढम् ।।
data.md: Then taking up a javelin made of black iror girt with many a thorn, he furiously smote that deity on the chest.

data.v: तथैव रणरक्तस्तु मुष्टिना वासवानुजम् । ताडयित्वा धनुर्मात्रमपक्रान्तो निशाचरः ।।
data.md: And that night-ranger delighting in battle, dealing a box at Vāsavā's younger brother, moved away a distance measuring a bow's length.

data.v: ततोऽम्बरे महाञ्शब्दः साधु साध्विति चोत्थितः । आहत्य राक्षसो विष्णुं गरुडं चाप्यताडयत् ।।
data.md: And now there arose a mighty tumult in the sky of 'Excellent!' 'Excellent!' and having struck Visnu, the Raksasa also hit Garuda.

data.v: वैनतेयस्ततः क्रुद्धः पक्षवातेन राक्षसं । व्यपोहद्बलवान्वायुः शुष्कपर्णचयं यथा ।।
data.md: Thereat Vinata's son, growing engaged, drove the Rākşasas away with the wind of his wings, even as the lusty wind bloweth about sere leaves.

data.v: द्विजेन्द्रपक्षवातेन द्रावितं दृश्य पूर्वजम् । सुमाली स्वबलैः सार्धं लङ्कामभिमुखो ययौ ।।
data.md: Seeing his elder brother driven by the wind produced by the wings of that bird, Sumali along with his forces, made for Lankā.

data.v: पक्षवातबलोद्धूतो माल्यवानपि राक्षसः । स्वबलेन समागम्य ययौ लङ्कां ह्रिया वृतः ।।
data.md: And pushed off by the violence of the wind of (Garuda's) wings, the Rākṣasa Mālyavān also, joined by his own forces, departed for Lankā, covered with shame.

data.v: एवं ते राक्षसा राम हरिणा कमलेक्षण । बहुशः संयुगे भग्ना हतप्रवरनायकाः ।।
data.md: Thus, O Rama, O lotus-eyed one, (the Rākşasas) had innumerable warriors beaten down and their foremost leaders slain.

data.v: अशक्नुवन्तस्ते विष्णुं प्रतियोद्धुं भयार्दिताः । त्यक्त्वा लङ्कां गता वस्तुं पातालं सहपत्नयः ।।
data.md: And albeit inflated with pride, they, incapable of coping with Vişnu, leaving Lankā, went to the nether regions with their wives dwelling there.

data.v: सुमालिनं समासाद्य राक्षसं रघुनन्दन । स्थिताः प्रख्यातवीर्यास्ते वंशे सालकटङ्कटे ।।
data.md: O best of the Raghus, these Rākşasa of celebrated prowess, related to the race of Sälakatankața, remained under the leadership of the Rākṣasa Sumāli.

data.v: ये त्वया निहतास्ते वै पौलस्त्या नाम राक्षसाः । सुमाली माल्यवान्माली ये च तेषां पुरःसराः । सर्व एते महाभाग रावणाद्बलवत्तराः ।।
data.md: All those exalted Rākşasas going under the name of Pulastya that had been headed by Sumāli, Mālyavān and Māli, were stronger than Ravana.

data.v: न चान्यो रक्षसां हन्ता सुरेष्वपि पुरंजय । ऋते नारायणं देवं शङ्खचक्रगदाधरम् ।।
data.md: No other than the god Nārāyaṇa, holding the conch, the discus and the mace, could slay those Råkşasa-foes to the celestials and thorns in the side of the deties.

data.v: भवान्नारायणो देवश्चतुर्बाहुः सनातनः । राक्षसान्हन्तुमुत्पन्नो अजेयः प्रभुरव्ययः ।।
data.md: And you are that eternal god the four armed Narayana, the lord, undeteriorating and unconquerable, sprung to exterminate Rāksasas.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य सुमाली नाम राक्षसः । रसातलान्मर्त्यलोकं सर्वं वै विचचार ह ।।
नीलजीमूतसंकाशस्तप्तकाञ्चनकुण्डलः । कन्यां दुहितरं गृह्य विना पद्ममिव श्रियम् । अथापश्यत्स गच्छन्तं पुष्पकेण धनेश्वरम् ।।
तं दृष्ट्वामरसंकाशं गच्छन्तं पावकोपमम् । अथाब्रवीत्सुतां रक्षः कैकसीं नाम नामतः ।।
पुत्रि प्रदानकालोऽयं यौवनं तेऽतिवर्तते । त्वत्कृते च वयं सर्वे यन्त्रिता धर्मबुद्धयः ।।
त्वं हि सर्वगुणोपेता श्रीः सपद्मेव पुत्रिके । प्रत्याख्यानाच्च भीतैस्त्वं न वरैः प्रतिगृह्यसे ।।
data.md: O daughter, the time has come when I should give you away. Your youth is about to be passed. (Kept back) by the fear of refusal, no suiter has sought you (up to his time).

data.v: कन्यापितृत्वं दुःखं हि सर्वेषां मानकाङ्क्षिणाम् । न ज्ञायते च कः कन्यां वरयेदिति पुत्रिके ।।
data.md: The being father to a daughter is misery to every one that seekes honour. O daughter, one does not know who shall ask for one's daughter.

data.v: मातुः कुलं पितृकुलं यत्र चैव प्रदीयते । कुलत्रयं सदा कन्या संशये स्थाप्य तिष्ठति ।।
data.md: Whenever may a daughter be conferred, a daughter stayes, placing in uncertainly the three races* to which she is related. *The races respectively of her father, mother and husband.

data.v: सा त्वं मुनिवरश्रेष्ठं प्रजापतिकुलोद्भवम् । गच्छ विश्रवसं पुत्रि पौलस्त्यं वरय स्वयम् ।।
data.md: Do you, my daughter, seek for your husband that best and foremost of ascetics sprung in the line of Prajăpati Pulastya's son, Viśravā, and of yourself accept him (for your lord).

data.v: ईदृशास्ते भविष्यन्ति पुत्राः पुत्रि न संशयः । तेजसा भास्करसमा यादृशोऽयं धनेश्वरः ।।
data.md: Then, O daughter, even as this lord of riches, so you will, without doubt, have sons resembling the Sun himself in energy.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नन्तरे राम पुलस्त्यतनयो द्विजः । अग्निहोत्रमुपातिष्ठच्चतुर्थ इव पावकः ।।
data.md: In the meanwhile, O Rama, that twice-born one-Pulastya's was performing the Agnihotra, like the fourth Fire itself.

data.v: सा तु तां दारुणां वेलामचिन्त्य पितृगौरवात् । उपसृत्याग्रतस्तस्य चरणाधोमुखी स्थिता ।।
data.md: And without minding that terrific time, (Kaikasi), having regard to the dignity of her sire, coming up before him, stood (there) son hanging her head down towards his feet and throwing up the earth with her great foe.

data.v: स तु तां वीक्ष्य सुश्रोणीं पूर्णचन्द्रनिभाननाम् । अब्रवीत्परमोदारो दीप्यमान इवौजसा ।।
भद्रे कस्यासि दुहिता कुतो वा त्वमिहागता । किं कार्यं कस्य वा हेतोस्तत्त्वतो ब्रूहि शोभने ।।
data.md: Seeing that one of the shapely hips, having a face fair as the full Moon, (that exceedingly high-minded ascetic) flaming in energy accosted her thus. O gentle one, whose daughter are you? And when do you come hither? And what is your errand? And for whom (do you come)? O beauteous (damsel), truly tell me this.

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा कन्या कृताञ्जलिरथाब्रवीत् । आत्मप्रभावेन मुने ज्ञातुमर्हसि मे मतम् ।।
data.md: Thus addressed, the girl, with joined hands, said, 'O ascetic, you are competent to get at my intent by virtue of your own power. Yet, O Brahmarși, know me as having come here at the mandate of my sire. My name is Kaikasī. The rest do you read yourself.

data.v: किं तु विद्धि हि मां ब्रह्मञ्शासनात्पितुरागताम् । कैकसी नाम नाम्नाहं शेषं त्वं ज्ञातुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: Thus addressed, the girl, with joined hands, said, 'O ascetic, you are competent to get at my intent by virtue of your own power. Yet, O Brahmarși, know me as having come here at the mandate of my sire. My name is Kaikasī. The rest do you read yourself.

data.v: स तु गत्वा मुनिर्ध्यानं वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह । विज्ञातं ते मया भद्रे कारणं यन्मनोगतम् ।।
दारुणायां तु वेलायां यस्मात्त्वं मामुपस्थिता । शृणु तस्मात्सुतान्भद्रे यादृशाञ्जनयिष्यसि ।।
दारुणान्दारुणाकारान्दारुणाभिजनप्रियान् । प्रसविष्यसि सुश्रोणि राक्षसान्क्रूरकर्मणः ।।
सा तु तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रणिपत्याब्रवीद्वचः । भगवन्नेदृशाः पुत्रास्त्वत्तोऽर्हा ब्रह्मयोनितः ।।
data.md: Hearing his speech, she, bowing down, said, 'O reverend (ascetic), such sons of terrific ways seek I not from you that follow the Veda. Therefore it behoves you to favour me.'

data.v: अथाब्रवीन्मुनिस्तत्र पश्चिमो यस्तवात्मजः । मम वंशानुरूपश्च धर्मात्मा च भविष्यति ।।
एवमुक्ता तु सा कन्या राम कालेन केनचित् । जनयामास बीभत्सं रक्षोरूपं सुदारुणम् ।।
data.md: Having been thus accosted, the girl, O Rama, after a length of time brought forth a very terrible and hideous offspring having the form of a Raksasa, having ten necks, furnished with large teeth, and resembling a heap of collyrium, with coppery lips, twenty arms, huge faces, and flaming hair.

data.v: दशशीर्षं महादंष्ट्रं नीलाञ्जनचयोपमम् । ताम्रौष्ठं विंशतिभुजं महास्यं दीप्तमूर्धजम् ।।
data.md: Having been thus accosted, the girl, O Rama, after a length of time brought forth a very terrible and hideous offspring having the form of a Raksasa, having ten necks, furnished with large teeth, and resembling a heap of collyrium, with coppery lips, twenty arms, huge faces, and flaming hair.

data.v: जातमात्रे ततस्तस्मिन्सज्वालकवलाः शिवाः । क्रव्यादाश्चापसव्यानि मण्डलानि प्रचक्रिरे ।।
data.md: On his having been born, jacka.s with flaming mouths and other ferocious beasts began to gyrate on the left.

data.v: ववर्ष रुधिरं देवो मेघाश्च खरनिस्वनाः । प्रबभौ न च खे सूर्यो महोल्काश्चापतन्भुवि ।।
data.md: That god showered down blood; and the clouds uttered forth harsh sounds. And the sun was deprived of his splendour; and meteors began to dart to the earth. And the earth shook; and the wind swept away violently. And that lord of streams-the ocean, which was calm before, became agitated.

data.v: अथ नामाकरोत्तस्य पितामहसमः पिता । दशशीर्षः प्रसूतोऽयं दशग्रीवो भविष्यति ।।
data.md: And his sire resembling his grand-father named him, (saying), 'As this one has been born with ten necks, he shall be called Ten-necked.'

data.v: तस्य त्वनन्तरं जातः कुम्भकर्णो महाबलः । प्रमाणाद्यस्य विपुलं प्रमाणं नेह विद्यते ।।
data.md: After him was born Kumbhakarņa endowed with prodigious strength, than whose proportions there are none other's on earth.

data.v: ततः शूर्पणखा नाम संजज्ञे विकृतानना । विभीषणश्च धर्मात्मा कैकस्याः पश्चिमः सुतः ।।
data.md: Then was born she that, having a frightful visage, goes under the name of Surpanakha; the righteous Vibhīşaņa is the youngest son of Kaikasi.

data.v: ते तु तत्र महारण्ये ववृधुः सुमहौजसः । तेषां क्रूरो दशग्रीवो लोकोद्वेगकरोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: 'Excellent!' And in that extensive forest those exceedingly energetic ones, Kumbhakarņa and the Ten-necked one grew up, and became the sources of anxiety to the people.

data.v: कुम्भकर्णः प्रमत्तस्तु महर्षीन्धर्मसंश्रितान् । त्रैलोक्यं त्रासयन्दुष्टो भक्षयन्विचचार ह ।।
data.md: Kumbhakarma, maddened to the height, devouring mighty-saints devoted to religion, constantly ranged the triune world in a dissatisfied spirit.

data.v: विभीषणस्तु धर्मात्मा नित्यं धर्मपथे स्थितः । स्वाध्यायनियताहार उवास नियतेन्द्रियः ।।
data.md: But the righteous Vibhișana, ever intent on piety, dwelt there studying the Veda, restraining his fare, and controlling his senses.

data.v: अथ वित्तेश्वरो देवस्तत्र कालेन केनचित् । आगच्छत्पितरं द्रष्टुं पुष्पकेण महौजसं ।।
data.md: It came to pass that after a length of time the god, Vaisravana-lord of riches-came to see his sire, mounted on Puspaka.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा कैकसी तत्र ज्वलन्तमिव तेजसा । आस्थाय राक्षसीं बुद्धिं दशग्रीवमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Seeing him, the Raksasi-Kaikasi-flaming up in energy, coming to the Ten-necked one, represented to him.

data.v: पुत्र वैश्रवणं पश्य भ्रातरं तेजसा वृतम् । भ्रातृभावे समे चापि पश्यात्मानं त्वमीदृशम् ।।
data.md: O son, behold your brother, Vaisravana, enfolded in effulgence; and, albeit of equal fraternity, behold you in this plight!

data.v: दशग्रीव तथा यत्नं कुरुष्वामितविक्रम । यथा भवसि मे पुत्र शीघ्रं वैश्वरणोपमः ।।
data.md: Therefore, O Ten-necked one, O you of measureless prowess, do you so strive that you also, my son, may be like Vaisravana himself.

data.v: मातुस्तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा दशग्रीवः प्रतापवान् । अमर्षमतुलं लेभे प्रतिज्ञां चाकरोत्तदा ।।
data.md: Hearing that speech of his mother, the powerful Ten-necked one was wrought up with exceeding great ill-will, and he vowed then.

data.v: सत्यं ते प्रतिजानामि तुल्यो भ्रात्राधिकोऽपि वा । भविष्याम्यचिरान्मातः संतापं त्यज हृद्गतम् ।।
data.md: I truly promise to you that I will be equal to my brother (in energy), or excel him in it. Therefore do you cast off this sorrow in your heart.

data.v: ततः क्रोधेन तेनैव दशग्रीवः सहानुजः । प्राप्स्यामि तपसा काममिति कृत्वाध्यवस्य च । आगच्छदात्मसिद्ध्यर्थं गोकर्णस्याश्रमं शुभम् ।।
data.md: And influenced by that passion, the tennecked one with his younger brother began to perform rigid acts, with his mind fixed on asceticism. 'I must through austerities have my wish,' thus fixed and resolved, he compassing his end, came to the sacred asylum of Gokarna.

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्द्विजं रामः कथं ते भ्रातरो वने । कीदृशं तु तदा ब्रह्मंस्तपश्चेरुर्महाव्रताः ।।
data.md: Then Rāma spoke to the ascetic, O Brahmana, how did those exceedingly mighty brothers carry on austerities in that forest; and what kind of penances was theirs?

data.v: अगस्त्यस्त्वब्रवीत्तत्र रामं प्रयत मानसं । तांस्तान्धर्मविधींस्तत्र भ्रातरस्ते समाविशन् ।।
data.md: Thereat there Agastya said to Rāma of a complacent mind, “The brothers severally observed the morality proper to each.”

data.v: कुम्भकर्णस्तदा यत्तो नित्यं धर्मपरायणः । तताप ग्रैष्मिके काले पञ्चस्वग्निष्ववस्थितः ।।
वर्षे मेघोदकक्लिन्नो वीरासनमसेवत । नित्यं च शैशिरे काले जलमध्यप्रतिश्रयः ।।
एवं वर्षसहस्राणि दश तस्यातिचक्रमुः । धर्मे प्रयतमानस्य सत्पथे निष्ठितस्य च ।।
data.md: Thus passed away ten thousand of that one putting forth exertions in behalf of religion, and established in the path of honesty.

data.v: विभीषणस्तु धर्मात्मा नित्यं धर्मपरः शुचिः । पञ्चवर्षसहस्राणि पादेनैकेन तस्थिवान् ।।
data.md: The virtuous Vibhīşaņa, ever intent on virtue and pure of spirit, remained standing on one leg for five thousand years.

data.v: समाप्ते नियमे तस्य ननृतुश्चाप्सरोगणाः । पपात पुष्पवर्षं च क्षुभिताश्चापि देवताः ।।
data.md: When he had completed (his term of restriction), swarms of apsaras danced, and blossoms showered, and the deities hymned (him).

data.v: पञ्चवर्षसहस्राणि सूर्यं चैवान्ववर्तत । तस्थौ चोर्ध्वशिरोबाहुः स्वाध्यायधृतमानसः ।।
data.md: And for five thousand years, he adored the Sun, and with his mind concentrated in the study of the Veda, remained with his head and hands raised up.

data.v: एवं विभीषणस्यापि गतानि नियतात्मनः । दशवर्षसहस्राणि स्वर्गस्थस्येव नन्दने ।।
दशवर्षसहस्रं तु निराहारो दशाननः । पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रे तु शिरश्चाग्नौ जुहाव सः ।।
data.md: The ten-necked passed ten thousand years without fare. On a thousand years being complete, he offered his own head as a sacrifice to Fire.

data.v: एवं वर्षसहस्राणि नव तस्यातिचक्रमुः । शिरांसि नव चाप्यस्य प्रविष्टानि हुताशनम् ।।
data.md: In this way, he passed away nine thousand years, and nine of his heads entered into Fire.

data.v: अथ वर्षसहस्रे तु दशमे दशमं शिरः । छेत्तुकामः स धर्मात्मा प्राप्तश्चात्र पितामहः ।।
data.md: And as in the tenth year he intended to strike off his tenth head, the Great-father (Brahmā) presented himself at that place.

data.v: पितामहस्तु सुप्रीतः सार्धं देवैरुपस्थितः । वत्स वत्स दशग्रीव प्रीतोऽस्मीत्यभ्यभाषत ।।
data.md: Well-pleased, the Pitamaha Brahmā came there along with the celestials. 'O Ten-necked one,' said (the Great-father), 'I am well-pleased with you.

data.v: शीघ्रं वरय धर्मज्ञ वरो यस्तेऽभिकाङ्क्षितः । किं ते कामं करोम्यद्य न वृथा ते परिश्रमः ।।
data.md: Do you, O cognisant of righteousness, at once ask for the boon that you wish to have. What wish of your shall I realise? Your toil must not go for nothing.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीद्दशग्रीवः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना । प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं हर्षगद्गदया गिरा ।।
data.md: Thereat, the Ten-necked one, bowing down his head to the deity, said with a delighted heart, his words faltering with ecstasy.

data.v: भगवन्प्राणिनां नित्यं नान्यत्र मरणाद्भयम् । नास्ति मृत्युसमः शत्रुरमरत्वमतो वृणे ।।
data.md: O reverend one, creatures have no other fear than (that of) death; and enemy there is none that is like to death. Therefore immortality is even what I crave for.

data.v: सुपर्णनागयक्षाणां दैत्यदानवरक्षसाम् । अवध्यः स्यां प्रजाध्यक्ष देवतानां च शाश्वतम् ।।
data.md: O lord of creatures, I would, O external one, he incapable of being slain by birds and serpents, Yaksas, Daityas, Danavas and Raksasas, and the deities; for, O you that are worshipped by the immortals, anxiety I have none from any other beings. Indeed, I deem as straw creatures such as men etc.

data.v: न हि चिन्ता ममान्येषु प्राणिष्वमरपूजित । तृणभूता हि मे सर्वे प्राणिनो मानुषादयः ।।
